item.quote: Some old wounds never truly heal, and bleed again at the slightest word.
item.author: George R.R. Martin

item.quote: Dare to Be
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Pain is temporary. Quitting lasts forever.
item.author: Lance Armstrong Sally Jenkins

item.quote: Cinderella? Snow White? What's that? An illness?
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: I think... if it is true that
item.author: Leo Tolstoy

item.quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
item.author: Henry David Thoreau

item.quote: There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest.
item.author: Elie Wiesel

item.quote: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: Would you tell me, please, which way I ought to go from here?
item.author: Lewis Carroll

item.quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: I have heard there are troubles of more than one kind. Some come from ahead and some come from behind. But I've bought a big bat. I'm all ready you see. Now my troubles are going to have troubles with me!
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: When I was a little girl I used to read fairy tales. In fairy tales you meet Prince Charming and he's everything you ever wanted. In fairy tales the bad guy is very easy to spot. The bad guy is always wearing a black cape so you always know who he is. Then you grow up and you realize that Prince Charming is not as easy to find as you thought. You realize the bad guy is not wearing a black cape and he's not easy to spot; he's really funny, and he makes you laugh, and he has perfect hair.
item.author: Taylor Swift

item.quote: Follow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness.
item.author: Allen Ginsberg

item.quote: Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I mean, if the relationship can't survive the long term, why on earth would it be worth my time and energy for the short term?
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Reading one book is like eating one potato chip.
item.author: Diane Duane

item.quote: Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength.
item.author: Corrie Ten Boom

item.quote: The minute I heard my first love story,
item.author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.quote: We know what we are, but not what we may be.
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: I think we dream so we dont have to be apart for so long. If were in each others dreams, we can be together all the time.
item.author: A.A. Milne

item.quote: There comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but he must take it because conscience tells him it is right.
item.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

item.quote: It's not the load that breaks you down, it's the way you carry it.
item.author: Lou Holtz

item.quote: Vanity and pride are different things, though the words are often used synonymously. A person may be proud without being vain. Pride relates more to our opinion of ourselves, vanity to what we would have others think of us.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric.
item.author: Bertrand Russell

item.quote: Men always say that as the defining compliment, dont they? Shes a cool girl. Being the Cool Girl means I am a hot, brilliant, funny woman who adores football, poker, dirty jokes, and burping, who plays video games, drinks cheap beer, loves threesomes and anal sex, and jams hot dogs and hamburgers into her mouth like shes hosting the worlds biggest culinary gang bang while somehow maintaining a size 2, because Cool Girls are above all hot. Hot and understanding. Cool Girls never get angry; they only smile in a chagrined, loving manner and let their men do whatever they want. Go ahead, shit on me, I dont mind, Im the Cool Girl.
item.author: Gillian Flynn

item.quote: I believe the universe wants to be noticed. I think the universe is inprobably biased toward the consciousness, that it rewards intelligence in part because the universe enjoys its elegance being observed. And who am I, living in the middle of history, to tell the universe that it-or my observation of it-is temporary?
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Thats part of what I like about the book in some ways. It portrays death truthfully. You die in the middle of your life, in the middle of a sentence
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Laters, baby.
item.author: E.L. James

item.quote: The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious. It is the fundamental emotion that stands at the cradle of true art and true science.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: Dont grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: I read a book one day and my whole life was changed.
item.author: Orhan Pamuk

item.quote: Albus Severus, Harry said quietly, so that nobody but Ginny could hear, and she was tactful enough to pretend to be waving to Rose, who was now on the train, you were named for two headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin and he was probably the bravest man I ever knew.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: The most important kind of freedom is to be what you really are. You trade in your reality for a role. You trade in your sense for an act. You give up your ability to feel, and in exchange, put on a mask. There can't be any large-scale revolution until there's a personal revolution, on an individual level. It's got to happen inside first.
item.author: Jim MORRISON

item.quote: I hate to hear you talk about all women as if they were fine ladies instead of rational creatures. None of us want to be in calm waters all our lives.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: A woman has to live her life, or live to repent not having lived it.
item.author: D.H. Lawrence

item.quote: If writers wrote as carelessly as some people talk, then adhasdh asdglaseuyt[bn[ pasdlgkhasdfasdf.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: Everything tells me that I am about to make a wrong decision, but making mistakes is just part of life. What does the world want of me? Does it want me to take no risks, to go back to where I came from because I didn't have the courage to say yes to life?
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: The scariest moment is always just before you start.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: Don't be afraid of your fears. They're not there to scare you. They're there to let you know that something is worth it.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Don't. Clary raised a warning hand. I'm not really in the mood right now.

item.quote: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.

item.quote: Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia.
item.author: E.L. Doctorow

item.quote: Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind.
item.author: Henry James

item.quote: I was smiling yesterday,I am smiling today and I will smile tomorrow.Simply because life is too short to cry for anything.

item.quote: How do you feel, Georgie? whispered Mrs. Weasley.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: I don't believe in the kind of magic in my books. But I do believe something very magical can happen when you read a good book.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Everyone has talent. What's rare is the courage to follow it to the dark places where it leads.
item.author: Erica Jong

item.quote: In heaven, all the interesting people are missing.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: Youre wishin too much, baby. You gotta stop wearing your wishbone where your backbone oughtta be.
item.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

item.quote: Basically, I have two speeds.... Hostile or smart-aleck. Your choice.
item.author: James Patterson

item.quote: Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer.
item.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

item.quote: The most painful thing is losing yourself in the process of loving someone too much, and forgetting that you are special too.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: She wasn't bitter. She was sad, though. But it was a hopeful kind of sad. The kind of sad that just takes time.
item.author: Stephen Chbosky

item.quote: Fantasy is escapist, and that is its glory. If a soldier is imprisioned by the enemy, don't we consider it his duty to escape?. . .If we value the freedom of mind and soul, if we're partisans of liberty, then it's our plain duty to escape, and to take as many people with us as we can!
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle.
item.author: St. Francis Of Assisi

item.quote: The paradox of our time in history is that we have taller buildings but shorter tempers, wider Freeways, but narrower viewpoints. We spend more, but have less, we buy more, but enjoy less. We have bigger houses and smaller families, more conveniences, but less time. We have more degrees but less sense, more knowledge, but less judgment, more experts, yet more problems, more medicine, but less wellness.
item.author: Bob Moorehead

item.quote: A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness.
item.author: Robert Frost

item.quote: Right now Im having amnesia and dj vu at the same time. I think Ive forgotten this before.
item.author: Steven Wright

item.quote: You never fail until you stop trying.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: Why is it, he said, one time, at the subway entrance, I feel I've known you so many years?

item.quote: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.
item.author: Nicolas Chamfort

item.quote: I loved her against reason, against promise, against peace, against hope, against happiness, against all discouragement that could be.
item.author: Charles Dickens

item.quote: The true soldier fights not because he hates what is in front of him, but because he loves what is behind him.
item.author: G.K. Chesterton

item.quote: Francois Rabelais. He was a poet. And his last words were I go to seek a Great Perhaps. That's why I'm going. So I don't have to wait until I die to start seeking a Great Perhaps.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Youve got about as much charm as a dead slug.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: The more I see, the less I know for sure.

item.quote: Its only after youve stepped outside your comfort zone that you begin to change, grow, and transform.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?
item.author: Abraham Lincoln

item.quote: You'll stay with me?'
item.author: J. K. Rowling

item.quote: If you want to forget something or someone, never hate it, or never hate him/her. Everything and everyone that you hate is engraved upon your heart; if you want to let go of something, if you want to forget, you cannot hate.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: Knowing others is intelligence;
item.author: Lao Tzu

item.quote: It has been said, 'time heals all wounds.' I do not agree. The wounds remain. In time, the mind, protecting its sanity, covers them with scar tissue and the pain lessens. But it is never gone.
item.author: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

item.quote: You are so busy being YOU that you have no idea how utterly unprecedented you are.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: No thief, however skillful, can rob one of knowledge, and that is why knowledge is the best and safest treasure to acquire.
item.author: L. Frank Baum

item.quote: but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: Just because you call an electric eel a rubber duck doesn't make it a rubber duck, does it? And God help the poor bastard who decides they want to take a bath with the duckie. (Jace Wayland)
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: What would men be without women? Scarce, sir...mighty scarce.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: The Chinese use two brush strokes to write the word 'crisis.' One brush stroke stands for danger; the other for opportunity. In a crisis, be aware of the danger--but recognize the opportunity.

item.quote: There's plenty of sense in nonsense sometimes, if you wish to look for it.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page.

item.quote: Holey? You have the the whole world of ear-related humor before you, you go for holey?
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: There is nothing noble in being superior to your fellow man; true nobility is being superior to your former self.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: Hope
item.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.quote: If I can stop one heart from breaking, I shall not live in vain.
item.author: Emily Dickinson

item.quote: Start writing, no matter what. The water does not flow until the faucet is turned on.
item.author: Louis L'Amour

item.quote: Mom. I have something to tell you. Im undead. Now, I know you may have some preconceived notions about the undead. I know you may not be comfortable with the idea of me being undead. But Im here to tell you that undead are just like you and me well, okay. Possibly more like me than you.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: A good library will never be too neat, or too dusty, because somebody will always be in it, taking books off the shelves and staying up late reading them.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: Some say the world will end in fire,
item.author: Robert Frost

item.quote: Life is to be enjoyed, not endured
item.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

item.quote: Now, you two this year, you behave yourselves. If I get one more owl telling me you've you've blown up a toilet or
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: You can't be happy unless you're unhappy sometimes.
item.author: Lauren Oliver

item.quote: All endings are also beginnings. We just don't know it at the time.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: If you obey all of the rules, you miss all of the fun.

item.quote: If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Nothing is so painful to the human mind as a great and sudden change.
item.author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

item.quote: You see, cuckoos are parasites. They lay their eggs in other birds' nests. When the egg hatches, the baby cuckoo pushes the other baby birds out of the nest. The poor parent birds work themselves to death trying to find enough food to feed the enormous cuckoo child who has murdered their babies and taken their places.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them.
item.author: Agatha Christie

item.quote: Among other things, you'll find that you're not the first person who was ever confused and frightened and even sickened by human behavior. You're by no means alone on that score, you'll be excited and stimulated to know. Many, many men have been just as troubled morally and spiritually as you are right now. Happily, some of them kept records of their troubles. You'll learn from themif you want to. Just as someday, if you have something to offer, someone will learn something from you. It's a beautiful reciprocal arrangement. And it isn't education. It's history. It's poetry.
item.author: J.D. Salinger

item.quote: Why didn't I learn to treat everything like it was the last time. My greatest regret was how much I believed in the future.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: When you stop expecting people to be perfect, you can like them for who they are.
item.author: Donald Miller

item.quote: When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace.
item.author: Jimi Hendrix

item.quote: I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
item.author: Victor Hugo

item.quote: There is no real ending. Its just the place where you stop the story.
item.author: Frank Herbert

item.quote: I fell in love with her courage, her sincerity, and her flaming self respect. And it's these things I'd believe in, even if the whole world indulged in wild suspicions that she wasn't all she should be. I love her and it is the beginning of everything.
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope...I have loved none but you.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
item.author: G.K. Chesterton

item.quote: I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me.
item.author: Emerson, Ralph Waldo

item.quote: More smiling, less worrying. More compassion, less judgment. More blessed, less stressed. More love, less hate.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Perhaps when we find ourselves wanting everything, it is because we are dangerously close to wanting nothing.
item.author: sylvia plath

item.quote: After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world.
item.author: Philip Pullman

item.quote: Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness.
item.author: Bertrand Russell

item.quote: You're off to Great Places!
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: Out of the corner of her eye she thought she saw Jace shoot her a look of white rage - but when she glanced at him, he looked as he always did: easy, confident, slightly bored.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Don't Panic.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of.
item.author: Gregory Maguire

item.quote: A book, too, can be a star, a living fire to lighten the darkness, leading out into the expanding universe.
item.author: Madeleine L'Engle

item.quote: Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.
item.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

item.quote: We are all different. Dont judge, understand instead.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Usually I'm remarkably good natured. Try me on a day that doesn't end in y.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Learn what is to be taken seriously and laugh at the rest.
item.author: Herman Hesse

item.quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: It's enough for me to be sure that you and I exist at this moment.
item.author: Gabriel Garca Mrquez

item.quote: Both Rowling and Meyer, theyre speaking directly to young people. The real difference is that Jo Rowling is a terrific writer and Stephenie Meyer cant write worth a darn. Shes not very good.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: Hate the sin, love the sinner.
item.author: Mahatma Gandhi

item.quote: To see a World in a Grain of Sand
item.author: William Blake

item.quote: There was a clatter as the basilisk fangs cascaded out of Hermione's arms. Running at Ron, she flung them around his neck and kissed him full on the mouth. Ron threw away the fangs and broomstick he was holding and responded with such enthusiasm that he lifted Hermione off her feet.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Many people lose the small joys in the hope for the big happiness.
item.author: Pearl S. Buck

item.quote: I go to seek a Great Perhaps.
item.author: Franois Rabelais

item.quote: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: Live to the point of tears.
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: You are imperfect, permanently and inevitably flawed. And you are beautiful.
item.author: Amy Bloom

item.quote: Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein.
item.author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.quote: Remember that wherever your heart is, there you will find your treasure.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: History will be kind to me for I intend to write it.
item.author: Winston S. Churchill

item.quote: Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Take responsibility of your own happiness, never put it in other peoples hands.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: All I ever wanted was to reach out and touch another human being not just with my hands but with my heart.
item.author: Tahereh Mafi

item.quote: There are no facts, only interpretations.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: He's a wallflower. You see things. You keep quiet about them. And you understand.
item.author: Stephen Chbosky

item.quote: Well, now
item.author: Pablo Neruda

item.quote: How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live.
item.author: Henry David Thoreau

item.quote: What Is Love? I have met in the streets a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, the water passed through his shoes and the stars through his soul
item.author: Victor Hugo

item.quote: If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love.
item.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.quote: We have to allow ourselves to be loved by the people who really love us, the people who really matter. Too much of the time, we are blinded by our own pursuits of people to love us, people that don't even matter, while all that time we waste and the people who do love us have to stand on the sidewalk and watch us beg in the streets! It's time to put an end to this. It's time for us to let ourselves be loved.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: Ah, said a voice from the doorway, having your annual everyone thinks Will is a lunatic meeting, are you?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.
item.author: Bukkyo Dendo Kyokai

item.quote: I am not sure that I exist, actually. I am all the writers that I have read, all the people that I have met, all the women that I have loved; all the cities I have visited.
item.author: Jorge Luis Borges

item.quote: If you have two friends in your lifetime, you're lucky. If you have one good friend, you're more than lucky.
item.author: S.E. Hinton

item.quote: A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say.
item.author: Italo Calvino

item.quote: All the world's a stage,
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: If no one in the entire world cared about you, did you really exist at all?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: The greater the love, the greater the tragedy when it's over.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: This is your life and its ending one moment at a time.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: Find what you love and let it kill you.
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
item.author: Voltaire

item.quote: Some birds are not meant to be caged, that's all. Their feathers are too bright, their songs too sweet and wild. So you let them go, or when you open the cage to feed them they somehow fly out past you. And the part of you that knows it was wrong to imprison them in the first place rejoices, but still, the place where you live is that much more drab and empty for their departure.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: The thing about growing up with Fred and George, said Ginny thoughtfully, is that you sort of start thinking anything's possible if you've got enough nerve.
item.author: J. K. Rowling

item.quote: What you do, the way you think, makes you beautiful.
item.author: Scott Westerfeld

item.quote: Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return.
item.author: Leonardo da Vinci

item.quote: One love, one heart, one destiny.
item.author: Robert Marley

item.quote: Look again at that dot. That's here. That's home. That's us. On it everyone you love, everyone you know, everyone you ever heard of, every human being who ever was, lived out their lives. The aggregate of our joy and suffering, thousands of confident religions, ideologies, and economic doctrines, every hunter and forager, every hero and coward, every creator and destroyer of civilization, every king and peasant, every young couple in love, every mother and father, hopeful child, inventor and explorer, every teacher of morals, every corrupt politician, every superstar, every supreme leader, every saint and sinner in the history of our species lived there-on a mote of dust suspended in a sunbeam.
item.author: Carl Sagan

item.quote: To burn with desire and keep quiet about it is the greatest punishment we can bring on ourselves.
item.author: Federico Garca Lorca

item.quote: To define is to limit.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: If you gave someone your heart and they died, did they take it with them? Did you spend the rest of forever with a hole inside you that couldn't be filled?
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: Don't take life too seriously. Punch it in the face when it needs a good hit. Laugh at it.
item.author: Colleen Hoover

item.quote: That was the thing. You never got used to it, the idea of someone being gone. Just when you think it's reconciled, accepted, someone points it out to you, and it just hits you all over again, that shocking.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Lets not forget this.
item.author: Dave Eggers

item.quote: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: I, myself, am made entirely of flaws, stitched together with good intentions.
item.author: Augusten Burroughs

item.quote: I felt my lungs inflate with the onrush of sceneryair, mountains, trees, people. I thought, This is what it is to be happy.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: Stories may well be lies, but they are good lies that say true things, and which can sometimes pay the rent.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: Do your thing and don't care if they like it.
item.author: Tina Fey

item.quote: It's not because I want to make out with her.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further.
item.author: Richard Dawkins

item.quote: There are no faster or firmer friendships than those formed between people who love the same books.
item.author: Irving Stone

item.quote: A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet.
item.author: mahatma gandhi

item.quote: If she's amazing, she won't be easy. If she's easy, she won't be amazing. If she's worth it, you wont give up. If you give up, you're not worthy. ... Truth is, everybody is going to hurt you; you just gotta find the ones worth suffering for.
item.author: Bob Marley

item.quote: I was thinking about the first time I ever saw you, he said, and how after that I couldn't forget you. I wanted to, but I couldn't stop myself. I forced Hodge to let me be the one who came to find you and bring you back to the Institue. And even back then, in that stupid coffee shop, when I saw you sitting on that couch with Simon, even then that felt wrong to me-- I should have been the one sitting with you. The one who made you laugh like that. I couldn't get rid of that feeling. That it should have been me. And the more I knew you, the more I felt it--it had never been like that for me before. I'd always wanted a girl and then gotten to know her and not wanted her anymore, but with you the feeling just got stronger and stronger until that night when you showed up at Renwick's and I knew.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Is standing by the window muttering about blood something he does all the time? asked Simon.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Today a reader, tomorrow a leader.
item.author: Margaret Fuller

item.quote: And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: Forever is composed of nows.
item.author: Emily Dickinson

item.quote: It's not the face, but the expressions on it. It's not the voice, but what you say. It's not how you look in that body, but the thing you do with it. You are beautiful.
item.author: Stephenie Meyer

item.quote: Goodbye, said the fox. And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
item.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupry

item.quote: But a mermaid has no tears, and therefore she suffers so much more.
item.author: Hans Christian Andersen

item.quote: So be sure when you step, Step with care and great tact. And remember that life's A Great Balancing Act. And will you succeed? Yes! You will, indeed! (98 and percent guaranteed) Kid, you'll move mountains.
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: What are men to rocks and mountains?
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: Life is too short to waste your time on people who dont respect, appreciate, and value you.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: Sometimes it seems safer to hold it all in, where the only person who can judge is yourself.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: For me, trees have always been the most penetrating preachers. I revere them when they live in tribes and families, in forests and groves. And even more I revere them when they stand alone. They are like lonely persons. Not like hermits who have stolen away out of some weakness, but like great, solitary men, like Beethoven and Nietzsche. In their highest boughs the world rustles, their roots rest in infinity; but they do not lose themselves there, they struggle with all the force of their lives for one thing only: to fulfil themselves according to their own laws, to build up their own form, to represent themselves. Nothing is holier, nothing is more exemplary than a beautiful, strong tree. When a tree is cut down and reveals its naked death-wound to the sun, one can read its whole history in the luminous, inscribed disk of its trunk: in the rings of its years, its scars, all the struggle, all the suffering, all the sickness, all the happiness and prosperity stand truly written, the narrow years and the luxurious years, the attacks withstood, the storms endured. And every young farmboy knows that the hardest and noblest wood has the narrowest rings, that high on the mountains and in continuing danger the most indestructible, the strongest, the ideal trees grow.
item.author: Herman Hesse

item.quote: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.
item.author: Charles Dickens

item.quote: And that's the thing about people who mean everything they say. They think everyone else does too.
item.author: Khaled Hosseini

item.quote: When someone is crying, of course, the noble thing to do is to comfort them. But if someone is trying to hide their tears, it may also be noble to pretend you do not notice them.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: Reading is escape, and the opposite of escape; it's a way to make contact with reality after a day of making things up, and it's a way of making contact with someone else's imagination after a day that's all too real.
item.author: Nora Ephron

item.quote: No matter how much suffering you went through, you never wanted to let go of those memories.
item.author: haruki murakami

item.quote: It isn't possible to love and part. You will wish that it was. You can transmute love, ignore it, muddle it, but you can never pull it out of you. I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal.
item.author: E.M. Forster

item.quote: And so it goes...
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: Confront the dark parts of yourself, and work to banish them with illumination and forgiveness. Your willingness to wrestle with your demons will cause your angels to sing.
item.author: August Wilson

item.quote: I do things like get in a taxi and say, The library, and step on it.
item.author: David Foster Wallace

item.quote: Is 'fat' really the worst thing a human being can be? Is 'fat' worse than 'vindictive', 'jealous', 'shallow', 'vain', 'boring' or 'cruel'? Not to me.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.
item.author: JK Rowling

item.quote: Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind.
item.author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.quote: Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk.
item.author: Robert Bloch

item.quote: Oh well... I'd just been thinking, if you had died, you'd have been welcome to share my toilet.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Be mindful. Be grateful. Be positive. Be true. Be kind.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: The Road goes ever on and on
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: It is a great thing to start life with a small number of really good books which are your very own.
item.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

item.quote: At some point, you just pull off the Band-Aid, and it hurts, but then it's over and you're relieved.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
item.author: Marcus Aurelius

item.quote: Tell your heart that the fear of suffering is worse than the suffering itself. And that no heart has ever suffered when it goes in search of its dreams, because every second of the search is a second's encounter with God and with eternity.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Dance, when you're broken open. Dance, if you've torn the bandage off. Dance in the middle of the fighting. Dance in your blood. Dance when you're perfectly free.
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: When a man is denied the right to live the life he believes in, he has no choice but to become an outlaw.
item.author: Nelson Mandela

item.quote: I dream my painting and I paint my dream.
item.author: Vincent Willem van Gogh

item.quote: The silence depressed me. It wasn't the silence of silence. It was my own silence.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: Any fool can be happy. It takes a man with real heart to make beauty out of the stuff that makes us weep.
item.author: Clive Barker

item.quote: If I should ever die, God forbid, let this be my epitaph:
item.author: kurt vonnegut

item.quote: You don't remember what happened. What you remember becomes what happened.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: And I like large parties. Theyre so intimate. At small parties there isnt any privacy.
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: There is a stubbornness about me that never can bear to be frightened at the will of others. My courage always rises at every attempt to intimidate me.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: People are more difficult to work with than machines. And when you break a person, he can't be fixed.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: Isabelle drifted over, Jace a pace behind her. She was wearing a long black dress with boots and an even longer cutaway coat of soft green velvet, the color of moss. I can't believe you did it! she exclaimed. How did you get Magnus to let Jace leave?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: You is kind. You is smart. You is important.
item.author: Kathryn Stockett

item.quote: You do not have to be good.
item.author: Mary Oliver

item.quote: I lived in books more than I lived anywhere else.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: It was books that made me feel that perhaps I was not completely alone. They could be honest with me, and I with them.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Don't stop there. I suppose there are also, what, vampires and werewolves and zombies?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Be the reason someone smiles. Be the reason someone feels loved and believes in the goodness in people.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away.
item.author: Philip K. Dick

item.quote: It happens to everyone as they grow up. You find out who you are and what you want, and then you realize that people you've known forever don't see things the way you do. So you keep the wonderful memories, but find yourself moving on.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: If a book about failures doesn't sell, is it a success?
item.author: Jerry Seinfeld

item.quote: How wrong is it for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself?
item.author: Anais Nin

item.quote: Fighting for peace is like screwing for virginity.
item.author: George Carlin

item.quote: I don't want to be at the mercy of my emotions. I want to use them, to enjoy them, and to dominate them.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Maybe you can afford to wait. Maybe for you there's a tomorrow. Maybe for you there's one thousand tomorrows, or three thousand, or ten, so much time you can bathe in it, roll around it, let it slide like coins through you fingers. So much time you can waste it.
item.author: Lauren Oliver

item.quote: Wherever you go becomes a part of you somehow.
item.author: Anita Desai

item.quote: Happiness is the consequence of personal effort. You fight for it, strive for it, insist upon it, and sometimes even travel around the world looking for it. You have to participate relentlessly in the manifestations of your own blessings. And once you have achieved a state of happiness, you must never become lax about maintaining it. You must make a mighty effort to keep swimming upward into that happiness forever, to stay afloat on top of it.
item.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

item.quote: Perhaps it's impossible to wear an identity without becoming what you pretend to be.
item.author: Orson Scott Card

item.quote: For last year's words belong to last year's language
item.author: T.S. Eliot

item.quote: Isn't it odd how much fatter a book gets when you've read it several times? Mo had said...As if something were left between the pages every time you read it. Feelings, thoughts, sounds, smells...and then, when you look at the book again many years later, you find yourself there, too, a slightly younger self, slightly different, as if the book had preserved you like a pressed flower...both strange and familiar.
item.author: Cornelia Funke

item.quote: You know, when it works, love is pretty amazing. It's not overrated. There's a reason for all those songs.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: They say when you are missing someone that they are probably feeling the same, but I don't think it's possible for you to miss me as much as I'm missing you right now
item.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.quote: Fall down again, Bella?'
item.author: Stephenie Meyer

item.quote: Love is not affectionate feeling, but a steady wish for the loved person's ultimate good as far as it can be obtained.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: Solitude is fine but you need someone to tell that solitude is fine.
item.author: Honor de Balzac

item.quote: Do you wish me a good morning, or mean that it is a good morning whether I want it or not; or that you feel good this morning; or that it is a morning to be good on?
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
item.author: Aldous Huxley

item.quote: Do what is right, not what is easy nor what is popular.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Accept yourself, love yourself, and keep moving forward. If you want to fly, you have to give up what weighs you down.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love.
item.author: Tom Robbins

item.quote: Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Say 'provoking' again. Your mouth looks provocative when you do.
item.author: Becca Fitzpatrick

item.quote: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: I want
item.author: Pablo Neruda

item.quote: Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book. And then there are books like An Imperial Affliction, which you can't tell people about, books so special and rare and yours that advertising your affection feels like betrayal
item.author: John Green

item.quote: And so with the sunshine and the great bursts of leaves growing on the trees, just as things grow in fast movies, I had that familiar conviction that life was beginning over again with the summer.
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: To me, Fearless is not the absense of fear. It's not being completely unafraid. To me, Fearless is having fears. Fearless is having doubts. Lots of them. To me, Fearless is living in spite of those things that scare you to death.
item.author: Taylor Swift

item.quote: If you are irritated by every rub, how will your mirror be polished?
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: Understanding is the first step to acceptance, and only with acceptance can there be recovery.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: And still, after all this time,
item.author: Hafiz

item.quote: The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: It was not the feeling of completeness I so needed, but the feeling of not being empty.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: Every generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it.
item.author: George Orwell

item.quote: You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?
item.author: George Bernard Shaw

item.quote: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.
item.author: Virginia Woolf

item.quote: The world was hers for the reading.
item.author: Betty Smith

item.quote: I love you like a fat kid loves cake!
item.author: Scott Adams

item.quote: Don't you think it's better to be extremely happy for a short while, even if you lose it, than to be just okay for your whole life?
item.author: Audrey Niffenegger

item.quote: When I was a boy of 14, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be 21, I was astonished at how much the old man had learned in seven years.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Why are women... so much more interesting to men than men are to women?
item.author: Virginia Woolf

item.quote: Have enough courage to trust love one more time and always one more time.
item.author: Maya Angelou

item.quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
item.author: Marcus Aurelius

item.quote: A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Atticus told me to delete the adjectives and I'd have the facts.
item.author: Harper Lee

item.quote: People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.
item.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

item.quote: I can resist anything except temptation.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: The first draft of anything is shit.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof.
item.author: Barbara Kingsolver

item.quote: How did it get so late so soon?
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: Imagine smiling after a slap in the face. Then think of doing it twenty-four hours a day.
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: If you want to really hurt you parents, and you don't have the nerve to be gay, the least you can do is go into the arts. I'm not kidding. The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake. Sing in the shower. Dance to the radio. Tell stories. Write a poem to a friend, even a lousy poem. Do it as well as you possible can. You will get an enormous reward. You will have created something.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
item.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupry

item.quote: And when her lips met mine, I knew that I could live to be a hundred and visit every country in the world, but nothing would ever compare to that single moment when I first kissed the girl of my dreams and knew that my love would last forever.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Live the Life of Your Dreams: Be brave enough to live the life of your dreams according to your vision and purpose instead of the expectations and opinions of others.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Words are easy, like the wind; Faithful friends are hard to find.
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: War must be, while we defend our lives against a destroyer who would devour all; but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend.
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: What makes the desert beautiful,' said the little prince, 'is that somewhere it hides a well...
item.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupry

item.quote: Maybe everbody in the whole damn world is scared of each other.
item.author: John Steinbeck

item.quote: Though nobody can go back and make a new beginning... Anyone can start over and make a new ending.
item.author: Chico Xavier

item.quote: Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live.
item.author: Natalie Babbitt

item.quote: I am an excitable person who only understands life lyrically, musically, in whom feelings are much stronger as reason. I am so thirsty for the marvelous that only the marvelous has power over me. Anything I can not transform into something marvelous, I let go. Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.
item.author: Anais Nin

item.quote: You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.
item.author: Colette

item.quote: I would like to be the air that inhabits you for a moment only. I would like to be that unnoticed and that necessary.
item.author: Margaret Atwood

item.quote: Welcome to the wonderful world of jealousy, he thought. For the price of admission, you get a splitting headache, a nearly irresistable urge to commit murder, and an inferiority complex. Yippee.
item.author: J.R. Ward

item.quote: Live in the present, remember the past, and fear not the future, for it doesn't exist and never shall. There is only now.
item.author: Christopher Paolini

item.quote: You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life?
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics.
item.author: Benjamin Disraeli

item.quote: Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: It doesn't interest me what you do for a living. I want to know what you ache for, and if you dare to dream of meeting your heart's longing.
item.author: Oriah Mountain Dreamer

item.quote: So it's you and a syringe against the Capitol? See, this is why no one lets you make the plans.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: Its probably not just by chance that Im alone. It would be very hard for a man to live with me, unless hes terribly strong. And if hes stronger than I, Im the one who cant live with him. Im neither smart nor stupid, but I dont think Im a run-of-the-mill person. Ive been in business without being a businesswoman, Ive loved without being a woman made only for love. The two men Ive loved, I think, will remember me, on earth or in heaven, because men always remember a woman who caused them concern and uneasiness. Ive done my best, in regard to people and to life, without precepts, but with a taste for justice.
item.author: Coco Chanel

item.quote: Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper,
item.author: Kahlil Gibran

item.quote: I'm quite illiterate, but I read a lot.
item.author: J.D. Salinger

item.quote: You speak an infinite deal of nothing.
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: You need to learn how to select your thoughts just the same way you select your clothes every day. This is a power you can cultivate. If you want to control things in your life so bad, work on the mind. That's the only thing you should be trying to control.
item.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

item.quote: Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: It's just that most really good-looking people are stupid, so I exceed expectations.'
item.author: John Green

item.quote: You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it.
item.author: Malcolm X

item.quote: He does something to me, that boy. Every time. Its his only detriment. He steps on my heart. He makes me cry.
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: The past is a place of reference, not a place of residence; the past is a place of learning, not a place of living.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: To say goodbye is to die a little.
item.author: Raymond Chandler

item.quote: I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.
item.author: Fitzgerald F. Scott

item.quote: So you're always honest, I said.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us.
item.author: Franz Kafka

item.quote: No. I can survive well enough on my own if given the proper reading material.
item.author: Sarah J. Maas

item.quote: You here to finish me off, Sweetheart?
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace.
item.author: Frank McCourt

item.quote: When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you, a joy.
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?
item.author: Christopher Paolini

item.quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
item.author: Anais Nin

item.quote: The meek may inherit the earth, but at the moment it belongs to the conceited. Like me.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Grover was sniffing the wind, looking nervous. He fished out his acorns and threw them into the sand, then played his pipes. They rearranged themselves in a pattern that made no sense to me, but Grover looked concerned.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: As if you were on fire from within.
item.author: Pablo Neruda

item.quote: You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved.
item.author: Stewart O'Nan

item.quote: All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: Even death has a heart.
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: You must make a decision that you are going to move on. It wont happen automatically. You will have to rise up and say, I dont care how hard this is, I dont care how disappointed I am, Im not going to let this get the best of me. Im moving on with my life.
item.author: Joel Osteen

item.quote: It's a lot easier to be lost than found. It's the reason we're always searching and rarely discovered--so many locks not enough keys.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation.
item.author: Walter Cronkite

item.quote: I dream. Sometimes I think that's the only right thing to do.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Love is an untamed force. When we try to control it, it destroys us. When we try to imprison it, it enslaves us. When we try to understand it, it leaves us feeling lost and confused.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get
item.author: W. P. Kinsella

item.quote: We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.
item.author: Stephen Hawking

item.quote: When I discover who I am, Ill be free.
item.author: Ralph Ellison

item.quote: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs.
item.author: Charlotte Bronte

item.quote: If you're lonely when you're alone, you're in bad company.
item.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

item.quote: If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck.
item.author: Joss Whedon

item.quote: Life, he realize, was much like a song. In the beginning there is mystery, in the end there is confirmation, but it's in the middle where all the emotion resides to make the whole thing worthwhile.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: Look after my heart - I've left it with you.
item.author: Stephenie Meyer

item.quote: Growing apart doesn't change the fact that for a long time we grew side by side; our roots will always be tangled. I'm glad for that.
item.author: Ally Condie

item.quote: Tonight I can write the saddest lines
item.author: Pablo Neruda

item.quote: If I got rid of my demons, Id lose my angels.
item.author: Tennessee Williams

item.quote: Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God.
item.author: Corrie ten Boom

item.quote: Love is a temporary madness, it erupts like volcanoes and then subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots have so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part. Because this is what love is. Love is not breathlessness, it is not excitement, it is not the promulgation of promises of eternal passion, it is not the desire to mate every second minute of the day, it is not lying awake at night imagining that he is kissing every cranny of your body. No, don't blush, I am telling you some truths. That is just being in love, which any fool can do. Love itself is what is left over when being in love has burned away, and this is both an art and a fortunate accident.
item.author: Shawn Slovo

item.quote: No woman really wants a man to carry her off; she only wants him to want to do it.
item.author: Elizabeth Peters

item.quote: We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once.
item.author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.quote: The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache.
item.author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley

item.quote: The darker the night, the brighter the stars,
item.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.quote: There are darknesses in life and there are lights, and you are one of the lights, the light of all lights.
item.author: Bram Stoker

item.quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
item.author: Plato

item.quote: There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love.
item.author: Christopher Morley

item.quote: In politics, If you want anything said, ask a man. If you want anything done, ask a woman.
item.author: Margaret Thatcher

item.quote: I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn.
item.author: Anne Frank

item.quote: Some people say, Never let them see you cry. I say, if youre so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone.
item.author: Tina Fey

item.quote: I came from a real tough neighborhood. Once a guy pulled a knife on me. I knew he wasn't a professional, the knife had butter on it.
item.author: Rodney Dangerfield

item.quote: Every great love starts with a great story...
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Biology gives you a brain. Life turns it into a mind.
item.author: Jeffrey Eugenides

item.quote: Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?
item.author: George Carlin

item.quote: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.
item.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.quote: I'm sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It's just been too intelligent to come here.
item.author: Arthur C. Clarke

item.quote: You know what charm is: a way of getting the answer yes without having asked any clear question.
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: Clary,
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.
item.author: W. Somerset Maugham

item.quote: It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
item.author: Soren Kierkegaard

item.quote: You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange.
item.author: Milan Kundera

item.quote: How do you spell 'love'? - Piglet
item.author: A.A. Milne

item.quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.
item.author: George Bernard Shaw

item.quote: Theyre not hideous, said Tessa.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Why were you lurking under our window?
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: I'm not young enough to know everything.
item.author: J.M. Barrie

item.quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
item.author: William Arthur Ward

item.quote: We are all alone, born alone, die alone, andin spite of True Romance magazineswe shall all someday look back on our lives and see that, in spite of our company, we were alone the whole way. I do not say lonelyat least, not all the timebut essentially, and finally, alone. This is what makes your self-respect so important, and I don't see how you can respect yourself if you must look in the hearts and minds of others for your happiness.
item.author: Hunter S. Thompson

item.quote: Believe in Your Heart
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: If you ever find yourself in the wrong story, leave.
item.author: Mo Willems

item.quote: It's often just enough to be with someone. I don't need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You're not alone.
item.author: Marilyn Monroe

item.quote: I've got nothing to do today but smile.
item.author: Simon and Garfunkel

item.quote: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
item.author: J. M. Barrie

item.quote: Every man I meet wants to protect me. I can't figure out what from.
item.author: Mae West

item.quote: Happiness [is] only real when shared
item.author: Jon Krakauer

item.quote: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: I am a cage, in search of a bird.
item.author: Franz Kafka

item.quote: I'm not going to wear a red dress, she said.
item.author: Kristin Cashore

item.quote: Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats.
item.author: Voltaire

item.quote: I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of ones own self.
item.author: Franz Kafka

item.quote: One can never have enough socks, said Dumbledore. Another Christmas has come and gone and I didn't get a single pair. People will insist on giving me books.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet.
item.author: Emily Dickinson

item.quote: I crave your mouth, your voice, your hair.
item.author: Pablo Neruda

item.quote: Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books.
item.author: Julian Barnes

item.quote: Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.
item.author: Robert Frost

item.quote: And then he gives me a smile that just seems so genuinely sweet with just the right touch of shyness that unexpected warmth rushes through me.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: And I thought about how many people have loved those songs. And how many people got through a lot of bad times because of those songs. And how many people enjoyed good times with those songs. And how much those songs really mean. I think it would be great to have written one of those songs. I bet if I wrote one of them, I would be very proud. I hope the people who wrote those songs are happy. I hope they feel it's enough. I really do because they've made me happy. And I'm only one person.
item.author: Stephen Chbosky

item.quote: An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.
item.author: Niels Bohr

item.quote: It was, he thought, the difference between being dragged into the arena to face a battle to the death and walking into the arena with your head held high. Some people, perhaps, would say that there was little to choose between the two ways, but Dumbledore knew - and so do I, thought Harry, with a rush of fierce pride, and so did my parents - that there was all the difference in the world.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image. If in loving them we do not love what they are, but only their potential likeness to ourselves, then we do not love them: we only love the reflection of ourselves we find in them
item.author: Thomas Merton

item.quote: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: A ship is safe in harbor, but that's not what ships are for.
item.author: John A. Shedd

item.quote: Maybe...you'll fall in love with me all over again.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
item.author: John Locke

item.quote: Dogs never bite me. Just humans.
item.author: Marilyn Monroe

item.quote: You never know what worse luck your bad luck has saved you from.
item.author: Cormac McCarthy

item.quote: The best moments in reading are when you come across something a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things which you had thought special and particular to you. Now here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out and taken yours.
item.author: Alan Bennett

item.quote: I can listen no longer in silence. I must speak to you by such means as are within my reach. You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope. Tell me not that I am too late, that such precious feelings are gone for ever. I offer myself to you again with a heart even more your own than when you almost broke it, eight years and a half ago. Dare not say that man forgets sooner than woman, that his love has an earlier death. I have loved none but you. Unjust I may have been, weak and resentful I have been, but never inconstant. You alone have brought me to Bath. For you alone, I think and plan. Have you not seen this? Can you fail to have understood my wishes? I had not waited even these ten days, could I have read your feelings, as I think you must have penetrated mine. I can hardly write. I am every instant hearing something which overpowers me. You sink your voice, but I can distinguish the tones of that voice when they would be lost on others. Too good, too excellent creature! You do us justice, indeed. You do believe that there is true attachment and constancy among men. Believe it to be most fervent, most undeviating, in F. W.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: Words are pale shadows of forgotten names. As names have power, words have power. Words can light fires in the minds of men. Words can wring tears from the hardest hearts.
item.author: Patrick Rothfuss

item.quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Better to be strong than pretty and useless.
item.author: Lilith Saintcrow

item.quote: If you are a dreamer come in
item.author: Shel Silverstein

item.quote: If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud.
item.author: mile Zola

item.quote: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.
item.author: Zora Neale Hurston

item.quote: He smiled understandingly-much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it, that you may come across four or five times in life. It faced--or seemed to face--the whole eternal world for an instant, and then concentrated on you with an irresistible prejudice in your favor. It understood you just as far as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you would like to believe in yourself, and assured you that it had precisely the impression of you that, at your best, you hoped to convey.
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
item.author: Virginia Woolf

item.quote: Suffering has been stronger than all other teaching, and has taught me to understand what your heart used to be. I have been bent and broken, but - I hope - into a better shape.
item.author: Charles Dickens

item.quote: Don't tell me, Jace said, Simon's turned himself into an ocelot and you want me to do something about it before Isabelle makes him into a stole. Well, you'll have have to wait till tomorrow. I'm out of commission. He pointed at himself - he was wearing blue pajamas with a hole in the sleeve. Look. Jammies.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.
item.author: Ayn Rand

item.quote: I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity.
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: Of all the trees we could've hit, we had to get one that hits back.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books.
item.author: Jorge Luis Borges

item.quote: Any fool knows men and women think differently at times, but the biggest difference is this. Men forget, but never forgive; women forgive, but never forget.
item.author: Robert Jordan

item.quote: The unreal is more powerful than the real. Because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it. Because its only intangible ideas, concepts, beliefs, fantasies that last. Stone crumbles. Wood rots. People, well, they die. But things as fragile as a thought, a dream, a legend, they can go on and on. If you can change the way people think. The way they see themselves. The way they see the world. You can change the way people live their lives. That's the only lasting thing you can create.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: All the secrets of the world are contained in books. Read at your own risk.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
item.author: Alice Walker

item.quote: Be grateful for what you already have while you pursue your goals.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Letting go doesn't mean that you don't care about someone anymore. It's just realizing that the only person you really have control over is yourself.
item.author: Deborah Reber

item.quote: you can, you should, and if youre brave enough to start, you will.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-God damn it, you've got to be kind.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: Don't feel bad, I'm usually about to die.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned.
item.author: Saul Bellow

item.quote: Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift.
item.author: Mary Oliver

item.quote: Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice.
item.author: Bill Watterson

item.quote: I realize only one person will be damaged beyond repair if Peeta dies. Me.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: The real story of the Fleece: there were these two children of Zeus, Cadmus and Europa, okay? They were about to get offered up as human sacrifices, when they prayed to Zeus to save them. So Zeus sent this magical flying ram with golden wool, which picked them up in Greece and carried them all the way to Colchis in Asia Minor. Well, actually it carried Cadmus. Europa fell off and died along the way, but that's not important.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be.
item.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.quote: Make improvements, not excuses. Seek respect, not attention.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: That's why they call it the American Dream, because you have to be asleep to believe it.
item.author: George Carlin

item.quote: Before you, Bella, my life was like a moonless night. Very dark, but there were stars, points of light and reason. ...And then you shot across my sky like a meteor. Suddenly everything was on fire; there was brilliancy, there was beauty. When you were gone, when the meteor had fallen over the horizon, everything went black. Nothing had changed, but my eyes were blinded by the light. I couldnt see the stars anymore. And there was no more reason, for anything.
item.author: Stephenie Meyer

item.quote: Though she be but little, she is fierce!
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.
item.author: Henry Miller

item.quote: Crying is all right in its way while it lasts. But you have to stop sooner or later, and then you still have to decide what to do.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: But in the end one needs more courage to live than to kill himself.
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: I could easily forgive his pride, if he had not mortified mine.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: Don't let the expectations and opinions of other people affect your decisions. It's your life, not theirs. Do what matters most to you; do what makes you feel alive and happy. Don't let the expectations and ideas of others limit who you are. If you let others tell you who you are, you are living their reality not yours. There is more to life than pleasing people. There is much more to life than following others' prescribed path. There is so much more to life than what you experience right now. You need to decide who you are for yourself. Become a whole being. Adventure.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem.
item.author: Diana Gabaldon

item.quote: She read books as one would breathe air, to fill up and live.
item.author: Annie Dillard

item.quote: You will lose someone you cant live without,and your heart will be badly broken, and the bad news is that you never completely get over the loss of your beloved. But this is also the good news. They live forever in your broken heart that doesnt seal back up. And you come through. Its like having a broken leg that never heals perfectlythat still hurts when the weather gets cold, but you learn to dance with the limp.
item.author: Anne Lamott

item.quote: From the moment I picked up your book until I put it down, I was convulsed with laughter. Some day I intend reading it.
item.author: Groucho Marx

item.quote: You realize that our mistrust of the future makes it hard to give up the past.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: The best books... are those that tell you what you know already.
item.author: George Orwell

item.quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
item.author: Truman Capote

item.quote: Even if you are on the right track, youll get run over if you just sit there.
item.author: Will Rogers

item.quote: Was it hard? I ask.
item.author: Lisa Schroeder

item.quote: He was my mum and dad's best friend. He's a convicted murderer, but he's broken out of wizard prison and he's on the run. He likes to keep in touch with me, though...keep up with my news...check if I'm happy...
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks.
item.author: Harper Lee

item.quote: You will find that it is necessary to let things go; simply for the reason that they are heavy. So let them go, let go of them. I tie no weights to my ankles.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: The past has no power over the present moment.
item.author: Eckhart Tolle

item.quote: Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: Let everything happen to you
item.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

item.quote: love the life you live.
item.author: Bob Marley

item.quote: Knock, And He'll open the door
item.author: Jalal Ad-Din Rumi

item.quote: It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
item.author: Voltaire

item.quote: A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.
item.author: Thomas Mann

item.quote: Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.
item.author: David Byrne

item.quote: I nodded, looking at Rachel with respect. You hit the Lord of the Titans in the eye with a blue plastic hairbrush.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: A DEFINITION NOT FOUND
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.
