item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: It's amazing how a little tomorrow can make up for a whole lot of yesterday.
item.author: John Guare

item.quote: Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.
item.author: Benjamin Franklin

item.quote: What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.
item.author: Walt Whitman

item.quote: The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families.
item.author: Jay McInerney

item.quote: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
item.author: A.A. Milne

item.quote: The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love.
item.author: William Wordsworth

item.quote: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: I'm tough, I'm ambitious, and I know exactly what I want. If that makes me a bitch, okay.
item.author: Madonna

item.quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
item.author: Victor Hugo

item.quote: It's discouraging to think how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit.
item.author: Nol Coward

item.quote: When I am with you, we stay up all night.
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: Every now and then I like to do as I'm told, just to confuse people.
item.author: Tamora Pierce

item.quote: Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.
item.author: Bob Marley

item.quote: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
item.author: Thomas Jefferson

item.quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths;
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: Did you know that for pretty much the entire history of the human species, the average life span was less than thirty years? You could count on ten years or so of real adulthood, right? There was no planning for retirement, There was no planning for a career. There was no planning. No time for plannning. No time for a future. But then the life spans started getting longer, and people started having more and more future. And now life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future--you go to high school so you can go to college so you can get a good job so you can get a nice house so you can afford to send your kids to college so they can get a good job so they can get a nice house so they can afford to send their kids to college.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: What are all these? Clary asked.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Great minds are always feared by lesser minds.
item.author: Dan Brown

item.quote: I could not tell you if I loved you the first moment I saw you, or if it was the second or third or fourth. But I remember the first moment I looked at you walking toward me and realized that somehow the rest of the world seemed to vanish when I was with you.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Winter is coming.
item.author: George R.R. Martin

item.quote: Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: You possess other people's...bodies.
item.author: Becca Fitzpatrick

item.quote: Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Don't be so humble - you are not that great.
item.author: Golda Meir

item.quote: What if it lines up like it did in the Trojan War ... Athena versus Poseidon?
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: No one knows for certain how much impact they have on the lives of other people. Oftentimes, we have no clue. Yet we push it just the same.
item.author: Jay Asher

item.quote: Today was good. Today was fun. Tomorrow is another one.
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.
item.author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.quote: Tears shed for another person are not a sign of weakness. They are a sign of a pure heart.
item.author: Jos N. Harris

item.quote: Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.
item.author: Margaret Mead

item.quote: If things start happening, don't worry, don't stew, just go right along and you'll start happening too.
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: Yes, frosting. The final defense of the dying.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
item.author: Joseph Campbell

item.quote: One day you will kiss a man you can't breathe without, and find that breath is of little consequence.
item.author: Karen Marie Moning

item.quote: Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone.
item.author: Dorothy Parker

item.quote: Pursue what catches your heart, not what catches your eyes.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.
item.author: Jane Goodall

item.quote: Anyone who falls in love is searching for the missing pieces of themselves. So anyone who's in love gets sad when they think of their lover. It's like stepping back inside a room you have fond memories of, one you haven't seen in a long time.
item.author: Murakami, Haruki

item.quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens
item.author: Jimi Hendrix

item.quote: Art and love are the same thing: Its the process of seeing yourself in things that are not you.
item.author: Chuck Klosterman

item.quote: My imagination functions much better when I don't have to speak to people.
item.author: Patricia Highsmith

item.quote: The most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or touched, they are felt with the heart.
item.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupry

item.quote: I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else.
item.author: Joshua Slocum

item.quote: I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: Stay gold, Ponyboy, stay gold.
item.author: S.E. Hinton

item.quote: And he took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many.
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: I loved you like a man loves a woman he never touches, only writes to, keeps little photographs of.
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: Acts of Kindness:
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: So when the moon's only partly full, you only feel a little wolfy?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.
item.author: Irina Dunn

item.quote: You think my first instinct is to protect you. Because you're small, or a girl, or a Stiff. But you're wrong.
item.author: Veronica Roth

item.quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
item.author: John Muir

item.quote: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.
item.author: Sren Kierkegaard

item.quote: Promise me you'll never forget me because if I thought you would, I'd never leave.
item.author: A.A. Milne

item.quote: When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.
item.author: Charles Dickens

item.quote: Don't bend; don't water it down; don't try to make it logical; don't edit your own soul according to the fashion. Rather, follow your most intense obsessions mercilessly.
item.author: Franz Kafka

item.quote: I am constantly torn between killing myself and killing everyone around me.
item.author: David Levithan

item.quote: There is no exquisite beauty without some strangeness in the proportion.
item.author: Edgar Allan Poe

item.quote: Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.
item.author: Dan Brown

item.quote: Once you had put the pieces back together, even though you may look intact, you were never quite the same as you'd been before the fall.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.
item.author: Abraham Lincoln

item.quote: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
item.author: Lao Tzu

item.quote: I think the reward for conformity is that everyone likes you except yourself.
item.author: Rita Mae Brown

item.quote: I knew, in the silence that followed, that anything could happen here. It might be too late: again, I might have missed my chance. But I would at least know I tried, that I took my heart and extended my hand, whatever the outcome.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin.
item.author: Aldous Huxley

item.quote: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Dont waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
item.author: Lao Tzu

item.quote: May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.
item.author: George Carlin

item.quote: People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss.
item.author: Nick Hornby

item.quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
item.author: Salvador Dali

item.quote: I have come to accept the feeling of not knowing where I am going. And I have trained myself to love it. Because it is only when we are suspended in mid-air with no landing in sight, that we force our wings to unravel and alas begin our flight. And as we fly, we still may not know where we are going to. But the miracle is in the unfolding of the wings. You may not know where you're going, but you know that so long as you spread your wings, the winds will carry you.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: I am trying here to prevent anyone saying the really foolish thing that people often say about Him: Im ready to accept Jesus as a great moral teacher, but I dont accept his claim to be God. That is the one thing we must not say. A man who was merely a man and said the sort of things Jesus said would not be a great moral teacher. He would either be a lunatic on the level with the man who says he is a poached egg or else he would be the Devil of Hell. You must make your choice. Either this man was, and is, the Son of God, or else a madman or something worse. You can shut him up for a fool, you can spit at him and kill him as a demon or you can fall at his feet and call him Lord and God, but let us not come with any patronizing nonsense about his being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: These violent delights have violent ends
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: All great and precious things are lonely.
item.author: John Steinbeck

item.quote: When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.
item.author: Laurie Halse Anderson

item.quote: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
item.author: Mother Theresa

item.quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
item.author: John Lennon

item.quote: Keep in mind that people change, but the past doesn't.
item.author: Becca Fitzpatrick

item.quote: The only way that we can live, is if we grow. The only way that we can grow is if we change. The only way that we can change is if we learn. The only way we can learn is if we are exposed. And the only way that we can become exposed is if we throw ourselves out into the open. Do it. Throw yourself.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: Your friend's poetry is terrible, he said.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
item.author: Bette Midler

item.quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
item.author: Kahlil Gibran

item.quote: You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.
item.author: Toni Morrison

item.quote: The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night.
item.author: Isabel Allende

item.quote: Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.
item.author: J. K. Rowling

item.quote: Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.
item.author: Fernando Pessoa

item.quote: Then I realize what it is. It's him. Something about him makes me feel like I am about to fall. Or turn to liquid. Or burst into flames.
item.author: Veronica Roth

item.quote: I have absolutely no pleasure in the stimulants in which I sometimes so madly indulge. It has not been in the pursuit of pleasure that I have periled life and reputation and reason. It has been the desperate attempt to escape from torturing memories, from a sense of insupportable loneliness and a dread of some strange impending doom.
item.author: Edgar Allan Poe

item.quote: Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another.
item.author: Carl Sagan

item.quote: For whatever we lose (like a you or a me),
item.author: e.e. cummings

item.quote: I'll just have them change the entry in the demonology textbook from 'almost extinct' to 'not extinct enough for Alec. He prefers his monsters really, really extinct.' Will that make you happy?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect, you should expect it.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: There is greatness in doing something you hate for the sake of someone you love.
item.author: Shmuley Boteach

item.quote: And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: A good book is an event in my life.
item.author: Stendhal

item.quote: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
item.author: Winston S. Churchill

item.quote: I'm saying that I'm a moody, insecure, narrow-minded, jealous, borderline homicidal bitch, and I want you to promise me that you're okay with that, because it's who I am, and you're what I need.
item.author: Jeaniene Frost

item.quote: You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against.
item.author: Laurie Halse Anderson

item.quote: The best thing for being sad, replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn.
item.author: T.H. White

item.quote: Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts.
item.author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

item.quote: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection
item.author: Sharon Salzberg

item.quote: To be, or not to be: that is the question:
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?
item.author: Lewis Carroll

item.quote: It's all in the view. That's what I mean about forever, too. For any one of us our forever could end in an hour, or a hundred years from now. You never know for sure, so you'd better make every second count.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think, more talented than you know, and capable of more than you imagine.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Love is the absence of judgment.
item.author: Dalai Lama XIV

item.quote: If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be.
item.author: J. D. Salinger

item.quote: I suppose a fire that burns that bright is not meant to last.
item.author: Veronica Roth

item.quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
item.author: George Bernard Shaw

item.quote: We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Learn to light a candle in the darkest moments of someones life. Be the light that helps others see; it is what gives life its deepest significance.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Our memory is a more perfect world than the universe: it gives back life to those who no longer exist.
item.author: Guy de Maupassant

item.quote: That's why when major badasses greet each other in movies, they don't say anything, they just nod. The nod means, 'I' am a badass, and I recognize that you, too, are a badass,' but they don't say anything because they're Wolverine and Magneto and it would mess up their vibe to explain.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
item.author: Mother Teresa

item.quote: Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations.
item.author: Anais Nin

item.quote: Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body.
item.author: Walt Whitman

item.quote: Keep Going
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: It wouldn't be my move, Jace agreed. First the candy and flowers, then the apology letters, then the ravenous demon hordes. In that order.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside.
item.author: John Lennon

item.quote: She seems so cool, so focused, so quiet, yet her eyes remain fixed upon the horizon. You think you know all there is to know about her immediately upon meeting her, but everything you think you know is wrong. Passion flows through her like a river of blood.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: The best fantasy is written in the language of dreams. It is alive as dreams are alive, more real than real ... for a moment at least ... that long magic moment before we wake.
item.author: George R.R. Martin

item.quote: Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Still round the corner there may wait
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming.
item.author: Pablo Neruda

item.quote: In a way, it's nice to know that there are Greek gods out there, because you have somebody to blame when things go wrong. For instance, when you're walking away from a bus that's just been attacked by monster hags and blown up by lightning, and it's raining on top of everything else, most people might think that's just really bad luck; when you're a half-blood, you understand that some devine force is really trying to mess up your day.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.
item.author: William Blake

item.quote: No amount of regretting can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.
item.author: Ray Bradbury

item.quote: The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: A truth that's told with bad intent
item.author: William Blake

item.quote: being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right.
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Your beliefs become your thoughts,
item.author: Gandhi

item.quote: You can't stop the future
item.author: Jay Asher

item.quote: No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
item.author: Franz Kafka

item.quote: I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know,
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: She leaned down and looked at his lifeless face and Leisel kissed her best friend, Rudy Steiner, soft and true on his lips. He tasted dusty and sweet. He tasted like regret in the shadows of trees and in the glow of the anarchist's suit collection. She kissed him long and soft, and when she pulled herself away, she touched his mouth with her fingers...She did not say goodbye. She was incapable, and after a few more minutes at his side, she was able to tear herself from the ground. It amazes me what humans can do, even when streams are flowing down their faces and they stagger on...
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
item.author: Thomas Merton

item.quote: Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle.
item.author: Lewis Carroll

item.quote: There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one.
item.author: Kazuo Ishiguro

item.quote: Trust is like a mirror, you can fix it if it's broken, but you can still see the crack in that mother fucker's reflection.
item.author: Lady Gaga

item.quote: For what its worth: its never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. Theres no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life youre proud of. If you find that youre not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again.
item.author: Eric Roth

item.quote: Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: I want to grow old without facelifts. I want to have the courage to be loyal to the face I have made.
item.author: Marilyn Monroe

item.quote: A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes.
item.author: Walt Whitman

item.quote: There is more to sex appeal than just measurements. I don't need a bedroom to prove my womanliness. I can convey just as much sex appeal, picking apples off a tree or standing in the rain.
item.author: Audrey Hepburn

item.quote: Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ourselves.
item.author: Milan Kundera

item.quote: But it is the nature of stars to cross, and never was Shakespeare more wrong than when he has Cassius note, The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars / But in ourselves.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Honestly, if you were any slower, youd be going backward.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: Must you go? I was rather hoping you'd stay and be a ministering angel, but if you must go, you must.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Be with me always - take any form - drive me mad! only do not leave me in this abyss, where I cannot find you! Oh, God! it is unutterable! I can not live without my life! I can not live without my soul!
item.author: Emily Bront

item.quote: You endure what is unbearable, and you bear it. That is all.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
item.author: Confucious

item.quote: But he who dares not grasp the thorn
item.author: Anne Bronte

item.quote: I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead;
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: Beautiful face. Beautiful body. Horrible attitude. It was the holy trinity of hot boys.
item.author: Jennifer L. Armentrout

item.quote: What's the good of living if you don't try a few things?
item.author: Charles M. Schulz

item.quote: She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring.
item.author: Zelda Fitzgerald

item.quote: Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: In a time of destruction, create something.
item.author: Maxine Hong Kingston

item.quote: Many boys will bring you flowers. But someday you'll meet a boy who will learn your favorite flower, your favorite song, your favorite sweet. And even if he is too poor to give you any of them, it won't matter because he will have taken the time to know you as no one else does. Only that boy earns your heart.
item.author: Leigh Bardugo

item.quote: He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking.
item.author: Leo Tolstoy

item.quote: A girl should be two things: who and what she wants.
item.author: Coco Chanel

item.quote: All alone! Whether you like it or not, alone is something you'll be quite a lot!
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: From there to here, from here to there, funny things are everywhere!
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Perhaps the greatest faculty our minds possess is the ability to cope with pain. Classic thinking teaches us of the four doors of the mind, which everyone moves through according to their need.
item.author: Patrick Rothfuss

item.quote: The saddest people I've ever met in life are the ones who don't care deeply about anything at all. Passion and satisfaction go hand in hand, and without them, any happiness is only temporary, because there's nothing to make it last.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met.
item.author: Marguerite Duras

item.quote: Dont try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When youre good, bad things can still happen. And if youre bad, you can still be lucky.
item.author: Barbara Kingsolver

item.quote: Did you ever think that in a past life Alec was an old woman with ninety cats who was always yelling at the neighborhood kids to get off her lawn? Because I do,
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Open your heart. Someone will come. Someone will come for you. But first you must open your heart.
item.author: Kate DiCamillo

item.quote: Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.
item.author: Ayn Rand

item.quote: Because you can't argue with all the fools in the world. It's easier to let them have their way, then trick them when they're not paying attention.
item.author: Christopher Paolini

item.quote: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
item.author: Benjamin Franklin

item.quote: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: A half-read book is a half-finished love affair.
item.author: David Mitchell

item.quote: If conversation was the lyrics, laughter was the music, making time spent together a melody that could be replayed over and over without getting stale.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Dreams do come true, if only we wish hard enough. You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.
item.author: J.M. Barrie

item.quote: God can't give us peace and happiness apart from Himself because there is no such thing.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Ah, my daughter, he said. Eighteen, and already youve been accused of murder, aided felons, and acquired a death count higher than most guardians will ever see. He paused. I couldnt be prouder.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong.
item.author: Franois de La Rochefoucauld

item.quote: If there's a single lesson that life teaches us, it's that wishing doesn't make it so.
item.author: Lev Grossman

item.quote: I meant, said Ipslore bitterly, what is there in this world that truly makes living worthwhile?
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: When you find your path, you must not be afraid. You need to have sufficient courage to make mistakes. Disappointment, defeat, and despair are the tools God uses to show us the way.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: It's not gray, Clary felt compelled to point out. It's green.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: I thought I'd lie on the floor and writhe in pain for a while, he grunted, It relaxes me.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.
item.author: Benjamin Franklin

item.quote: People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people.
item.author: Alan Moore

item.quote: Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: If people refuse to look at you in a new light and they can only see you for what you were, only see you for the mistakes you've made, if they don't realize that you are not your mistakes, then they have to go.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning...
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.
item.author: Robert Orben

item.quote: What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do.
item.author: Alan Bennett

item.quote: You can have it all. Just not all at once.
item.author: Oprah Winfrey

item.quote: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.
item.author: Zig Ziglar

item.quote: I fell in love with him. But I don't just stay with him by default as if there's no one else available to me. I stay with him because I choose to, every day that I wake up, every day that we fight or lie to each other or disappoint each other. I choose him over and over again, and he chooses me.
item.author: Veronica Roth

item.quote: Dreams like a podcast,
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Give her hell from us, Peeves.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object.
item.author: Milan Kundera

item.quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.
item.author: Viktor E. Frankl

item.quote: And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: You're just worried they'll hire a male instructor and he'll be hotter than you.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.
item.author: Jim Morrison

item.quote: If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads.
item.author: Francois Mauriac

item.quote: When I get lonely these days, I think: So BE lonely, Liz. Learn your way around loneliness. Make a map of it. Sit with it, for once in your life. Welcome to the human experience. But never again use another person's body or emotions as a scratching post for your own unfulfilled yearnings.
item.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

item.quote: Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.
item.author: William Wordsworth

item.quote: Are you implying that shreds of my reputation remain intact? Will demanded with mock horror. Clearly I have been doing something wrong. Or not something wrong, as the case may be.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Compassion is the basis of morality.
item.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

item.quote: When did we see each other face-to-face? Not until you saw into my cracks and I saw into yours. Before that, we were just looking at ideas of each other, like looking at your window shade but never seeing inside. But once the vessel cracks, the light can get in. The light can get out.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship.
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: Try a little harder to be a little better.
item.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

item.quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
item.author: Abraham Lincoln

item.quote: Don't compromise yourself - you're all you have.
item.author: John Grisham

item.quote: Let our scars fall in love.
item.author: Galway Kinnell

item.quote: You'd think people had better things to gossip about, said Ginny as she sat on the common room floor, leaning against Harrys legs and reading the Daily Prophet. Three Dementor attacks in a week, and all Romilda Vane does is ask me if its true youve got a Hippogriff tattooed across your chest.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: You could have fooled me. Everytime I called you, Luke said you were sick. I figured you were avoiding me. Again.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.
item.author: Orhan Pamuk

item.quote: If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it.
item.author: Frank Zappa

item.quote: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.
item.author: Charles Dickens

item.quote: Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means...
item.author: Umberto Eco

item.quote: Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself.
item.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

item.quote: Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: I don't want tea, said Clary, with muffled force. I want to find my mother. And then I want to find out who took her in the first place, and I want to kill them.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.
item.author: Desmond Tutu

item.quote: Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know.
item.author: Eoin Colfer

item.quote: Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: It was a mistake, you said. But the cruel thing was, it felt like the mistake was mine, for trusting you.
item.author: David Levithan

item.quote: If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.
item.author: The Dalai Lama

item.quote: I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.
item.author: C. S. Lewis

item.quote: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
item.author: A.A. Milne

item.quote: The important thing to you is not how many years in your life, but how much life in your years!
item.author: Edward J. Stieglitz

item.quote: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
item.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

item.quote: Scared is what you're feeling. Brave is what you're doing.
item.author: Emma Donoghue

item.quote: A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition.
item.author: Henry Miller

item.quote: A lot of you cared, just not enough.
item.author: Jay Asher

item.quote: Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they aren't after you.
item.author: Joseph Heller

item.quote: The more you know who you are, and what you want, the less you let things upset you.
item.author: Stephanie Perkins

item.quote: I know I am but summer to your heart, and not the full four seasons of the year.
item.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.quote: I drink to make other people more interesting.
item.author: Hemingway, Ernest

item.quote: There is something delicious about writing the first words of a story. You never quite know where they'll take you.
item.author: Beatrix Potter

item.quote: If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.
item.author: Dorothy Parker

item.quote: She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape.
item.author: Michael Ondaatje

item.quote: I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it.
item.author: Mae West

item.quote: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
item.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

item.quote: The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, not the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: You're an idiot.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: A house without books is like a room without windows.
item.author: Horace Mann

item.quote: Reading brings us unknown friends
item.author: Honore de Balzac

item.quote: There is only one page left to write on. I will fill it with words of only one syllable. I love. I have loved. I will love.
item.author: Dodie Smith

item.quote: Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
item.author: Barack Obama

item.quote: Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.
item.author: Leo Tolstoy

item.quote: The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: I wonder if the snow
item.author: Lewis Carroll

item.quote: May the odds be ever in your favor!
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
item.author: Confucius

item.quote: I am looking for friends. What does that mean -- tame?
item.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupry

item.quote: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.
item.author: Herbert Hoover

item.quote: Really, the combination of the scabs and the ointment looks hideous. I can't help enjoying his distress.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: Sonnet XVII
item.author: Pablo Neruda

item.quote: Only the dead have seen the end of war.
item.author: Plato

item.quote: A diary with no drawings of me in it? Where are the torrid fantasies? The romance covers?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think
item.author: Socrates

item.quote: Let me give you a piece of advice. The handsome young fellow who's trying to rescue you from a hideous fate is never wrong. Not even if he says the sky is purple and made of hedgehogs.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: I'm oxygen and he's dying to breathe.
item.author: Tahereh Mafi

item.quote: Did you know that 'I told you so' has a brother,Jacob? she asked cutting me off. His name is 'Shut the hell up'.
item.author: Stephenie Meyer

item.quote: Yes, I was infatuated with you: I am still. No one has ever heightened such a keen capacity of physical sensation in me. I cut you out because I couldn't stand being a passing fancy. Before I give my body, I must give my thoughts, my mind, my dreams. And you weren't having any of those.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
item.author: Euripides

item.quote: Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedomsto choose ones attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose ones own way.
item.author: Viktor E. Frankl

item.quote: Remember, darkness does not always equate to evil, just as light does not always bring good.
item.author: P.C. Cast

item.quote: Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask whats for lunch.
item.author: Orson Welles

item.quote: I always channel my emotions into my work. That way, I don't hurt anyone but myself.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: My soul will find yours.
item.author: Jude Deveraux

item.quote: I'm so glad I live in a world where there are Octobers.
item.author: L. M. Montgomery

item.quote: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: Whenever you read a cancer booklet or website or whatever, they always list depression among the side effects of cancer. But, in fact, depression is not a side effect of cancer. Depression is a side effect of dying.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: A childhood without books that would be no childhood. That would be like being shut out from the enchanted place where you can go and find the rarest kind of joy.
item.author: Astrid Lindgren

item.quote: Believe nothing you hear, and only one half that you see.
item.author: Edgar Allan Poe

item.quote: I meant what I said and I said what I meant. An elephant's faithful one-hundred percent!
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: In time, the hurt began to fade and it was easier to just let it go. At least I thought it was. But in every boy I met in the next few years, I found myself looking for you, and when the feelings got too strong, I'd write you another letter. But I never sent them for fear of what I might find. By then, you'd gone on with your life and I didn't want to think about you loving someone else. I wanted to remember us like we were that summer. I didn't ever want to lose that.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.
item.author: Sun Tzu

item.quote: Who, being loved, is poor?
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Lolita, light of my life, fire of my loins. My sin, my soul. Lo-lee-ta: the tip of the tongue taking a trip of three steps down the palate to tap, at three, on the teeth. Lo. Lee. Ta. She was Lo, plain Lo, in the morning, standing four feet ten in one sock. She was Lola in slacks. She was Dolly at school. She was Dolores on the dotted line. But in my arms she was always Lolita. Did she have a precursor? She did, indeed she did. In point of fact, there might have been no Lolita at all had I not loved, one summer, an initial girl-child. In a princedom by the sea. Oh when? About as many years before Lolita was born as my age was that summer. You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style. Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, exhibit number one is what the seraphs, the misinformed, simple, noble-winged seraphs, envied. Look at this tangle of thorns.
item.author: Vladimir Nabokov

item.quote: If A is a success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: When we least expect it, life sets us a challenge to test our courage and willingness to change; at such a moment, there is no point in pretending that nothing has happened or in saying that we are not yet ready. The challenge will not wait. Life does not look back. A week is more than enough time for us to decide whether or not to accept our destiny.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book.
item.author: Margaret Walker

item.quote: Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it.
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.
item.author: Coco Chanel

item.quote: Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse...and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: Treat everyone with politeness and kindness, not because they are nice, but because you are.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: If neurotic is wanting two mutually exclusive things at one and the same time, then I'm neurotic as hell. I'll be flying back and forth between one mutually exclusive thing and another for the rest of my days.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I love books, by the way, way more than movies. Movies tell you what to think. A good book lets you choose a few thoughts for yourself. Movies show you the pink house. A good book tells you there's a pink house and lets you paint some of the finishing touches, maybe choose the roof style,park your own car out front. My imagination has always topped anything a movie could come up with. Case in point, those darned Harry Potter movies. That was so not what that part-Veela-chick, Fleur Delacour, looked like.
item.author: Karen Marie Moning

item.quote: The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: Go on with what your heart tells you, or you will lose all.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Be brave to stand for what you believe in even if you stand alone.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Remember, remember, this is now, and now, and now. Live it, feel it, cling to it. I want to become acutely aware of all Ive taken for granted.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: He accused me of being Dumbledore's man through and through.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: The scar had not pained Harry for nineteen years. All was well.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: The spell. Victor said you had to want me... to care about me... for it to work. When he didn't say anything, I tried to grip his shirt, but my fingers were too weak. Did you? Did you want me?
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: You are not your job, you're not how much money you have in the bank. You are not the car you drive. You're not the contents of your wallet. You are not your fucking khakis. You are all singing, all dancing crap of the world.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: Sometimes beautiful things come into our lives out of nowhere. We can't always understand them, but we have to trust in them. I know you want to question everything, but sometimes it pays to just have a little faith.
item.author: Lauren Kate

item.quote: I'm going to wake Peeta, I say.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.
item.author: Max Lucado

item.quote: The pleasure of remembering had been taken from me, because there was no longer anyone to remember with. It felt like losing your co-rememberer meant losing the memory itself, as if the things we'd done were less real and important than they had been hours before.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: My library is an archive of longings.
item.author: Susan Sontag

item.quote: Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends.
item.author: George Bernard Shaw

item.quote: People have forgotten this truth, the fox said. But you mustnt forget it. You become responsible forever for what youve tamed. Youre responsible for your rose.
item.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupry

item.quote: A word after a word after a word is power.
item.author: Margaret Atwood

item.quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
item.author: T.S. Eliot

item.quote: Everyone must leave something behind when he dies, my grandfather said. A child or a book or a painting or a house or a wall built or a pair of shoes made. Or a garden planted. Something your hand touched some way so your soul has somewhere to go when you die, and when people look at that tree or that flower you planted, you're there.
item.author: Ray Bradbury

item.quote: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.
item.author: Thomas Paine

item.quote: Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.
item.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

item.quote: A word to the wise ain't necessary, it's the stupid ones who need advice.
item.author: Bill Cosby

item.quote: What day is it? asked Pooh.
item.author: A.A. Milne

item.quote: Do not fall in love with people like me.
item.author: Caitlyn Siehl

item.quote: He was gone, and I did not have time to tell him what I had just now realized: that I forgave him, and that she forgave us, and that we had to forgive to survive in the labyrinth. There were so many of us who would have to live with things done and things left undone that day. Things that did not go right, things that seemed okay at the time because we could not see the future. If only we could see the endless string of consequences that result from our smallest actions. But we cant know better until knowing better is useless. And as I walked back to give Takumis note to the Colonel, I saw that I would never know. I would never know her well enough to know her thoughts in those last minutes, would never know if she left us on purpose. But the not-knowing would not keep me from caring, and I would always love Alaska Young, my crooked neighbor, with all my crooked heart.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are god. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they draw the conclusion that
item.author: Christopher Hitchens

item.quote: Do not fear failure but rather fear not trying.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Even in half demon hunter clothes, Clary thought, he looked like the kind of boy who'd come over your house to pick you up for a date and be polite to your parents and nice to your pets.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: Even if you cannot change all the people around you, you can change the people you choose to be around. Life is too short to waste your time on people who dont respect, appreciate, and value you. Spend your life with people who make you smile, laugh, and feel loved.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Is it possible for home to be a person and not a place?
item.author: Stephanie Perkins

item.quote: Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.
item.author: Yogi Berra

item.quote: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Ah, music, he said, wiping his eyes. A magic beyond all we do here!
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party.
item.author: Nick Hornby

item.quote: silence is the language of god,
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: It's not always necessary to be strong, but to feel strong.
item.author: Jon Krakauer

item.quote: People come, people go theyll drift in and out of your life, almost like characters in a favorite book. When you finally close the cover, the characters have told their story and you start up again with another book, complete with new characters and adventures. Then you find yourself focusing on the new ones, not the ones from the past.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
item.author: Mahatma Gandhi

item.quote: I read once that the ancient Egyptians had fifty words for sand & the Eskimos had a hundred words for snow. I wish I had a thousand words for love, but all that comes to mind is the way you move against me while you sleep & there are no words for that.
item.author: Brian Andreas

item.quote: All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Time is the longest distance between two places.
item.author: Tennessee Williams

item.quote: There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth.
item.author: Khaled Hosseini

item.quote: There are so many ways to be brave in this world. Sometimes bravery involves laying down your life for something bigger than yourself, or for someone else. Sometimes it involves giving up everything you have ever known, or everyone you have ever loved, for the sake of something greater.
item.author: Veronica Roth

item.quote: Never underestimate the power of stupid people in large groups.
item.author: George Carlin

item.quote: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.
item.author: Charles Lamb

item.quote: We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams.
item.author: Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy

item.quote: I cannot go to school today
item.author: Shel Silverstein

item.quote: Have you really read all those books in your room?
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Crying is for plain women. Pretty women go shopping.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: I like flaws. I think they make things interesting.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected. Maybe they always have been and will be. Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other. And maybe each time, we've been forced apart for the same reasons. That means that this goodbye is both a goodbye for the past ten thousand years and a prelude to what will come.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: By the pricking of my thumbs,
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: As it has been said:
item.author: Anne Sexton

item.quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
item.author: Pablo Picasso

item.quote: It is easy to love people in memory; the hard thing is to love them when they are there in front of you.
item.author: John Updike

item.quote: DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death. JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: What do you want?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.
item.author: Nikolai V. Gogol

item.quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
item.author: Elie Wiesel

item.quote: The trouble is if you dont spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you.
item.author: Peter Shaffer

item.quote: Lost love is still love. It takes a different form, that's all. You can't see their smile or bring them food or tousle their hair or move them around a dance floor. But when those senses weaken another heightens. Memory. Memory becomes your partner. You nurture it. You hold it. You dance with it.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.
item.author: Laini Taylor

item.quote: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
item.author: George Eliot

item.quote: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: Pretty women wonder where my secret lies.
item.author: Maya Angelou

item.quote: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: I am too fond of reading books to care to write them.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane.
item.author: Robert Frost

item.quote: You know, Hobbes, some days even my lucky rocket ship underpants don't help.
item.author: Bill Watterson

item.quote: I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion.
item.author: Jack Kerouac

item.quote: Peeta, how come I never know when you're having a nightmare? I say.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, It might have been.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: No one has ever become poor by giving.
item.author: Anne Frank

item.quote: Top 15 Things Money Cant Buy
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Don't Just
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee
item.author: Robert Frost

item.quote: Thinking something does not make it true. Wanting something does not make it real.
item.author: Michelle Hodkin

item.quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
item.author: Carl Gustav Jung

item.quote: There must be those among whom we can sit down and weep and still be counted as warriors.
item.author: Adrienne Rich

item.quote: You know how they say you only hurt the ones you love? Well, it works both ways.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.
item.author: Christopher Hitchens

item.quote: I must have loved you a lot.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: Ginny! said Mr. Weasley, flabbergasted. Haven't I taught you anything? What have I always told you? Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain?
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: I would have come for you. And if I couldn't walk, I'd crawl to you, and no matter how broken we were, we'd fight our way out together-knives drawn, pistols blazing. Because that's what we do. We never stop fighting.
item.author: Leigh Bardugo

item.quote: This is the way the world ends
item.author: T.S. Eliot

item.quote: Jace shook his blond head in exasperation.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.
item.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

item.quote: I like good strong words that mean something
item.author: Louisa May Alcott

item.quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
item.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

item.quote: The only thing better than imagining Dimitri carrying me in his arms was imagining him shirtless while carrying me in his arms.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.
item.author: W.B. Yeats

item.quote: The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively
item.author: Bob Marley

item.quote: Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.
item.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafn

item.quote: How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: Do not be afraid; our fate
item.author: Dante Alighieri

item.quote: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
item.author: Abraham Lincoln

item.quote: I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.
item.author: Abraham Lincoln

item.quote: Tears are words that need to be written.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.
item.author: Arundhati Roy

item.quote: Anyone can hide. Facing up to things, working through them, that's what makes you strong.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: It ain't what they call you, it's what you answer to.
item.author: W.C. Fields

item.quote: It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.
item.author: Patrick Rothfuss

item.quote: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.
item.author: John Muir

item.quote: Stories can conquer fear, you know. They can make the heart bigger.
item.author: Ben Okri

item.quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.
item.author: Blaise Pascal

item.quote: One word
item.author: Sophocles

item.quote: When I saw you I fell in love, and you smiled because you knew.
item.author: Arrigo Boito

item.quote: If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.
item.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.quote: Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on.
item.author: jonathan safran foer

item.quote: Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.
item.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

item.quote: You can make anything by writing.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: When I was your age, television was called books.
item.author: William Goldman

item.quote: What happened down in the dungeons between you and Professor Quirrell is a complete secret, so, naturally the whole school knows.
item.author: J. K. Rowling

item.quote: If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree.
item.author: Michael Crichton

item.quote: Black holes are where God divided by zero.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.
item.author: Maya Angelou

item.quote: Did you see that dress? I saw the dress. Did you like it? He didn't answer. I took that as a yes. Am I going to endanger my reputation if I wear it to the dance? When he spoke, I could barely hear him. You'll endanger the school. I smiled and fell asleep.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: If Im honest I have to tell you I still read fairy-tales and I like them best of all.
item.author: Audrey Hepburn

item.quote: Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary,
item.author: Edgar Allan Poe

item.quote: You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world.
item.author: Ray Bradbury

item.quote: Where you used to be, there is a hole in the world, which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime, and falling in at night. I miss you like hell.
item.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.quote: I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them.
item.author: Boris Pasternak

item.quote: I fell in love with her when we were together, then fell deeper in love with her in the years we were apart.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.
item.author: Lao Tsu

item.quote: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,
item.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.quote: It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.
item.author: Emilie Autumn

item.quote: And all the books you've read have been read by other people. And all the songs you've loved have been heard by other people. And that girl that's pretty to you is pretty to other people. and that if you looked at these facts when you were happy, you would feel great because you are describing 'unity.
item.author: Stephen Chbosky

item.quote: Come sleep with me: We won't make Love, Love will make us.
item.author: Julio Cortzar

item.quote: A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.
item.author: Phyllis Diller

item.quote: [D]on't ever apologise to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them.
item.author: Cornelia Funke

item.quote: There are two means of refuge from the misery of life music and cats.
item.author: Albert Schweitzer

item.quote: We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.
item.author: Santosh Kalwar

item.quote: The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.
item.author: Charlotte Bront

item.quote: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
item.author: Leo Tolstoy

item.quote: I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat.
item.author: Rebecca West

item.quote: What she had realized was that love was that moment when your heart was about to burst.
item.author: Stieg Larsson

item.quote: No matter how careful you are, there's going to be the sense you missed something, the collapsed feeling under your skin that you didn't experience it all. There's that fallen heart feeling that you rushed right through the moments where you should've been paying attention.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: I know we're fucked up, alright? I'm impulsive, and hot tempered, and you get under my skin like no one else. You act like you hate me one minute, and then need me the next. I never get anything right, and I don't deserve you...but I fucking love you, Abby. I love you more than I loved anyone or anything ever. When you're around, I don't need booze, or money, or the fighting, or the one-night stands...
item.author: Jamie McGuire

item.quote: Friendship- my definition- is built on two things. Respect and trust. Both elements have to be there. And it has to be mutual. You can have respect for someone, but if you don't have trust, the friendship will crumble.
item.author: Stieg Larsson

item.quote: Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back. That's part of what it means to be alive. But inside our heads - at least that's where I imagine it - there's a little room where we store those memories. A room like the stacks in this library. And to understand the workings of our own heart we have to keep on making new reference cards. We have to dust things off every once in awhile, let in fresh air, change the water in the flower vases. In other words, you'll live forever in your own private library.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.
item.author: George Orwell

item.quote: My rapier wit hides my inner pain.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching -- they are your family.
item.author: Jim Butcher

item.quote: Forbidden to remember, terrified to forget; it was a hard line to walk.
item.author: Stephenie Meyer

item.quote: If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: Always find opportunities to make someone smile, and to offer random acts of kindness in everyday life.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: If you have good friends, no matter how much life is sucking , they can make you laugh.
item.author: P.C. Cast Kristin Cast

item.quote: The only real prison is fear, and the only real freedom is freedom from fear
item.author: Aung San Suu Kyi

item.quote: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.
item.author: Kahlil Gibran

item.quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
item.author: Mahatma Gandhi

item.quote: Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.
item.author: E.E. Cummings

item.quote: Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.
item.author: Joyce Carol Oates

item.quote: Headline? he asked.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.
item.author: Charles Lamb

item.quote: The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who dont want it badly enough. Theyre there to stop the other people.
item.author: Randy Pausch

item.quote: Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day.
item.author: Glen Cook

item.quote: I'd rather die my way than live yours.
item.author: Lauren Oliver

item.quote: please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.
item.author: Stephen Chbosky

item.quote: In the end
item.author: Jack Kornfield
