item.quote: When we don't know who to hate, we hate ourselves.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff.
item.author: Carl Sagan

item.quote: A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her.
item.author: Maya Angelou

item.quote: I will love you always. When this red hair is white, I will still love you. When the smooth softness of youth is replaced by the delicate softness of age, I will still want to touch your skin. When your face is full of the lines of every smile you have ever smiled, of every surprise I have seen flash through your eyes, when every tear you have ever cried has left its mark upon your face,I will treasure you all the more, because I was there to see it all. I will share your life with you, Meredith, and I will love you until the last breath leaves your body or mine.
item.author: Laurell K. Hamilton

item.quote: It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books.
item.author: Jo Walton

item.quote: There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: Do not think that love in order to be genuine has to be extraordinary. What we need is to love without getting tired. Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
item.author: Mother Teresa

item.quote: I am always saying Glad to've met you to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.
item.author: J.D. Salinger

item.quote: Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Better a cruel truth than a comfortable delusion.
item.author: Edward Abbey

item.quote: Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way.
item.author: Steve Martin

item.quote: I kept always two books in my pocket, one to read, one to write in.
item.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

item.quote: From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone.
item.author: Edgar Allan Poe

item.quote: Remember me and smile, for it's better to forget than to remember me and cry.
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: When the first baby laughed for the first time, its laugh broke into a thousand pieces, and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies.
item.author: J.M. Barrie

item.quote: The emotion that can break your heart is sometimes the very one that heals it...
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Where words leave off, music begins.
item.author: Heinrich Heine

item.quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
item.author: Mother Teresa

item.quote: If you want to keep a secret, you must also hide it from yourself.
item.author: George Orwell

item.quote: Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.
item.author: Bob Dylan

item.quote: Sorrow is how we learn to love. Your heart isn't breaking. It hurts because it's getting larger. The larger it gets, the more love it holds.
item.author: Rita Mae Brown

item.quote: He thinks he'll be remembered as the villain in the story. But I forgot to tell him that the villain is usually the person who locks up the maiden and throws away the key. He was the one who let me out.
item.author: Sarah J. Maas

item.quote: The more one judges, the less one loves.
item.author: Honor de Balzac

item.quote: One person's craziness is another person's reality.
item.author: Tim Burton

item.quote: If you're too open-minded; your brains will fall out.
item.author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

item.quote: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life, but define yourself.
item.author: Harvey Fierstein

item.quote: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
item.author: James Baldwin

item.quote: You are not special. You're not a beautiful and unique snowflake. You're the same decaying organic matter as everything else. We're all part of the same compost heap. We're all singing, all dancing crap of the world.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation.
item.author: Yann Martel

item.quote: An Unbreakable Vow? said Ron, looking stunned. Nah, he cant have.... Are you sure?
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains.
item.author: Anne Frank

item.quote: I do not think, sir, you have any right to command me, merely because you are older than I, or because you have seen more of the world than I have; your claim to superiority depends on the use you have made of your time and experience.
item.author: Charlotte Bront

item.quote: Don't let the bastards grind you down.
item.author: Margaret Atwood

item.quote: You do have a story inside you; it lies articulate and waiting to be written behind your silence and your suffering.
item.author: Anne Rice

item.quote: Sometimes, when I have to do something I don't want to do, I pretend I'm a character from a book. It's easier to know what they would do.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.
item.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

item.quote: I hope you're pleased with yourselves. We could all have been killed - or worse, expelled. Now if you don't mind, I'm going to bed.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: Holding Eleanor's hand was like holding a butterfly. Or a heartbeat. Like holding something complete, and completely alive.
item.author: Rainbow Rowell

item.quote: I have faith that God will show you the answer. But you have to understand that sometimes it takes a while to be able to recognize what God wants you to do. That's how it often is. God's voice is usually nothing more than a whisper, and you have to listen very carefully to hear it. But other times, in those rarest of moments, the answer is obvious and rings as loud as a church bell.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can never live long enough to make them all yourself.
item.author: Groucho Marx

item.quote: It takes courage to love, but pain through love is the purifying fire which those who love generously know. We all know people who are so much afraid of pain that they shut themselves up like clams in a shell and, giving out nothing, receive nothing and therefore shrink until life is a mere living death.
item.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

item.quote: I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Great heroes need great sorrows and burdens, or half their greatness goes unnoticed. It is all part of the fairy tale.
item.author: Peter S. Beagle

item.quote: There's nowhere you can be that isn't where you're meant to be...
item.author: John Lennon

item.quote: Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money.
item.author: Virginia Woolf

item.quote: Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Patience, grasshopper, said Maia. Good things come to those who wait.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
item.author: Andy Warhol

item.quote: I guess thats just part of loving people: You have to give things up. Sometimes you even have to give them up.
item.author: Lauren Oliver

item.quote: I am lonely, yet not everybody will do. I don't know why, some people fill the gaps and others emphasize my loneliness. In reality those who satisfy me are those who simply allow me to live with my ''idea of them.
item.author: Anais Nin

item.quote: Let the first act of every morning be to make the following resolve for the day:
item.author: Mahatma Gandhi

item.quote: Better to die fighting for freedom then be a prisoner all the days of your life.
item.author: Bob Marley

item.quote: If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week.
item.author: Charles Darwin

item.quote: Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: The moon is a loyal companion.
item.author: Tahereh Mafi

item.quote: They say I'm old-fashioned, and live in the past, but sometimes I think progress progresses too fast!
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
item.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

item.quote: Why are you worrying about YOU-KNOW-WHO, when you should be worrying about YOU-NO-POO? The constipation sensation that's gripping the nation!
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Life is too short to waste any amount of time on wondering what other people think about you. In the first place, if they had better things going on in their lives, they wouldn't have the time to sit around and talk about you. What's important to me is not others' opinions of me, but what's important to me is my opinion of myself.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: When will you learn that there isn't a word for everything?
item.author: Nicole Krauss

item.quote: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
item.author: Maya Angelou

item.quote: Behind every exquisite thing that existed, there was something tragic.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Don't give in to your fears. If you do, you won't be able to talk to your heart.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: I hope you will have a wonderful year, that you'll dream dangerously and outrageously, that you'll make something that didn't exist before you made it, that you will be loved and that you will be liked, and that you will have people to love and to like in return. And, most importantly (because I think there should be more kindness and more wisdom in the world right now), that you will, when you need to be, be wise, and that you will always be kind.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.
item.author: Charles Dickens

item.quote: Men are afraid that women will laugh at them. Women are afraid that men will kill them.
item.author: Margaret Atwood

item.quote: What is family? They were the people who claimed you. In good, in bad, in parts or in whole, they were the ones who showed up, who stayed in there, regardless. It wasn't just about blood relations or shared chromosomes, but something wider, bigger. We had many families over time. Our family of origin, the family we created, and the groups you moved through while all of this was happening: friends, lovers, sometimes even strangers. None of them perfect, and we couldn't expect them to be. You can't make any one person your world. The trick was to take what each could give you and build your world from it.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.
item.author: Mae West

item.quote: I dont trust anybody. Not anybody. And the more that I care about someone, the more sure I am theyre going to get tired of me and take off.
item.author: Rainbow Rowell

item.quote: Memories, even your most precious ones, fade surprisingly quickly. But I dont go along with that. The memories I value most, I dont ever see them fading.
item.author: Kazuo Ishiguro

item.quote: You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your
item.author: Harlan Ellison

item.quote: Curiouser and curiouser!
item.author: Lewis Carroll

item.quote: When we're incomplete, we're always searching for somebody to complete us. When, after a few years or a few months of a relationship, we find that we're still unfulfilled, we blame our partners and take up with somebody more promising. This can go on and on--series polygamy--until we admit that while a partner can add sweet dimensions to our lives, we, each of us, are responsible for our own fulfillment. Nobody else can provide it for us, and to believe otherwise is to delude ourselves dangerously and to program for eventual failure every relationship we enter.
item.author: Tom Robbins

item.quote: If you know someone whos depressed, please resolve never to ask them why. Depression isnt a straightforward response to a bad situation; depression just is, like the weather.
item.author: Stephen Fry

item.quote: If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution.
item.author: Jasper Fforde

item.quote: I don't know who invented high heels, but all women owe him a lot!
item.author: Marilyn Monroe

item.quote: Words dazzle and deceive because they are mimed by the face. But black words on a white page are the soul laid bare.
item.author: Guy de Maupassant

item.quote: Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult.
item.author: Anne Rice

item.quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
item.author: Edmund Burke

item.quote: 1. Be Impeccable With Your Word
item.author: Don Miguel Ruiz

item.quote: Why do people say grow some balls? Balls are weak and sensitive. If you wanna be tough, grow a vagina. Those things can take a pounding.
item.author: Sheng Wang

item.quote: We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
item.author: Marcus Aurelius

item.quote: When you have lost hope, you have lost everything. And when you think all is lost, when all is dire and bleak, there is always hope.
item.author: Pittacus Lore

item.quote: I could die for you. But I couldn't, and wouldn't, live for you.
item.author: Ayn Rand

item.quote: I am not proud, but I am happy; and happiness blinds, I think, more than pride.
item.author: Alexandre Dumas

item.quote: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.
item.author: Lao Tzu

item.quote: He awoke each morning with the desire to do right, to be a good and meaningful person, to be, as simple as it sounded and as impossible as it actually was, happy. And during the course of each day his heart would descend from his chest into his stomach. By early afternoon he was overcome by the feeling that nothing was right, or nothing was right for him, and by the desire to be alone. By evening he was fulfilled: alone in the magnitude of his grief, alone in his aimless guilt, alone even in his loneliness.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: Sometimes I wonder if there's something wrong with me. Perhaps I've spent too long in the company of my literary romantic heroes, and consequently my ideals and expectations are far too high.
item.author: E.L. James

item.quote: I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: We sit silently and watch the world around us. This has taken a lifetime to learn. It seems only the old are able to sit next to one another and not say anything and still feel content. The young, brash and impatient, must always break the silence. It is a waste, for silence is pure. Silence is holy. It draws people together because only those who are comfortable with each other can sit without speaking. This is the great paradox.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world.
item.author: Virginia Woolf

item.quote: When God Created Mothers
item.author: Erma Bombeck

item.quote: Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not.
item.author: Kurt Cobain

item.quote: I was dead until you found me, though I breathed. I was sightless, though I could see. And then you came...and I was awakened.
item.author: J.R. Ward

item.quote: Education: the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: You're the first Shadowhunter I've ever met.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Magnus, standing by the door, snapped his fingers impatiently. Move it along, teenagers. The only person who gets to canoodle in my bedroom is my magnificent self.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: I don't go out with strangers, I said.
item.author: Becca Fitzpatrick

item.quote: You might want to lie down, Magnus advised. I find that it helps when the crushing sense of horrible realization sets in.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: It's going to be all right, sir, Harry said over and over again, more worried by Dumbledore's silence than he had been by his weakened voice. We're nearly there ... I can Apparate us both back ... don't worry ...
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Trains are great dirty smoky things, said Will. You won't like it.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: The earth has its music for those who will listen
item.author: Reginald Vincent Holmes

item.quote: When we are young, the words are scattered all around us. As they are assembled by experience, so also are we, sentence by sentence, until the story takes shape.
item.author: Louise Erdrich

item.quote: Youre dangerous, he says.
item.author: Simone Elkeles

item.quote: I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living.
item.author: Anais Nin

item.quote: The Very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: What a blessing it is to love books as I love them;- to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!
item.author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

item.quote: Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: Alec looked at her and shook his head. How do you manage never to get mud on your clothes?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of.
item.author: Joss Whedon

item.quote: They say time heals all wounds, but that presumes the source of the grief is finite
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: There is a crack in everything.
item.author: Leonard Cohen

item.quote: No sight so sad as that of a naughty child, he began, especially a naughty little girl. Do you know where the wicked go after death?
item.author: Charlotte Bront

item.quote: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.
item.author: Louisa May Alcott

item.quote: That's the thing about depression: A human being can survive almost anything, as long as she sees the end in sight. But depression is so insidious, and it compounds daily, that it's impossible to ever see the end.
item.author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

item.quote: To err is human, to forgive, divine.
item.author: Alexander Pope

item.quote: It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish.
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
item.author: Marcel Proust

item.quote: The past is always tense, the future perfect.
item.author: Zadie Smith

item.quote: And then something invisible snapped insider her, and that which had come together commenced to fall apart.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Second star to the right and straight on 'til morning.
item.author: J.M. Barrie

item.quote: Loneliness is the human condition. Cultivate it. The way it tunnels into you allows your soul room to grow. Never expect to outgrow loneliness. Never hope to find people who will understand you, someone to fill that space. An intelligent, sensitive person is the exception, the very great exception. If you expect to find people who will understand you, you will grow murderous with disappointment. The best you'll ever do is to understand yourself, know what it is that you want, and not let the cattle stand in your way.
item.author: Janet Fitch

item.quote: May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound or stab us. If the book we're reading doesn't wake us up with a blow to the head, what are we reading for? So that it will make us happy, as you write? Good Lord, we would be happy precisely if we had no books, and the kind of books that make us happy are the kind we could write ourselves if we had to. But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief.
item.author: Franz Kafka

item.quote: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
item.author: Nelson Mandela

item.quote: I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness.
item.author: Bill Watterson

item.quote: Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living.
item.author: Sean O'Casey

item.quote: I know it's wrong - God, it's all kinds of wrong - but I just want to lie down with you and wake up with you, just once, just once ever in my life.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: You should write because you love the shape of stories and sentences and the creation of different words on a page. Writing comes from reading, and reading is the finest teacher of how to write.
item.author: Annie Proulx

item.quote: If someone were to harm my family or a friend or somebody I love, I would eat them. I might end up in jail for 500 years, but I would eat them.
item.author: Johnny Depp

item.quote: I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: Only a generation of readers will spawn a generation of writers.
item.author: Steven Spielberg

item.quote: To shine your brightest light is to be who you truly are.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had.
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good.
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword. If you would take a man's life, you owe it to him to look into his eyes and hear his final words. And if you cannot bear to do that, then perhaps the man does not deserve to die.
item.author: George R.R. Martin

item.quote: This is how you do it: you sit down at the keyboard and you put one word after another until its done. It's that easy, and that hard.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: Maybe our girlfriends are our soulmates and guys are just people to have fun with.
item.author: Candace Bushnell

item.quote: So many people walk around with a meaningless life. They seem half-asleep, even when they're busy doing things they think are important. This is because they're chasing the wrong things. The way you get meaning into your life is to devote yourself to loving others, devote yourself to your community around you, and devote yourself to creating something that gives you purpose and meaning.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.
item.author: Pat Monahan

item.quote: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
item.author: Sren Kierkegaard

item.quote: To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow - this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.
item.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

item.quote: Once you have read a book you care about, some part of it is always with you.
item.author: Louis L'Amour

item.quote: Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.
item.author: Moliere

item.quote: The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.
item.author: David Foster Wallace

item.quote: Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death.
item.author: Rumi Jalalud-Din

item.quote: I have nothing to declare except my genius.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: I wonder how many people don't get the one they want, but end up with the one they're supposed to be with.
item.author: Fannie Flagg

item.quote: When someone is in your heart, they're never truly gone. They can come back to you, even at unlikely times.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.
item.author: Honor de Balzac

item.quote: Sometimes the Bible in the hand of one man is worse than a whisky bottle in the hand of (another)... There are just some kind of men who - who're so busy worrying about the next world they've never learned to live in this one, and you can look down the street and see the results.
item.author: Harper Lee

item.quote: Holding anger is a poison...It eats you from inside...We think that by hating someone we hurt them...But hatred is a curved blade...and the harm we do to others...we also do to ourselves.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: They're certainly entitled to think that, and they're entitled to full respect for their opinions... but before I can live with other folks I've got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.
item.author: Harper Lee

item.quote: You could say sorry, suggested Harry bluntly.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: If you're texting Magnus to say 'I think u r kewl,' I'm going to kill you.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: I know how devastated you must be to miss me, but leave a message, and I'll try to ease your agony
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: Sometimes love means letting go when you want to hold on tighter.
item.author: Melissa Marr

item.quote: Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; its all an experience.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.
item.author: David Henry Hwang

item.quote: In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no-one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art.
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: Do not let the memories of your past limit the potential of your future. There are no limits to what you can achieve on your journey through life, except in your mind.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.
item.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

item.quote: Atticus, he was real nice.
item.author: Harper Lee

item.quote: There is more than one way to burn a book. And the world is full of people running about with lit matches.
item.author: Ray Bradbury

item.quote: Gus: It tastes like...
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Wanting to be someone else is a waste of the person you are.
item.author: Marilyn Monroe

item.quote: Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.
item.author: Jane Yolen

item.quote: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough
item.author: Oprah Winfrey

item.quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer someone else up.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that cant be in books.
item.author: Gary Paulsen

item.quote: Don't cry over someone who wouldn't cry over you.
item.author: Lauren Conrad

item.quote: I got schooled this year
item.author: Colleen Hoover

item.quote: If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character...Would you slow down? Or speed up?
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: Whatever you are physically...male or female, strong or weak, ill or healthy--all those things matter less than what your heart contains. If you have the soul of a warrior, you are a warrior. All those other things, they are the glass that contains the lamp, but
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: The major problem
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: The future depends on what you do today.
item.author: Mahatma Gandhi

item.quote: Heaven knows we need never be ashamed of our tears, for they are rain upon the blinding dust of earth, overlying our hard hearts. I was better after I had cried, than before--more sorry, more aware of my own ingratitude, more gentle.
item.author: Charles Dickens

item.quote: The only truth is music.
item.author: Jack Kerouac

item.quote: A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.
item.author: Caroline Gordon

item.quote: Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.
item.author: Abraham Lincoln

item.quote: Dreams are always crushing when they don't come true. But it's the simple dreams that are often the most painful because they seem so personal, so reasonable, so attainable. You're always close enough to touch, but never quite close enough to hold and it's enough to break your heart.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.
item.author: Marilyn Monroe

item.quote: Your silence will not protect you.
item.author: Audre Lorde

item.quote: When I say it's you I like, I'm talking about that part of you that knows that life is far more than anything you can ever see or hear or touch. That deep part of you that allows you to stand for those things without which humankind cannot survive. Love that conquers hate, peace that rises triumphant over war, and justice that proves more powerful than greed.
item.author: Fred Rogers

item.quote: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.
item.author: Anne Frank

item.quote: The past is never where you think you left it.
item.author: Katherine Anne Porter

item.quote: make a radical change in your lifestyle and begin to boldly do things which you may previously never have thought of doing, or been too hesitant to attempt. So many people live within unhappy circumstances and yet will not take the initiative to change their situation because they are conditioned to a life of security, conformity, and conservation, all of which may appear to give one peace of mind, but in reality nothing is more damaging to the adventurous spirit within a man than a secure future. The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure. The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences, and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun. If you want to get more out of life, you must lose your inclination for monotonous security and adopt a helter-skelter style of life that will at first appear to you to be crazy. But once you become accustomed to such a life you will see its full meaning and its incredible beauty.
item.author: Jon Krakauer

item.quote: When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.
item.author: George R.R. Martin

item.quote: If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.
item.author: Frank Zappa

item.quote: Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire.
item.author: Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld

item.quote: Time doesnt heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.
item.author: Anas Nin

item.quote: Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.
item.author: Toni Morrison

item.quote: In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.
item.author: Laurie Halse Anderson

item.quote: Have you tried talking to her?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts.
item.author: Washington Irving

item.quote: We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit.
item.author: E.E. Cummings

item.quote: True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.
item.author: Kiera Cass

item.quote: Um...is that thing
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I'd do it. I can lose you like that if I don't lose you today. I'll let you go. If you stay.
item.author: Gayle Forman

item.quote: Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education.
item.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

item.quote: Have you ever lost someone you love and wanted one more conversation, one more chance to make up for the time when you thought they would be here forever? If so, then you know you can go your whole life collecting days, and none will outweigh the one you wish you had back.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.
item.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafn

item.quote: But I didn't understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: We're staying together, he promised. You're not getting away from me. Never again.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators.
item.author: Stephen Fry

item.quote: Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: The earth laughs in flowers.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: ...you know that a good, long session of weeping can often make you feel better, even if your circumstances have not changed one bit.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.
item.author: Charles M. Schulz

item.quote: We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, thats like saying you can never change your fate.
item.author: Amy Tan

item.quote: I guess that's what saying good-bye is always like--like jumping off an edge. The worst part is making the choice to do it. Once you're in the air, there's nothing you can do but let go.
item.author: Lauren Oliver

item.quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
item.author: Marcus Aurelius

item.quote: A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Ive been fighting to be who I am all my life. Whats the point of being who I am, if I cant have the person who was worth all the fighting for?
item.author: Stephanie Lennox

item.quote: The things you used to own, now they own you.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: Can you surf really well, then?
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: You only live twice:
item.author: Ian Fleming

item.quote: If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.
item.author: Leo Tolstoy

item.quote: I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself
item.author: Simone de Beauvoir

item.quote: there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone.
item.author: Nicole Krauss

item.quote: With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.
item.author: Margaret Mitchell

item.quote: We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: to love life, to love it even
item.author: Ellen Bass

item.quote: Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got.
item.author: Philip Jos Farmer

item.quote: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way.
item.author: Seamus Heaney

item.quote: There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: What's up? I asked.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: Stop comparing yourself to other people, just choose to be happy and live your own life.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Even
item.author: Hafiz

item.quote: So light a fire! Harry choked. Yes...of course...but there's no wood! ...
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: He died not for men, but for each man. If each man had been the only man made, He would have done no less.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.
item.author: Becca Fitzpatrick

item.quote: Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Well, she's not responding to my advances, he observed more brightly than he felt, so she must be dead.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.
item.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.quote: We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: You are okay? he asked. Not eaten by monsters?
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: To-morrow, and to-morrow, and to-morrow,
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: You are not rich until you have a rich heart.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Will rolled up his sleeves. We'll probably have to knock down the door--
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.
item.author: Nadezhda Mandelstam

item.quote: When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart
item.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

item.quote: Hope is a waking dream.
item.author: Aristotle

item.quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
item.author: Walt Disney

item.quote: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
item.author: Aristotle

item.quote: The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history.
item.author: George Orwell

item.quote: Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light;
item.author: Sarah Williams

item.quote: Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.
item.author: Zig Ziglar

item.quote: I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.
item.author: Taylor Swift

item.quote: The power of a glance has been so much abused in love stories, that it has come to be disbelieved in. Few people dare now to say that two beings have fallen in love because they have looked at each other. Yet it is in this way that love begins, and in this way only.
item.author: Victor Hugo

item.quote: How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.
item.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.quote: Freedom lies in being bold.
item.author: Robert Frost

item.quote: You care so much you feel as though you will bleed to death with the pain of it.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them.
item.author: Leo Tolstoy

item.quote: It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known.
item.author: Charles Dickens

item.quote: Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.
item.author: George R.R. Martin

item.quote: The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.
item.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
item.author: Charles Darwin

item.quote: I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past.
item.author: Virginia Woolf

item.quote: The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.
item.author: Plato

item.quote: Demon pox, oh demon pox
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: The question is not what you look at, but what you see.
item.author: Henry David Thoreau

item.quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
item.author: Helen Keller

item.quote: Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.
item.author: Dan Brown

item.quote: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.
item.author: Henry Thomas Buckle

item.quote: Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.
item.author: Daphne du Maurier

item.quote: The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.
item.author: Agatha Christie

item.quote: I believe in God, but not as one thing, not as an old man in the sky. I believe that what people call God is something in all of us. I believe that what Jesus and Mohammed and Buddha and all the rest said was right. It's just that the translations have gone wrong.
item.author: John Lennon

item.quote: Seventeen, eh! said Hagrid as he accepted a bucket-sized glass of wine from Fred.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.
item.author: Mae West

item.quote: Words, I think, are such unpredictable creatures.
item.author: Tahereh Mafi

item.quote: Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
item.author: George Bernard Shaw

item.quote: What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.
item.author: Doris Lessing

item.quote: My name is Celaena Sardothien. But it makes no difference if my name's Celaena or Lillian or Bitch, because I'd still beat you, no matter what you call me.
item.author: Sarah J. Maas

item.quote: Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?
item.author: Julie Kagawa

item.quote: The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.
item.author: Rachel Carson

item.quote: Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Stop fighting me! he said, trying to pull on the arm he held.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.
item.author: Taylor Swift

item.quote: Always be a poet, even in prose.
item.author: Charles Baudelaire

item.quote: Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter
item.author: John Keats

item.quote: Nothing travels faster than the speed of light, with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand.
item.author: Benjamin Alire Senz

item.quote: I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.
item.author: Alyson Noel

item.quote: The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one.
item.author: J.D. Salinger

item.quote: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
item.author: Jack London

item.quote: You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.
item.author: Veronica Roth

item.quote: This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.
item.author: David Nicholls

item.quote: Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. I'm okay we say. I'm alright. But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: There will be a few times in your life when all your instincts will tell you to do something, something that defies logic, upsets your plans, and may seem crazy to others. When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the complications, and just go for it.
item.author: Judith McNaught

item.quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.
item.author: Ellen DeGeneres

item.quote: Never miss a good chance to shut up.
item.author: Will Rogers

item.quote: Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane
item.author: Rachel Caine

item.quote: Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war
item.author: John Green

item.quote: District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.
item.author: Albert Dietrich

item.quote: You're something between a dream and a miracle.
item.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.quote: I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.
item.author: Stephen Chbosky

item.quote: Youll get over it Its the clichs that cause the trouble. To lose someone you love is to alter your life for ever. You dont get over it because it is the person you loved. The pain stops, there are new people, but the gap never closes. How could it? The particularness of someone who mattered enough to grieve over is not made anodyne by death. This hole in my heart is in the shape of you and no-one else can fit it. Why would I want them to?
item.author: Jeanette Winterson

item.quote: A small but noteworthy note. I've seen so many young men over the years who think they're running at other young men. They are not. They are running at me.
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on.
item.author: William S. Burroughs

item.quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.
item.author: Norman Vincent Peale

item.quote: We dont need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and donts: we need books, time, and silence.
item.author: Philip Pullman

item.quote: What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.
item.author: C. S. Lewis

item.quote: He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: Watch out for intellect,
item.author: Anne Sexton

item.quote: Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.
item.author: Anais Nin

item.quote: Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.
item.author: Groucho Marx

item.quote: Atticus said to Jem one day, Id rather you shot at tin cans in the backyard, but I know youll go after birds. Shoot all the blue jays you want, if you can hit em, but remember its a sin to kill a mockingbird. That was the only time I ever heard Atticus say it was a sin to do something, and I asked Miss Maudie about it. Your fathers right, she said. Mockingbirds dont do one thing except make music for us to enjoy. They dont eat up peoples gardens, dont nest in corn cribs, they dont do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. Thats why its a sin to kill a mockingbird.
item.author: Harper Lee

item.quote: I'm going to keep going until I succeed or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: I decided as long as I'm going to hell, I might as well do it thoroughly.
item.author: Stephenie Meyer

item.quote: I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.
item.author: H.L. Mencken

item.quote: Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.
item.author: Margaret Atwood

item.quote: To survive, you must tell stories.
item.author: Umberto Eco

item.quote: Alone. Yes, that's the key word, the most awful word in the English tongue. Murder doesn't hold a candle to it and hell is only a poor synonym.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: Don't let the muggles get you down.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
item.author: Mahatma Gandhi

item.quote: Well-read people are less likely to be evil.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.
item.author: Judy Garland

item.quote: I can't eat and I can't sleep. I'm not doing well in terms of being a functional human, you know?
item.author: Ned Vizzini

item.quote: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.
item.author: Mother Teresa

item.quote: You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. It's a bad word, 'belong.' Especially when you put it with somebody you love. Love shouldn't be like that. Did you ever see the way the clouds love a mountain? They circle all around it; sometimes you can't even see the mountain for the clouds. But you know what? You go up top and what do you see? His head. The clouds never cover the head. His head pokes through, beacuse the clouds let him; they don't wrap him up. They let him keep his head up high, free, with nothing to hide him or bind him. You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own. Suppose you did own him. Could you really love somebody who was absolutely nobody without you? You really want somebody like that? Somebody who falls apart when you walk out the door? You don't, do you? And neither does he. You're turning over your whole life to him. Your whole life, girl. And if it means so little to you that you can just give it away, hand it to him, then why should it mean any more to him? He can't value you more than you value yourself.
item.author: Toni Morrison

item.quote: When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.
item.author: George R.R. Martin

item.quote: The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.
item.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

item.quote: Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: There are much worse games to play.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: Im not in this world to live up to your expectations and youre not in this world to live up to mine.
item.author: Bruce Lee

item.quote: No good deed goes unpunished.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.
item.author: Betty Smith

item.quote: When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.
item.author: Roberto Bolao

item.quote: A girl calls and asks, Does it hurt very much to die?
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: We need not to be let alone. We need to be really bothered once in a while. How long is it since you were really bothered? About something important, about something real?
item.author: Ray Bradbury

item.quote: Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.
item.author: Abraham Lincoln

item.quote: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
item.author: J.K.Rowling

item.quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
item.author: Walt Whitman

item.quote: I hate men who are afraid of women's strength.
item.author: Anas Nin

item.quote: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?
item.author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.quote: A short story is a different thing altogether a short story is like a quick kiss in the dark from a stranger.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: And then I felt sad because I realized that once people are broken in certain ways, they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one. You wonder when your turn is going to be, or if it's already happened.
item.author: Douglas Coupland

item.quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.
item.author: Epicurus

item.quote: Did you really want to die?
item.author: Tiffanie DeBartolo

item.quote: If no one cares for you at all, do you even really exist?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.
item.author: Mae West

item.quote: We are always the same age inside.
item.author: Gertrude Stein

item.quote: God, but life is loneliness, despite all the opiates, despite the shrill tinsel gaiety of parties with no purpose, despite the false grinning faces we all wear. And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter - they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long. Yes, there is joy, fulfillment and companionship - but the loneliness of the soul in its appalling self-consciousness is horrible and overpowering.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: Behind this mask there is more than just flesh. Beneath this mask there is an idea... and ideas are bulletproof.
item.author: Alan Moore

item.quote: In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.
item.author: Marilyn Monroe

item.quote: The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?
item.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

item.quote: Humor is reason gone mad.
item.author: Groucho Marx

item.quote: The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.
item.author: Mother Teresa

item.quote: You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: Hang on, did you just call me Angel? I asked.
item.author: Becca Fitzpatrick

item.quote: Can you be a girl for a few seconds?
item.author: Veronica Roth

item.quote: You're a guardian angel now. I was still too much in awe to wrap my mind around it, but at the same time I felt amazement, curiosity...happiness.
item.author: Becca Fitzpatrick

item.quote: The mountains are calling and I must go.
item.author: John Muir

item.quote: I just want to be wonderful.
item.author: Marilyn Monroe

item.quote: I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.
item.author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.quote: Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.
item.author: Dean Koontz

item.quote: To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balanced
item.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

item.quote: The best way out is always through.
item.author: Robert Frost

item.quote: The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
item.author: Mahatma Gandhi

item.quote: Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength.
item.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

item.quote: If Peeta and I were both to die, or they thought we were....My fingers fumble with the pouch on my belt, freeing it. Peeta sees it and his hand clamps on my wrist. No, I won't let you. Trust me, I whisper. He holds my gaze for a long moment then lets go. I loosen the top of the pouch and pour a few spoonfuls of berries into his palm. Then I fill my own. On the count of three? Peeta leans down and kisses me once, very gently. The count of three, he says. We stand, our backs pressed together, our empty hands locked tight. Hold them out. I want everyone to see, he says. I spread out my fingers, and the dark berries glisten in the sun. I give Peeta's hand one last squeeze as a signal, as a good-bye, and we begin counting. One. Maybe I'm wrong. Two. Maybe they don't care if we both die. Three! It's too late to change my mind. I lift my hand to my mouth taking one last look at the world. The berries have just passed my lips when the trumpets begin to blare. The frantic voice of Claudius Templesmith shouts above them. Stop! Stop! Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! I give you - the tributes of District 12!
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: there is a place in the heart that
item.author: Charles bukowski

item.quote: All thinking men are atheists.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: But until a person can say deeply and honestly, I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday, that person cannot say, I choose otherwise.
item.author: Stephen R. Covey

item.quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.
item.author: Cheris Kramarae

item.quote: Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.
item.author: Mahatma Gandhi

item.quote: Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.
item.author: George R.R. Martin

item.quote: Moths, repeats Will. You're afraid of moths?
item.author: Veronica Roth

item.quote: I think and think and think, Ive thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!
item.author: Maya Angelou

item.quote: She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.
item.author: Dalai Lama XIV

item.quote: The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Dont wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope.
item.author: Barack Obama

item.quote: It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: It would seem that Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak. We are half-hearted creatures, fooling about with drink and sex and ambition when infinite joy is offered us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in a slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by the offer of a holiday at the sea. We are far too easily pleased.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: There is no such thing as a broken family. Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not your family. If you make those ties, those people are your family. And if you hate those ties, those people will still be your family because whatever you hate will always be with you.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.
item.author: Woody Allen

item.quote: The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.
item.author: Pablo Picasso

item.quote: I sit beside the fire and think
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
item.author: Sun Tzu

item.quote: Maybe this world is another planets hell.
item.author: Aldous Huxley

item.quote: We need to talk. All of us About what we're going to do now.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: I figured all your classes were stuff like Slaughter 101 and Beheading for Beginners.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
item.author: Ben Okri

item.quote: Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing.
item.author: Ayn Rand

item.quote: God alert! Blackjack yelled. It's the wine dude!
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
item.author: Walt Disney

item.quote: I have accepted fear as part of life specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....
item.author: Erica Jong

item.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
item.author: Marie Curie

item.quote: This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.
item.author: James Lecesne

item.quote: The course of true love never did run smooth.
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.
item.author: Maya Angelou

item.quote: My only love sprung from my only hate!
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.
item.author: Confucius

item.quote: I address you all tonight for who you truly are: wizards, mermaids, travelers, adventurers, and magicians. You are the true dreamers.
item.author: Brian Selznick

item.quote: I was always hungry for love. Just once, I wanted to know what it was like to get my fill of it -- to be fed so much love I couldn't take any more. Just once.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.
item.author: Ken Kesey

item.quote: It is not the length of life, but the depth.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say.
item.author: Anais Nin

item.quote: Let the improvement of yourself keep you so busy that you have no time to criticize others.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: If I should have a daughterInstead of Mom, shes gonna call me Point B. Because that way, she knows that no matter what happens, at least she can always find her way to me. And Im going to paint the solar system on the back of her hands so that she has to learn the entire universe before she can say Oh, I know that like the back of my hand.
item.author: Sarah Kay

item.quote: Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.
item.author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.quote: People, generally, suck.
item.author: Christopher Moore

item.quote: He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.
item.author: Gabriel Garca Mrquez

item.quote: Jace?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?
item.author: Hunter S. Thompson

item.quote: Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation.
item.author: Charlotte Bront

item.quote: But- Maia, still looking at Alec and Magnus, broke off and rasied her eyebrows. Simon turned to see what she was looking at - and stared.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'
item.author: Dalai Lama XIV

item.quote: Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy
item.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

item.quote: Clary felt suddenly annoyed. When the self-congratulatory part of the evening is over, maybe we could get back to saving my best friend from being exsanguinated to death?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Hello, Harry said George, beaming at him. We thought we heard your dulcet tones.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.
item.author: G.K. Chesterton

item.quote: I don't hate you.. I just don't like that you exist
item.author: Gena Showalter

item.quote: I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.
item.author: Herman Melville

item.quote: If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: It's gonna go wrong. Or She's going to hurt me. Or,I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . . Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down.
item.author: Ray Bradbury

item.quote: A trap is only a trap if you don't know about it. If you know about it, it's a challenge.
item.author: China Miville

item.quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
item.author: Anais Nin

item.quote: Man is the cruelest animal.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.
item.author: J.D. Salinger

item.quote: Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand
item.author: Hayley Williams

item.quote: Sebastian just smiled. I could hear your heart beating, he said softly. When you were watching me with Valentine. Did it bother you?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: But Dumbledore says he doesn't care what they do as long as they don't take him off the Chocolate Frog cards.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.
item.author: Chaim Potok

item.quote: What else? She is so beautiful. You dont get tired of looking at her. You never worry if she is smarter than you: You know she is. She is funny without ever being mean. I love her. I am so lucky to love her, Van Houten. You dont get to choose if you get hurt in this world, old man, but you do have some say in who hurts you. I like my choices. I hope she likes hers.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world.
item.author: Bill Watterson

item.quote: The worst type of crying wasn't the kind everyone could see--the wailing on street corners, the tearing at clothes. No, the worst kind happened when your soul wept and no matter what you did, there was no way to comfort it. A section withered and became a scar on the part of your soul that survived. For people like me and Echo, our souls contained more scar tissue than life.
item.author: Katie McGarry

item.quote: You live like this, sheltered, in a delicate world, and you believe you are living. Then you read a book or you take a trip and you discover that you are not living, that you are hibernating. The symptoms of hibernating are easily detectable: first, restlessness. The second symptom (when hibernating becomes dangerous and might degenerate into death): absence of pleasure. That is all. It appears like an innocuous illness. Monotony, boredom, death. Millions live like this (or die like this) without knowing it. They work in offices. They drive a car. They picnic with their families. They raise children. And then some shock treatment takes place, a person, a book, a song, and it awakens them and saves them from death. Some never awaken.
item.author: Anas Nin

item.quote: The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Spring is the time of plans and projects.
item.author: Leo Tolstoy

item.quote: I fell in love with you, smartass, because you were one of usbecause you werent afraid of me, and you decided to end your spectacular victory by throwing that piece of bone at Amarantha like a javelin. I felt Cassians spirit beside me in that moment, and could have sworn I heard him say, If you dont marry her, you stupid prick, I will.
item.author: Sarah J. Maas

item.quote: The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
