Well that just isn't good enough..Look what happens to people just living their lives. They get hurt, it's not fair they get hurt but they do, all the time, no matter how careful they are. Somebody can just just come along and hurt them, for no stupid reason..
item.author: Julian Gough

item.quote: Love is like the sea. It's a moving thing, but still and all, it takes its shape from the shore it meets, and it's different with every shore.
item.author: Zora Neale Hurston

item.quote: Mysteries of attraction could not always be explained through logic. Sometimes the fractures in two separate souls became the very hinges that held them together.
item.author: Lisa Kleypas

item.quote: Your memory feels like home to me.
item.author: Ranata Suzuki

item.quote: When I like people immensely I never tell their names to anyone. It is like surrendering a part of them. I have grown to love secrecy.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: I may have come close, but I never had what you had. Something always held me back or stood in the way. How you live your life is your business. But remember, our hearts and our bodies are given to us only once. Most of us can't help but live as though we've got two lives to live, one is the mockup, the other the finished version, and then there are all those versions in between. But there's only one, and before you know it, your heart is worn out, and, as for your body, there comes a point when no one looks at it, much less wants to come near it. Right now there's sorrow. I don't envy the pain. But I envy you the pain.
item.author: Andr Aciman

item.quote: Perhaps the reason we are unable to love is that we yearn to be loved, that is, we demand something (love) from our partner instead of delivering ourselves up to him demand-free and asking for nothing but his company.
item.author: Milan Kundera

item.quote: The Quiet World
item.author: Jeffrey McDaniel

item.quote: Who fixes broken people? Is it only other broken people, ones who've already been ruined? And do we need to be fixed? It was the messiness and hurt in our pasts that drove us, and that same hurt connected us at a subdermal level, the kind of scars written so deeply in your cells that you can't even see them anymore, only recognize them in someone else.
item.author: Leah Raeder

item.quote: Sometimes I think gravity may be death in disguise. Other times I think gravity is love, which is why love's only demand is that we fall.
item.author: Shaun David Hutchinson

item.quote: You want to take me to a movie? I asked.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: I loved him as we always love for the first time; with idolatry and wild passion.
item.author: Candide

item.quote: I found myself grinning until my cheeks hurt, my scalp prickling till I thought it might lift off my head. My tongue ran away from me, giddy with freedom. This, and this, and this, I said to him. I did not have to fear that I spoke too much. I did not have to worry that I was too slender, or too slow. This and this and this! I taught him how to skip stones, and he taught me how to carve wood. I could feel every nerve in my body, every brush of air against my skin.
item.author: Madeline Miller

item.quote: What am I supposed to call you?
item.author: Kiera Cass

item.quote: The spiritualization of sensuality is called love: it is a great triumph over Christianity.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: I'll come and make love to you at five o'clock. If I'm late start without me.
item.author: Tallulah Bankhead

item.quote: You know not, yet, the sort of love that strikes like a lightning bolt; that clutches hold of you by the heart, as irrevocably as death; that becomes the lodestar by which you steer the rest of your life. I would not wish such a love on anyone, man or woman, for it can make your life a paradise, or it can destroy you utterly.
item.author: Juliet Marillier

item.quote: Its too bad if a heart lacks fire,
item.author: Omar Khayyam

item.quote: Images flashed through his mind. He saw Nico and his sister on a snowy cliff in Maine, Percy Jackson protecting them from a manticore. Percy's sword gleamed in the dark. He'd been the first demigod Nico had ever seen in action.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: In any relationship, there will be frightening spells in which your feelings of love dry up. And when that happens you must remember that the essence of marriage is that it is a covenant, a commitment, a promise of future love. So what do you do? You do the acts of love, despite your lack of feeling. You may not feel tender, sympathetic, and eager to please, but in your actions you must BE tender, understanding, forgiving and helpful. And, if you do that, as time goes on you will not only get through the dry spells, but they will become less frequent and deep, and you will become more constant in your feelings. This is what can happen if you decide to love.
item.author: Timothy Keller

item.quote: He opened his mouth. The words were there. He was about to say them when a jolt of terror went through him, the terror of someone who, wandering in a mist, pauses only to realise that they have stopped inches from the edge of a gaping abyss. The way she was looking at him - she could read what was in his eyes, he realised. It must have been written plainly there, like words on the page of a book. There had been no time, no chance, to hide it.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: I understood that as much as I had resisted the outside, as much as I had constricted my life, as much as I had closed and narrowed the channels into me, there were still many takers for the quiet heart.
item.author: Steve Martin

item.quote: Don't you know that love isn't just going to bed? Love isn't an act, it's a whole life. It's staying with her now because she needs you; it's knowing you and she will still care about each other when sex and daydreams, fights and futures -- when all that's on the shelf and done with. Love -- why, I'll tell you what love is: it's you at seventy-five and her at seventy-one, each of you listening for the other's step in the next room, each afraid that a sudden silence, a sudden cry, could mean a lifetime's talk is over.
item.author: Brian Moore

item.quote: im not scared
item.author: Amanda Lovelace

item.quote: Sometimes, remembering hurts too much.
item.author: Jess Rothenberg

item.quote: You carried my heart in your hands tonight, he said. But I have felt as if you carried it long before that.
item.author: Holly Black

item.quote: It occurred to me that my cheek was probably right over his tattoo. Without thinking, I lifted my face and tugged at the neckline of his T-shirt. This time, the stark black-and-gold mark wasn't hidden. No need for that spell anymore, I guess. Still, I covered it with my palm. Archer's hands clutched reflexively on my waist. Our eyes met. It doesn't burn this time, I whispered.
item.author: Rachel Hawkins

item.quote: ...some things are better left in the past. And true things are destined to repeat themselves.
item.author: Suzanne Young

item.quote: Part of falling in love with someone is actually falling in love with yourself. Realizing that you're gorgeous, you're fearless and unpredictable, you're a firecracker spitting light, entrancing a hundred faces that stare up at you with starry eyes.
item.author: Leah Raeder

item.quote: Ive been working hard to become the kind of man she needs, the kind of man she already believes me to be.
item.author: Colleen Houck

item.quote: I gave you my heart, but it wasn't enough.
item.author: Simone Elkeles

item.quote: I don't want to live, I want to love first and live incidentally.
item.author: Zelda Fitzgerald

item.quote: All any of us wanted, really, was to know that we counted. That someone else's life would not have been as rich without us here.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: Thank you...for gracing my life with your lovely presence, for adding the sweet measure of your soul to my existence.
item.author: Richard Matheson

item.quote: the world is not a pleasant place to be without someone to hold and be held by.
item.author: Nikki Giovanni

item.quote: I realized Im in love. It's always been right in front of me.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: The thing is, that world doesn't exist. All growing up means is that your realize no one will come along to fix things. No one will come along to save you.
item.author: Elizabeth Scott

item.quote: I look down at our knees, slightly touching. Jeans against jeans. Does she notice the heat transferring from her body to mine? Does she even realize what she's doing to me? I know, I know. I'm not a virgin and the slightest touch of a girl's knee is driving me insane. I don't even know what I'm feeling for Maggie, I just know that I'm
item.author: Simone Elkeles

item.quote: I dont understand the hatred and fear of gays and bisexuals and lesbians
item.author: Al Pacino

item.quote: Waiting is erotic
item.author: irene nemirovsky

item.quote: I can't--I can't think about anything or anyone else, he whispered. A hand drifted up, dragging back through his hair. I can't think straight when you're around. I can't sleep. It feels like I can't breathe--I just--
item.author: Alexandra Bracken

item.quote: What we all want, really, is to be loved. That craving drives our worst behavior.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: The bottom line is that we never fall for the person we're supposed to.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: If in thirst you drink water from a cup, you see God in it. Those who are not in love with God will see only their own faces in it.
item.author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.quote: One of the few downsides to being awakened is that we no longer require sleep; therefore we also no longer dream. It's a shame, because if I could dream, I know I'd dream about you.I'd dream about the way you smell and how your dark hair feels like silk between my fingers. I'd dream about the smoothness of your skin and the fierceness of your lips when we kiss.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: Friends ask you questions; enemies question you.
item.author: Criss Jami

item.quote: You left with my soul in your fists and my heart in your teeth, and I dont want either of them back. ~Ben
item.author: Colleen Hoover

item.quote: It was as if they had leapt over the arduous cavalry of conjugal life and gone straight to the heart of love. They were together in silence like an old married couple wary of life, beyond the pitfalls of passion, beyond the brutal mockery of hope and the phantoms of disillusion: beyond love. For they had lived together long enough to know that love was always love, anytime and anyplace, but it was more solid the closer it came to death.
item.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.quote: It's a very brave thing to fall in love. You have to be willing to trust somebody else with your whole being, and that's very difficult, really difficult and very brave.
item.author: Nicole Kidman

item.quote: You're a dream. Like everything else.
item.author: Kelly Creagh

item.quote: You know I love you, right? The urge to kiss her goodbye was so strong that I almost broke our rules.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: Here's a news flash for the ladies: for every one of you who thinks we all want a girl like Angelina Jolie, all skinny elbows and angles, the truth is, we'd rather curl up with someone like Charlotte - a woman who's soft when a guy wraps his arms around her; a woman who might have a smear of flour on her shirt the whole day and not notice or care, not even when she goes out to meet with the PTA; a woman who doesn't feel like an exotic vacation but is the home we can't wait to come back to.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: You seem to think you have a choice, Cam said. But you have it backwards. Love chooses you. The shadow moves as the sun commands.
item.author: Lisa Kleypas

item.quote: What is it the I'll want from you? Not love: that would be too much to ask. Not forgiveness, which isn't yours to bestow. Only a listener, perhaps; only someone who will see me. Don't prettify me though, whatever else you do: I have no wish to be a decorated skull.
item.author: Margaret Atwood

item.quote: Christianity is not about building an absolutely secure little niche in the world where you can live with your perfect little wife and your perfect little children in your beautiful little house where you have no gays or minority groups anywhere near you. Christianity is about learning to love like Jesus loved and Jesus loved the poor and Jesus loved the broken.
item.author: Rich Mullins

item.quote: Does that count as an argument? Can we kiss and make up now?
item.author: Colleen Houck

item.quote: Live simply. Deepest joy is like a flower....beautiful in essence.
item.author: Tony Samara

item.quote: It always struck me in years after how bizarre it was, how two people could look at one another with such tenderness and complete love, and how quickly that could dissolve into nothing but bitterness.
item.author: Hannah Harrington

item.quote: I think ... I should go home soon. Mom and Luke are probably going nuts. What about you?
item.author: Julie Kagawa

item.quote: Okay, then Ill just say I love you. There is nothing in this world more important to me than you are. Im only content when youre near. My whole purpose is to be what you need me to be. Its not poetry, but its from my heart. Will that do?
item.author: Colleen Houck

item.quote: ...lies can sound awfully pretty when a girl is in love with the person telling them.
item.author: Gabrielle Zevin

item.quote: It's easy to cry when you realize that everyone you love will reject you or die.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: I reserve the right to love many different people at once, and to change my prince often.
item.author: Anas Nin

item.quote: I cut myself because you wouldn't let me cry.
item.author: Emilie Autumn

item.quote: That was when it was all made painfully clear to me. When you are a child, there is joy. There is laughter. And most of all, there is trust. Trust in your fellows. When you are an adult...then comes suspicion, hatred, and fear. If children ran the world, it would be a place of eternal bliss and cheer. Adults run the world; and there is war, and enmity, and destruction unending. Adults who take charge of things muck them up, and then produce a new generation of children and say, The children are the hope of the future. And they are right. Children are the hope of the future. But adults are the damnation of the present, and children become adults as surely as adults become worm food.
item.author: Peter David

item.quote: Voicemail #1: Hi, Isabel Culpeper. I am lying in my bed, looking at the ceiling. I am mostly naked. I am thinking of your mother. Call me.
item.author: Maggie Stiefvater

item.quote: It hurts to love. It's like giving yourself to be flayed and knowing that at any moment the other person may just walk off with your skin.
item.author: Susan Sontag

item.quote: Love, and you shall be loved.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: Love is not something you protect. Its something you risk.
item.author: Gayle Forman

item.quote: Andaikata semua kehidupan ini menyakitkan, maka di luar sana pasti masih ada sepotong bagian yang menyenangkan. Kemudian kau akan membenak pasti ada sesuatu yang jauh lebih indah dari menatap rembulan di langit. Kau tidak tahu apa itu, karna ilmumu terbatas. Kau hanya yakin , bila tidak di kehidupan ini suatu saat nanti pasti akan ada yang lebih mempesona dibanding menatap sepotong rembulan yang sedang bersinar indah.
item.author: Tere Liye

item.quote: You may only call me Mrs. Darcy... when you are completely, and perfectly, and incandescently happy.
item.author: Deborah Moggach

item.quote: Love was the most savage monster of all.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Some people feel love in their hearts, Julie. Some of us feel it all way into our souls. We're the ones who can't forget.
item.author: Judith McNaught

item.quote: I look at you, and I think about you, and ... I don't know. No one has ever confounded me the way you do.
item.author: Stephanie Perkins

item.quote: I miss us too. I always have and I probably always will. Sometimes there are no happy endings. No matter what, I'll be losing something, someone. But maybe that's what it all comes down to. Love, not as a surge of passion, but as a choice to commit to something, someone, no matter what obstacles or temptations stand in the way. And maybe making that choice again and again, day in and day out, year after year,says more about love than never having a choice to make at all.
item.author: Emily Giffin

item.quote: They kissed for the first time then in the cold spring rain, though neither one of them now knew that it was raining. Tristran's heart pounded in his chest as if it was not big enough to contain all the joy that it held. He opened his eyes as he kissed the star. Her sky-blue eyes stared back into his, and in her eyes he could see no parting from her.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: The opposite of love is not hate. It is indifference.
item.author: Wilhelm Stekel

item.quote: Disappointments in love, even betrayals and losses, serve the soul at the very moment they seem in life to be tragedies. The soul is partly in time and partly in eternity. We might remember the part that resides in eternity when we feel despair over the part that is in life.
item.author: Thomas Moore

item.quote: In love there are two things - bodies and words.
item.author: Joyce Carol Oates

item.quote: They do make love stories for girls with black hearts after all. They go like this.
item.author: Jandy Nelson

item.quote: She blushed and so did he. She greeted him in a faltering voice, and he spoke to her without knowing what he was saying.
item.author: Candide

item.quote: Gilbert, I'm afraid I'm scandalously in love with you.
item.author: L.M. Montgomery

item.quote: Choice or no, my heart is his.
item.author: Beth Revis

item.quote: Two seconds later, the sound of an alarm filled my ears.
item.author: Michelle Hodkin

item.quote: I want him to love me as much as I love him.
item.author: L.J. Smith

item.quote: Love, being in love, isnt a constant thing. It doesnt always flow at the same strength. Its not always like a river in flood. Its more like the sea. It has tides, it ebbs and flows. The thing is, when love is real, whether its ebbing or flowing, its always there, it never goes away. And thats the only proof you can have that it is real, and not just a crush or an infatuation or a passing fancy
item.author: Aidan Chambers

item.quote: Oh, don't mind me, came an extremely sarcastic voice near the wall. You two go ahead and make outI'll just sit here and bleed quietly.
item.author: Julie Kagawa

item.quote: Love doesnt have to be on Valentines Day. It doesnt have to be by the time you turn eighteen or thirty-three or fifty-nine. It doesnt have to conform to whatever is usual. It doesnt have to be kismet at once, or rhapsody by the third day.
item.author: David Levithan

item.quote: The two of you, there's something uncanny about the way you two are with each other. I mean everything--the way you look at each other, the way she relaxes when you put your hand on her back, the way you both seem to know what the other is always thinking, it's always struck me as extraordinary. That's another reason I keep putting marriage off. I know I want something like what you two share, and I'm not sure I've found it yet. I'm not sure I ever will. And with love like that, they say anything's possible, right?
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: He wanted to take his love back from her so badly. The old techniques didnt work anymore. In fact, theyd never worked. How do you stop loving someone? It was one of the worlds more brutal mysteries. The more you tried, the less it worked.
item.author: Ann Brashares

item.quote: She knew whose love she doubted. It wasn't her parents' and it wasn't her friends: It was her own.
item.author: Ann Brashares

item.quote: Not like this. He wanted it to be real.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: If you listen to the wind very carefully, you'll be able to hear me whisper my love for you.
item.author: Andrew Davidson

item.quote: And he knew that at that moment, they understood each other perfectly, and when he told her what he was going to do now, she would not say be careful or dont do it, but she would accept his decision because she would not have expected anything less of him.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Please, he says. I'm begging you to stop.
item.author: Tahereh Mafi

item.quote: I could still smell her on my fur. It clung to me, a memory of another world.
item.author: Maggie Stiefvater

item.quote: A man always finds it hard to realize that he may have finally lost a woman's love, however badly he may have treated her.
item.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

item.quote: Better to put your heart on the line, risk everything, and walk away with nothing than play it safe. Love is a lot of things, but safe isnt one of them.
item.author: Mandy Hale

item.quote: He shook his head, just looking at me.
item.author: John Green The Fault in Our Stars

item.quote: I just don't see why the past has to matter.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: You become. It takes a long time. Thats why it doesnt happen often to people who break easily, or have sharp edges, or who have to be carefully kept. Generally, by the time you are Real, most of your hair has been loved off, and your eyes drop out and you get loose in your joints and very shabby.
item.author: Margery Williams Bianco

item.quote: So many believe that it is love that grows, but it is the knowing that grows and love simply expands to contain it.
item.author: Wm. Paul Young

item.quote: Take it from me: love has all the lasting permanence of a rainbow- beautiful while it's there, and just as likely to have disappeared by the time you blink.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: Falling into ruin was a bit like falling in love: Both descents stripped you bare and left you as you were at your core. And both endings are equally painful.
item.author: J.R. Ward

item.quote: I want my world to start and end with you.
item.author: E.L. James

item.quote: Love is blind, they say--but isn't it more that love makes us see too much? Isn't it more that love floods our brain with sights and sounds, so that everything looks bigger, brighter, more lovely than ever before?
item.author: Susan Fletcher

item.quote: And when she at last came out, her eyes were dry. Her parents stared up from their silent breakfast at her. They both started to rise but she put a hand out, stopped them. I can care for myself, please, and she set about getting some food. They watched her closely.
item.author: William Goldman

item.quote: he is both the source of my happiness and the one i want to share it with.
item.author: David Levithan

item.quote: He didn't mind how he looked to other people, because the nursery magic had made him Real, and when you are Real shabbiness doesn't matter.
item.author: Margery Williams Bianco

item.quote: Elizabeth's spirit's soon rising to playfulness again, she wanted Mr. Darcy to account for his having ever fallen in love with her. 'How could you begin?' said she.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: Theres always that one guy who gets a hold on you. Not like your best friends brother who gets you in a headlock kind of hold. Or the little kid youre babysitting who attaches himself to your leg kind of hold.
item.author: Jess Rothenberg

item.quote: If you cannot hold me in your arms, then hold my memory in high regard.
item.author: Ranata Suzuki

item.quote: I could feel the warmth of his presence as if a soft blanket had been wrapped around my soul, around my heart. It held me and protected me. It sheltered me and I knew I wasnt alone anymore.
item.author: Colleen Houck

item.quote: Sometimes I shrink from your knowing what I have felt for you, and sometimes I am distressed that all of it you will never know.
item.author: Thomas Hardy

item.quote: This goes to show you that sometimes the unseen is not to be feared and that those meant to love us most are not always ones who do.
item.author: Leigh Bardugo

item.quote: If you have one parent who loves you, even if they can't buy you clothes, they're so poor and they make all kinds of mistakes and maybe sometimes they even give you awful advice, but never for one moment do you doubt their love for you--if you have this, you have incredibly good fortune.
item.author: Augusten Burroughs

item.quote: Love is proved the moment you let go of someone because they need you to.
item.author: Shannon L. Alder

item.quote: A sky
item.author: Atticus Poetry

item.quote: To me you are a work of art, and I would give you my heart - that's if I had one.
item.author: Morrissey

item.quote: It is better to have an enemy who will fight you in an open field then a lover who will kill you in your sleep.
item.author: Marie Lu

item.quote: You have a beautiful laugh. Like the promise of tomorrow.
item.author: Renee Ahdieh

item.quote: Sometimes you have to learn to love what's good for you.
item.author: Stephenie Meyer

item.quote: Faith goes up the stairs that love has built and looks out the windows which hope has opened.
item.author: Charles H. Spurgeon

item.quote: I wanted movement and not a calm course of existence. I wanted excitement and danger and the chance to sacrifice myself for my love.
item.author: Leo Tolstoy

item.quote: A gentleman holds my hand.
item.author: Alessandra Torre

item.quote: Love all Gods creation, both the whole and every grain of sand. Love every leaf, every ray of light. Love the animals, love the plants, love each separate thing. If thou love each thing thou wilt perceive the mystery of God in all; and when once thou perceive this, thou wilt thenceforward grow every day to a fuller understanding of it: until thou come at last to love the whole world with a love that will then be all-embracing and universal.
item.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.quote: It isn't about love, Vee said. It's about fun.
item.author: Becca Fitzpatrick

item.quote: Prayer for Love
item.author: Don Miguel Ruiz

item.quote: Don't be afraid to lose him, because if a man truly loves you, he's not going anywhere
item.author: Steve Harvey

item.quote: You don't have to say I love you to say I love you, you said with a shrug. All you have to do is say my name and I know.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: What are you wishing for?' Grace interrupted. 'To kiss you,' I said to her.
item.author: Maggie Stiefvater

item.quote: He is the cheese to my macaroni.
item.author: Diablo Cody

item.quote: When I talk about unrequited love, most of you probably think about romantic love, but there are many other kinds of love that are not adequately returned, if they are returned at all. An angry adolescent may not love her mother back as her mother loves her; an abusive father doesn't return the innocent open love of his young child. But grief is the ultimate unrequieted love. However hard and however long we love someone who has died, they can never love us back. At least that is how it feels...
item.author: Rosamund Lupton

item.quote: Think of it! We could have gone on longing for one another and pretending not to notice forever. This obsession with dignity can ruin your life if you let it.
item.author: Mary Ann Shaffer

item.quote: Im sort of coming off a bad relationship
item.author: Rainbow Rowell

item.quote: Love is born into every human being; it calls back the halves of our original nature together; it tries to make one out of two and heal the wound of human nature.
item.author: Plato

item.quote: If you don't like Cinderella because she seems so naive and weak, listen to this quote from the Walt himself: She believed in dreams, all right, but she also believed in doing something about them. When Prince Charming didn't come along, she went over to the palace and got him.
item.author: Walt Disney

item.quote: They loved each other, not driven by necessity, by the blaze of passion often falsely ascribed to love. They loved each other because everything around them willed it, the trees and the clouds and the sky over their heads and the earth under their feet.
item.author: Boris Pasternak

item.quote: She writes things with her movements that I for the life of me could never write with a pen.
item.author: Christopher Poindexter

item.quote: Kitten, your hands are heaven and your eyes are my home.
item.author: Jeaniene Frost

item.quote: You have within you,right now,everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
item.author: Brian Tracy

item.quote: love will come
item.author: Rupi Kaur

item.quote: I want you. I want you so badly I cant stand it. When you left, it felt like the world got darker. Like I couldnt truly see anything. Couldnt feel anything.
item.author: Rachel Vincent

item.quote: You make me smile like the sun, fall out bed, sing like a bird, dizzy in my head. Spin like a record crazy on a sunday night. You make me dance like a fool, forget how to breath, shine like the sun buzz like a bee, just the thought of you can drive me wild. Oh you make me smile. -Uncle Kracker-
item.author: Uncle Kracker

item.quote: Falling In Love Is Like Owning A Dog.
item.author: Taylor Mali

item.quote: Like time suspended,
item.author: Lang Leav

item.quote: He recognized her despite the uproar, through his tears of unrepeatable sorrow at dying without her, and he looked at her for the last and final time with eyes more luminous, more grief-stricken, more grateful than she had ever seen them in half a century of a shared life, and he managed to say to her with his last breath: Only God knows how much I loved you
item.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.quote: Why? she screamed. Are you crazy? You know the English subjunctive, you understand trigonometry, you can read Marx, and you don't know the answer to something as simple as that? Why do you even have to ask? Why do you have to make a girl SAY something like this? I like you more than I like him, that's all. I wish I had fallen in love with somebody a little more handsome, of course. But I didn't. I fell in love with you!
item.author: Haruki Murukami

item.quote: But I believe in love, you know; love is a uniquely portable magic. I dont think its in the stars, but I
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: She had never imagined she had the power to make someone else so happy. And not a magical power, either--a purely human one.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: It is love, not reason, that is stronger than death.
item.author: Thomas Mann

item.quote: Im not a warrior or a goddess, I said at last.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: I remember when your name was just another name that rolled without thought off my tongue.
item.author: Jamie Weise

item.quote: Clare, I want to tell you, again, I love you. Our love has been the thread through the labyrinth, the net under the high-wire walker, the only real thing in this strange life of mine that I could ever trust. Tonight I feel that my love for you has more density in this world than I do, myself: as though it could linger on after me and surround you, keep you, hold you.
item.author: Audrey Niffenegger (The Time Traveler's Wife)

item.quote: The only difference between falling in love and being in love is that your heart already knows how you feel, but your mind is too stubborn to admit it.
item.author: Colleen Hoover

item.quote: To love someone enough to let them go, you had to let them go forever or you did not love them that much.
item.author: Diana Wynne Jones

item.quote: Dare not say that man forgets sooner than woman, that his love has an earlier death.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: Watch carefully
item.author: Atticus Poetry

item.quote: Love. It was the beginning and end of everything, the foundation and the ceiling and the air in between.
item.author: Kristin Hannah

item.quote: You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving.
item.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

item.quote: Simon: So were you following me? Or is it just an amazing coincidence that you happened to be on the roof of a building I was walking by when I got attacked?
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Love is happiness, but only when you believe it will last forever. Even though every time it turns out to be a lie, its only faith that gives love its strength and its joy.
item.author: Sergei Lukyanenko

item.quote: You are at once both the quiet and the confusion of my heart; imagine my heartbeat when you are in this state.
item.author: Franz Kafka

item.quote: When what you want is a relationship, and not a person, get a dog.
item.author: Deb Caletti

item.quote: Love can rebuild the world, they say, so everything's possible when it comes to love.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: There was a man who loved the moon, but whenever he tried to embrace her, she broke into a thousand pieces and left him drenched, with empty arms.
item.author: Laini Taylor

item.quote: When we first met, I didn't want to get involved with anyone. I didn't have the time or energy, and I wasn't sure that I was ready for it. But you were so good to me, and I got swept up in that. And little by little, I found myself falling in love with you.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Soulmate is an overused term, but a true soul connection is very rare, and very real.
item.author: Hilary Duff

item.quote: He'd only been gone two seconds, but the room got brighter when they were together, as if they were two elements that became brilliant in proximity. At Sam's clumsy efforts to carry the vacuum, Grace smiled a new smile that I thought only he ever got, and he shot her a withering look full of the sort of subtext you could only get from a lot of conversations whispered after dark.
item.author: Maggie Stiefvater

item.quote: Ah me, but where are now the songs I sang
item.author: Christina Rossetti

item.quote: Love is not an emotion. It is your very existence.
item.author: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar

item.quote: And sometimes I believe your relentless analysis of June leaves something out, which is your feeling for her beyond knowledge, or in spite of knowledge. I often see how you sob over what you destroy, how you want to stop and just worship; and you do stop, and then a moment later you are at it again with a knife, like a surgeon.
item.author: Anais Nin

item.quote: I give her the only honest and true answer I have.
item.author: Simone Elkeles

item.quote: I don't understand how I can know so little about love and how it works. How I can be so bad at it when it's all I've ever wanted.
item.author: Carrie Ryan

item.quote: I love, because my love is not dependent on the object of love. My love is dependent on my state of being. So whether the other person changes, becomes different, friend turns into a foe, does not matter, because my love was never dependent on the other person. My love is my state of being. I simply love.
item.author: Osho

item.quote: They wouldn't understand, and I don't feel the need to explain, simply because I know in my heart how real it was. When I think of you, I can't help smiling, knowing that you've completed me somehow. I love you, not just for now, but for always, and I dream of the day that you'll take me in your arms again
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: I have no fear of losing u, for you aren't an object of my property, or anyone else's. I love you as you are, without attachment, without fears, without conditions, without egoism, trying not to absorb you. I love you freely because I love your freedom, as well as mine.
item.author: Anthony de Mello

item.quote: Life is like a sandwich!
item.author: Allan Rufus

item.quote: Then you look at her and smile a smile your dissembling face will remember until the day you die. Baby, you say, baby, this is part of my novel.
item.author: Junot Diaz

item.quote: I want you, Hank. I'm much more of an animal than you think. I wanted you from the first moment I saw you - and the only thing I'm ashamed of is that I did not know it. I did not know why, for two years, the brightest moments I found were the ones in your office, where I could lift my head to look up at you. I did not know the nature of what I felt in your presence, nor the reason. I know it now. That is all I want, Hank. I want you in my bed - and you are free of me for all the rest of your time. There's nothing you'll have to pretend - don't think of me, don't feel; don't care - I do not want your mind, your will, your being or your soul, so long as it's to me you will come for that lowest one of your desires. I am an animal who wants nothing but the sensation of pleasure which you despise - but I want it from you. You'd give up amy height of virtue for it , while I - I haven't any to give up. There's none I seek or wish to reach. I am so low that I would exchange the greatest sight of beauty in the world for the sight of your figure in the cab of a railroad engine. Amd seeing it, I would not be able to see it indifferently. You don't have to fear that you're now dependent on me. It's I who will depend on any whim of yours. You'll have me anytime you wish, anywhere, on any terms. Did you call it the obscenity of my talent? It's such that it gives you a safer hold on me than on any other property you own. You may dispose of me as you please - I'm not afraid to admit it - I have nothing to protect from you and nothing to reserve. You think that this is a threat to your achievement, but it is not to mine. I will sit at my desk, and work, and when the things around me get hard to bear, I will think that for my reward I will be in your bed that night. Did you call it depravity? I am much more depraved than you are: you hold it as your guilt, and I - as my pride. I'm more proud of it than anything I've done, more proud than of building the Line. If I'm asked to name my proudest attainment, I will say: I have slept with Hank Rearden. I had earned it.
item.author: Ayn Rand

item.quote: I think sometimes when we find love we pretend it away, or ignore it, or tell ourselves were imagining it. Because it is the most painful kind of hope there is.
item.author: Rae Carson

item.quote: Dustfinger still clearly remembered the feeling of being in love for the first time. How vulnerable his heart had suddenly been! Such a trembling, quivering thing, happy and miserably unhappy at once.
item.author: Cornelia Funke

item.quote: If he can't handle you at your worst then he does not deserve you at your best. Real love means seeing beyond the words spoken out of pain, and instead seeing a person's soul.
item.author: Shannon Alder

item.quote: ...and you drink a little too much and try a little too hard. And you go home to a cold bed and think, 'That was fine'. And your life is a long line of fine.
item.author: Gillian Flynn

item.quote: I think its beautiful
item.author: Atticus Poetry

item.quote: Nothing is more curious and awkward than the relationship of two people who only know each other with their eyes who meet and observe each other daily, even hourly and who keep up the impression of disinterest either because of morals or because of a mental abnormality. Between them there is listlessness and pent-up curiosity, the hysteria of an unsatisfied, unnaturally suppressed need for communion and also a kind of tense respect. Because man loves and honors man as long as he is not able to judge him, and desire is a product of lacking knowledge.
item.author: Thomas Mann

item.quote: True love always makes a man better, no matter what woman inspires it.
item.author: Alexandre Dumas

item.quote: And think not you can direct the course of love, for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course.
item.author: Khalil Gibran

item.quote: A broken heart in real life isn't half as dreadful as it is in books. It's a good deal like a bad tooth, though you won't think THAT a very romantic simile. It takes spells of aching and gives you a sleepless night now and then, but between times it lets you enjoy life and dreams and echoes and peanut candy as if there were nothing the matter with it.
item.author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.quote: I don't want to lose you
item.author: Alexandra Bracken

item.quote: He looked at her as a man might look at a faded flower he had plucked, in which it was difficult for him to trace the beauty that had made him pick and so destroy it
item.author: Leo Tolstoy

item.quote: He didn't realize that love as powerful as your mother's for you leaves its own mark.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: I wanted to tell her that I loved her, and not in the complicated way I loved our parents, but in a simple way I never had to think about. I loved her like breathing.
item.author: Brenna Yovanoff

item.quote: Marie, lets suppose that two firemen go into a forest to put out a small fire. Afterwards, when they emerge and go over to a stream, the face of one is all smeared with black, while the other mans face is completely clean. My question is this: which of the two will wash his face?
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Do you think we can be friends? I asked.
item.author: Priya Ardis

item.quote: I met a boy whose eyes showed me that the past, present and future were all the same thing.
item.author: Jennifer Elisabeth

item.quote: Un-winged and naked, sorrow surrenders its crown to a throne called grace.
item.author: Aberjhani

item.quote: The heart makes its choices without weighing the consequences. It doesn't look ahead to the lonely nights that follow.
item.author: Tess Gerritsen

item.quote: The cord pulled taut and she rebounded, flying back up before falling again. As her velocity slowed, she opened her eyes and found herself dangling at the end of the cord, about five feet above Jace. He was grinning.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Darkness may hide the trees
item.author: Khalil Gibran

item.quote: Kisses open doors, I've noticed. That one gesture can unlock secrets, ease open feelings. It can't be prevented--these kisses just are. It's how they work. They break into basements you never knew you had.
item.author: Susan Fletcher

item.quote: In love the other is important; in lust you are important
item.author: Osho

item.quote: If I fought for them and was crippled, they would all say nice things,and then they would replace me and forget I was ever there. You would stay with me. You would take care of me, because you love me. I love you too, Kate. If you ever became hurt, I would not leave you.
item.author: Ilona Andrews

item.quote: I know love is fragile. And loving someone like you is near impossible. Like holding something shattered through a raging sandstorm. If you want her to love you, shelter her from that stormAnd make certain that storm isnt you.
item.author: Renee Ahdieh

item.quote: Falling in love was like falling off a cliff. It felt pretty much like flying until you hit the ground.
item.author: Cinda Williams Chima

item.quote: I am glad it cannot happen twice, the fever of first love. For it is a fever, and a burden, too, whatever the poets may say. They are not brave, the days when we are twenty-one. They are full of little cowardices, little fears without foundation, and one is so easily bruised, so swiftly wounded, one falls to the first barbed word. To-day, wrapped in the complacent armour of approaching middle age, the infinitesimal pricks of day by day brush one but lightly and are soon forgotten, but then--how a careless word would linger, becoming a fiery stigma, and how a look, a glance over a shoulder, branded themselves as things eternal. A denial heralded the thrice crowing of a cock, and an insincerity was like the kiss of Judas. The adult mind can lie with untroubled conscience and a gay composure, but in those days even a small deception scoured the tongue, lashing one against the stake itself.
item.author: Daphne du Maurier

item.quote: Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous? Actually, who are you not to be?
item.author: Marianne Williamson

item.quote: Im not the kind of man to bottle up my feelings, Kells. I dont sit up in my room pining away, writing love poems. Im not a dreamer. Im a fighter. Im a man of action, and it will take all of my self-control not to fight for this. When something needs to be done, I do it. When I feel something, I act on it. I dont see any reason why Ren deserves to get the girl of his dreams and I dont. It doesnt seem fair that this happens to me twice.
item.author: Colleen Houck

item.quote: We all know interspecies romance is weird.
item.author: Tim Burton

item.quote: To love makes one solitary.
item.author: Virginia Woolf

item.quote: I shouldn't have to be a liar to make someone love me. I shouldn't be so afraid of losing someone that I'll do anything to make them stay.
item.author: Deb Caletti

item.quote: The desire to go home that is a desire to be whole, to know where you are, to be the point of intersection of all the lines drawn through all the stars, to be the constellation-maker and the center of the world, that center called love. To awaken from sleep, to rest from awakening, to tame the animal, to let the soul go wild, to shelter in darkness and blaze with light, to cease to speak and be perfectly understood.
item.author: Rebecca Solnit

item.quote: Love is a force unto itself, sayyidi. For love, people consider the unthinkable...and often achieve the impossible. I would not sneer at its power.
item.author: Renee Ahdieh

item.quote: That's the big picture, your happiness. And health. You should never care what a man thinks of you -- until he demonstrates to you that he cares about making you happy. If he isn't trying to make you happy, then send him back from whence he came because winning him over will have no benefit. At the end of the day, happines, joy...and yes...your emotional stability...those comprise the only measuring stick you really need to have.
item.author: Sherry Argov

item.quote: Soul connections are not often found and are worth every bit of fight left in you to keep.
item.author: Shannon Alder

item.quote: And besides... I dont want to leave you. Er, you guys.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: Then she was kissing him as she had never kissed him before...and it was blissful oblivion, better than firewhisky; she was the only real thing in the world.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: We looked at each other for a minute, not saying anything, but I could feel the air between us shift. It became thick, sultry, and tangiblelike when the air changes right before a storm. I could feel its power envelop me as it brushed across my skin. Even though I couldnt see it, I knew a storm was coming.
item.author: Colleen Houck

item.quote: No human should mislead another by promising them something they know to be untrue.
item.author: Santosh Kalwar

item.quote: The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselvessay rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
item.author: Victor Hugo

item.quote: Set the standard! Stop expecting others to show you love, acceptance, commitment, & respect when you don't even show that to yourself.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Three years? That's a thousand tomorrows, ma'am.
item.author: Karen Kingsbury

item.quote: Lepaskanlah. Maka besok lusa, jika dia cinta sejatimu, dia pasti akan kembali dengan cara mengagumkan. Ada saja takdir hebat yang tercipta untuk kita. Jika dia tidak kembali, maka sederhana jadinya, itu bukan cinta sejatimu. Hei, kisah-kisah cinta di dalam buku itu, di dongeng-dongeng cinta, atau hikayat orang tua, itu semua ada penulisnya.
item.author: Tere Liye

item.quote: I love him wholly and unconditionally and without reservation. I love him enough to sacrifice a friendship. I love him enough to accept my own happiness and use it, in turn, to make him happy back.
item.author: Emily Giffin

item.quote: Maybe that's it, [...] [w]ith what you were talking about before. The world being broken. Maybe it isn't that we're supposed to find the pieces and put them back together. Maybe
item.author: David Levithan

item.quote: Love makes you see a place differently, just as you hold differently an object that belongs to someone you love. If you know one landscape well, you will look at all other landscapes differently. And if you learn to love one place, sometimes you can also learn to love another.
item.author: Anne Michaels

item.quote: Whats wrong is that every morning and every night, I lie in bed wondering why youre not beside me.
item.author: K.A. Tucker

item.quote: I dont want to be your first, Fallon. I want to be your last.
item.author: Colleen Hoover

item.quote: I am the least difficult of men. All I want is boundless love.
item.author: Frank O'Hara

item.quote: Pamela, Im in love with you. Yeah, its that bad. Youre so beautiful to me. Shut up! Lemme tell you. Let me. Every time I look at your face or even remember it, it wrecks me - and the way you are with me - and youre just fun and you shit all over me and you make fun of me and youre real. I dont have enough time in any day to think about you enough. I feel like Im going to live a thousand years cause thats how long its gonna take me to have one thought about you which is that Im crazy about you, Pamela. I dont wanna be with anybody else. I dont. I really dont. I dont think about women anymore. I think about you. I had a dream the other night that you and I were on a train. We were on this train and you were holding my hand. Thats the whole dream. You were holding my hand and I felt you holding my hand. I woke up and I couldnt believe it wasnt real. Im sick in love with you, Pamela. Its like a condition. Its like polio. I feel like Im gonna die if I cant be with you. And I cant be with you. So Im gonna die - and I dont care cause I was brought into existence to know you and thats enough. The idea that you would want me back its like greedy.
item.author: Louis C.K.

item.quote: One of the most important things you can do on this earth is to let people know they are not alone.
item.author: Shannon L. Alder

item.quote: I don't look for love. Love looks for me. Why? Because it needs me. Because I'm not afraid of it.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: Too many adults wish to 'protect' teenagers when they should be stimulating them to read of life as it is lived.
item.author: Margaret A. Edwards

item.quote: the worst thing, he told me,
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: Parents have this twisted belief that anyone under the age of about twenty simply cant know what love is, like the age to love is assessed in the same way the law assesses the legal age to drink. They think that the emotional growth of a teenagers mind is too underdeveloped to understand love, to know if its real or not.
item.author: J.A. Redmerski

item.quote: A Stranger
item.author: Lang Leav

item.quote: There are very few friends that will lie down with you on empty streets in the middle of the night, without a word. No questions, no asking why, just quietly lay there with you, observing the stars, until you're ready to get back up on your feet again and walk the last bit home, softly holding your hand as a quiet way of saying I'm here.
item.author: Charlotte Eriksson

item.quote: Your salary is not love and your word is not love. Your clothes are not love and holding hands is not love. Sex is not love and a kiss is not love. Long letters are not love and a text is not love. Flowers are not love and a box of chocolates is not love. Sunsets are not love and photographs are not love. The stars are not love and a beach under the moonlight is not love. The smell of someone else on your pillow is not love and the feeling of their skin touching your skin is not love. Heart-shaped candy is not love and an overseas holiday is not love. The truth is not love and winning an argument is not love. Warm coffee isn't love and cheap cards bought from stores are not love. Tears are not love and laughter is not love. A head on a shoulder is not love and messages written at the front of books given as gifts are not love. Apathy is not love and numbness is not love. A pain in your chest is not love and clenching your fist is not love. Rain is not love.
item.author: pleasefindthis

item.quote: Perhaps people like us cannot love. Ordinary people can - that is their secret.
item.author: Hermann Hesse

item.quote: Everything happens for a reason and, something better will come along for me!
item.author: Selena Gomez

item.quote: And I got out of there without punching anyone, kicking anyone, or breaking down in tears. Some days the small victories are all you achieve.
item.author: Molly Ringle

item.quote: Mine was the twilight and the morning. Mine was a world of rooftops and love songs.
item.author: Roman Payne

item.quote: Love is bullshit. Emotion is bullshit. I am a rock. A jerk. I'm an uncaring asshole and proud of it.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: I know what I have given you...
item.author: Antonio Porchia

item.quote: We have just enough religion to make us hate, but not enough to make us love.
item.author: David Mitchell

item.quote: He didn't marry you to become king. He became king because he wanted to marry you.
item.author: Megan Whalen Turner

item.quote: I have loved in life and I have been loved.
item.author: Hazrat Inayat Khan

item.quote: There is lust and then there is love. They are related, but still very different things. To indulge in one requires little but honeyed speech and a change of clothes; to obtain the other, by contrast, a man must give up his rib. In return, his woman will undo the sin of Eve, and bring him back into Paradise.
item.author: Anne Fortier

item.quote: I want your most vital organ. I want it to be mine.
item.author: Jamie Weise

item.quote: Dont marry him. Dont be with him. Be with me.
item.author: Jenny Han

item.quote: I guess the sacrifice of my dignity is the only thing that will save us now. The things I endure for love. The Fates laugh at my torment.
item.author: Julie Kagawa

item.quote: You promised, Seaweed Brain. We would not get separated! Ever again!
item.author: Rick Riordan The House of Hades

item.quote: What made me run away was doubtless not so much the fear of settling down, but of settling down permanently in something ugly.
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: I am larger, better than I thought; I did not know I held so much goodness.
item.author: Walt Whitman

item.quote: I don't care, said Seth. I would have done it. I would have sold my soul for you. You and me...I told you. Something's always going to keep us near each other...even if we aren't together.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: You see, there are some people that one loves, and others that perhaps one would rather be with.
item.author: Henrik Ibsen

item.quote: No one has imagined us. We want to live like trees,
item.author: Adrienne Rich

item.quote: For the first time in forever, he was stunned to silence. Not by her words, but by the tenderness in her hands, the worry in her eyes. He was an archangel. Hed been wounded far, far worse and shrugged it off. But then, there had been no woman with sun kissed by the sunset and eyes of storm gray to tear into him for daring to get himself hurt.
item.author: Nalini Singh

item.quote: In the shadow my father has cast over my entire life, you are the only light I can see anymore. And, whatever the cost, I refuse to let that light be extinguished
item.author: Morgan Rhodes

item.quote: The faculty to think objectively is
item.author: Erich Fromm

item.quote: So shut up, live, travel, adventure, bless and don't be sorry
item.author: Jack Kerouac

item.quote: Katniss: Im coming back into focus when Caesar asks him if he has a girlfriend back home.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: Its natural to want someone you love to do what you want, or what you think would be good for them, but you have to let everything happen to them. You can't interfere with people you love any more than you're supposed to interfere with people you don't even know. And that's hard, ..., because you often feel like interfering -you want to be the one who makes the plans.
item.author: John Irving

item.quote: The trick. . .is to find the balance between the bright colors of humor and the serious issues of identity, self-loathing, and the possibility for intimacy and love when it seems no longer possible or, sadder yet, no longer necessary.
item.author: Wendy Wasserstein

item.quote: Give me the waters of Lethe that numb the heart, if they exist, I will still not have the power to forget you.
item.author: Publius Ovidius Naso

item.quote: Life is fragile and temporary. The faces of today quickly become the faces of the past. Sorrow, pain, and anger... it all fades-
item.author: Lee Argus

item.quote: I'd sell my soul to have you. In my whole life, you'll always be what I wanted most.
item.author: Lisa Kleypas

item.quote: I felt overwhelmed. I didnt expect a first kiss to be solife altering. In a few brief moments, the rule book of my universe had been rewritten. Suddenly I was a brand new person. I was as fragile as a newborn, but instead of the doctor placing me in my mothers arms, hed put me in Rens. What would Ren do with me? Would he draw me near, soothe me, and teach me about this new world or would he reject me and tell the doctor there must be some mistake. There was no way to know. What a breakable and delicate thing a heart was, no wonder Id kept mine locked away.
item.author: Colleen Houck

item.quote: Never stop smiling not even when you're sad, someone might fall in love with your smile.
item.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.quote: He who is in love is wise and is becoming wiser, sees newly every time he looks at the object beloved, drawing from it with his eyes and his mind those virtues which it possesses.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: Friendship arises out of mere Companionship when two or more of the companions discover that they have in common some insight or interest or even taste which the others do not share and which, till that moment, each believed to be his own unique treasure (or burden). The typical expression of opening Friendship would be something like, What? You too? I thought I was the only one.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: The only sea I saw Was the seesaw sea With you riding on it. Lie down, lie easy. Let me shipwreck in your thighs.
item.author: Dylan Thomas

item.quote: Adrian smiled and clasped my hands, taking a few steps toward me. And as for who you are, youre the same beautiful, brave, and ridiculously smart caffeinated fighter youve been since the day I met you. Finally, he put beautiful at the top of his list of adjectives. Not that I should have cared.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: Sometimes I think my whole life has been about holding on to you.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: I want to love you without clutching, appreciate you without judging, join you without invading, invite you without demanding, leave you without guilt, criticize you without blaming, and help you without insulting. If I can have the same from you, then we can truly meet and enrich each other.
item.author: Virginia Satir

item.quote: You are my whole heart, Scarlet. And this is breaking it.'
item.author: A.C. Gaughen

item.quote: Love moderately. Long love doth so.
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: How far have you walked for men whove never held your feet in their laps?
item.author: Warsan Shire

item.quote: Sometimes I turn around and catch the smell of you and I cannot go on I cannot fucking go on without expressing this terrible so fucking awful physical aching fucking longing I have for you. And I cannot believe that I can feel this for you and you feel nothing. Do you feel nothing?
item.author: Sarah Kane

item.quote: Kids chase the love that eludes them.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: Do you ever just put your arms out and just spin and spin and spin? Well, that's what love is like; everything inside of you tells you to stop before you fall, but for some reason you just keep going.
item.author: Alice Hoffman

item.quote: It is easy to hate and it is difficult to love. This is how the whole scheme of things works. All good things are difficult to achieve; and bad things are very easy to get.
item.author: Confucius

item.quote: It wasn't a thing I had consciously missed, but having it now reminded me of the joy of it; that drowsy intimacy in which a man's body is accessible to you as your own, the strange shapes and textures of it like a sudden extension of your own limbs.
item.author: Diana Gabaldon

item.quote: Most people are slow to champion love because they fear the transformation it brings into their lives. And make no mistake about it: love does take over and transform the schemes and operations of our egos in a very mighty way.
item.author: Aberjhani

item.quote: The surest way to hurt yourself is to give up on love, just because it didnt
item.author: Amanda Howells

item.quote: Why me? she asked, holding on to him.
item.author: Annette Curtis Klause

item.quote: What made you fall in love with a prostitute?
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: If it's ka it'll come like a wind, and your plans will stand before it no more than a barn before a cyclone
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: Marriage must fight constantly against a monster which devours everything: routine.
item.author: Honore de Balzac

item.quote: He loved her for being so beautiful, and he hated her for it. He loved how she put shiny stuff on her lips for him, and he also reviled her for it. He wanted her to walk home alone, and he wanted to run after her and grab her up before she could take another step.
item.author: Ann Brashares

item.quote: He gripped her hard, forcing her to meet his eyes as he snarled, I see you. I see every part of you. And I am not afraid.
item.author: Sarah J. Maas

item.quote: Anatasia
item.author: E.L. James

item.quote: Nico studied his face his sea-green eyes, his grin, his ruffled black hair. Somehow Percy Jackson seemed like a regular guy now, not a mythical figure. Not someone to idolize or crush on.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Love brings to light a lover's noble and hidden qualities-his rare and exceptional traits: it is thus liable to be deceptive of his normal qualities.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: In definitiv, cu cat vei ridica un zid mai inalt in jurul tau cu atat va fi mai bun cel care-l va sari.
item.author: Tudor Chiril

item.quote: People die. Love endures.
item.author: Rick Yancey

item.quote: Look, I said, We knew Jason and Becky would be back, the break would end. This isn't a surprise, it's what's supposed to happen. It's what we wanted. Right?
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: I don't believe it,' Quince says with absolute certainty. ' I don't believe anything magical can make someone more in love.' [...] He looks me right in the eye as he says, 'Love is already the strongest magic in the world.
item.author: Tera Lynn Childs

item.quote: He loved her, he loved her, and until he'd loved her she had never minded being alone....
item.author: Truman Capote

item.quote: There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.
item.author: George Sand

item.quote: Its all about falling in love with yourself and sharing that love with someone who appreciates you, rather than looking for love to compensate for a self love deficit.
item.author: Eartha Kitt

item.quote: I believe this. When we meet those we fall in love with, there is an aspect of our spirit that is historian, a bit of a pedant who reminisces or remembers a meeting when the other has passed by innocentlybut all parts of the body must be ready for the other, all atoms must jump in one direction for desire to occur.
item.author: Michael Ondaatje

item.quote: And there is my payment the rubies in your cheeks. Are you properly scandalized by your wicked behavior? If you were Catholic, you'd singe the ears of the priest you confessed to. Do you remember making me swear to repeat all those naughty actions agian, no matter what you said this morning?
item.author: Jeaniene Frost

item.quote: Your love should never be offered to the mouth of a Stranger / Only to someone who has the valor and daring to cut pieces of their soul off with a knife / Then weave them into a blanket to protect you.
item.author: Hafiz

item.quote: She had a wild, wandering soul
item.author: Ariana Dancu

item.quote: If you love something let it go.. if it comes back its yours
item.author: James Patterson

item.quote: Ruby: ...What's so good about being 20? I call them the materialist years. The years we get distracted by all the bullshit. Then we cop on when we hit our 30s and spend those years trying to make up for the 20s. But your 40s? Those years are for enjoying it.
item.author: Cecelia Ahern

item.quote: Denna is a wild thing, I explained. Like a hind or a summer storm. If a storm blows down your house, or breaks a tree, you don't say the storm was mean. It was cruel. It acted according to its nature and something unfortunately was hurt. The same is true of Denna.
item.author: Patrick Rothfuss

item.quote: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
item.author: Michel de Montaigne

item.quote: Human existence is so fragile a thing and exposed to such dangers that I cannot love without trembling.
item.author: Simone Weil

item.quote: No, I do not want to be loved unconditionally. I want to be shown when I am treating you less than you deserve. I want you to leave if I ever start making you promises I do not see through. Love me for my flaws, yes, but dont you dare ever allow them to hurt you.
item.author: Beau Taplin

item.quote: Borges said there are only four stories to tell: a love story between two people, a love story between three people, the struggle for power and the voyage. All of us writers rewrite these same stories ad infinitum.
item.author: Paolo Coelho

item.quote: I believe that love--not imitation--is the sincerest form of flattery. Your imitator thinks that you can be duplicated; your lover knows you can't.
item.author: Marilyn Vos Savant

item.quote: We love men because they can never fake orgasms, even if they wanted to.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Whenever you are ready, or if you never are, my heart is yours, until Death do us part. Whatever that may mean when consorting with one of Deaths handmaidens.
item.author: R.L. LaFevers

item.quote: I prayed for all his dreams to come true. I prayed that I would always be able to connect with him--even if I was no longer on earth.
item.author: Alexandra Adornetto

item.quote: No you sick, stupid creep, I love you. I shouldn't. I shouldn't. You're sick inside, Caine, sick! But I love you.
item.author: Michael Grant

item.quote: In the vastness of space and the immensity of time, it is my joy to share a planet and an epoch with Annie.
item.author: Carl Sagan

item.quote: Real love finds you once, if you're lucky.
item.author: Ellen Hopkins

item.quote: Just because you love someone, doesn't mean you have to be involved with them. Love is not a bandage to cover wounds.
item.author: Hugh Elliott

item.quote: Love is an engraved invitation to grief.
item.author: Sunshine O'Donnell

item.quote: Grief is like the ocean; it comes on waves ebbing and flowing. Sometimes the water is calm, and sometimes it is overwhelming. All we can do is learn to swim.
item.author: Vicki Harrison

item.quote: Fall in love with someone
item.author: Nikita Gill

item.quote: I'm afraid they're in love, he said, concerned. They don't want to leave you. He lifted one hand from her waist to gently brush a pair from her neck, where their wings fanned against her jaw. Melancholy, he said, I know just how they feel.
item.author: Laini Taylor

item.quote: He studied my appearance carefully. You cut your hair. Yes. Do you like it? That depends. How long is it? I pulled a curl down and showed him it ended just past my shoulder. He grunted, Thats still long enough, so I like it. Long enough for what? Long enough for a man to run his hands through.
item.author: Colleen Houck

item.quote: Maybe you expected marriage to be perfect - I guess that's where you and I are different. See, I thought it would be all about making mistakes, but doing it with someone who's there to remind you what you learned along the way.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: Here are the things I want for you -
item.author: Lang Leav

item.quote: In love, as in life, one misheard word can be tremendously important. If you tell someone you love them, for instance, you must be absolutely certain that they have replied I love you back and not I love your back before you continue the conversation.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: You know I love you right?
item.author: Stephenie Meyer

item.quote: Value your parabatai, he said. For it is a precious bond. All love is precious. It is why we do what we do. Why do we fight demons? Why are they not fit custodians of this world? What makes us better? It is because they do not build, but destroy. They do not love, but hate only. We are human and fallible, we Shadowhunters. But if we did not have the capability to love, we could not guard humans; we must love to guard them. My parabatai, he loved like few ever could love, with all and everything. I see you are like that too; it burns more brightly in you than the fire of Heaven
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Lift your hips for me, love.
item.author: Tahereh Mafi

item.quote: Tomas did not realize at the time that metaphors are dangerous. Metaphors are not to be trifled with. A single metaphor can give birth to love.
item.author: Milan Kundera

item.quote: I love you, I thought. But I didnt say it. It was not that I feared she would laugh in my face. She was far too kind for that. My fear was a greater one that she wont say it back.
item.author: Alex Flinn

item.quote: In this here place, we flesh; flesh that weeps, laughs; flesh that dances on bare feet in grass. Love it. Love it hard. Yonder they do not love your flesh. They despise it. They don't love your eyes; they'd just as soon pick em out. No more do they love the skin on your back. Yonder they flay it. And O my people they do not love your hands. Those they only use, tie, bind, chop off and leave empty. Love your hands! Love them. Raise them up and kiss them. Touch others with them, pat them together, stroke them on your face 'cause they don't love that either. You got to love it, you! And no, they ain't in love with your mouth. Yonder, out there, they will see it broken and break it again. What you say out of it they will not heed. What you scream from it they do not hear. What you put into it to nourish your body they will snatch away and give you leavins instead. No, they don't love your mouth. You got to love it. This is flesh I'm talking about here. Flesh that needs to be loved. Feet that need to rest and to dance; backs that need support; shoulders that need arms, strong arms I'm telling you. And O my people, out yonder, hear me, they do not love your neck unnoosed and straight. So love your neck; put a hand on it, grace it, stroke it and hold it up. and all your inside parts that they'd just as soon slop for hogs, you got to love them. The dark, dark liver--love it, love it and the beat and beating heart, love that too. More than eyes or feet. More than lungs that have yet to draw free air. More than your life-holding womb and your life-giving private parts, hear me now, love your heart. For this is the prize.
item.author: Toni Morrison

item.quote: ...mencintai itu, kadang mengumpulkan segala tabiat menyebalkan dari seseorang yang engkau cintai, memakinya, merasa tak sanggup lagi menjadi yang terbaik untuk dirinya, dan berpikir tak ada lagi jalan kembali, tapi tetap saja engkau tak sanggup benar-benar meninggalkannya.
item.author: Tasaro

item.quote: Maybe we shouldn't be looking for love. Maybe we should be looking for a person. Because maybe you can find love in a person, but not have that person. So if you look for love, what you will find is love. But if you want to belong to someone, and you want someone to belong to you, you should look for a person.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: Time is how you spend your love.
item.author: Zadie Smith

item.quote: When love beckons to you, follow him,
item.author: Kahlil Gibran

item.quote: I know I want you, he heard himself say, all his vows and his honor all forgotten. She stood before him naked as her name day, and he was as hard as the rock around them. He had been in her half a hundred times by now, but always beneath furs, with others all around them. He had never seeen how beautiful she was. Her legs were skinny and well muscled, the hair at the juncture of her thighs a brighter red than that on her head. Does that make it even luckier? He pulled her close.
item.author: George R.R. Martin

item.quote: Having an eye for beauty isn't the same thing as a weakness...except possibly when it comes to you.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: It's clear to me now that I have been moving toward you and you toward me for a long time. Though neither of us was aware of the other before we met, there was a kind of mindless certainty bumming blithely along beneath our ignorance that ensured we would come together. Like two solitary birds flying the great prairies by celestial reckoning, all of these years and lifetimes we have been moving toward one another.
item.author: Robert James Waller

item.quote: I never wanted to have anything in my life that I couldn't stand losing. But it's too late for that.
item.author: Audrey Niffenegger

item.quote: Love should be treated like a business deal, but every business deal has its own terms and its own currency. And in love, the currency is virtue. You love people not for what you do for them or what they do for you. You love them for the values, the virtues, which they have achieved in their own character.
item.author: Ayn Rand

item.quote: I can hate you more, but I'll never love you less.
item.author: Michael Morpurgo

item.quote: You know, he said, under normal circumstances, you inviting me to the bedroom would be the highlight of my day.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: I never understood how men could remember all those details about sports but, yet, were incapable of remembering where they set their car keys or wallet.
item.author: Tina Reber

item.quote: My lover asks me:
item.author: Nizar Qabbani

item.quote: I have come to the conclusion never again to think of marrying, and for this reason, I can never be satisfied with anyone who would be blockhead enough to have me.
item.author: Abraham Lincoln

item.quote: Love, too, has to be learned.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: Falling in love should be the easiest thing in the world, but it's not.
item.author: Rachel Hawthorne

item.quote: It's delicious to have people adore you, but it's exhausting, too. Particularly when your own feelings don't match theirs.
item.author: Tasha Alexander

item.quote: You are enough to drive a saint to madness or a king to his knees.
item.author: Grace Willows

item.quote: Wow. I didnt think it was possible for him to look any more intoxicating than he already did. But a leather clad Ren standing next to the gorgeous racing motorcycle holding his helmet made my brain go numb. I had kind of a this-is-your-brain-on-drugs moment, only mine was more like a this-is-your-brain-on-seeing-Ren-in-tight-leather moment. If theyd been smart, the Ducati Company should have used him in a commercial and given him the bike for free.
item.author: Colleen Houck

item.quote: I wished it was raining, he said.
item.author: Benjamin Alire Senz

item.quote: I'm not so stupid as to believe that you've completely forgotten about your former boyfriend. I know you think there are others here more suited for me and this life, and I wouldn't want you to rush into trying to be happy with any of this. I just... I just want to know if it's possible...
item.author: Kiera Cass

item.quote: You think I'm pretty
item.author: Katy Perry

item.quote: Yes, St. Claire. I like you. But I can't say it aloud, because he's my friend. And friends don't let other friends make drunken declarations and expect them to act upon them the next day
item.author: Stephanie Perkins

item.quote: Love heals scars love left
item.author: Henry Rollins

item.quote: Sometimes you know in your heart you love someone, but you have to go away before your head can figure it out.
item.author: Sharon Creech

item.quote: You don't need another Human Being to make your life complete, but let's be honest. Having your wounds kissed by someone who doesn't see them as disasters In your soul, but cracks to put their love into, Is the most calming thing In this World.
item.author: Emery Allen

item.quote: The most difficult aspect of moving on is accepting that the other person already did.
item.author: Faraaz Kazi

item.quote: What you are to do without me I cannot imagine.
item.author: George Bernard Shaw

item.quote: The strategic adversary is fascism... the fascism in us all, in our heads and in our everyday behavior, the fascism that causes us to love power, to desire the very thing that dominates and exploits us.
item.author: Michel Foucault

item.quote: I loved you long before you loved me. It's the only thing I have you beat at, and I'll bring it up every chance I get.
item.author: Becca Fitzpatrick

item.quote: Doubt thou the stars are fire;
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: It's the most wonderful and terrible thing that can ever happen to you, she said simply. You know that you've found something amazing, and you want to hold on to it forever; and every second after you have it, you fear the moment you might lose it.
item.author: Kiera Cass

item.quote: The great love is gone. There are still little loves - friend to friend, brother to sister, student to teacher. Will you deny yourself comfort at the hearthfire of a cottage because you may no longer sit by the fireplace of a palace? Will you deny yourself to those who reach out to you in hopes of warming themselves at your hearthfire?
item.author: Mercedes Lackey

item.quote: I'm with you. No matter what else you have in your head I'm with you and I love you.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: Know that it is a corpse who loves you and adores you and will never, never leave you!...Look, I am not laughing now, crying, crying for you, Christine, who have torn off my mask and who therefore can never leave me again!...Oh, mad Christine, who wanted to see me!
item.author: Gaston Leroux

item.quote: When you really love someone, you see all their mess and their brokenness and you love them anyway. In fact, seeing all of that sort of makes you love them more.
item.author: Heather Hepler Love Maybe

item.quote: I miss everything about you
item.author: Colbie Caillat

item.quote: In God there is no hunger that needs to be filled, only plenteousness that desires to give.
item.author: C.S. Lewis
