item.quote: But when it came right down to it, the skin of my wrist looked so white and defensless that I couldn't do it. It was as if what I wanted to kill wasn't in that skin or the thin blue pulse that jumped under my thumb, but somewhere else, deeper, more secret, and a whole lot harder to get.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much
item.author: Helen Keller

item.quote: My body is my journal, and my tattoos are my story.
item.author: Johnny Depp

item.quote: He was mastered by the sheer surging of life, the tidal wave of being, the perfect joy of each separate muscle, joint, and sinew in that it was everything that was not death, that it was aglow and rampant, expressing itself in movement, flying exultantly under the stars.
item.author: Jack London

item.quote: Oh, Life, I am yours. Whatever it is you want of me, I am ready to give.
item.author: William Steig

item.quote: Smile more. Smiling can make you and others happy.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: What's done is done. What's gone is gone. One of life's lessons is always moving on. Its okay to look back to see how far youve come but keep moving forward.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Never stop dreaming,
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Who says life is fair, where is that written?
item.author: William Goldman

item.quote: How much I missed, simply because I was afraid of missing it.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Sleep my little baby-oh
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: How can I be reasonable? To me our love was everything and you were my whole life. It is not very pleasant to realize that to you it was only an episode.
item.author: W. Somerset Maugham

item.quote: Throughout life people will make you mad, disrespect you and treat you bad. Let God deal with the things they do, cause hate in your heart will consume you too.
item.author: Will Smith

item.quote: You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: We have to create culture, don't watch TV, don't read magazines, don't even listen to NPR. Create your own roadshow. The nexus of space and time where you are now is the most immediate sector of your universe, and if you're worrying about Michael Jackson or Bill Clinton or somebody else, then you are disempowered, you're giving it all away to icons, icons which are maintained by an electronic media so that you want to dress like X or have lips like Y. This is shit-brained, this kind of thinking. That is all cultural diversion, and what is real is you and your friends and your associations, your highs, your orgasms, your hopes, your plans, your fears. And we are told 'no', we're unimportant, we're peripheral. 'Get a degree, get a job, get a this, get a that.' And then you're a player, you don't want to even play in that game. You want to reclaim your mind and get it out of the hands of the cultural engineers who want to turn you into a half-baked moron consuming all this trash that's being manufactured out of the bones of a dying world.
item.author: Terence McKenna

item.quote: I will not try to convince you to love me, to respect me, to commit to me. I deserve better than that; I AM BETTER THAN THAT...Goodbye.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Human life is but a series of footnotes to a vast obscure unfinished masterpiece
item.author: Vladimir Nabokov

item.quote: Nothing can disturb your peace of mind unless you allow it to.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Often, its not about becoming a new person, but becoming the person you were meant to be, and already are, but dont know how to be.
item.author: Heath L. Buckmaster

item.quote: Friends are the family you choose (~ Nin/Ithilnin, Elven rogue).
item.author: Jess C Scott

item.quote: The whole of life is just like watching a film. Only it's as though you always get in ten minutes after the big picture has started, and no-one will tell you the plot, so you have to work it out all yourself from the clues.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: You must not ever stop being whimsical. And you must not, ever, give anyone else the responsibility for your life.
item.author: Mary Oliver

item.quote: Then, one stupid person, no different from any other stupid person, wanders into your stupid life...you give them a piece of you. They don't ask for it. They do something dumb one day like kiss you or smile at you, and then your life isn't your own anymore.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: The strongest people find the courage and caring to help others, even if they are going through their own storm.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Time takes it all, whether you want it to or not.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: To perceive is to suffer.
item.author: Aristotle

item.quote: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
item.author: Elbert Hubbard

item.quote: I'm the most terrific liar you ever saw in your life. It's awful. If I'm on my way to the store to buy a magazine, even, and somebody asks me where I'm going, I'm liable to say I'm going to the opera. It's terrible.
item.author: J.D. Salinger

item.quote: Magic exists. Who can doubt it, when there are rainbows and wildflowers, the music of the wind and the silence of the stars? Anyone who has loved has been touched by magic. It is such a simple and such an extraordinary part of the lives we live.
item.author: Nora Roberts

item.quote: My one regret in life is that I am not someone else.
item.author: Woody Allen

item.quote: Life is a comedy to those who think, a tragedy to those who feel.
item.author: Jean Racine

item.quote: Oh the places you'll go! There is fun to be done! There are points to be scored. There are games to be won. And the magical things you can do with that ball will make you the winning-est winner of all.
item.author: Dr. Seuss

item.quote: You never know what's around the corner. It could be everything. Or it could be nothing. You keep putting one foot in front of the other, and then one day you look back and you've climbed a mountain.
item.author: Tom Hiddleston

item.quote: People are unhappy when they get something too easily. You have to sweat--that's the only moral they know.
item.author: Dany Laferrire

item.quote: The biggest wall you have to climb is the one you build in your mind: Never let your mind talk you out of your dreams, trick you into giving up. Never let your mind become the greatest obstacle to success. To get your mind on the right track, the rest will follow.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Sometimes all a person wants is an empathetic ear; all he or she needs is to talk it out. Just offering a listening ear and an understanding heart for his or her suffering can be a big comfort.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Everyone you meet is a part of your journey, but not all of them are meant to stay in your life. Some people are just passing through to bring you gifts; either they're blessings or lessons.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Do not let arrogance go to your head and despair to your heart; do not let compliments go to your head and criticisms to your heart; do not let success go to your head and failure to your heart.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Learning to let go should be learned before learning to get. Life should be touched, not strangled. Youve got to relax, let it happen at times, and at others move forward with it.
item.author: Ray Bradbury

item.quote: Keep your best wishes, close to your heart and watch what happens
item.author: Tony DeLiso

item.quote: Life ... is a tale
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: Make a pact with yourself today to not be defined by your past. Sometimes the greatest thing to come out of all your hard work isn't what you get for it, but what you become for it. Shake things up today! Be You...Be Free...Share.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: I can't decide whether I'm a good girl wrapped up in a bad girl, or if I'm a bad girl wrapped up in a good girl. And that's how I know I'm a woman!
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: This is the real secret of life -- to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.
item.author: Alan Watts

item.quote: When it's over, I want to say: all my life
item.author: Mary Oliver

item.quote: Kindness is not a business. True kindness expects nothing in return and should never act with conditions.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: He's not your prince charming if he doesn't make sure you know that you're his princess.
item.author: Demi Lovato

item.quote: We leave something of ourselves behind when we leave a place, we stay there, even though we go away. And there are things in us that we can find again only by going back there.
item.author: Pascal Mercier

item.quote: We'd start slow, the way we always did, because the run, and the game, could go on for awhile. Maybe even forever.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: When you can live forever what do you live for?
item.author: Stephenie Meyer

item.quote: Its never an insult to be called what somebody thinks is a bad name. It just shows you how poor that person is, it doesnt hurt you.
item.author: Harper Lee

item.quote: When you run with the Doctor, it feels like it'll never end. But however hard you try you can't run forever. Everybody knows that everybody dies and nobody knows it like the Doctor. But I do think that all the skies of all the worlds might just turn dark if he ever for one moment, accepts it. Everybody knows that everybody dies. But not every day. Not today. Some days are special. Some days are so, so blessed. Some days, nobody dies at all. (In the library, the Doctor walks back to the TARDIS. He stops, looking at the doors. Then he raises his hand, and stands there poised like that for a long moment. Finally he snaps his fingers. The doors open. He smiles slowly and walks in, joining Donna. Then he snaps his fingers again, and the doors close. River's voice continues over this.) Now and then, every once in a very long while, every day in a million days, when the wind stands fair, and the Doctor comes to call... everybody lives.
item.author: Steven Moffat

item.quote: Were here, and then were gone, and its not about the time were here, but what we do with the time.
item.author: Rick Yancey

item.quote: Do not wait for the last judgment. It comes every day.
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: Don't leave a piece of jewelry at his house so you can go back and get it later; he may be with his real girlfriend.
item.author: Amy Sedaris

item.quote: Don't be too timid and squeamish about your actions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: Romance novels are birthday cake and life is often peanut butter and jelly. I think everyone should have lots of delicious romance novels lying around for those times when the peanut butter of life gets stuck to the roof of your mouth.
item.author: Janet Evanovich

item.quote: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.
item.author: Steve Jobs

item.quote: When Great Trees Fall
item.author: Maya Angelou

item.quote: It has always seemed strange to me...The things we admire in men, kindness and generosity, openness, honesty, understanding and feeling, are the concomitants of failure in our system. And those traits we detest, sharpness, greed, acquisitiveness, meanness, egotism and self-interest, are the traits of success. And while men admire the quality of the first they love the produce of the second.
item.author: John Steinbeck

item.quote: Happiness is not a goal...it's a by-product of a life well lived.
item.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

item.quote: You were given life; it is your duty (and also your entitlement as a human being) to find something beautiful within life, no matter how slight.
item.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

item.quote: However mean your life is, meet it and live it; do not shun it and call it hard names. It is not so bad as you are. It looks poorest when you are richest. The fault-finder will find faults even in paradise. Love your life, poor as it is. You may perhaps have some pleasant, thrilling, glorious hours, even in a poorhouse.
item.author: Henry David Thoreau

item.quote: Our lives are not as limited as we think they are; the world is a wonderfully weird place; consensual reality is significantly flawed; no institution can be trusted, but love does work; all things are possible; and we all could be happy and fulfilled if we only had the guts to be truly free and the wisdom to shrink our egos and quit taking ourselves so damn seriously.
item.author: Tom Robbins

item.quote: Count your blessings, not your problems. Count your own blessings, not someone else's. Remember that jealousy is when you count someone else's blessings instead of your own.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: A smile puts you on the right track. A smile makes the world a beautiful place. When you lose your smile, you lose your way in the chaos of life.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Patience Is Not the Ability to Wait:
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Guard well your thoughts when alone and your words when accompanied.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Each day brings new opportunities, allowing you to constantly live with lovebe there for othersbring a little light into someone's day. Be grateful and live each day to the fullest.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: You are unique. You have different talents and abilities. You dont have to always follow in the footsteps of others. And most important, you should always remind yourself that you don't have to do what everyone else is doing and have a responsibility to develop the talents you have been given.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I'm not in search of sanctity, sacredness, purity; these things are found after this life, not in this life; but in this life I search to be completely human: to feel, to give, to take, to laugh, to get lost, to be found, to dance, to love and to lust, to be so human.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: nothing in this world was more difficult than love.
item.author: Gabriel Garca Mrquez

item.quote: Perfectionism is the voice of the oppressor, the enemy of the people. It will keep you cramped and insane your whole life, and it is the main obstacle between you and a shitty first draft. I think perfectionism is based on the obsessive belief that if you run carefully enough, hitting each stepping-stone just right, you won't have to die. The truth is that you will die anyway and that a lot of people who aren't even looking at their feet are going to do a whole lot better than you, and have a lot more fun while they're doing it.
item.author: Anne Lamott

item.quote: Courage is feeling fear, not getting rid of fear, and taking action in the face of fear.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Man is a mystery. It needs to be unravelled, and if you spend your whole life unravelling it, don't say that you've wasted time. I am studying that mystery because I want to be a human being.
item.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.quote: My father had taught me to be nice first, because you can always be mean later, but once you've been mean to someone, they won't believe the nice anymore. So be nice, be nice, until it's time to stop being nice, then destroy them.
item.author: Laurell K. Hamilton

item.quote: You are in charge of your own happiness; you don't need to wait for other people's permission to be happy.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
item.author: Marcus Aurelius

item.quote: Perfectionism is the enemy of happiness. Embrace being perfectly imperfect. Learn from your mistakes and forgive yourself, youll be happier. We make mistakes because we are imperfect. Learn from your mistakes, forgive yourself, and keep moving forward.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Spring passes and one remembers one's innocence.
item.author: Yoko Ono

item.quote: It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: There are people who are generic. They make generic responses and they expect generic answers. They live inside a box and they think people who don't fit into their box are weird. But I'll tell you what, generic people are the weird people. They are like genetically-manipulated plants growing inside a laboratory, like indistinguishable faces, like droids. Like ignorance.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: When the going gets weird, the weird turn professional.
item.author: Hunter S. Thompson

item.quote: My life didn't please me, so I created my life.
item.author: Coco Chanel

item.quote: One swing set, well worn but structurally sound, seeks new home. Make memories with your kid or kids so that someday he or she or they will look into the backyard and feel the ache of sentimentality as desperately as I did this afternoon. It's all fragile and fleeting, dear reader, but with this swing set, your child(ren) will be introduced to the ups and downs of human life gently and safely, and may also learn the most important lesson of all: No matter how hard you kick, no matter how high you get, you can't go all the way around.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Life was meant to be lived, and curiosity must be kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.
item.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

item.quote: Life is a series of pulls back and forth... A tension of opposites, like a pull on a rubber band. Most of us live somewhere in the middle. A wrestling match...Which side win? Love wins. Love always wins
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: The only way to survive eternity is to be able to appreciate each moment.
item.author: Lauren Kate

item.quote: No! Try not. Do, or do not. There is no try.
item.author: George Lucas

item.quote: There's nothing more embarrassing than to have earned the disfavor of a perceptive animal.
item.author: Michael Chabon

item.quote: Action expresses priorities.
item.author: Mahatma Gandhi

item.quote: Your life is an occasion. Rise to it.
item.author: Suzanne Weyn

item.quote: Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass...It's about learning to dance in the rain.
item.author: Vivian Greene

item.quote: You cannot change anyone, but you can be the reason someone changes.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: The surest way to make your dreams come true is to live them.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: To have what you have never had, you have to do what you have never done.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Live the Life of Your Dreams
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I know it seems hard sometimes but remember one thing. Through every dark night, there's a bright day after that. So no matter how hard it get, stick your chest out, keep ya head up.... and handle it.
item.author: Tupac Shakur

item.quote: Sacrifice is a part of life. It's supposed to be. It's not something to regret. It's something to aspire to.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: You Are the Master of Your Attitude
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I was always an unusual girl.
item.author: Lana Del Rey

item.quote: Bottom line is, even if you see 'em coming, you're not ready for the big moments. No one asks for their life to change, not really. But it does. So what are we, helpless? Puppets? No. The big moments are gonna come. You can't help that. It's what you do afterwards that counts. That's when you find out who you are.
item.author: Joss Whedon

item.quote: Tears, idle tears, I know not what they mean,
item.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.quote: Whenever something bad happens, keep calm, take a few deep breaths and shift the focus to something positive.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: There are ships sailing to many ports, but not a single one goes where life is not painful.
item.author: Fernando Pessoa

item.quote: Life, although it may only be an accumulation of anguish, is dear to me, and I will defend it.
item.author: Mary Shelley

item.quote: I love that you get cold when it's 71 degrees out. I love that it takes you an hour and a half to order a sandwich. I love that you get a little crinkle above your nose when you're looking at me like I'm nuts. I love that after I spend the day with you, I can still smell your perfume on my clothes. And I love that you are the last person I want to talk to before I go to sleep at night. And it's not because I'm lonely, and it's not because it's New Year's Eve. I came here tonight because when you realize you want to spend the rest of your life with somebody, you want the rest of your life to start as soon as possible.
item.author: Nora Ephron

item.quote: I see it all perfectly; there are two possible situations one can either do this or that. My honest opinion and my friendly advice is this: do it or do not do it you will regret both.
item.author: Soren Kierkegaard

item.quote: I just wanted to tell you that I understand if you go. Its okay if you have to leave us. Its okay if you want to stop fighting.
item.author: Gayle Forman

item.quote: You don't have to disrespect and insult others simply to hold your own ground. If you do, that shows how shaky your own position is.
item.author: Red Haircrow

item.quote: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.
item.author: Thomas Merton

item.quote: I don't want to achieve immortality through my work; I want to achieve immortality through not dying. I don't want to live on in the hearts of my countrymen; I want to live on in my apartment.
item.author: Woody Allen

item.quote: Growing up happens when you start having things you look back on and wish you could change -Clary Fray
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Knowledge, like air, is vital to life. Like air, no one should be denied it.
item.author: Alan Moore

item.quote: It wasnt my day. My week. My month. My year. My life. God damn it.
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: Of all creatures that breathe and move upon the earth, nothing is bred that is weaker than man.
item.author: Homer

item.quote: I have always, essentially, been waiting. Waiting to become something else, waiting to be that person I always thought I was on the verge of becoming, waiting for that life I thought I would have. In my head, I was always one step away. In high school, I was biding my time until I could become the college version of myself, the one my mind could see so clearly. In college, the post-college adult person was always looming in front of me, smarter, stronger, more organized. Then the married person, then the person Id become when we have kids. For twenty years, literally, I have waited to become the thin version of myself, because thats when life will really begin.
item.author: Shauna Niequist

item.quote: I have often wished I had time to cultivate modesty...But I am too busy thinking about myself.
item.author: Edith Sitwell

item.quote: Every woman that finally figured out her worth, has picked up her suitcases of pride and boarded a flight to freedom, which landed in the valley of change.
item.author: Shannon L. Alder

item.quote: People say that eyes are windows to the soul.
item.author: Khaled Hosseini

item.quote: I feel that life is divided into the horrible and the miserable. That's the two categories. The horrible are like, I don't know, terminal cases, you know, and blind people, crippled. I don't know how they get through life. It's amazing to me. And the miserable is everyone else. So you should be thankful that you're miserable, because that's very lucky, to be miserable.
item.author: Woody Allen

item.quote: People, Geralt turned his head, like to invent monsters and monstrosities. Then they seem less monstrous themselves. When they get blind-drunk, cheat, steal, beat their wives, starve an old woman, when they kill a trapped fox with an axe or riddle the last existing unicorn with arrows, they like to think that the Bane entering cottages at daybreak is more monstrous than they are. They feel better then. They find it easier to live.
item.author: Andrzej Sapkowski

item.quote: Being grateful does not mean that everything is necessarily good. It just means that you can accept it as a gift.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: If you hang out with chickens, you're going to cluck and if you hang out with eagles, you're going to fly.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Get Off The Scale!
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: How would your life be different ifYou walked away from gossip and verbal defamation? Let today be the dayYou speak only the good you know of other people and encourage others to do the same.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: The best thing, though, in that museum was that everything always stayed right where it was. Nobody'd move. You could go there a hundred thousand times, and that Eskimo would still be just finished catching those two fish, the birds would still be on their way south, the deers would still be drinking out of that water hole, with their pretty antlers and they're pretty, skinny legs, and that squaw with the naked bosom would still be weaving that same blanket. Nobody's be different. The only thing that would be different would be you. Not that you'd be so much older or anything. It wouldn't be that, exactly. You'd just be different, that's all. You'd have an overcoat this time. Or the kid that was your partner in line the last time had got scarlet fever and you'd have a new partner. Or you'd have a substitute taking the class, instead of Miss Aigletinger. Or you'd heard your mother and father having a terrific fight in the bathroom. Or you'd just passed by one of those puddles in the street with gasoline rainbows in them. I mean you'd be different in some wayI can't explain what I mean. And even if I could, I'm not sure I'd feel like it.
item.author: J.D. Salinger

item.quote: There is nothing more frightful than ignorance in action.
item.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.quote: Your conscience is the measure of the honesty of your selfishness.
item.author: Richard Bach

item.quote: Our lives are defined by opportunities, even the ones we miss.
item.author: Eric Roth

item.quote: Sure, we'd faced some things as children that a lot of kids don't. Sure, Justin had qualified for his Junior de Sade Badge in his teaching methods for dealing with pain. We still hadn't learned, though, that growing up is all about getting hurt. And then getting over it. You hurt. You recover. You move on. Odds are pretty good you're just going to get hurt again. But each time, you learn something.
item.author: Jim Butcher

item.quote: When two people are under the influence of the most violent, most insane, most delusive, and most transient of passions, they are required to swear that they will remain in that excited, abnormal, and exhausting condition continuously until death do them part.
item.author: George Bernard Shaw

item.quote: Very occasionally, if you pay really close attention, life doesn't suck.
item.author: Joss Whedon

item.quote: It was always the becoming he dreamed of, never the being.
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: Yea, all things live forever, though at times they sleep and are forgotten.
item.author: H. Rider Haggard

item.quote: You do not immortalize the lost by writing about them. Language buries, but does not resurrect.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: The story of life is quicker than the wink of an eye, the story of love is hello and goodbye...until we meet again
item.author: Jimi Hendrix

item.quote: Who are you?
item.author: Lana Del Rey

item.quote: I have no idea what's awaiting me, or what will happen when this all ends. For the moment I know this: there are sick people and they need curing.
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: Don't think about making life better for other people who don't even deserve you, rather, focus on making your life the best, for yourself and those who love you.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: If you've never eaten while crying you don t know what life tastes like.
item.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.quote: You never knew the last time you were seeing someone. You didn't know when the last argument happened, or the last time you had sex, or the last time you looked into their eyes and thanked God they were in your life.
item.author: J.R. Ward

item.quote: Cynics are simply thwarted romantics.
item.author: William Goldman

item.quote: Prime numbers are what is left when you have taken all the patterns away. I think prime numbers are like life. They are very logical but you could never work out the rules, even if you spent all your time thinking about them.
item.author: Mark Haddon

item.quote: The person in life that you will always be with the most, is yourself. Because even when you are with others, you are still with yourself, too! When you wake up in the morning, you are with yourself, laying in bed at night you are with yourself, walking down the street in the sunlight you are with yourself.What kind of person do you want to walk down the street with? What kind of person do you want to wake up in the morning with? What kind of person do you want to see at the end of the day before you fall asleep? Because that person is yourself, and it's your responsibility to be that person you want to be with. I know I want to spend my life with a person who knows how to let things go, who's not full of hate, who's able to smile and be carefree. So that's who I have to be.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: Remember that everyone you meet is afraid of something, loves something and has lost something.
item.author: H. Jackson Brown

item.quote: Even for me life had its gleams of sunshine.
item.author: Charlotte Bront

item.quote: The person you became with her is worth being.
item.author: Veronica Roth

item.quote: If there were such a thing as terminal literalism, you'd have died in childhood.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Always have a willing hand to help someone, you might be the only one that does.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Great leaders create more leaders, not followers.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Dont sacrifice yourself too much, because if you sacrifice too much theres nothing else you can give and nobody will care for you.
item.author: Karl Lagerfeld

item.quote: Renew, release, let go. Yesterdays gone. Theres nothing you can do to bring it back. You cant shouldve done something. You can only DO something. Renew yourself. Release that attachment. Today is a new day!
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Just living is not enough, said the butterfly, one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
item.author: Hans Christian Anderson

item.quote: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others.
item.author: Brian Tracy

item.quote: How far that little candle throws his beams! So shines a good deed in a weary world.
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: A fit, healthy bodythat is the best fashion statement
item.author: Jess C Scott

item.quote: The best of us must sometimes eat our words.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Closed in a room, my imagination becomes the universe, and the rest of the world is missing out.
item.author: Criss Jami

item.quote: I would rather be ashes than dust!
item.author: Jack London

item.quote: Forget yesterday - it has already forgotten you. Don't sweat tomorrow - you haven't even met. Instead, open your eyes and your heart to a truly precious gift - today.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: There are no random acts...We are all connected...You can no more separate one life from another than you can separate a breeze from the wind...
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: Life is like a novel. It's filled with suspense. You have no idea what is going to happen until you turn the page.
item.author: sidney sheldon

item.quote: I woke up as the sun was reddening; and that was the one distinct time in my life, the strangest moment of all, when I didn't know who I was - I was far away from home, haunted and tired with travel, in a cheap hotel room I'd never seen, hearing the hiss of steam outside, and the creak of the old wood of the hotel, and footsteps upstairs, and all the sad sounds, and I looked at the cracked high ceiling and really didn't know who I was for about fifteen strange seconds. I wasn't scared; I was just somebody else, some stranger, and my whole life was a haunted life, the life of a ghost.
item.author: Jack Kerouac

item.quote: Choosing a path meant having to miss out on others. She had a whole life to live, and she was always thinking that, in the future, she might regret the choices she made now. Im afraid of committing myself, she thought to herself. She wanted to follow all possible paths and so ended up following none. Even in that most important area of her life, love, she had failed to commit herself. After her first romantic disappointment, she had never again given herself entirely. She feared pan, loss, and separation. These things were inevitable on the path to love, and the only way of avoiding them was by deciding not to take that path at all. In order not to suffer, you had to renounce love. It was like putting out your own eyes not to see the bad things in life.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: I think that the best thing we can do for our children is to allow them to do things for themselves, allow them to be strong, allow them to experience life on their own terms, allow them to take the subway... let them be better people, let them believe more in themselves.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: Dont let others tell you what you cant do. Don't let the limitations of others limit your vision. If you can remove your self-doubt and believe in yourself, you can achieve what you never thought possible.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: There comes a time in your life when you have to choose to turn the page, write another book or simply close it.
item.author: Shannon L. Alder

item.quote: It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!
item.author: Robert T. Kiyosaki

item.quote: Oh, don't cry, I'm so sorry I cheated so much, but that's the way things are.
item.author: Vladimir Nabokov

item.quote: Life is funny. Things change, people change, but you will always be you, so stay true to yourself and never sacrifice who you are for anyone.
item.author: Zayn Malik

item.quote: We are all connected; To each other, biologically. To the earth, chemically. To the rest of the universe atomically.
item.author: Neil DeGrasse Tyson

item.quote: There were five others before they got to him. He smiled a little when his turn came. His voice was low, smoky, and dead sexy. My name is Augustus Waters, he said. Im seventeen. I had a little touch of osteosarcoma a year and a half ago, but Im just here today at Isaacs request.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: I don't think that there are any limits to how excellent we could make life seem.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: Art is the proper task of life.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
item.author: Marcus Aurelius

item.quote: Do not ask your children
item.author: William Martin

item.quote: All human beings have three lives: public, private, and secret.
item.author: Gabriel Garca Mrquez

item.quote: Life, with its rules, its obligations, and its freedoms, is like a sonnet: You're given the form, but you have to write the sonnet yourself. - Mrs. Whatsit
item.author: Madeleine L'Engle

item.quote: Just keep moving forward and don't give a shit about what anybody thinks. Do what you have to do, for you.
item.author: Johnny Depp

item.quote: But I don't believe that life is supposed to make you feel good, or to make you feel miserable either. Life is just supposed to make you feel.
item.author: Gloria Naylor

item.quote: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: Life will not break your heart. It'll crush it.
item.author: Henry Rollins

item.quote: For I have known them all already, known them all
item.author: T.S. Eliot

item.quote: It does not matter how long you are spending on the earth, how much money you have gathered or how much attention you have received. It is the amount of positive vibration you have radiated in life that matters,
item.author: Amit Ray

item.quote: There is a time for everything, and a season for every activity under heaven:
item.author: Anonymous

item.quote: There are, it has been said, two types of people in the world. There are those who, when presented with a glass that is exactly half full, say: this glass is half full. And then there are those who say: this glass is half empty.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors for you where there were only walls.
item.author: Joseph Campbell

item.quote: Nobody wants to be here and nobody wants to leave.
item.author: Cormac McCarthy

item.quote: The truth is that the world is full of dragons, and none of us are as powerful or cool as wed like to be. And that sucks. But when youre confronted with that fact, you can either crawl into a hole and quit, or you can get out there, take off your shoes, and Bilbo it up.
item.author: Patrick Rothfuss

item.quote: I want words at my funeral. But I guess that means you need life in your life.
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: When things go wrong, don't go with them.
item.author: Elvis Presley

item.quote: Life doesnt get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Too many people spend money they haven't earned, to buy things they don't want, to impress people that they don't like.
item.author: Will Rogers

item.quote: To travel is to live.
item.author: Hans Christian Andersen

item.quote: Then I discovered that being related is no guarantee of love!
item.author: Stieg Larsson

item.quote: We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: The cosmos is within us. We are made of star-stuff. We are a way for the universe to know itself.
item.author: Carl Sagan

item.quote: You are not the victim of the world, but rather the master of your own destiny. It is your choices and decisions that determine your destiny.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I want a life that sizzles and pops and makes me laugh out loud. And I don't want to get to the end, or to tomorrow, even, and realize that my life is a collection of meetings and pop cans and errands and receipts and dirty dishes. I want to eat cold tangerines and sing out loud in the car with the windows open and wear pink shoes and stay up all night laughing and paint my walls the exact color of the sky right now. I want to sleep hard on clean white sheets and throw parties and eat ripe tomatoes and read books so good they make me jump up and down, and I want my everyday to make God belly laugh, glad that he gave life to someone who loves the gift.
item.author: Shauna Niequist

item.quote: How often do we tell our own life story? How often do we adjust, embellish, make sly cuts? And the longer life goes on, the fewer are those around to challenge our account, to remind us that our life is not our life, merely the story we have told about our life. Told to others, butmainlyto ourselves.
item.author: Julian Barnes

item.quote: This life is yours. Take the power to choose what you want to do and do it well. Take the power to love what you want in life and love it honestly. Take the power to walk in the forest and be a part of nature. Take the power to control your own life. No one else can do it for you. Take the power to make your life happy.
item.author: Susan Polis Schutz

item.quote: A kind gesture can reach a wound that only compassion can heal.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Most of the basic material a writer works with is acquired before the age of fifteen.
item.author: Willa Cather

item.quote: Life isn't as serious as the mind makes it out to be.
item.author: Eckhart Tolle

item.quote: Breathe. Let go. And remind yourself that this very moment is the only one you know you have for sure.
item.author: Oprah Winfrey

item.quote: If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself, tell yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for to the creator there is no poverty and no poor indifferent place.
item.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

item.quote: Hollowness: that I understand. I'm starting to believe that there isn't anything you can do to fix it. That's what I've taken from the therapy sessions: the holes in your life are permanent. You have to grow around them, like tree roots around concrete; you mold yourself through the gaps
item.author: Paula Hawkins

item.quote: It scares me how hard it is to remember life before you. I can't even make the comparisons anymore, because my memories of that time have all the depth of a photograph. It seems foolish to play games of better and worse. It's simply a matter of is and is no longer.
item.author: David Levithan

item.quote: A smart person knows how to talk. A wise person knows when to be silent.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: In all of living, have much fun and laughter. Life is to be enjoyed, not just endured.
item.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

item.quote: Dont let the noise of others opinions drown out your own inner voice.
item.author: Steve Jobs

item.quote: A person can learn a lot from a dog, even a loopy one like ours. Marley taught me about living each day with unbridled exuberance and joy, about seizing the moment and following your heart. He taught me to appreciate the simple things-a walk in the woods, a fresh snowfall, a nap in a shaft of winter sunlight. And as he grew old and achy, he taught me about optimism in the face of adversity. Mostly, he taught me about friendship and selflessness and, above all else, unwavering loyalty.
item.author: John Grogan

item.quote: At some point we all look up and realize we are lost in a maze.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: If there was anything that depressed him more than his own cynicism, it was that quite often it still wasn't as cynical as real life.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: When a man cannot choose, he ceases to be a man.
item.author: Anthony Burgess

item.quote: Amor Fati Love Your Fate, which is in fact your life.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: I want to live my life in such a way that when I get out of bed in the morning, the devil says, aw shit, he's up!
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash.
item.author: Leonard Cohen

item.quote: This isn't life in the fast lane, it's life in the oncoming traffic.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: Human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but ... life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.
item.author: Gabriel Garca Mrquez

item.quote: There was beauty in the idea of freedom, but it was an illusion. Every human heart was chained by love.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Perhaps I know best why it is man alone who laughs; he alone suffers so deeply that he had to invent laughter.
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: When life gives you lemons, chunk it right back.
item.author: Bill Watterson

item.quote: Every atom in your body came from a star that exploded. And, the atoms in your left hand probably came from a different star than your right hand. It really is the most poetic thing I know about physics: You are all stardust. You couldnt be here if stars hadnt exploded, because the elements - the carbon, nitrogen, oxygen, iron, all the things that matter for evolution and for life - werent created at the beginning of time. They were created in the nuclear furnaces of stars, and the only way for them to get into your body is if those stars were kind enough to explode. So, forget Jesus. The stars died so that you could be here today.
item.author: Lawrence M. Krauss

item.quote: Nobody sees anybody truly but all through the flaws of their own egos. That is the way we all see ...each other in life. Vanity, fear, desire, competition-- all such distortions within our own egos-- condition our vision of those in relation to us. Add to those distortions to our own egos the corresponding distortions in the egos of others, and you see how cloudy the glass must become through which we look at each other. That's how it is in all living relationships except when there is that rare case of two people who love intensely enough to burn through all those layers of opacity and see each other's naked hearts.
item.author: Tennessee Williams

item.quote: But I have learned that you make your own happiness, that part of going for what you want means losing something else. And when the stakes are high, the losses can be that much greater.
item.author: Emily Giffin

item.quote: No one here gets out alive.
item.author: Jim Morrison

item.quote: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: If you dont give up on something you truly believe in, you will find a way.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: We demand rigidly defined areas of doubt and uncertainty!
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: Life is not a PG feel-good movie. Real life often ends badly. Literature tries to document this reality, while showing us it is still possible for us to endure nobly.
item.author: Matthew Quick

item.quote: No one should ever ask themselves that: why am I unhappy? The question carries within it the virus that will destroy everything. If we ask that question, it means we want to find out what makes us happy. If what makes us happy is different from what we have now, then we must either change once and for all or stay as we are, feeling even more unhappy.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Some things you hear with your ears. Others, you hear with your heart.
item.author: Sarah J. Maas

item.quote: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.
item.author: Kahlil Gibran

item.quote: How terribly sad it was that people are made in such a way that they get used to something as extraordinary as living.
item.author: Jostein Gaarder

item.quote: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
item.author: Oprah Winfrey

item.quote: You can live your whole life not realizing that what you're looking for is right in front of you.
item.author: David Nicholls

item.quote: Most everything you think you know about me is nothing more than memories.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Focus on your goals, not your fear.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Though the road's been rocky it sure feels good to me.
item.author: Bob Marley

item.quote: To be rejected by someone doesn't mean you should also reject yourself or that you should think of yourself as a lesser person. It doesn't mean that nobody will ever love you anymore. Remember that only ONE person has rejected you at the moment, and it only hurt so much because to you, that person's opinion symbolized the opinion of the whole world, of God.
item.author: Jocelyn Soriano

item.quote: I'm the girl nobody knows until she commits suicide. Then suddenly everyone had a class with her.
item.author: Tom Leveen

item.quote: It's everybody, I mean. Everything everybody does is so I don't know not wrong, or even mean, or even stupid necessarily. But just so tiny and meaningless and sad-making. And the worst part is, if you go bohemian or something crazy like that, you're conforming just as much only in a different way.
item.author: J.D. Salinger

item.quote: Each affects the other, and the other affects the next, and the world is full of stories, but the stories are all one.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: I am not the same having seen the moon shine on the other side of the world.
item.author: mary anne radmacher

item.quote: Here's what I think, Mr. Wind-Up Bird, said May Kasahara. Everybody's born with some different thing at the core of their existence. And that thing, whatever it is, becomes like a heat source that runs each person from the inside. I have one too, of course. Like everybody else. But sometimes it gets out of hand. It swells or shrinks inside me, and it shakes me up. What I'd really like to do is find a way to communicate that feeling to another person. But I can't seem to do it. They just don't get it. Of course, the problem could be that I'm not explaining it very well, but I think it's because they're not listening very well. They pretend to be listening, but they're not, really. So I get worked up sometimes, and I do some crazy things.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Be the positive impact on the lives of others.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: You're both the fire and the water that extinguishes it. You're the narrator, the protagonist, and the sidekick. You're the storyteller and the story told. You are somebody's something, but you are also your you.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: You can't just plan a moment when things get back on track, just as you can't plan the moment you lose your way in the first place.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
item.author: Abraham Lincoln

item.quote: There is more to life than simply increasing its speed.
item.author: Mahatma Gandhi

item.quote: The human race tends to remember the abuses to which it has been subjected rather than the endearments. What's left of kisses? Wounds, however, leave scars.
item.author: Bertolt Brecht

item.quote: You were born with potential.
item.author: Rumi

item.quote: You know what I think? she says. That people's memories are maybe the fuel they burn to stay alive. Whether those memories have any actual importance or not, it doesn't matter as far as the maintenance of life is concerned. They're all just fuel. Advertising fillers in the newspaper, philosophy books, dirty pictures in a magazine, a bundle of ten-thousand-yen bills: when you feed 'em to the fire, they're all just paper. The fire isn't thinking 'Oh, this is Kant,' or 'Oh, this is the Yomiuri evening edition,' or 'Nice tits,' while it burns. To the fire, they're nothing but scraps of paper. It's the exact same thing. Important memories, not-so-important memories, totally useless memories: there's no distinction--they're all just fuel.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Be happy, but never satisfied.
item.author: Bruce Lee

item.quote: Marry, and you will regret it; dont marry, you will also regret it; marry or dont marry, you will regret it either way. Laugh at the worlds foolishness, you will regret it; weep over it, you will regret that too; laugh at the worlds foolishness or weep over it, you will regret both. Believe a woman, you will regret it; believe her not, you will also regret it Hang yourself, you will regret it; do not hang yourself, and you will regret that too; hang yourself or dont hang yourself, youll regret it either way; whether you hang yourself or do not hang yourself, you will regret both. This, gentlemen, is the essence of all philosophy.
item.author: Sren Kierkegaard

item.quote: Don't confuse poor decision-making with destiny. Own your mistakes. Its ok; we all make them. Learn from them so they can empower you!
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: To look life in the face, always, to look life in the face, and to know it for what it is...at last, to love it for what it is, and then, to put it away...
item.author: Virginia Woolf

item.quote: Do not lose hope what you seek will be found. Trust ghosts. Trust those that you have helped to help you in their turn. Trust dreams. Trust your heart, and trust your story. (from 'Instructions')
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: I don't get it,' Caroline said, bemused. 'She's the only one with wings. Why is that?'
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: In the end, it wasn't death that surprised her but the stubbornness of life.
item.author: Jeffrey Eugenides

item.quote: How many times have you tried to talk to someone about something that matters to you, tried to get them to see it the way you do? And how many of those times have ended with you feeling bitter, resenting them for making you feel like your pain doesn't have any substance after all?
item.author: Michael Marshall Smith

item.quote: Yeah, sometimes life really sucks, she says. But you know what I'm holding on for?
item.author: Veronica Roth

item.quote: People tend to be generous when sharing their nonsense, fear, and ignorance. And while they seem quite eager to feed you their negativity, please remember that sometimes the diet we need to be on is a spiritual and emotional one. Be cautious with what you feed your mind and soul. Fuel yourself with positivity and let that fuel propel you into positive action.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: You can't become a decent horseman until you fall off and get up again, a good number of times.
item.author: Bear Grylls

item.quote: Integrity is doing the right thing when nobody's watching, and doing as you say you would do.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Discipline Your Mind to Think Positively: Discipline your mind to see the good in every situation and look on the best side of every event.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: You dont have to like someone, but you have to treat them as you wish to be treated.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Style is the answer to everything.
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: Life is a journey. Time is a river. The door is ajar
item.author: Jim Butcher

item.quote: If you need something from somebody always give that person a way to hand it to you.
item.author: Sue Monk Kidd

item.quote: How would your life be different ifYou stopped allowing other people to dilute or poison your day with their words or opinions? Let today be the dayYou stand strong in the truth of your beauty and journey through your day without attachment to the validation of others
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: I like the scientific spiritthe holding off, the being sure but not too sure, the willingness to surrender ideas when the evidence is against them: this is ultimately fineit always keeps the way beyond openalways gives life, thought, affection, the whole man, a chance to try over again after a mistakeafter a wrong guess.
item.author: Walt Whitman

item.quote: He died that day because his body had served its purpose. His soul had done what it came to do, learned what it came to learn, and then was free to leave.
item.author: Garth Stein

item.quote: Hardships make or break people.
item.author: Margaret Mitchell

item.quote: There's gon' be some stuff you gon' see
item.author: Tupac Shakur

item.quote: The Laughing Heart
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: Turn your obstacles into opportunities and your problems into possibilities.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Taking pictures is savoring life intensely, every hundredth of a second.
item.author: Marc Riboud

item.quote: One of the most spiritual things you can do is embrace your humanity. Connect with those around you today. Say, I love you, I'm sorry, I appreciate you, I'm proud of you...whatever you're feeling. Send random texts, write a cute note, embrace your truth and share it...cause a smile today for someone else...and give plenty of hugs.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: And therein lies the whole of man's plight. Human time does not turn in a circle; it runs ahead in a straight line. That is why man cannot be happy: happiness is the longing for repetition.
item.author: Milan Kundera

item.quote: Cinema is the ultimate pervert art. It doesn't give you what you desire - it tells you how to desire.
item.author: Slavoj iek

item.quote: You made me confess the fears that I have. But I will tell you also what I do not fear. I do not fear to be alone or to be spurned for another or to leave whatever I have to leave. And I am not afraid to make a mistake, even a great mistake, a lifelong mistake and perhaps as long as eternity too.
item.author: James Joyce

item.quote: Life is tragic simply because the earth turns and the sun inexorably rises and sets, and one day, for each of us, the sun will go down for the last, last time. Perhaps the whole root of our trouble, the human trouble, is that we will sacrifice all the beauty of our lives, will imprison ourselves in totems, taboos, crosses, blood sacrifices, steeples, mosques, races, armies, flags, nations, in order to deny the fact of death, the only fact we have. It seems to me that one ought to rejoice in the fact of death--ought to decide, indeed, to earn one's death by confronting with passion the conundrum of life. One is responsible for life: It is the small beacon in that terrifying darkness from which we come and to which we shall return.
item.author: James Baldwin

item.quote: Wed met at a carefree time, a moment full of promise, in its place now were the harsh lessons of the real world.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: It's worth making time to find the things that really stir your soul. Thats what makes you really feel alive. You have to say no to other things youre used to, and do it with all your heart.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I seem to have run in a great circle, and met myself again on the starting line.
item.author: Jeanette Winterson

item.quote: Dreams don't work unless you take action. The surest way to make your dreams come true is to live them.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead. The consciousness of loving and being loved brings a warmth and a richness to life that nothing else can bring.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: To sell your soul is the easiest thing in the world. That's what everybody does every hour of his life. If I asked you to keep your soul - would you understand why that's much harder?
item.author: Ayn Rand

item.quote: But if everything was always smooth and perfect, you'd get too used to that, you know? You have to have a little bit of disorganization now and then. Otherwise, you'll never really enjoy it when things go right.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: I've apparently been the victim of growing up, which apparently happens to all of us at one point or another. It's been going on for quite some time now, without me knowing it. I've found that growing up can mean a lot of things. For me, it doesn't mean I should become somebody completely new and stop loving the things I used to love. It means I've just added more things to my list. Like for example, I'm still beyond obsessed with the winter season and I still start putting up strings of lights in September. I still love sparkles and grocery shopping and really old cats that are only nice to you half the time. I still love writing in my journal and wearing dresses all the time and staring at chandeliers. But some new things I've fallen in love with -- mismatched everything. Mismatched chairs, mismatched colors, mismatched personalities. I love spraying perfumes I used to wear when I was in high school. It brings me back to the days of trying to get a close parking spot at school, trying to get noticed by soccer players, and trying to figure out how to avoid doing or saying anything uncool, and wishing every minute of every day that one day maybe I'd get a chance to win a Grammy. Or something crazy and out of reach like that. ;) I love old buildings with the paint chipping off the walls and my dad's stories about college. I love the freedom of living alone, but I also love things that make me feel seven again. Back then naivety was the norm and skepticism was a foreign language, and I just think every once in a while you need fries and a chocolate milkshake and your mom. I love picking up a cookbook and closing my eyes and opening it to a random page, then attempting to make that recipe. I've loved my fans from the very first day, but they've said things and done things recently that make me feel like they're my friends -- more now than ever before. I'll never go a day without thinking about our memories together.
item.author: Taylor Swift

item.quote: There was a moment in my life when I really wanted to kill myself. And there was one other moment when I was close to that. . . . But even in my most jaded times, I had some hope.
item.author: Gerard Way

item.quote: I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves.
item.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

item.quote: Art is to console those who are broken by life.
item.author: Vincent van Gogh

item.quote: He knew one of the women well, and had shared his universe with her. They had seen the same mountains, and the same trees, although each of them had seem them differently. She knew his weaknesses, his moments of hatred, of despair. Yet she was there at his side. They shared the same universe.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: After all, what's a life, anyway? We're born, we live a little while, we die.
item.author: E.B. White

item.quote: If you don't know who you truly are, you'll never know what you really want.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Home wasn't a set house, or a single town on a map. It was wherever the people who loved you were, whenever you were together. Not a place, but a moment, and then another, building on each other like bricks to create a solid shelter that you take with you for your entire life, wherever you may go.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: The more I live, the more I learn. The more I learn, the more I realize, the less I know.
item.author: Michel Legrand

item.quote: Youre not obligated to win. Youre obligated to keep trying. To the best you can do everyday.
item.author: Jason Mraz

item.quote: The cost of a thing is the amount of what I will call life which is required to be exchanged for it, immediately or in the long run.
item.author: Henry David Thoreau

item.quote: Never let hard lessons harden your heart; the hard lessons of life are meant to make you better, not bitter.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: You will be required to do wrong no matter where you go. It is the basic condition of life, to be required to violate your own identity. At some time, every creature which lives must do so. It is the ultimate shadow, the defeat of creation; this is the curse at work, the curse that feeds on all life. Everywhere in the universe.
item.author: Philip K. Dick

item.quote: You are -- your life, and nothing else.
item.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

item.quote: Life gives us choices. You either grab on with both hands and just go for it, or you sit on the sidelines.
item.author: Christine Feehan

item.quote: Learning to distance yourself from all the negativity is one of the greatest lessons to achieve inner peace.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: What is called a reason for living is also an excellent reason for dying.
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: Quiet is peace. Tranquility. Quiet is turning down the volume knob on life. Silence is pushing the off button. Shutting it down. All of it. - Amir
item.author: Khaled Hosseini

item.quote: Being happy doesn't mean that everything is perfect. It means that you've decided to look beyond the imperfections.
item.author: Gerard Way

item.quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
item.author: Will Durant

item.quote: It is a very funny thing that the sleepier you are, the longer you take about getting to bed.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: Never respond to an angry person with a fiery comeback, even if he deserves it...Don't allow his anger to become your anger.
item.author: Bohdi Sanders

item.quote: Let today be the day you stop being haunted by the ghost of yesterday. Holding a grudge & harboring anger/resentment is poison to the soul. Get even with people...but not those who have hurt us, forget them, instead get even with those who have helped us.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Strange, I thought, how you can be living your dreams and your nightmares at the very same time.
item.author: Ransom Riggs

item.quote: V-Dayif you need this one day in a year to show everyone else you truly care for your loved one I think its quite stupid. I hate this commercialism. Its all artificial, and has nothing to do with real love.
item.author: Jess C Scott

item.quote: Carve your name on hearts, not tombstones. A legacy is etched into the minds of others and the stories they share about you.
item.author: Shannon Alder

item.quote: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
item.author: Annie Dillard

item.quote: As far as we can discern, the sole purpose of human existence is to kindle a light of meaning in the darkness of mere being.
item.author: Carl Gustav Jung

item.quote: There will be time, there will be time
item.author: T.S. Eliot.

item.quote: When you compare the sorrows of real life to the pleasures of the imaginary one, you will never want to live again, only to dream forever.
item.author: Alexandre Dumas

item.quote: The worst memories stick with us, while the nice ones always seem to slip through our fingers.
item.author: Rachel Vincent

item.quote: Life is a gift. Don't forget to live it.
item.author: Nicola Yoon

item.quote: Live life fully while you're here. Experience everything. Take care of yourself and your friends. Have fun, be crazy, be weird. Go out and screw up! You're going to anyway, so you might as well enjoy the process. Take the opportunity to learn from your mistakes: find the cause of your problem and eliminate it. Don't try to be perfect; just be an excellent example of being human.
item.author: Anthony Robbins

item.quote: Our revels now are ended. These our actors,
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.
item.author: Joseph Stalin

item.quote: I am convinced that most people do not grow up...We marry and dare to have children and call that growing up. I think what we do is mostly grow old. We carry accumulation of years in our bodies, and on our faces, but generally our real selves, the children inside, are innocent and shy as magnolias.
item.author: Maya Angelou

item.quote: Gratitude builds a bridge to abundance.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Life is painful and messed up. It gets complicated at the worst of times, and sometimes you have no idea where to go or what to do. Lots of times people just let themselves get lost, dropping into a wide open, huge abyss. But that's why we have to keep trying. We have to push through all that hurts us, work past all our memories that are haunting us. Sometimes the things that hurt us are the things that make us strongest. A life without experience, in my opinion, is no life at all. And that's why I tell everyone that, even when it hurts, never stop yourself from living.
item.author: Alysha Speer

item.quote: All opinions are not equal. Some are a very great deal more robust, sophisticated and well supported in logic and argument than others.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: Independence is my happiness, and I view things as they are, without regard to place or person; my country is the world, and my religion is to do good.
item.author: thomas paine

item.quote: There are many things worth living for, a few things worth dying for, and nothing worth killing for.
item.author: Tom Robbins

item.quote: When you hold a grudge, you want someone elses sorrow to reflect your level of hurt but the two rarely meet.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: The only position that leaves me with no cognitive dissonance is atheism. It is not a creed. Death is certain, replacing both the siren-song of Paradise and the dread of Hell. Life on this earth, with all its mystery and beauty and pain, is then to be lived far more intensely: we stumble and get up, we are sad, confident, insecure, feel loneliness and joy and love. There is nothing more; but I want nothing more.
item.author: Ayaan Hirsi Ali

item.quote: Dont bother trying to explain your emotions. Live everything as intensely as you can and keep whatever you felt as a gift from God. The best way to destroy the bridge between the visible and invisible is by trying to explain your emotions.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Magic
item.author: Shel Silverstein

item.quote: If you want to identify me, ask me not where I live, or what I like to eat, or how I comb my hair, but ask me what I am living for, in detail, ask me what I think is keeping me from living fully for the thing I want to live for.
item.author: Thomas Merton

item.quote: Have patience with everything that remains unsolved in your heart. Try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books written in a foreign language. Do not now look for the answers. They cannot now be given to you because you could not live them. It is a question of experiencing everything. At present you need to live the question. Perhaps you will gradually, without even noticing it, find yourself experiencing the answer, some distant day.
item.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

item.quote: Why Not You?
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a
item.author: Leo F. Buscaglia

item.quote: Losing your life is not the worst thing that can happen. The worst thing is to lose your reason for living.
item.author: Jo Nesbo

item.quote: Most of us must learn to love people and use things rather than loving things and using people.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: It takes sunshine and rain to make a rainbow. There would be no rainbows without sunshine and rain.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: When one has a grateful heart, life is so beautiful.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Six hundred and forty fish later, the only thing I know is everything you love will die. The first time you meet someone special, you can count on them one day being dead and in the ground.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: Some things cannot be taught; they must be experienced. You never learn the most valuable lessons in life until you go through your own journey.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: It doesn't matter what you did or where you were...it matters where you are and what you're doing. Get out there! Sing the song in your heart and NEVER let anyone shut you up!!
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: You cannot control what happens to you, but you can control your attitude
item.author: Brian Tracy

item.quote: Life is a tapestry woven by the decisions we make.
item.author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.quote: All knowledge is worth having.
item.author: Jacqueline Carey

item.quote: When I was little and running on the race track at school, I always stopped and waited for all the other kids so we could run together even though I knew (and everybody else knew) that I could run much faster than all of them! I pretended to read slowly so I could wait for everyone else who couldn't read as fast as I could! When my friends were short I pretended that I was short too and if my friend was sad I pretended to be unhappy. I could go on and on about all the ways I have limited myself, my whole life, by waiting for people. And the only thing that I've ever received in return is people thinking that they are faster than me, people thinking that they can make me feel bad about myself just because I let them and people thinking that I have to do whatever they say I should do. My mother used to teach me Cinderella is a perfect example to be but I have learned that Cinderella can go fuck herself, I'm not waiting for anybody, anymore! I'm going to run as fast as I can, fly as high as I can, I am going to soar and if you want you can come with me! But I'm not waiting for you anymore.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: There is no time for cut-and-dried monotony. There is time for work. And time for love. That leaves no other time.
item.author: Coco Chanel

item.quote: Ive come to the conclusion that people who wear headphones while they walk, are much happier, more confident, and more beautiful individuals than someone making the solitary drudge to work without acknowledging their own interests and power.
item.author: Jason Mraz

item.quote: Our battered suitcases were piled on the sidewalk again; we had longer ways to go. But no matter, the road is life
item.author: Jack Kerouac

item.quote: Life, unfortunately, doesn't seem to care what we want.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: Life is nothing without a little chaos to make it interesting.
item.author: Amelia Atwater-Rhodes

item.quote: Challenge and adversity are meant to help you know who you are. Storms hit your weakness, but unlock your true strength.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Nothing makes a person happier than having a happy heart.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Earth's crammed with heaven...
item.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.quote: The great object of life is sensation- to feel that we exist, even though in pain.
item.author: Lord Byron

item.quote: To move, to breathe, to fly, to float,
item.author: Hans Christian Andersen

item.quote: Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as Ive said before, bugs in amber.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: Growing up means learning what life is. When you're little, you have a set of ideals, standards, criteria, plans, outlooks, and you think that you have to sit around and wait for them to happen to you and then life will work. But life isn't like that, for anybody; you can't fall in love with a standard, you have to fall in love with a person. You can't live in a criteria, you have to live your life. You can't wait for your plans to materialize, because they may never materialize the way you think they will. You can't wait to watch your ideals and standards walk up to you, because you can't know what's yours until you have it. I always say, always take the first chance in case you never get a second one, but growing up takes that even one step further, growing up means that you have to hold on to what you have, when you have it, because what you have- that's yours- and all the ideals and criteria you have set in your head, those aren't yours, because those haven't happened to you.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: If you have a dream, dont just sit there. Gather courage to believe that you can succeed and leave no stone unturned to make it a reality.
item.author: Dr Roopleen

item.quote: I wish to weep
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say
item.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

item.quote: When you do something noble and beautiful and nobody noticed, do not be sad. For the sun every morning is a beautiful spectacle and yet most of the audience still sleeps.
item.author: John Lennon

item.quote: The camera is an instrument that teaches people how to see without a camera.
item.author: Dorothea Lange

item.quote: Perhaps - I want the old days back again and they'll never come back, and I am haunted by the memory of them and of the world falling about my ears.
item.author: Margaret Mitchell

item.quote: Souls cross ages like clouds cross skies, an' tho' a cloud's shape nor hue nor size don't stay the same, it's still a cloud an' so is a soul. Who can say where the cloud's blowed from or who the soul'll be 'morrow? Only Sonmi the east an' the west an' the compass an' the atlas, yay, only the atlas o' clouds.
item.author: David Mitchell

item.quote: It doesnt matter how many times you get knocked down. All that matters is you get up one more time than you were knocked down.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Writing is a form of therapy; sometimes I wonder how all those who do not write, compose, or paint can manage to escape the madness, melancholia, the panic and fear which is inherent in a human situation.
item.author: Graham Greene

item.quote: People die, I think, but your relationship with them doesn't. It continues and is ever-changing.
item.author: Jandy Nelson

item.quote: We never know which lives we influence, or when, or why.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: It takes guts and humility to admit mistakes. Admitting we're wrong is courage, not weakness.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: It's not hard to decide what you want your life to be about. What's hard, she said, is figuring out what you're willing to give up in order to do the things you really care about.
item.author: Shauna Niequist

item.quote: If you live each day as it was your last, someday you'll most certainly be right
item.author: Steve Jobs

item.quote: I have learned that you can go anywhere you want to go and do anything you want to do and buy all the things that you want to buy and meet all the people that you want to meet and learn all the things that you desire to learn and if you do all these things but are not madly in love: you have still not begun to live.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: When you come out of the storm, you wont be the same person who walked in. Thats what this storms all about.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: He had the look of one who had drunk the cup of life and found a dead beetle at the bottom.
item.author: P.G. Wodehouse

item.quote: and when all the wars are over, a butterfly will still be beautiful.
item.author: Ruskin Bond

item.quote: Hearing voices no one else can hear isn't a good sign, even in the wizarding world.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: How can I go forward when I don't know which way I'm facing?
item.author: John Lennon

item.quote: Look. I have a strategy. Why expect anything? If you dont expect anything, you dont get disappointed.
item.author: Patricia McCormick

item.quote: All the adversity I've had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me... You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.
item.author: Walt Disney

item.quote: The mistakes I've made are dead to me. But I can't take back the things I never did.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: It is difficult to live in and enjoy the moment when you are thinking about the past or worrying about the future. You cannot change your past, but you can ruin the present by worrying about your future. Learn from the past, plan for the future. The more you live in and enjoy the present moment, the happier you will be.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Changing your outside world cannot make you happy if you are an unhappy person. The real personal change can only happen from the inside out. If you firstly create the change within yourself, you can turn your life around.
