item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Mistakes are, after all, the foundations of truth, and if a man does not know what a thing is, it is at least an increase in knowledge if he knows what it is not.
item.author: Carl G. Jung

item.quote: O Me! O life!... of the questions of these recurring;
item.author: Walt Whitman

item.quote: Transformation is my favorite game and in my experience, anger and frustration are the result of you not being authentic somewhere in your life or with someone in your life. Being fake about anything creates a block inside of you. Life cant work for you if you dont show up as you.
item.author: Jason Mraz

item.quote: I am always sad, I think. Perhaps this signifies that I am not sad at all, because sadness is something lower than your normal disposition, and I am always the same thing. Perhaps I am the only person in the world, then, who never becomes sad. Perhaps I am lucky.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: For everything in this journey of life we are on, there is a right wing and a left wing: for the wing of love there is anger; for the wing of destiny there is fear; for the wing of pain there is healing; for the wing of hurt there is forgiveness; for the wing of pride there is humility; for the wing of giving there is taking; for the wing of tears there is joy; for the wing of rejection there is acceptance; for the wing of judgment there is grace; for the wing of honor there is shame; for the wing of letting go there is the wing of keeping. We can only fly with two wings and two wings can only stay in the air if there is a balance. Two beautiful wings is perfection. There is a generation of people who idealize perfection as the existence of only one of these wings every time. But I see that a bird with one wing is imperfect. An angel with one wing is imperfect. A butterfly with one wing is dead. So this generation of people strive to always cut off the other wing in the hopes of embodying their ideal of perfection, and in doing so, have created a crippled race.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: We should forgive our enemies, but not before they are hanged
item.author: Heinrich Heine

item.quote: It's no good trying to get rid of your own aloneness. You've got to stick to it all your life. Only at times, at times, the gap will be filled in. At times! But you have to wait for the times. Accept your own aloneness and stick to it, all your life. And then accept the times when the gap is filled in, when they come. But they've got to come. You can't force them.
item.author: D.H. Lawrence

item.quote: Failure is a bend in the road, not the end of the road. Learn from failure and keep moving forward.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: E.L. Doctorow said once said that 'Writing a novel is like driving a car at night. You can see only as far as your headlights, but you can make the whole trip that way.' You don't have to see where you're going, you don't have to see your destination or everything you will pass along the way. You just have to see two or three feet ahead of you. This is right up there with the best advice on writing, or life, I have ever heard.
item.author: Anne Lamott

item.quote: When defeat comes, accept it as a signal that your plans are not sound, rebuild those plans, and set sail once more toward your coveted goal.
item.author: Napoleon Hill

item.quote: The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: If I were to wish for anything, I should not wish for wealth and power, but for the passionate sense of the potential, for the eye which, ever young and ardent, sees the possible. Pleasure disappoints, possibility never. And what wine is so sparkling, what so fragrant, what so intoxicating, as possibility!
item.author: Sren Kierkegaard

item.quote: Until you step into the unknown, you dont know what youre made of.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Be still, sad heart! and cease repining;
item.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.quote: Character the willingness to accept responsibility for one's own life is the source from which self-respect springs.
item.author: Joan Didion

item.quote: The aim of life is self-development. To realize one's nature perfectly - that is what each of us is here for.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: You are someone who is different, but who wants to be the same as everyone else. And that in my view is a serious illness. God chose you to be different. Why are you disappointing God with this kind of attitude?
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Can you remember who you were, before the world told you who you should be?
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: People are strange: They are constantly angered by trivial things, but on a major matter like totally wasting their lives, they hardly seem to notice.
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: The cost of oblivious daydreaming was always this moment of return, the realignment with what had been before and now seemed a little worse.
item.author: Ian McEwan

item.quote: I suppose sooner or later in the life of everyone comes a moment of trial. We all of us have our particular devil who rides us and torments us, and we must give battle in the end.
item.author: Daphne Du Maurier

item.quote: Power does not corrupt. Fear corrupts... perhaps the fear of a loss of power.
item.author: John Steinbeck

item.quote: You have wakened not out of sleep, but into a prior dream, and that dream lies within another, and so on, to infinity, which is the number of grains of sand. The path that you are to take is endless, and you will die before you have truly awakened.
item.author: Jorge Luis Borges

item.quote: You can't be brave if you've only had wonderful things happen to you.
item.author: Mary Tyler Moore

item.quote: You were made by God and for God and until you understand that, life will never make sense.
item.author: Rick Warren

item.quote: Let me give you a tip on a clue to men's characters: the man who damns money has obtained it dishonorably; the man who respects it has earned it.
item.author: Ayn Rand

item.quote: A man is like a novel: until the very last page you don't know how it will end. Otherwise it wouldn't even be worth reading.
item.author: Yevgeny Zamyatin

item.quote: Stop doing what is easy. Start doing what is right.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: CALVIN:
item.author: Bill Watterson

item.quote: Walk with the dreamers, the believers, the courageous, the cheerful, the planners, the doers, the successful people with their heads in the clouds and their feet on the ground. Let their spirit ignite a fire within you to leave this world better than when you found it...
item.author: Wilferd Peterson

item.quote: Don't own so much clutter that you will be relieved to see your house catch fire.
item.author: Wendell Berry

item.quote: No single event can awaken within us a stranger whose existence we had never suspected. To live is to be slowly born.
item.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupry

item.quote: You must be shapeless, formless, like water. When you pour water in a cup, it becomes the cup. When you pour water in a bottle, it becomes the bottle. When you pour water in a teapot, it becomes the teapot. Water can drip and it can crash. Become like water my friend.
item.author: Bruce Lee

item.quote: Life is filled with unanswered questions, but it is the courage to seek those answers that continues to give meaning to life. You can spend your life wallowing in despair, wondering why you were the one who was led towards the road strewn with pain, or you can be grateful that you are strong enough to survive it.
item.author: J.D. Stroube

item.quote: If other people do not understand our behaviorso what? Their request that we must only do what they understand is an attempt to dictate to us. If this is being asocial or irrational in their eyes, so be it. Mostly they resent our freedom and our courage to be ourselves. We owe nobody an explanation or an accounting, as long as our acts do not hurt or infringe on them. How many lives have been ruined by this need to explain, which usually implies that the explanation be understood, i.e. approved. Let your deeds be judged, and from your deeds, your real intentions, but know that a free person owes an explanation only to himselfto his reason and his conscienceand to the few who may have a justified claim for explanation.
item.author: Erich Fromm

item.quote: Don't wait for the right moment to start, start and make each moment right.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: ...nothing ever happens quickly (except when it does). Nothing is ever, ever easy (except when it is). And, most of all, nothing ever goes perfectly according to plan (except in the movies).
item.author: Ally Carter

item.quote: You learn something valuable from all of the significant events and people, but you never touch your true potential until you challenge yourself to go beyond imposed limitations.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Dont wait for things to happen. Make them happen.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Good things happen in your life when you surround yourself with positive people.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Good people see the good and bring out the best in other people.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Those who hurt others will also hurt themselves.
item.author: Natsuki Takaya

item.quote: We should count time by heart-throbs. He most lives,
item.author: Philip James Bailey

item.quote: Its important that what thoughts you are feeding into your mind because your thoughts create your belief and experiences. You have positive thoughts and you have negative ones too. Nurture your mind with positive thoughts: kindness, empathy, compassion, peace, love, joy, humility, generosity, etc. The more you feed your mind with positive thoughts, the more you can attract great things into your life.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Enjoy every step you take. If you're curious, there is always something new to be discovered in the backdrop of your daily life.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: My expectations were reduced to zero when I was 21. Everything since then has been a bonus.
item.author: Stephen W. Hawking

item.quote: If you enter this world knowing you are loved and you leave this world knowing the same, then everything that happens in between can be dealt with.
item.author: Michael Jackson

item.quote: People rarely bring flowers to a suicide.
item.author: Jennifer Niven

item.quote: If others tell us something we make assumptions, and if they don't tell us something we make assumptions to fulfill our need to know and to replace the need to communicate. Even if we hear something and we don't understand we make assumptions about what it means and then believe the assumptions. We make all sorts of assumptions because we don't have the courage to ask questions.
item.author: Miguel Ruiz

item.quote: These were the lovely bones that had grown around my absence: the connections-sometimes tenuous, sometimes made at great cost, but often magnificent-that happened after I was gone. And I began to see things in a way that let me hold the world without me in it. The events that my death wrought were merely the bones of a body that would become whole at some unpredictable time in the future. The price of what I came to see as this miraculous body had been my life.
item.author: Alice Sebold

item.quote: EARLY BIRD
item.author: Shel Silverstein

item.quote: We are all equal in the fact that we are all different. We are all the same in the fact that we will never be the same. We are united by the reality that all colours and all cultures are distinct & individual. We are harmonious in the reality that we are all held to this earth by the same gravity. We don't share blood, but we share the air that keeps us alive. I will not blind myself and say that my black brother is not different from me. I will not blind myself and say that my brown sister is not different from me. But my black brother is he as much as I am me. But my brown sister is she as much as I am me.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: She just smiled, said that she loved books more than anything, and started telling him excitedly what each of the ones in her lap was about. And Ove realised that he wanted to hear her talking about the things she loved for the rest of his life.
item.author: Fredrik Backman

item.quote: Imagine life is a game in which you are juggling five balls. The balls are called work, family, health, friends, and integrity. And you're keeping all of them in the air. But one day you finally come to understand that work is a rubber ball. If you drop it, it will bounce back. The other four balls...are made of glass. If you drop one of these, it will be irrevocably scuffed, nicked, perhaps even shattered.
item.author: James Patterson

item.quote: I hate to say it, but shit really does happen. You just have to get over it. Beat the hell out of it by doing things that make you happy.
item.author: J.A. Redmerski

item.quote: When I lost my sight, Werner, people said I was brave. When my father left, people said I was brave. But it is not bravery; I have no choice. I wake up and live my life. Don't you do the same?
item.author: Anthony Doerr

item.quote: Perfectly Imperfect
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: We are unusual and tragic and alive.
item.author: dave eggers

item.quote: To each there comes in their lifetime a special moment when they are figuratively tapped on the shoulder and offered the chance to do a very special thing, unique to them and fitted to their talents. What a tragedy if that moment finds them unprepared or unqualified for that which could have been their finest hour.
item.author: Sir Winston Churchill

item.quote: Personally, I dont like inherently happy people. I dont trust them. I think theres something seriously wrong with anyone who isnt at least a little let down by the world.
item.author: Tiffanie DeBartolo

item.quote: 7 Effective Ways to Make Others Feel Important
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Don't live down to expectations. Go out there and do something remarkable.
item.author: Wendy Wasserstein

item.quote: I suffer from life and from other people. I cant look at reality face to face. Even the sun discourages and depresses me. Only at night and all alone, withdrawn, forgotten and lost, with no connection to anything real or useful only then do I find myself and feel comforted.
item.author: Fernando Pessoa

item.quote: The hardest thing about the road not taken is that you never know where it might have led.
item.author: Lisa Wingate

item.quote: You made me feel alive again.
item.author: Julie Kagawa

item.quote: If the path before you is clear, you're probably on someone else's.
item.author: Joseph Campbell

item.quote: Hard is trying to rebuild yourself, piece by piece, with no instruction book, and no clue as to where all the important bits are supposed to go.
item.author: Nick Hornby

item.quote: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.
item.author: Hemingway, Ernest

item.quote: What you stay focused on will grow.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: When things do not go your way, remember that every challenge every adversity contains within it the seeds of opportunity and growth.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: All the world's a stage and most of us are desperately unrehearsed.
item.author: Sen O'Casey

item.quote: Make the most of the best and the best of the worst, and keep your standards high. Never settle for anything less than you deserve or are capable of achieving.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Dare I say I miss him? I do. I miss him. I still see him in my dreams. They are nightmares mostly, but nightmares tinged with love.
item.author: Yann Martel

item.quote: I was in the biggest breakdown of my life when I stopped crying long enough to let the words of my epiphany really sink in. That whore, karma, had finally made her way around, and had just bitch-slapped me right across the face. The realization only made me cry harder.
item.author: Jennifer Salaiz

item.quote: The one who falls and gets up is stronger than the one who never tried. Do not fear failure but rather fear not trying.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: So much working, reading, thinking, living to do! A lifetime is not long enough.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: Berterimakasihlah pada segala yang memberi kehidupan.
item.author: Pramoedya Ananta Toer

item.quote: Do you believe a man can truly love a woman and constantly betray her?Never mind physically but betray her in his mind,in the very poetry of his soul.Well,it's not easy but men do it all the time.
item.author: Mario Puzo

item.quote: People who lack the clarity, courage, or determination to follow their own dreams will often find ways to discourage yours. When you change for the better, the people around you will be inspired to change also....but only after doing their best to make you stop. Live your truth and don't EVER stop.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: We lead our lives like water flowing down a hill, going more or less in one direction until we splash into something that forces us to find a new course.
item.author: Arthur Golden

item.quote: This is how the entire course of a life can be changed: by doing nothing.
item.author: Ian McEwan

item.quote: You were born to stand out, stop trying to fit in.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I know it's not easy for you, living this life, but try to remember, always try to remember, you're not the only one with troubles.
item.author: Laini Taylor

item.quote: There are a lot of things I wish I would have done, instead of just sitting around and complaining about having a boring life.
item.author: Kurt Cobain

item.quote: We, unaccustomed to courage
item.author: Maya Angelou

item.quote: One way of looking at speech is to say that it is a constant stratagem to cover nakedness.
item.author: Harold Pinter

item.quote: Everyone enjoys being acknowledged and appreciated. Sometimes even the simplest act of gratitude can change someone's entire day. Take the time to recognize and value the people around you and appreciate those who make a difference in your lives.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Change may not always bring growth, but there is no growth without change.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Unrequited love is the infinite curse of a lonely heart.
item.author: Christina Westover

item.quote: I believe that life is a game, that life is a cruel joke, and that life is what happens when you're alive and that you might as well lie back and enjoy it.
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: Sometimes life is too hard to be alone, and sometimes life is too good to be alone.
item.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

item.quote: Pulvis et umbra sumus. (
item.author: Horace

item.quote: Do not let the roles you play in life make you forget who you are.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Beliefs are choices. First you choose your beliefs. Then your beliefs affect your choices.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Despair is the price one pays for self-awareness. Look deeply into life, and you'll always find despair.
item.author: Irvin D. Yalom

item.quote: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: The goal of life is to make your heartbeat match the beat of the universe, to match your nature with Nature.
item.author: Joseph Campbell

item.quote: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and all science. He to whom this emotion is a stranger, who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt in awe, is as good as dead: his eyes are closed.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: Happiness was but the occasional episode in a general drama of pain.
item.author: Thomas Hardy

item.quote: Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books. Books make sense of life. The only problem is that the lives they make sense of are other people's lives, never your own.
item.author: Julian Barnes

item.quote: Life is more or less a lie, but then again, that's exactly the way we want it to be.
item.author: Bob Dylan

item.quote: I've crossed some kind of invisible line. I feel as if I've come to a place I never thought I'd have to come to. And I don't know how I got here. It's a strange place. It's a place where a little harmless dreaming and then some sleepy, early-morning talk has led me into considerations of death and annihilation.
item.author: Raymond Carver

item.quote: One swallow does not make a summer, neither does one fine day; similarly one day or brief time of happiness does not make a person entirely happy.
item.author: Aristotle

item.quote: Pierre was right when he said that one must believe in the possibility of happiness in order to be happy, and I now believe in it. Let the dead bury the dead, but while I'm alive, I must live and be happy.
item.author: Leo Tolstoy

item.quote: Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon.
item.author: Woody Allen

item.quote: ... you don't have to wait for someone to treat you bad repeatedly. All it takes is once, and if they get away with it that once, if they know they can treat you like that, then it sets the pattern for the future.
item.author: Jane Green

item.quote: Your I CAN is more important than your IQ.
item.author: Robin Sharma

item.quote: If you don't live a life in service of a greater good, you've gotta at least die a death in service of a greater good, you know? And I fear that I won't get either a life or a death that means anything.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Life is not like water. Things in life don't necessarily flow over the shortest possible route.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Ships at a distance have every man's wish on board. For some they come in with the tide. For others they sail forever on the same horizon, never out of sight, never landing until the Watcher turns his eyes away in resignation, his dreams mocked to death by Time. That is the life of men.
item.author: Zora Neale Hurston

item.quote: Enjoy life. There's plenty of time to be dead.
item.author: Hans Christian Andersen

item.quote: There was quite a lot of competitiveness about it, with everybody wanting to beat not only cancer itself, but also the other people in the room. Like, I realize that this is irrational, but when they tell you that you have, say, a 20 percent chance of living five years, the math kicks in and you figure thats one in five . . . so you look around and think, as any healthy person would: I gotta outlast four of these bastards.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: When you take control of your attitude, you take control of your life.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: What other people think and say about you is none of your business. The most destructive thing you would ever do is to believe someone else's opinion of you. You have to stop letting other people's opinions control you.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Enthusiasm can help you find the new doors, but it takes passion to open them. If you have a strong purpose in life, you don't have to be pushed. Your passion will drive you there.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: The comfort zone is a psychological state in which one feels familiar, safe, at ease, and secure. You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Let go of something old that no longer serves you in order to make room for something new.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Moral wounds have this peculiarity - they may be hidden, but they never close; always painful, always ready to bleed when touched, they remain fresh and open in the heart.
item.author: Alexandre Dumas

item.quote: Those who will not reason, are bigots, those who cannot, are fools, and those who dare not, are slaves.
item.author: George Gordon Byron (Lord Byron)

item.quote: The beautiful is always bizarre.
item.author: Charles Baudelaire

item.quote: What I'm not sure about, is if our lives have been so different from the lives of the people we save. We all complete. Maybe none of us really understand what we've lived through, or feel we've had enough time.
item.author: Kazuo Ishiguro

item.quote: One half of the world cannot understand the pleasures of the other.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: The world changes, we do not, therein lies the irony that kills us.
item.author: Anne Rice

item.quote: I am afraid. Not of life, or death, or nothingness, but of wasting it as if I had never been.
item.author: Daniel Keyes

item.quote: Winners are not afraid of losing. But losers are. Failure is part of the process of success. People who avoid failure also avoid success.
item.author: Robert T. Kiyosaki

item.quote: Every widow wakes one morning, perhaps after years of pure and unwavering grieving, to realize she slept a good night's sleep, and will be able to eat breakfast, and doesn't hear her husband's ghost all the time, but only some of the time. Her grief is replaced with a useful sadness. Every parent who loses a child finds a way to laugh again. The timbre begins to fade. The edge dulls. The hurt lessens. Every love is carved from loss. Mine was. Yours is. Your great-great-great-grandchildren's will be. But we learn to live in that love.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: Is life not a thousand times too short for us to bore ourselves?
item.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

item.quote: I think that youve got to make something that pleases you and hope that other people feel the same way.
item.author: Thomas Keller

item.quote: We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Truth is not something outside to be discovered, it is something inside to be realized.
item.author: Osho

item.quote: About once or twice every month I engage in public debates with those whose pressing need it is to woo and to win the approval of supernatural beings. Very often, when I give my view that there is no supernatural dimension, and certainly not one that is only or especially available to the faithful, and that the natural world is wonderful enoughand even miraculous enough if you insistI attract pitying looks and anxious questions. How, in that case, I am asked, do I find meaning and purpose in life? How does a mere and gross materialist, with no expectation of a life to come, decide what, if anything, is worth caring about?
item.author: Christopher Hitchens

item.quote: Never forget that anticipation is an important part of life. Work's important, family's important, but without excitement, you have nothing. You're cheating yourself if you refuse to enjoy what's coming.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: To care about your outward appearance is important, but whats more important is to have a beautiful soul.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.
item.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.quote: Life is short. Focus on what really matters most. You have to change your priorities over time.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are
item.author: Brian Tracy

item.quote: Surround Yourself with Positive People Who Believe in Your Dreams
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Your time is way too valuable to be wasting on people that can't accept who you are.
item.author: Turcois Ominek

item.quote: His talent was as natural as the pattern that was made by the dust on a butterfly's wings. At one time he understood it no more than the butterfly did and he did not know when it was brushed or marred. Later he became conscious of his damaged wings and of their construction and he learned to think and could not fly any more because the love of flight was gone and he could only remember when it had been effortless.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: Conventionality is not morality. Self-righteousness is not religion. To attack the first is not to assail the last.
item.author: Charlotte Bront

item.quote: Great leaders can see the greatness in others when they cant see it themselves and lead them to their highest potential they dont even know.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: People dont like to think, if one thinks, one must reach conclusions. Conclusions are not always pleasant.
item.author: Helen Keller

item.quote: It can only take a moment to waste the rest of your life.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: Successful people have no fear of failure. But unsuccessful people do. Successful people have the resilience to face up to failurelearn the lessons and adapt from it.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Tears are words the heart can't express
item.author: Gerard Way

item.quote: But that was the problem with having the answers. It was only after you gave them that you realized they sometimes weren't what people wanted to hear.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: One of the best ways to influence people is to make them feel important.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: People were always getting ready for tomorrow. I didn't believe in that. Tomorrow wasn't getting ready for them. It didn't even know they were there.
item.author: Cormac McCarthy

item.quote: May Light always surround you;
item.author: D. Simone

item.quote: If you cant save your own life, is it even worth saving?
item.author: Rainbow Rowell

item.quote: He walked out in the gray light and stood and he saw for a brief moment the absolute truth of the world. The cold relentless circling of the intestate earth. Darkness implacable. The blind dogs of the sun in their running. The crushing black vacuum of the universe. And somewhere two hunted animals trembling like ground-foxes in their cover. Borrowed time and borrowed world and borrowed eyes with which to sorrow it.
item.author: Cormac McCarthy

item.quote: He is terribly afraid of dying because he hasnt yet lived.
item.author: Franz Kafka

item.quote: You need to find a way to live your life, that it doesn't make a mockery of your values.
item.author: Bill Ayers

item.quote: How quick come the reasons for approving what we like.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: When a man learns to love, he must bear the risk of hatred.
item.author: Uchiha Madara

item.quote: Dogs are not our whole life, but they make our lives whole.
item.author: Roger Caras

item.quote: You will never follow your own inner voice until you clear up the doubts in your mind.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Yes, I understand why things had to happen this way. I understand his reason for causing me pain. But mere understanding does not chase away the hurt. It does not call upon the sun when dark clouds have loomed over me. Let the rain come then if it must come! And let it wash away the dust that hurt my eyes!
item.author: Jocelyn Soriano

item.quote: One does no question miracles, or complain that they are no constructed perfectly to one's liking.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Clocks slay time... time is dead as long as it is being clicked off by little wheels; only when the clock stops does time come to life.
item.author: William Faulkner

item.quote: Kiss a lover,
item.author: Neil Gaiman

item.quote: I dont really want to become normal, average, standard. I want merely to gain in strength, in the courage to live out my life more fully, enjoy more, experience more. I want to develop even more original and more unconventional traits
item.author: Anas Nin

item.quote: Thermodynamic miracles... events with odds against so astronomical they're effectively impossible, like oxygen spontaneously becoming gold. I long to observe such a thing.
item.author: Alan Moore

item.quote: When you make a choice, you change the future.
item.author: Deepak Chopra

item.quote: Well, I like to eat, sleep, drink, and be in love.
item.author: Langston Hughes

item.quote: Stop doing what is easy or popular. Start doing what is right.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: It doesn't matter how many people you meet in your life; you just need the real ones who accept you for who you are and help you become who you should be.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: If you try to change it, you will ruin it. Try to hold it, and you will lose it.
item.author: Lao Tzu

item.quote: Always believe in yourself and always stretch yourself beyond your limits. Your life is worth a lot more than you think because you are capable of accomplishing more than you know. You have more potential than you think, but you will never know your full potential unless you keep challenging yourself and pushing beyond your own self imposed limits.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Instructions for freedom:
item.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

item.quote: There's no need to wait for the bad things and bullshit to be over. Change now. Love now. Live now. Don't wait for people to give you permission to live, because they won't.
item.author: Kris Carr

item.quote: [F]or just one second, look at your life and see how perfect it is. Stop looking for the next secret door that is going to lead you to your real life. Stop waiting. This is it: there's nothing else. It's here, and you'd better decide to enjoy it or you're going to be miserable wherever you go, for the rest of your life, forever.
item.author: Lev Grossman

item.quote: Wanting him to come back before anyone notices part of the world has not moved since he left.
item.author: Brian Andreas

item.quote: Sharing tales of those we've lost is how we keep from really losing them.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: Live or die, but don't poison everything.
item.author: Anne Sexton

item.quote: Life is the tragedy,' she said bitterly. 'You know how they categorize Shakespeare's plays, right? If it ends with a wedding, it's a comedy. And if it ends with a funeral, it's a tragedy. So we're all living tragedies, because we all end the same way, and it isn't with a goddamn wedding.
item.author: Robyn Schneider

item.quote: Associate Yourself with People Who Think Positively:
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.
item.author: Dalai Lama XIV

item.quote: My past has not defined me, destroyed me, deterred me, or defeated me; it has only strengthened me.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Just remember that the things you put into your head are there forever, he said. You might want to think about that.
item.author: Cormac McCarthy

item.quote: Civilized men are more discourteous than savages because they know they can be impolite without having their skulls split, as a general thing.
item.author: Robert E. Howard

item.quote: My destination is no longer a place, rather a new way of seeing.
item.author: Marcel Proust

item.quote: You were put on this earth to achieve your greatest self, to live out your purpose, and to do it courageously.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: I do not believe anyone can be perfectly well, who has a brain and a heart
item.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.quote: It's not my story anymore: whenever I speak about the past now, I feel as if I were talking about something that has nothing to do with me. All that remains in the present are the voice, the presence, and the importance of fulfilling my mission. I don't regret difficulties I experienced; I think they helped me to become the person I am today, I feel the way a warrior must feel after years of training; he doesn't remember the details of everything he learned, but he knows how to strike when the time is right.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: My headll explode if I continue with this escapism.
item.author: Jess C Scott

item.quote: They had an ordinary life, full of ordinary thingsif love can ever be called that.
item.author: Leigh Bardugo

item.quote: The reason many people in our society are miserable, sick, and highly stressed is because of an unhealthy attachment to things they have no control over.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: When a stargirl cries, she sheds not tears but light.
item.author: Jerry Spinelli

item.quote: Life is hard. After all, it kills you.
item.author: Katharine Hepburn

item.quote: But we can't go back. We can only go forward.
item.author: Libba Bray

item.quote: Ah, love, let us be true
item.author: Matthew Arnold

item.quote: If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning: just as, if there were no light in the universe and therefore no creatures with eyes, we should never know it was dark. Dark would be without meaning.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: To learn something new, you need to try new things and not be afraid to be wrong.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: It might be possible that the world itself is without meaning.
item.author: Virginia Woolf

item.quote: Obscurity and a competencethat is the life that is best worth living.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: People sometimes sneer at those who run every day, claiming theyll go to any length to live longer. But I dont think thats the reason most people run. Most runners run not because they want to live longer, but because they want to live life to the fullest. If youre going to while away the years, its far better to live them with clear goals and fully alive than in a fog, and I believe running helps you do that. Exerting yourself to the fullest within your individual limits: thats the essence of running, and a metaphor for lifeand for me, for writing as well. I believe many runners would agree.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: We all have two lives. The second one starts when we realize that we only have one.
item.author: Tom Hiddleston

item.quote: The thing about a spiral is, if you follow it inward, it never actually ends. It just keeps tightening, infinitely.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Hobbes: Do you think there's a God?
item.author: Bill Watterson

item.quote: The choices you make now, the people you surround yourself with, they all have the potential to affect your life, even who you are, forever.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: Voici mon secret. Il est trs simple: on ne voit bien qu'avec le cur. L'essentiel est invisible pour les yeux.
item.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupry

item.quote: Its not that we have to quit
item.author: Roman Payne

item.quote: I think the highest and lowest points are the important ones. Anything else is just...in between.
item.author: Jim Morrison

item.quote: The Buddhists say there are 149 ways to God. I'm not looking for God, only for myself, and that is far more complicated. God has had a great deal written about Him; nothing has been written about me. God is bigger, like my mother, easier to find, even in the dark. I could be anywhere, and since I can't describe myself I can't ask for help.
item.author: Jeanette Winterson

item.quote: I used to spend so much time reacting and responding to everyone else that my life had no direction. Other people's lives, problems, and wants set the course for my life. Once I realized it was okay for me to think about and identify what I wanted, remarkable things began to take place in my life.
item.author: Melody Beattie

item.quote: If we admit that human life can be ruled by reason, then all possibility of life is destroyed.
item.author: leo tolstoy

item.quote: She was like a drowning person, flailing, reaching for anything that might save her. Her life was an urgent, desperate struggle to justify her life.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: Life happens. Shit happens. And it happens a lot. To a lot of people.
item.author: Colleen Hoover

item.quote: There are three deaths. The first is when the body ceases to function. The second is when the body is consigned to the grave. The third is that moment, sometime in the future, when your name is spoken for the last time.
item.author: David M. Eagleman

item.quote: The universe may not always play fair, but at least it's got a hell of a sense of humor.
item.author: Candace Bushnell

item.quote: How can I be substantial if I do not cast a shadow? I must have a dark side also If I am to be whole.
item.author: C.G. Jung

item.quote: I have known the joy and pain of friendship. I have served and been served. I have made some good enemies for which I am not a bit sorry. I have loved unselfishly, and I have fondled hatred with the red-hot tongs of Hell. That's living.
item.author: Zora Neale Hurston

item.quote: Without music, life would be a blank to me.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: There's no advantage to hurrying through life. -Shikamaru Nara
item.author: Masashi Kishimoto

item.quote: ...when pain is over, the remembrance of it often becomes a pleasure.
item.author: Jane Austen

item.quote: What if life could be this way? Only the happy parts, none of the terrible, not even the mildly unpleasant. What if we could just cut out the bad and keep the good? This is what I want to do with Violet - give her only the good, keep away the bad, so that good is all we ever have around us.
item.author: Jennifer Niven

item.quote: You can get all A's and still flunk life.
item.author: Walker Percy

item.quote: It's funny how, in this journey of life, even though we may begin at different times and places, our paths cross with others so that we may share our love, compassion, observations, and hope. This is a design of God that I appreciate and cherish.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: I'm not saying it's going to be easy. Nothing in life is easy. But that's no reason to give up. You'll be surprised what you can accomplish if you set your mind to it. After all, you only have one life, so you should try to make the most of it.
item.author: Louis Sachar

item.quote: Spending time with God is the key to our strength and success in all areas of life. Be sure that you never try to work God into your schedule, but always work your schedule around Him.
item.author: Joyce Meyer

item.quote: Oh, you hate your job? Why didn't you say so?
item.author: Drew Carey

item.quote: I am ready for whatever's coming. I expect nothing but to be let down or turned away. I am alone. Goddamn. The shit hurts sometimes, but I realize what I am, what I have become.
item.author: Henry Rollins

item.quote: Whether we fall by ambition, blood, or lust
item.author: John Webster

item.quote: Wisdom is knowing I am nothing,
item.author: Nisargadatta Maharaj

item.quote: Part of me suspects that I'm a loser, and the other part of me thinks I'm God Almighty.
item.author: John Lennon

item.quote: Consistency is the true foundation of trust. Either keep your promises or do not make them.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: In the end, the world always wins. That's just the way of things.
item.author: Khaled Hosseini

item.quote: I'm afraid of time... I mean, I'm afraid of not having enough time. Not enough time to understand people, how they really are, or to be understood myself. I'm afraid of the quick judgements or mistakes everybody makes. You can't fix them without time. I'm afraid of seeing snapshots, not movies.
item.author: Ann Brashares

item.quote: It's important in life if you don't give a shit. It can help you a lot.
item.author: George Carlin

item.quote: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived.
item.author: Henry David Thoreau

item.quote: And life
item.author: Colleen Hoover

item.quote: Pulvis et umbra sumus. It's a line from Horace. 'We are dust and shadows'. Appropriate, don't you think? Will said. It's not a long life, killing demons; one tends to die young, and then they burn your body - dust to dust, in the literal sense. And then we vanish into the shadows of history, nary a mark on the page of a mundane book to remind the world that once we existed at all.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Maybe everyone is just waiting for someone else to save them.
item.author: Margaret Peterson Haddix

item.quote: Fear robs you of your freedom to make the right choice in life that can bridge the gap between where you are and where you want to be. On the other side of fear, lies freedom. If you want to grow, you need to be brave and take risks. If you're not uncomfortable, you're not growing.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Life teaches us the right path is rarely the easy one.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Stay strong, stay positive, and never give up.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Want to keep Christ in Christmas? Feed the hungry, clothe the naked, forgive the guilty, welcome the unwanted, care for the ill, love your enemies, and do unto others as you would have done unto you.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Most things are forgotten over time. Even the war itself, the life-and-death struggle people went through is now like something from the distant past. Were so caught up in our everyday lives that events of the past are no longer in orbit around our minds. There are just too many things we have to think about everyday, too many new things we have to learn. But still, no matter how much time passes, no matter what takes place in the interim, there are some things we can never assign to oblivion, memories we can never rub away. They remain with us forever, like a touchstone.
item.author: haruki murakami

item.quote: Life is a blank canvas, and you need to throw all the paint on it you can.
item.author: Danny Kaye

item.quote: Maybe there is no Heaven. Or maybe this is all pure gibberisha product of the demented imagination of a lazy drunken hillbilly with a heart full of hate who has found a way to live out where the real winds blowto sleep late, have fun, get wild, drink whisky, and drive fast on empty streets with nothing in mind except falling in love and not getting arrested . . . Res ipsa loquitur. Let the good times roll.
item.author: Hunter S. Thompson

item.quote: What do you most value in your friends?
item.author: Christopher Hitchens

item.quote: Lo que mucha gente llama amar consiste en elegir una mujer y casarse con ella. La eligen, te lo juro, los he visto. Como si se pudiera elegir en el amor, como si no fuera un rayo que te parte los huesos y te deja estaqueado en la mitad del patio. Vos dirs que la eligen porque-la-aman, yo creo que es al vesre. A Beatriz no se la elige, a Julieta no se la elige. Vos no elegs la lluvia que te va a calar hasta los huesos cuando sals de un concierto.
item.author: Julio Cortzar

item.quote: I cannot understand anti-abortion arguments that centre on the sanctity of life. As a species we've fairly comprehensively demonstrated that we don't believe in the sanctity of life. The shrugging acceptance of war, famine, epidemic, pain and life-long poverty shows us that, whatever we tell ourselves, we've made only the most feeble of efforts to
item.author: Caitlin Moran

item.quote: He is the most beautiful creature I have ever seen and it's not about his face, but the life force I can see in him. It's the smile and the pure promise of everything he has to offer. Like he's saying, 'Here I am world, are you ready for so much passion and beauty and goodness and love and every other word that should be in the dictionary under the word life?' Except this boy is dead, and the unnaturalness of it makes me want to pull my hair out with Tate and Narnie and Fitz and Jude's grief all combined. It makes me want to yell at the God that I wish I didn't believe in. For hogging him all to himself. I want to say, 'You greedy God. Give him back. I needed him here.
item.author: Melina Marchetta

item.quote: One can be the master of what one does, but never of what one feels.
item.author: Gustave Flaubert

item.quote: Its strange how dreams get under your skin and give your heart a test for whats real and whats imaginary.
item.author: Jason Mraz

item.quote: If you learn to really sit with loneliness and embrace it for the gift that it isan opportunity to get to know YOU, to learn how strong you really are, to depend on no one but YOU for your happinessyou will realize that a little loneliness goes a LONG way in creating a richer, deeper, more vibrant and colorful YOU.
item.author: Mandy Hale

item.quote: Drink your tea slowly and reverently, as if it is the axis on which the world earth revolves - slowly, evenly, without rushing toward the future.
item.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

item.quote: Would you rather live one perfect day over and over or live your life with no perfect days but just decent ones?
item.author: Jenny Han

item.quote: People wait around too long for love. I'm happy with all of my lusts!
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: Do you know what your problem is? You can't live with the idea that someone might leave.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Life is problems. Living is solving problems.
item.author: Raymond E. Feist

item.quote: The boundaries which divide Life from Death are at best shadowy and vague. Who shall say where the one ends, and where the other begins?
item.author: Edgar Allan Poe

item.quote: Maybe happiness didn't have to be about the big, sweeping circumstances, about having everything in your life in place. Maybe it was about stringing together a bunch of small pleasures. Wearing slippers and watching the Miss Universe contest. Eating a brownie with vanilla ice cream. Getting to level seven in Dragon Master and knowing there were twenty more levels to go.
item.author: Ann Brashares

item.quote: The truth about the world, he said, is that anything is possible. Had you not seen it all from birth and thereby bled it of its strangeness it would appear to you for what it is, a hat trick in a medicine show, a fevered dream, a trance bepopulate with chimeras having neither analogue nor precedent, an itinerant carnival, a migratory tentshow whose ultimate destination after many a pitch in many a mudded field is unspeakable and calamitous beyond reckoning.
item.author: Cormac McCarthy

item.quote: It is not that we have so little time but that we lose so much. ... The life we receive is not short but we make it so; we are not ill provided but use what we have wastefully.
item.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

item.quote: I will be stronger than my sadness.
item.author: Jasmine Warga

item.quote: We know from daily life that we exist for other people first of all, for whose smiles and well-being our own happiness depends.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: Shine your light and make a positive impact on the world; there is nothing so honorable as helping improve the lives of others.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Youth offers the promise of happiness, but life offers the realities of grief.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: For a day, just for one day,
item.author: / Shams-al-Din Mohammad Hafez

item.quote: I scream for everything that has gone wrong. I scream for everything broken in our lives.
item.author: Marie Lu

item.quote: I had rather be shut up in a very modest cottage with my books, my family and a few old friends, dining on simple bacon, and letting the world roll on as it liked, than to occupy the most splendid post, which any human power can give.
item.author: Thomas Jefferson

item.quote: I want someone whose heart is big enough to hold me.
item.author: Rainbow Rowell

item.quote: Life is like a beautiful melody, only the lyrics are messed up.
item.author: Hans Christian Andersen

item.quote: Be with someone who inspires you and makes you be the best version of yourself.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Sometimes I just think depression's one way of coping with the world. Like, some people get drunk, some people do drugs, some people get depressed. Because there's so much stuff out there that you have to do something to deal with it.
item.author: Ned Vizzini

item.quote: I won't tell you that the world matters nothing, or the world's voice, or the voice of society. They matter a good deal. They matter far too much. But there are moments when one has to choose between living one's own life, fully, entirely, completelyor dragging out some false, shallow, degrading existence that the world in its hypocrisy demands. You have that moment now. Choose!
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: This life is for loving, sharing, learning, smiling, caring, forgiving, laughing, hugging, helping, dancing, wondering, healing, and even more loving. I choose to live life this way. I want to live my life in such a way that when I get out of bed in the morning, the devil says, 'aw shit, he's up!
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: We cast a shadow on something wherever we stand, and it is no good moving from place to place to save things; because the shadow always follows. Choose a place where you won't do harm - yes, choose a place where you won't do very much harm, and stand in it for all you are worth, facing the sunshine.
item.author: E.M. Forster

item.quote: If we had no winter, the spring would not be so pleasant: if we did not sometimes taste of adversity, prosperity would not be so welcome.
item.author: Anne Bradstreet

item.quote: Chocolate says I'm sorry so much better than words.
item.author: Rachel Vincent

item.quote: When someone sees the same people every day, as had happened with him at the seminary, they wind up becoming a part of that person's life. And then they want the person to change. If someone isn't what others want them to be, the others become angry. Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or her own.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: The art of living... is neither careless drifting on the one hand nor fearful clinging to the past on the other. It consists in being sensitive to each moment, in regarding it as utterly new and unique, in having the mind open and wholly receptive.
item.author: Alan Wilson Watts

item.quote: I hope you will go out and let stories, that is life, happen to you, and that you will work with these stories... water them with your blood and tears and your laughter till they bloom, till you yourself burst into bloom.
item.author: Clarissa Pinkola Ests

item.quote: For the things we have to learn before we can do them, we learn by doing them.
item.author: Aristotle

item.quote: I have looked in the mirror every morning and asked myself: If today were the last day of my life, would I want to do what I am about to do today? And whenever the answer has been No for too many days in a row, I know I need to change something.
item.author: Steve Jobs

item.quote: Changing is what people do when they have no options left.
item.author: Holly Black

item.quote: Because isnt that the point of every relationship: to be known by someone else, to be understood? He gets me. She gets me. Isnt that the simple magic phrase?
item.author: Gillian Flynn

item.quote: It can take years to mold a dream. It takes only a fraction of a second for it to be shattered.
item.author: Mary E. Pearson

item.quote: The sense of tragedy - according to Aristotle - comes, ironically enough, not from the protagonist's weak points but from his good qualities. Do you know what I'm getting at? People are drawn deeper into tragedy not by their defects but by their virtues.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Dream your own dreams, achieve your own goals. Your journey is your own and unique.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: You have lost your reason and taken the wrong path. You have taken lies for truth, and hideousness for beauty. You would marvel if, owing to strange events of some sorts, frogs and lizards suddenly grew on apple and orange trees instead of fruit, or if roses began to smell like a sweating horse; so I marvel at you who exchange heaven for earth. I don't want to understand you.
item.author: Anton Chekhov

item.quote: All that is important is this one moment in movement. Make the moment important, vital, and worth living. Do not let it slip away unnoticed and unused.
item.author: Martha Graham

item.quote: Selling my soul would be a lot easier if I could just find it.
item.author: Nikki Sixx

item.quote: I have an idea that the only thing which makes it possible to regard this world we live in without disgust is the beauty which now and then men create out of the chaos. The pictures they paint, the music they compose, the books they write, and the lives they lead. Of all these the richest in beauty is the beautiful life. That is the perfect work of art.
item.author: W. Somerset Maugham

item.quote: Great Leaders Create More Leaders
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I dont regret anything Ive ever done in life, any choice that Ive made. But Im consumed with regret for the things I didnt do, the choices I didnt make, the things I didnt say. We spend so much time being afraid of failure, afraid of rejection. But regret is the thing we should fear most. Failure is an answer. Rejection is an answer. Regret is an eternal question you will never have the answer to. What if If only I wonder what would have You will never, never know, and it will haunt you for the rest of your days.
item.author: Trevor Noah

item.quote: Life is but a dream for the dead.
item.author: Gerard Way

item.quote: Stay hungry, stay young, stay foolish, stay curious, and above all, stay humble because just when you think you got all the answers, is the moment when some bitter twist of fate in the universe will remind you that you very much don't.
item.author: Tom Hiddleston

item.quote: Semua perjalanan hidup adalah sinema. Bahkan lebih mengerikan. Darah adalah darah, dan tangis adalah tangis. Tak ada pemeran pengganti yang akan menanggung sakitmu.
item.author: Dee

item.quote: You were not born on earth to please anyone; you have to live life to express yourself, not to impress someone. Don't pretend to be someone you're not, and never lose yourself in search of other people's acceptance and approval.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Difficulties and adversities viciously force all their might on us and cause us to fall apart, but they are necessary elements of individual growth and reveal our true potential. We have got to endure and overcome them, and move forward. Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Every choice comes with a consequence. Once you make a choice, you must accept responsibility. You cannot escape the consequences of your choices, whether you like them or not.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: How much you can learn when you fail determines how far you will go into achieving your goals.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Push your boundaries beyond the ordinary; be that extra in extraordinary.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Normal is an illusion. What is normal for the spider is chaos for the fly.
item.author: Charles Addams

item.quote: Wisdom is having things right in your life
item.author: William Stafford

item.quote: The tragedy of life is what dies inside a man while he lives.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: I definitely learned a lesson this time. I know that I can be broken. I am not as tough as I thought. I see it now. At this point, it's the only thing good that came out of all of this. I know myself better now and know what I have to do.
item.author: Henry Rollins

item.quote: The right thing to do and the hard thing to do are usually the same.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: We pass through this world but once. Few tragedies can be more extensive than the stunting of life, few injustices deeper than the denial of an opportunity to strive or even to hope, by a limit imposed from without, but falsely identified as lying within.
item.author: Stephen Jay Gould

item.quote: I have noticed that even those who assert that everything is predestined and that we can change nothing about it still look both ways before they cross the street.
item.author: Stephen Hawking

item.quote: It's good to do uncomfortable things. It's weight training for life.
item.author: Anne Lamott

item.quote: I am suddenly comsumed by nostalgia for the little girl who was me, who loved the fields and believed in God, who spent winter days home sick from school reading Nancy Drew and sucking menthol cough drops, who could keep a secret.
item.author: Audrey Niffenegger

item.quote: Love, like everything else in life, should be a discovery, an adventure, and like most adventures, you dont know youre having one until youre right in the middle of it.
item.author: E.A. Bucchianeri

item.quote: I feel sorry for anyone who is in a place where he feels strange and stupid.
item.author: Lois Lowry

item.quote: Me: I refuse to attend Support Group.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: We judge others instantly by their clothes, their cars, their appearance, their race, their education, their social status. The list is endless. What gets me is that most people decide who another person is before they have even spoken to them. What's even worse is that these same people decide who someone else is, and don't even know who they are themselves.
item.author: Ashly Lorenzana

item.quote: A boo is a lot louder than a cheer.
item.author: Lance Armstrong

item.quote: Jamie: You know what I figured out today?
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Life is infinitely stranger than anything which the mind of man could invent.
item.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

item.quote: Those who have never known the deep intimacy and the intense companionship of happy mutual love have missed the best thing that life has to give.
item.author: Bertrand Russell

item.quote: Live fast. Die young. Be wild. Have fun.
item.author: Lana Del Rey

item.quote: Understanding the difference between healthy striving and perfectionism is critical to laying down the shield and picking up your life. Research shows that perfectionism hampers success. In fact, it's often the path to depression, anxiety, addiction, and life paralysis.
item.author: Bren Brown

item.quote: A bend in the road is not the end of the roadUnless you fail to make the turn.
item.author: Helen Keller

item.quote: Hopes are like hair ornaments. Girls want to wear too many of them. When they become old women they look silly wearing even one.
item.author: Arthur Golden

item.quote: Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories. Ask no guarantees, ask for no security, there never was such an animal. And if there were, it would be related to the great sloth which hangs upside down in a tree all day every day, sleeping its life away. To hell with that, he said, shake the tree and knock the great sloth down on his ass.
item.author: Ray Bradbury

item.quote: I'm not crying because of you; you're not worth it. I'm crying because my delusion of who you were was shattered by the truth of who you are.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: I always had this idea that you should never give up a happy middle in the hopes of a happy ending, because there is no such thing as a happy ending. Do you know what I mean? There is so much to lose.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: And when I saw him[my father] lying dead in a pool of his own blood, I knew then that I hadn't stopped believing in God. I'd just stopped believing God cared. There might be a God, Clary, and there might be not. Either way, we're on our own.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: What strange phenomena we find in a great city, all we need do is stroll about with our eyes open. Life swarms with innocent monsters.
item.author: Charles Baudelaire

item.quote: There is but one truly serious philosophical problem and that is suicide. Judging whether life is or is not worth living amounts to answering the fundamental question of philosophy. All the rest whether or not the world has three dimensions, whether the mind has nine or twelve categories comes afterwards. These are games; one must first answer.
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: I've come to believe that all my past failure and frustration were actually laying
item.author: Anthony Robbins

item.quote: Change course, but dont give up.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: I'll never know, and neither will you, of the life you don't choose. We'll only know that whatever that sister life was, it was important and beautiful and not ours. It was the ghost ship that didn't carry us. There's nothing to do but salute it from the shore.
item.author: Cheryl Strayed

item.quote: Do your own thing on your own terms and get what you came here for
item.author: Oliver James

item.quote: I love you. I hate you. I like you. I hate you. I love you. I think youre stupid. I think youre a loser. I think youre wonderful. I want to be with you. I dont want to be with you. I would never date you. I hate you. I love you..I think the madness started the moment we met and you shook my hand. Did you have a disease or something?
item.author: Shannon L. Alder

item.quote: Books can be dangerous. The best ones should be labeled This could change your life.
item.author: Helen Exley

item.quote: Even chance meetings are the result of karma Things in life are fated by our previous lives. That even in the smallest events theres no such thing as coincidence.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Art is unquestionably one of the purest and highest elements in human happiness. It trains the mind through the eye, and the eye through the mind. As the sun colors flowers, so does art color life.
item.author: John Lubbock

item.quote: Before I can live with other folks Ive got to live with myself. The one thing that doesnt abide by majority rule is a persons conscience.
item.author: Harper Lee

item.quote: All that happens means something; nothing you do is ever insignificant.
item.author: Aldous Huxley

item.quote: You are a child of the universe,
item.author: Max Ehrmann

item.quote: You need to spend time crawling alone through shadows to truly appreciate what it is to stand in the sun.
item.author: Shaun Hick

item.quote: There is no escapewe pay for the violence of our ancestors.
item.author: Frank Herbert

item.quote: I really don't see anything romantic in proposing. It is very romantic to be in love. But there is nothing romantic about a definite proposal. Why, one may be accepted. One usually is, I believe. Then the excitement is all over. The very essence of romance is uncertainty. If ever I get married, I'll certainly try to forget the fact.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: What makes earth feel like hell is our expectation that it should feel like heaven.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: Do not let your difficulties fill you with anxiety, after all it is only in the darkest nights that stars shine more brightly.
item.author: Ali Ibn Abi Talib AS

item.quote: No one ever does live happily ever after, but we leave the children to find that out for themselves.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: We never live; we are always in the expectation of living.
item.author: Voltaire

item.quote: I think computer viruses should count as life ... I think it says something about human nature that the only form of life we have created so far is purely destructive. We've created life in our own image.
item.author: Stephen Hawking

item.quote: Man starts over again everyday, in spite of all he knows, against all he knows.
item.author: Emil Cioran

item.quote: Life is not complex. We are complex. Life is simple, and the simple thing is the right thing.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: As we go through life we gradually discover who we are, but the more we discover, the more we lose ourselves.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: We can only be said to be alive in those moments when our hearts are conscious of our treasures.
item.author: Thornton Wilder

item.quote: We are born in one day. We die in one day. We can change in one day. And we can fall in love in one day. Anything can happen in just one day.
item.author: Gayle Forman

item.quote: I only want to write. And there's no college for that except life.
item.author: Dodie Smith

item.quote: In the Book of Life, The answers aren't in the back.
item.author: Charles M. Schulz

item.quote: Singing in the rain. I'm singing in the rain. And it's such a fucking glorious feeling. An unexpected downpour and I am just giving myself into it. Because what the fuck else can you do? Run for cover? Shriek and curse? No--when the rain falls you just let it fall and you grin like a madman and you dance with it because if you can make yourself happy in the rain, then you're doing pretty alright in life.
item.author: David Levithan

item.quote: I really think I write about everyday life. I don't think I'm quite as odd as others say I am. Life is intrinsically, well, boring and dangerous at the same time. At any given moment the floor may open up. Of course, it almost never does; that's what makes it so boring.
item.author: Edward Gorey

item.quote: Life will defend itself no matter how small it is.
item.author: Yann Martel

item.quote: Nothing in life is worth,
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: Our lives can't be measured by our final years, of this I am sure.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: ... so this is for us.
item.author: Charlotte Eriksson

item.quote: ...I told him a story of two people. Two people who shouldn't have met, and who didn't like each other much when they did, but who found they were the only two people in the world who could possibly have understood each other.
item.author: Jojo Moyes

item.quote: In case you never get a second chance: don't be afraid! And what if you do get a second chance? You take it!
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: Dont worry if people think youre crazy. You are crazy. You have that kind of intoxicating insanity that lets other people dream outside of the lines and become who theyre destined to be.
item.author: Jennifer Elisabeth

item.quote: I believe in looking reality straight in the eye and denying it.
item.author: Garrison Keillor

item.quote: There's always another storm. It's the way the world works. Snowstorms, rainstorms, windstorms, sandstorms, and firestorms. Some are fierce and others are small. You have to deal with each one separately, but you need to keep an eye on whats brewing for tomorrow.
item.author: Maria V. Snyder

item.quote: Let all of life be an unfettered howl.
item.author: Vladimir Nabokov

item.quote: I am nothing more than the consequence of catastrophe.
item.author: Tahereh Mafi

item.quote: Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.
item.author: Wil Zeus

item.quote: The only artists I have ever known who are personally delightful are bad artists. Good artists exist simply in what they make, and consequently are perfectly uninteresting in what they are. A great poet, a really great poet, is the most unpoetical of all creatures. But inferior poets are absolutely fascinating. The worse their rhymes are, the more picturesque they look. The mere fact of having published a book of second-rate sonnets makes a man quite irresistible. He lives the poetry that he cannot write. The others write the poetry that they dare not realize.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Each one of us here today will at one time in our lives look upon a loved one who is in need and ask the same question: We are willing to help, Lord, but what, if anything, is needed? For it is true we can seldom help those closest to us. Either we don't know what part of ourselves to give or, more often than not, the part we have to give is not wanted. And so it is those we live with and should know who elude us. But we can still love them - we can love completely without complete understanding.
item.author: Norman Maclean

item.quote: Thats how I know they are dreams. Because the simple and plain and everyday things are the ones that we can never have. (Cassia Reyes)
item.author: Ally Condie

item.quote: A joke is a very serious thing.
item.author: Winston S. Churchill

item.quote: Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to
item.author: Brian Tracy

item.quote: Never forget:
item.author: Kobayashi Issa

item.quote: Thats how stories happen with a turning point, an unexpected twist. Theres only one kind of happiness, but misfortune comes in all shapes and sizes. Its like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a story.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: So he tasted the deep pain that is reserved only for the strong, just as he had tasted for a little while the deep happiness.
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: Positive expectations are the mark of the superior personality.
item.author: Brian Tracy

item.quote: Most people overestimate what they can do in one year and underestimate what they can do in ten years.
item.author: Bill Gates

item.quote: The absence of the will to live is, alas, not sufficient to make one want to die.
item.author: Michel Houellebecq

item.quote: No one has ever achieved greatness without dreams.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Its probably my job to tell you life isnt fair, but I figure you already know that. So instead, Ill tell you that hope is precious, and youre right not to give up.
item.author: C.J. Redwine

item.quote: In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple. In conflict, be fair and generous. In governing, don't try to control. In work, do what you enjoy. In family life, be completely present.
item.author: Lao Tzu

item.quote: All sacrifice and suffering is redemptive. It is used to either teach the individual or to help others. Nothing is by chance.
item.author: A.J. RUSSELL

item.quote: I dont want life to imitate art. I want life to be art.
item.author: Carrie Fisher

item.quote: I havent been very impressed lately.
item.author: Charlotte Eriksson

item.quote: The irony of life is that those who wear masks often tell us more truths than those with open faces.
item.author: Marie Lu

item.quote: You can have everything you want if you can put your heart and soul into everything you do.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Never lose faith in yourself, and never lose hope; remember, even when this world throws its worst and then turns its back, there is still always hope.
item.author: Pittacus Lore

item.quote: Do not let your negative thoughts have power over you because those thoughts will end up controlling your life. No one can live a positive life with a negative mind.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: If you can't do anything about it, laugh like hell.
item.author: David Cook

item.quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be aliveto breathe, to think, to enjoy, to lovethen make that day count!
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Life will hit you hard in the face, wait for you to get back up just so it can kick you in the stomach. But getting the wind knocked out of you is the only way to remind your lungs how much they like the taste of air.
item.author: Sarah Kay

item.quote: No one else has access to the world you carry around within yourself; you are its custodian and entrance. No one else can see the world the way you see it. No one else can feel your life the way you feel it. Thus it is impossible to ever compare two people because each stands on such different ground. When you compare yourself to others, you are inviting envy into your consciousness; it can be a dangerous and destructive guest.
item.author: John O'Donohue

item.quote: Life is 10 percent what you make it
item.author: Irving Berlin

item.quote: How would your life be different ifYou stopped worrying about things you cant control and started focusing on the things you can? Let today be the dayYou free yourself from fruitless worry, seize the day and take effective action on things you can change.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: My life is a reading list.
item.author: John Irving

item.quote: Love demands everything, they say, but my love demands only this: that no matter what happens or how long it takes, you`ll keep faith in me, you`ll remember who we are, and you`ll never feel despair.
item.author: Ann Brashares

item.quote: People do not die for us immediately, but remain bathed in a sort of aura of
item.author: Marcel Proust

item.quote: Life is a drama full of tragedy and comedy. You should learn to enjoy the comic episodes a little more.
item.author: Jeannette Walls

item.quote: Life is a bowl of cherries. Some cherries are rotten while others are good; its your job to throw out the rotten ones and forget about them while you enjoy eating the ones that are good! There are two kinds of people: those who choose to throw out the good cherries and wallow in all the rotten ones, and those who choose to throw out all the rotten ones and savor all the good ones.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: All religions, arts and sciences are branches of the same tree. All these aspirations are directed toward ennobling man's life, lifting it from the sphere of mere physical existence and leading the individual towards freedom.
item.author: Albert Einstein

item.quote: When we're connected to others, we become better people.
item.author: Randy Pausch

item.quote: Failures are the stairs we climb to reach success.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: A man's work is nothing but this slow trek to rediscover, through the detours of art, those two or three great and simple images in whose presence his heart first opened.
item.author: Albert Camus

item.quote: Take wrong turns. Talk to strangers. Open unmarked doors. And if you see a group of people in a field, go find out what they are doing. Do things without always knowing how they'll turn out. You're curious and smart and bored, and all you see is the choice between working hard and slacking off. There are so many adventures that you miss because you're waiting to think of a plan. To find them, look for tiny interesting choices. And remember that you are always making up the future as you go.
item.author: Randall Munroe

item.quote: The moment a little boy is concerned with which is a jay and which is a sparrow, he can no longer see the birds or hear them sing.
item.author: Eric Berne

item.quote: Alice had got so much into the way of expecting nothing but out-of-the-way things to happen, that it seemed quite dull and stupid for life to go on in the common way.
item.author: Lewis Carroll

item.quote: It is life, I think, to watch the water. A man can learn so many things.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: Don't blow off another's candle for it won't make yours shine brighter.
item.author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu
