item.quote: I had a dream about you. I was sitting on your couch, relating my succession of ideas on subconscious influence. I asked you what they meant, and you told me that free associations were a bad way to advance my political career.
item.author: Bauvard

item.quote: Envy, after all, comes from wanting something that isn't yours. But grief comes from losing something you've already had.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: Every ounce of my cynicism is supported by historical precedent.
item.author: Glen Cook

item.quote: Oh, God of Dust and Rainbows,
item.author: Langston Hughes

item.quote: Hope is such a beautiful word, but it often seems very fragile. Life is still being needlessly hurt and destroyed.
item.author: Michael Jackson

item.quote: Journeys end
item.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

item.quote: Lottery: A tax on people who are bad at math.
item.author: Ambrose Bierce

item.quote: You know my name, not my story. You've heard what I've done, but not what I've been through.
item.author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett

item.quote: The heart may freeze, or it can burn. The pain will ease and I can learn. There is no future, there is no past. I live this moment as, my last.
item.author: Jonathan Larson

item.quote: You're here to be light, bringing out the God-colors in the world.
item.author: Anonymous

item.quote: We started off trying to set up a small anarchist community, but people wouldn't obey the rules.
item.author: Alan Bennett

item.quote: May all that have life be delivered from suffering
item.author: Buddha

item.quote: We fool ourselves so much we could do it for a living.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: If only you would realize some day, how much have you hurt me,
item.author: Mehek Bassi

item.quote: Those candle flames were like the lives of men. So fragile. So deadly. Left alone, they lit and warmed. Let run rampant, they would destroy the very things they were meant to illuminate. Embryonic bonfires, each bearing a seed of destruction so potent it could tumble cities and dash kings to their knees.
item.author: Brandon Sanderson

item.quote: Inside of all of us there is the need and the desire to be heard, to have our innermost thoughts, feelings and desires expressed for others to hear, to see and to understand. We all want to matter to someone, to leave a mark. Writers just take those thoughts, feelings and desires and express them in such a way that the reader not only reads them but feels them as well.
item.author: V. Vee

item.quote: The greatest wealth is health
item.author: Virgil

item.quote: He stood up straight and looked the world squarely in the fields and hills. To add weight to his words he stuck the rabbit bone in his hair. He spread his arm out wide. I will go mad! he annouced.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: Sometimes it seemed to him that his life was delicate as a dandelion. One little puff from any direction, and it was blown to bits.
item.author: Katherine Paterson

item.quote: I enjoy almost everything. Yet I have some restless searcher in me. Why is there not a discovery in life? Something one can lay hands on and say This is it? My depression is a harassed feeling. Im looking: but thats not it thats not it. What is it? And shall I die before I find it?
item.author: Virginia Woolf

item.quote: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.
item.author: Steve Jobs

item.quote: It's like this old patchwork quilt my momma used to have...Each piece on that quilt meant something. And some of those pieces were the damn ugliest things you've ever seen...But some of the pieces were so beautiful they almost hurt my eyes to look at when I was a kid...That's the best you can hope for, Danny. That your life turns out like that patchwork quilt. That you can add some bright, sparkling pieces to the dirty, stained ones you have so far. That in the end, the bright patches might take up more space on your quilt than the dark ones.
item.author: Brooke McKinley

item.quote: WE two boys together clinging,
item.author: Walt Whitman

item.quote: Morning will come, it has no choice.
item.author: Marty Rubin

item.quote: When humans were young, they were pushed around in strollers. When they were old, they were pushed around in wheelchairs. In between, they were just pushed around.
item.author: Tom Robbins

item.quote: When was the last time you woke up and realized that today could be the best day of your life?
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: REMEMBER YOUR GREATNESS
item.author: Suzy Kassem

item.quote: People said that video games were bad because they made you numb to death, made you register entrails splattering across a screen as a sign of success. In that moment, Val thought that the real problem with games was that the player was suppossed to try everything. If there was a cave, you went in it. If there was a mysterious stranger, you talked to him. If there was a map, you followed it. But in games, you had a hundred million billion lives and Val only had this one.
item.author: Holly Black

item.quote: Accidents happen. Our bones shatter, our skin splits, our hearts break. We burn, we drown, we stay alive.
item.author: Mora Fowley-Doyle

item.quote: Those guys who want to have the Mohawk...which, to me, is the new business casual.
item.author: Gerard Way

item.quote: You live it forward, but understand it backward.
item.author: Abraham Verghese

item.quote: I pull my foot back again, but Four's hands clamp around my arms, and he pulls me away from her with irresistible force. I breathe through gritted teeth, staring at Molly's blood-covered face, the color deep and rich and beautiful, in a way. She groans, and I hear a gurgling in her throat, watch blood trickle from her lips. You won, Four mutters. Stop. I wipe the sweat from my forehead. He stares at me. His eyes too wide; they look alarmed. I think you should leave, he says. Take a walk. I'm fine, I say. I'm fine now, I say again, this time for myself.
item.author: Veronica Roth

item.quote: But I have my life, Im living it. Its twisted, exhausting, uncertain, and full of guilt, but nonetheless, theres something there.
item.author: Banana Yoshimoto

item.quote: The life of every man is a diary in which he means to write one story, and writes another; and his humblest hour is when he compares the volume as it is with what he vowed to make it.
item.author: J.M. Barrie

item.quote: I thought that if I owned nothing, had nothing, was nothing, I would have nothing left to lose, and I wouldn't be scared anymore. Because my whole life Ive been so damn scared. Scared to live because I was scared to die. But at the same I was so scared of living, so I wanted to die. Or maybe so scared of dying that I refused to live. You don't have to be afraid to fall, when you're already on the ground. You don't have to be scared to lose someone, when there's no one around to lose.
item.author: Charlotte Eriksson

item.quote: I liked being a person. I wanted to keep at it.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: God surely did not create us, and cause us to live, with the sole end of wishing always to die. I believe, in my heart, we were intended to prize life and enjoy it, so long as we retain it. Existence never was originally meant to be that useless, blank, pale, slow-trailing thing it often becomes to many, and is becoming to me, among the rest.
item.author: Charlotte Bront

item.quote: I think of life as a good book. The further you get into it, the more it begins to make sense.
item.author: Harold Kushner

item.quote: There are no happy endings... There are no endings, happy or otherwise. We all have our own stories which are just part of the one Story that binds both this world and Faerie. Sometimes we step into each others stories - perhaps just for a few minutes, perhaps for years - and then we step out of them again. But all the while, the Story just goes on.
item.author: Charles deLint

item.quote: It is when we think we can act like God, that all respect is lost, and I think this is the downfall of peace. We lie if we say we do not see color and culture and difference. We fool ourselves and cheat ourselves when we say that all of us are the same. We should not want to be the same as others and we should not want others to be the same as us. Rather, we ought to glory and shine in all of our differences, flaunting them fabulously for all to see! It is never a conformity that we need! We need not to conform! What we need is to burst out into all these beautiful colors!
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: It is part of the human nature always to judge others very severely and,when the wind turns against us,always to find an excuse for our own misdeeds,or to blame someone else for our mistakes.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: There are a million rules for being a girl. There are a million things you have to do to get through each day. High school has things that can trip you up, ruin you, people say one thing and mean another, and you have to know all the rules, you have to know what you can and can't do.
item.author: Elizabeth Scott

item.quote: Art and life are subjective. Not everybody's gonna dig what I dig, but I reserve the right to dig it.
item.author: Whoopi Goldberg

item.quote: HOBBES:
item.author: Bill Watterson

item.quote: The whole house seemed to exhale a melancholy breath of emptiness
item.author: Michael Chabon

item.quote: But what are loyalty and caring really worth?
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: That's life for you, said MacDunn. Someone always waiting for someone who never comes home. Always someone loving some thing more than that thing loves them. And after a while you want to destroy whatever that thing is, so it can't hurt you no more.
item.author: Ray Bradbury

item.quote: Men's lives have meaning, not their deaths.
item.author: George R.R. Martin

item.quote: When you're the most happening person at the party, it's time to leave
item.author: Kelly Cutrone

item.quote: After all, if you run far enough, no one can catch you.
item.author: V.E. Schwab

item.quote: I think probably kindness is my number one attribute in a human being. I'll put it before any of the things like courage or bravery or generosity or anything else.
item.author: Roald Dahl

item.quote: If her enemies were Brigan's friends and her friends were Brigan's enemies, then the two of them could walk through the world arm in arm and never be hit by arrows again.
item.author: Kristin Cashore

item.quote: Know what you want to do, hold the thought firmly, and do every day what should be done, and every sunset will see you that much nearer the goal.
item.author: Elbert Hubbard

item.quote: Happiness is always a by-product. It is probably a matter of temperament, and for anything I know it may be glandular. But it is not something that can be demanded from life, and if you are not happy you had better stop worrying about it and see what treasures you can pluck from your own brand of unhappiness.
item.author: Robertson Davies

item.quote: Fleet kept running, Kaladin growled, getting back under Elhokars arm.
item.author: Brandon Sanderson

item.quote: Even though our time in this life is temporary, if we live well enough, our legacy will last forever.
item.author: idowu koyenikan

item.quote: They tell you: Follow your dreams. Listen to your spirit. Change the world. Make your mark. Find your inner voice and make it sing. Embrace failure. Dream. Dream and dream big. As a matter of fact, dream and dont stop dreaming until your dream comes true.
item.author: Shonda Rhimes

item.quote: Why cant the world hear? I ask myself. Within a few moments I ask it many times. Because it doesnt care, I finally answer, and I know Im right. Its like Ive been chosen. But chosen for what? I ask.
item.author: Markus Zusak

item.quote: I'll be happy if running and I can grow old together.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: The most important thing is this: to be able at any moment to be free to choose a life that makes you happy.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Our sweetest songs are those of saddest thought.
item.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

item.quote: Letting go is the lesson. Letting go is always the lesson. Have you ever noticed how much of our agony is all tied up with craving and loss?
item.author: Susan Gordon Lydon

item.quote: You had to risk your life to get love. You had to get right to the edge of death to ever be saved.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: The difference between school and life? In school, you're taught a lesson and then given a test. In life, you're given a test that teaches you a lesson.
item.author: Tom Bodett

item.quote: Sadly enough, the most painful goodbyes are the ones that are left unsaid and never explained.
item.author: Jonathan Harnisch

item.quote: Oh sorry, I was taking life seriously.
item.author: Bill Hicks

item.quote: It doesn't matter who you are, or where you come from, or how much money you've got in your pocket. You have your own destiny and your own life ahead of you.
item.author: Lady Gaga

item.quote: Occasionally in life there are those moments of unutterable fulfillment which cannot be completely explained by those symbols called words. Their meanings can only be articulated by the inaudible language of the heart.
item.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

item.quote: The world is merciless, and it's also very beautiful.
item.author: Hajime Isayama

item.quote: The young always have the same problem - how to rebel and conform at the same time. They have now solved this by defying their parents and copying one another.
item.author: Quentin Crisp

item.quote: But I think we both knew, even then, that what we had was something even more rare, and even more meaningful. I was going to be his friend, and was going to show him possibilities. And he, in turn, would become someone I could trust more than myself.
item.author: David Levithan

item.quote: Kindness, Ive discovered, is everything in life.
item.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

item.quote: The span of three or four minutes is pretty insignificant in the scheme of things. People lose hundreds of minutes everyday, squandering them on trivial things. But sometimes in those fragments of time, something can happen you'll remember the rest of your life.
item.author: Lisa Kleypas

item.quote: One day can change your life. One day can ruin your life. All life is is three or four big days that change everything.
item.author: Beverly Donofrio

item.quote: Because you can only die once but you can suffer forever.
item.author: Shaun David Hutchinson

item.quote: Ethical veganism results in a profound revolution within the individual; a complete rejection of the paradigm of oppression and violence that she has been taught from childhood to accept as the natural order. It changes her life and the lives of those with whom she shares this vision of nonviolence. Ethical veganism is anything but passive; on the contrary, it is the active refusal to cooperate with injustice
item.author: GaryLFrancione

item.quote: Nothing in this world compares to the comfort and security of having someone just hold your hand.
item.author: Richelle E. Goodrich

item.quote: Everyone who tells a story tells it differently, just to remind us that everybody sees it differently. Some people say there are true things to be found, some people say all kinds of things can be proved. I don't believe them. The only thing for certain is how complicated it all is, like string full of knots. It's all there but hard to find the beginning and impossible to fathom the end. The best you can do is admire the cat's cradle, and maybe knot it up a bit more.
item.author: Jeanette Winterson

item.quote: She laughed for her wasted, difficult life that never had to be wasted or difficult in the first place.
item.author: Leslye Walton

item.quote: That's all you can do in this world, no matter how strong the current beats against you, or how heavy your burden, or how tragic your love story. You keep going.
item.author: Robyn Schneider

item.quote: You will be fine,' the fortune teller says. 'There may be decisions to make and surprises in store. Life takes us to unexpected places sometimes. The future is never set in stone, remember that.
item.author: Erin Morgenstern

item.quote: It seemed to me that this world has a serious shortage of both logic and kindness.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Excellence/Perfection is not a destination; it is a continuous journey that never ends.
item.author: Brian Tracy

item.quote: I have given my word that only death will take me from you.
item.author: Philippa Gregory

item.quote: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realise they were the big things.
item.author: Robert Brault

item.quote: Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps; for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are, and what they ought to be.
item.author: William Hazlitt

item.quote: To put meaning in one's life may end in madness,
item.author: Edgar Lee Masters

item.quote: One of the inescapable encumbrances of leading an interesting life is that there have to be moments when you almost lose it.
item.author: Jimmy Buffett

item.quote: I was not, I was, I am not, I care not. (Non fui, fui, non sum, non curo)
item.author: Epicurus

item.quote: We remember the past, live in the present, and write the future.
item.author: Shaun David Hutchinson

item.quote: All this twaddle, the existence of God, atheism, determinism, liberation, societies, death, etc., are pieces of a chess game called language, and they are amusing only if one does not preoccupy oneself with 'winning or losing this game of chess.
item.author: Marcel Duchamp

item.quote: The true definition of mental illness is when the majority of your time is spent in the past or future, but rarely living in the realism of NOW.
item.author: Shannon L. Alder

item.quote: There had been times when he knew, somewhere in him, that he would get used to it, whatever it was, because he had learnt that some hard things became softer after a very little while.
item.author: Nick Hornby

item.quote: Don't give up! It's not over. The universe is balanced. Every set-back bears with it the seeds of a come-back.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Being liked for the way you looked is worse than not being liked at all.
item.author: Amanda Hocking

item.quote: I don't understand a thing about this world: about people, and why they do the things they do. The more I find out, the more I uncover, the more I know, the less I understand.
item.author: Craig Silvey

item.quote: Finding the lesson behind every adversity will be the one important thing that helps get you through it.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Love me when I least deserve it, because that's when I really need it.
item.author: Swedish Proverb

item.quote: The only thing you have to do in this life is die, said Mrs. Pinsky...everything else is a choice.
item.author: Karen Thompson Walker

item.quote: This world
item.author: Omar Khayym

item.quote: A 'no' does not hide anything, but a 'yes' very easily becomes a deception.
item.author: Soren Kierkegaard

item.quote: Kalau ada kupu-kupu yang terperangkap di sarang laba-laba, orang cenderung akan menolong kupu-kupu itu walaupun mungkin si laba-laba belum makan selama berhari-hari..Tapi gimana kalau yang terperangkap adalah ulat yang belum jadi kupu-kupu? Orang tetap nolong nggak? Padahal, keduanya sama. Di dunia ini, memang harus cantik supaya ditolong.
item.author: Windhy Puspitadewi

item.quote: How would your life be different ifYou didnt allow yourself to be defined by your past? Let today be the dayYou stop letting your history interfere with your destiny and awaken to the opportunity to release your greatest self.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: A mistake isnt a mistake unless it cant be put right.
item.author: Sophie Kinsella

item.quote: Whatever happens in your life, no matter how troubling things might seem, do not enter the neighbourhood of despair.
item.author: Elif Shafak

item.quote: Because, sometimes, things happen to people and they're not equipped to deal with them.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: What looks like garbage from one angle might be art from another. Maybe it
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: Life is a dance. Mindfulness is witnessing that dance.
item.author: Amit Ray

item.quote: If my answers frighten you then you should cease asking scary questions.
item.author: Quentin Tarantino

item.quote: The world's a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it. - Socrates
item.author: Dan Millman

item.quote: If you walked away from a
item.author: Lalah Delia

item.quote: Life was not to be sitting in hot amorphic leisure in my backyard idly writing or not-writing, as the spirit moved me. It was, instead, running madly, in a crowded schedule, in a squirrel cage of busy people. Working, living, dancing, dreaming, talking, kissing - singing, laughing, learning.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: The seeker embarks on a journey to find what he wants and discovers, along the way, what he needs.
item.author: Wally Lamb

item.quote: My biggest fault is that the faults I was born with grow bigger each year.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Life is dear to every living thing; the worm that crawls upon the ground will struggle for it.
item.author: Solomon Northup

item.quote: Nobody is so busy that they can't make time for the people they really care about.
item.author: leila sales

item.quote: Cancel my subscription to the resurrection.
item.author: Jim Morrison

item.quote: The clear awareness of having been born into a losing struggle need not lead one into despair. I do not especially
item.author: Christopher Hitchens

item.quote: We are all dying, every moment that passes of every day. That is the inescapable truth of this existence. It is a truth that can paralyze us with fear, or one that can energize us with impatience, with the desire to explore and experience, with the hope- nay, the iron-will!- to find a memory in every action. To be alive, under sunshine, or starlight, in weather fair or stormy. To dance with every step, be they through gardens of flowers or through deep snows.
item.author: R.A. Salvatore

item.quote: Silence is argument carried out by other means.
item.author: Ernesto Che Guevara

item.quote: I finally figured out that not every crisis can be managed. As much as we want to keep ourselves safe, we can't protect ourselves from everything. If we want to embrace life, we also have to embrace chaos.
item.author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips

item.quote: Be the kind of person who dares to face life's challenges and overcome them rather than dodging them.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Sometimes it's the same moments that take your breath away that breathe purpose and love back into your life.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Life' wrote a friend of mine, 'is a public performance on the violin, in which you must learn the instrument as you go along.
item.author: E.M. Forster

item.quote: dont be afraid of death, be afraid of the unlived life.
item.author: Natalie Babbitt

item.quote: People will kill you. Over time. They will shave out every last morsel of fun in you with little, harmless sounding phrases that people uses every day, like: 'Be realistic!'
item.author: Dylan Moran

item.quote: I saw the years of my life spaced along a road in the form of telephone poles threaded together by wires. I counted one, two, three... nineteen telephone poles, and then the wires dangled into space, and try as I would, I couldn't see a single pole beyond the nineteenth.
item.author: Sylvia Plath

item.quote: Now I've gone for too long
item.author: Hayley Williams

item.quote: This is love, I think. A place where people who have been alone may lock together like hawks and spin in the air, dizzy with surprise at the connection. A place you go willingly, and with wonder
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: To be born means being compelled to choose an era, a place, a life. To exist here, now, means to lost the possibility of being countless other potential selves.. Yet once being born there is no turning back. And I think that's exactly why the fantasy worlds of cartoon movies so strongly represent our hopes and yearnings. They illustrate a world of lost possibilities for us.
item.author: Hayao Miyazaki

item.quote: Skinny guys fight till they're burger.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: Thats the duty of the old, to be anxious on behalf of the young. And the duty of the young is to scorn the anxiety of the old.
item.author: Philip Pullman

item.quote: Remember that things are not always as they appear to be Curiosity creates possibilities and opportunities.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: His words are like the sound of a needle dragging across a record. A sinking, sickening feeling washes over me. This is why you should never, ever get your hopes up. This is why you should see the glass as half empty. So, when the whole things spills, you aren't as devastated.
item.author: Emily Giffin

item.quote: Life should be a risk. It's more than a straight line that you can see clearly from one point to the other. It dips and curves and you never know what's around the bend sometimes until you get there. That scares a lot of people. But that's the beauty of it.
item.author: Katie Kacvinsky

item.quote: Sometimes I feel that life has passed me by... Do you ever feel that way, Charlie Brown?
item.author: Charles M. Schulz

item.quote: You know why love stories have happy endings? I shake my head.
item.author: Hank Moody

item.quote: For a word to be spoken, there must be silence. Before, and after.
item.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

item.quote: Blind, broke, jobless, and frustrated, Kevin found it difficult to get through the following few months. But he had one big thing going for him.
item.author: Traci Medford-Rosow

item.quote: It is the beginning of wisdom when you recognize that the best you can do is choose
item.author: Wallace Stegner

item.quote: Temptation is the feeling we get when encountered by an opportunity to do what we innately know we shouldn't.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Toby Zeigler: There's literally no one in the world I don't hate right now.
item.author: Aaron Sorkin

item.quote: I would think for hours how strange it was that some parts of words are silent, just like some parts of our lives. Did the people who wrote the dictionaries decide to mirror language to our lives, or did it just happen that way?
item.author: Rene Denfeld

item.quote: There are some choices you can only make once. You can't go back to where you made a choice and then take the other one.
item.author: Mary Hoffman

item.quote: I have a theory about marriage, Monsieur Boustouler. And it's that nearly always you will know within two weeks if it's going to work. It's astonishing how many people remain shackled for years, decades even, in a protracted and mutual state of self-delusion and false hope when in fact they had their answer in those first two weeks.
item.author: Khaled Hosseini

item.quote: But love is complicated, its messy. It can inspire selflessness, selfishness, our greatest accomplishments and our hardest mistakes. It brings us together and it can just as easily drive us apart.
item.author: Courtney Summers

item.quote: Single is not a status, it is a word that describes a person who is strong enough to live and enjoy life without depending on others.
item.author: prixie

item.quote: I had a dream about you last night... you were a giant slinky and I watched you fall down the stairs.
item.author: Amy Summers

item.quote: Oh threats of Hell and Hopes of Paradise!
item.author: Omar Khayyam

item.quote: In a well-ordered universe...
item.author: Morgan Matson

item.quote: But what is the sense in forever speculating what might have happened had such and such a moment turned out differently? One could presumably drive oneself to distraction in this way. In any case, while it is all very well to talk of 'turning points', one can surely only recognize such moments in retrospect. Naturally, when one looks back to such instances today, they may indeed take the appearance of being crucial, precious moments in one's life; but of course, at the time, this was not the impression one had. Rather, it was as though one had available a never-ending number of days, months, years in which to sort out the vagaries of one's relationship with Miss Kenton; an infinite number of further opportunities in which to remedy the effect of this or that misunderstanding. There was surely nothing to indicate at the time that such evidently small incidents would render whole dreams forever irredeemable.
item.author: Kazuo Ishiguro

item.quote: In his face there came to be a brooding peace that is seen most often in the faces of the very sorrowful or the very wise. But still he wandered through the streets of the town, always silent and alone.
item.author: Carson McCullers

item.quote: Letting him go
item.author: Lang Leav

item.quote: Dying was nothing and he had no picture of it nor fear of it in his mind. But living was a field of grain blowing in the wind on the side of a hill. Living was a hawk in the sky. Living was an earthen jar of water in the dust of the threshing with the grain flailed out and the chaff blowing. Living was a horse between your legs and a carbine under one leg and a hill and a valley and a stream with trees along it and the far side of the valley and the hills beyond.
item.author: Ernest Hemingway

item.quote: The power of God is with you at all times; through the activities of mind, senses, breathing, and emotions; and is constantly doing all the work using you as a mere instrument.
item.author: Anonymous

item.quote: How does fear become so powerful? We cant see it. We cant touch it, yet it gets its claws in us and begins to control us. Sigh. I hate feeling afraid, and I hate, hate, HATE feeling out of control.
item.author: Gena Showalter

item.quote: We are always falling in love or quarreling, looking for jobs or fearing to lose them, getting ill and recovering, following public affairs. If we let ourselves, we shall always be waiting for some distraction or other to end before we can really get down to our work. The only people who achieve much are those who want knowledge so badly that they seek it while the conditions are still unfavorable. Favorable conditions never come.
item.author: C.S. Lewis

item.quote: There is strange comfort in knowing that no matter what happens today, the Sun will rise again tomorrow.
item.author: Aaron Lauritsen

item.quote: Life is a dream from which we all must wake before we can dream again.
item.author: Robert Jordan

item.quote: The rain fluctuates between drizzle and torrential. It messes with your mind. It makes you think things will always be like this, never getting better, always letting you down right when you though the worst was over.
item.author: Susane Colasanti

item.quote: The word sin is derived from the Indo-European root es-, meaning to be. When I discovered this etymology, I intuitively understood that for a [person] trapped in patriarchy, which is the religion of the entire planet, to be in the fullest sense is to sin'.
item.author: Mary Daly

item.quote: The problem with the designated driver program, it's not a desirable job, but if you ever get sucked into doing it, have fun with it. At the end of the night, drop them off at the wrong house.
item.author: Jeff Foxworthy

item.quote: Living might mean taking chances, but they're worth taking. Loving might be a mistake. but its worth making
item.author: Reba McEntire

item.quote: There's difference between being dead and dying. We're all dying. Some of us die for ninety years, and some of us die for nineteen. But each morning everyone on this planet wakes up one day closer to their death. Everyone. So living and dying are actually different words for the same thing, if you think about it.
item.author: Robyn Schneider

item.quote: The longing for Paradise is man's longing not to be man.
item.author: Milan Kundera

item.quote: Opinions are the cheapest commodities on earth. Everyone has a flock of opinions ready to be wished upon anyone who will accept them. If you are influenced by opinions when you reach DECISIONS, you will not succeed in any undertaking.
item.author: Napoleon Hill

item.quote: Those who don't jump will never fly.
item.author: Leena Ahmad Almashat

item.quote: Life is hell, at some point we all just have to get used to it.
item.author: Alysha Speer

item.quote: On this road there are no godspoke men. They are gone and I am left and they have taken with them the world.
item.author: Cormac McCarthy

item.quote: I'm hungry for a juicy life. I lean out my window at night and I can taste it out there, just waiting for me.
item.author: Brigid Lowry

item.quote: For truth is always strange; stranger than fiction.
item.author: George Gordon Byron

item.quote: Guilt results from unused life, from the unlived in us.
item.author: Ernest Becker

item.quote: We all like to think the world ends when we do. The truth is our acquaintances, our friends, and our loved ones all live on, and through them, so do we. It's not about what you had, but what you gave. It's not about how you looked, but how you lived. And it's not just about being remembered. It's about giving people a good reason to remember you.
item.author: Tonya Hurley

item.quote: Sober, gainfully employed, and physically secure once again, Kevin began to relax. His confidence slowly returned. For the first time since the onset of his blindness, he let his guard down and a crack in his carefully constructed veneer formed.
item.author: Traci Medford-Rosow

item.quote: She smiled. She knew she was dying. But it did not matter any longer. She had known something which no human words could ever tell and she knew it now. She had been awaiting it and she felt it, as if it had been, as if she had lived it. Life had been, if only because she had known it could be, and she felt it now as a hymn without sound, deep under the little whole that dripped red drops into the snow, deeper than that from which the red drops came. A moment or an eternity- did it matter? Life, undefeated, existed and could exist. She smiled, her last smile, to so much that had been possible.
item.author: Ayn Rand

item.quote: It was the living who ignored the strange and wonderful, because life was too full of the boring and mundane.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: They had, finally, the only thing anyone really wants in life: someone to hold your hand when you die.
item.author: Lorrie Moore

item.quote: Do not live in the shadow of the masters for ever. Learn to live in the light of your soul. Life deserves full expression.
item.author: Amit Ray

item.quote: Do good, live in the most positive and joyful way possible every day.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: What am I dying for?
item.author: Stephenie Meyer

item.quote: It is a fine thing to establish one's own religion in one's heart, not to be dependent on tradition and second-hand ideals. Life will seem to you, later, not a lesser, but a greater thing.
item.author: D.H. Lawrence

item.quote: Until you change how you get things done, you'll never know what works best.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: So I would choose to be with you,
item.author: Billy Joel

item.quote: If you own this story you get to write the ending.
item.author: Bren Brown

item.quote: Our lives were just beginning, our favorite moment was right now, our favorite songs were unwritten.
item.author: Rob Sheffield

item.quote: We do not need to eat animals, wear animals, or use animals for entertainment purposes, and our only defense of these uses is our pleasure, amusement, and convenience.
item.author: Gary L. Francione

item.quote: We think you'll find that every woman in her heart of hearts longs for three things: to be romanced, to play an irreplaceable role in a great adventure, and to unveil beauty. That's what makes a woman come alive.
item.author: John Eldredge

item.quote: Life is doubt,
item.author: Miguel de Unamuno

item.quote: Each of us is a unique strand in the intricate web of life and here to make a contribution.
item.author: Deepak Chopra

item.quote: There it was before her - life. Life: she thought but she did not finish her thought. She took a look at life, for she had a clear sense of it there, something real, something private, which she shared neither with her children nor with her husband. A sort of transaction went on between them, in which she was on one side, and life was on another, and she was always trying to get the better of it, as it was of her; and sometimes they parleyed (when she sat alone); there were, she remembered, great reconciliation scenes; but for the most part, oddly enough, she must admit that she felt this thing that she called life terrible, hostile, and quick to pounce on you if you gave it a chance.
item.author: Virginia Woolf

item.quote: Its never overreacting to ask for what you want and need.
item.author: Amy Poehler

item.quote: Do not forget that the value and interest of life is not so much to do conspicuous things...as to do ordinary things with the perception of their enormous value.
item.author: Pierre Teilhard De Chardin

item.quote: I want to Live! Not Die, Not Hide, LIVE!
item.author: Margaret Peterson Haddix

item.quote: Between living and dreaming there is a third thing. Guess it.
item.author: Antonio Machado

item.quote: It's no accident, I think, that tennis uses the language of life. Advantage, service, fault, break, love, the basic elements of tennis are those of everyday existence, because every match is a life in miniature. Even the structure of tennis, the way the pieces fit inside one another like Russian nesting dolls, mimics the structure of our days. Points become games become sets become tournaments, and it's all so tightly connected that any point can become the turning point. It reminds me of the way seconds become minutes become hours, and any hour can be our finest. Or darkest. It's our choice.
item.author: Andre Agassi

item.quote: When mice run, cats give chase.
item.author: Rachel Vincent

item.quote: What can we see, read, acquire, but ourselves. Take the book, my friend, and read your eyes out, you will never find there what I find.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: Most people gaze neither into the past nor the future; they explore neither truth nor lies. They gaze at the television.
item.author: Radiohead

item.quote: Life has no meaning, the moment you lose the illusion of being eternal.
item.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

item.quote: Imagination is a quality that was given to man compensate him from whats not. The sense of humor was given to console him from what is.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Hope like that, as I thought before, doesnt make you a weak person. Its hopelessness that makes you weak. Hope makes you stronger, because it brings with it a sense of reason. Not a reason for how or why they were taken from you, but a reason for you to live. Because its a maybe. A maybe someday things wont always be this shit. And that maybe immediately makes the shittiness better.
item.author: Cecelia Ahern

item.quote: You know how the tightrope guy at the circus wants everyone to believe his act is an art, but deep down you can see that he's really just hoping he makes it all the way across?
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: It was a melancholy secret that reality can arouse desires but never satisfy them.
item.author: Erich Maria Remarque

item.quote: Being brave means that knowing when you fail, you won't fail forever.
item.author: Lana Del Rey

item.quote: We are the sum of all people we have ever met; you change the tribe and the tribe changes you.
item.author: Dirk Wittenborn

item.quote: The busiest people I have known in my life always have time enough to do everything. Those who do nothing are always tired and pay no attention to the little amount of work they are required to do. They complain constantly that the day is too short. The truth is, they are afraid to fight the good fight.
item.author: Paulo Coelho

item.quote: Your cold mornings are filled with the heartache about the fact that although we are not at ease in this world, it is all we have, that it is ours but that it is full of strife, so that all we can call our own is strife; but even that is better than nothing at all, isn't it? And as you split the frost-laced wood with numb hands, rejoice that your uncertainty is God's will and His grace toward you that that is beautiful, and a part of a greater certainty, as your own father always said in his sermons and to you at home. And as the ax bites into the wood, be comforted in the fact that the ache in your heart and the confusion in your soul means that you are still alive, still human, and still open to the beauty of the world, even though you have done nothing to deserve it. And when you resent the ache in your heart, remember: You will be dead and buried soon enough.
item.author: Paul Harding

item.quote: Maybe getting around in life was nothing but map-reading. A skill that required practice. A key to unlock where you wanted to go. A legend to show where you were.
item.author: Justina Chen Headley

item.quote: Never stop just because you feel defeated. The journey to the other side is attainable only after great suffering.
item.author: Santosh Kalwar

item.quote: There is something incredibly nostalgic and significant about the annual cascade of autumn leaves.
item.author: Joe L. Wheeler

item.quote: Your beliefs affect your choices. Your choices shape your actions. Your actions determine your results. The future you create depends upon the choices you make and the actions you take today.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: Things will get easier, people's minds will change, and you should be alive to see it.
item.author: Ellen DeGeneres

item.quote: Sometimes we love with nothing more than hope. Sometimes we cry with everything except tears. In the end thats all there is: love and its duty, sorrow and its truth. In the end thats all we have - to hold on tight until the dawn
item.author: Gregory David Roberts

item.quote: Whether you like it or not, you are committed to the human endeavor. I cannot ally myself with such a purely negative goal as avoidance of suffering. Suffering is a chance you take by the fact of being alive.
item.author: William S. Burroughs

item.quote: We are star stuff harvesting sunlight.
item.author: Carl Sagan

item.quote: You might never fail on the scale I did, but some failure in life is inevitable. It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all - in which case, you fail by default.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Life lived in the absence of the psychedelic experience that primordial shamanism is based on is life trivialized, life denied, life enslaved to the ego.
item.author: Terence McKenna

item.quote: I heard an airplane passing overhead. I wished I was on it.
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: All I feel are the assaults of apprehension and terror at the thought that I am the only one who is entirely unlike the rest. It is almost impossible for me to converse with other people. What should I talk about, how should I say it? - I don't know.
item.author: Osamu Dazai

item.quote: You are the only you ... You are the best you. You will always be the second best anyone else.
item.author: Leo Buscaglia

item.quote: Life, if you keep chasing it so hard, will drive you to death. Time - when pursued like a bandit - will behave like one, always remaining one county or one room ahead of you, changing its name and hair color to elude you, slipping out the back door of the motel just as you're banging through the lobby with your newest search warrant, leaving only a burning cigarette in the ashtray to taunt you. At some point you have to stop because it won't. You have to admit that you can't catch it. That you're not supposed to catch it. At some point, you gotta let go and sit still and allow contentment to come to you.
item.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

item.quote: But life isn't something that should be edited. Life shouldn't be cut. The only way you'll ever discover what it truly means to be alive and human is by sharing the full experience of what it means to be human and each blemish and freckle that comes with it.
item.author: Iain Thomas

item.quote: To live is to be haunted.
item.author: Philip K. Dick

item.quote: To escape fear, you have to go through it, not around.
item.author: Richie Norton

item.quote: Life is neither static nor unchanging. With no individuality, there can be no change, no adaptation and, in an inherently changing world, any species unable to adapt is also doomed.
item.author: Jean M. Auel

item.quote: You have succeeded in life when all you really WANT is only what you really NEED.
item.author: Vernon Howard

item.quote: I am of certain convinced that the greatest heroes are those who do their duty in the daily grind of domestic affairs whilst the world whirls as a maddening dreidel.
item.author: Florence Nightingale

item.quote: If we were to one day encounter a form of life more powerful and intelligent than our own, and it regarded us as we regard fish, what would be our argument against being eaten?
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: There is nothing more mysterious than a TV set left on in an empty room. It is even stranger than a man talking to himself or a woman standing dreaming at her stove. It is as if another planet is communicating with you.
item.author: Jean Baudrillard

item.quote: As Kevin climbed the three flights of stairs to his apartment, his brain formulated a vague plan of action. He could not have explained it to anyone or even to himself in coherent sentences. But the outline was there in Kevins subconscious. It would not only change his life, but many others, as well.
item.author: Traci Medford-Rosow

item.quote: Don't dwell on things. Don't stay in one place too long. It was the only way to stay ahead of sadness.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Reshaping life! People who can say that have never understood a thing about lifethey have never felt its breath, its heartbeathowever much they have seen or done. They look on it as a lump of raw material that needs to be processed by them, to be ennobled by their touch. But life is never a material, a substance to be molded. If you want to know, life is the principle of self-renewal, it is constantly renewing and remaking and changing and transfiguring itself, it is infinitely beyond your or my obtuse theories about it.
item.author: Boris Pasternak

item.quote: Simplify, simplify.
item.author: Henry David Thoreau

item.quote: The difference between me and other people is that they all walk around with onion skins wrapped around them. Pre-meditations, pretentions, the faces that they present to the world, the faces that they present to themselves.. onion skins that come in layer after layer. They're on the inside of all that. And I... I am the inside of the onion skin walking around. I am only me.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: A new day: Be open enough to see opportunities. Be wise enough to be grateful. Be courageous enough to be happy.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: BRODIE:
item.author: Kevin Smith

item.quote: Knowing death is nearby gives you a chance to live...deliberately. -Tristan
item.author: Chelsea Fine

item.quote: You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you dont try.
item.author: Beverly Sills

item.quote: Give me strength, not to be better than my enemies, but to defeat my greatest enemy, the doubts within myself. Give me strength for a straight back and clear eyes, so when life fades, as the setting sun, my spirit may come to you without shame.
item.author: P.C. Cast & Kristin Cast

item.quote: Once your mindset changes, everything on the outside will change along with it.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Self-love is a good thing but self-awareness is more important. You need to once in a while go Uh, Im kind of an asshole.
item.author: Louis C.K.

item.quote: As for me, I was just trying to get it right, whatever that means. But now I finally felt I was on my way. Everyone had a forever, but given a choice, this would be mine. The one that began in this moment, with Wes, in a kiss that took my breath away, then gave it back - leaving meastounded, amazed and most of all, alive.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: The fact that a cloud from a minor volcanic eruption in Icelanda small disturbance in the complex mechanism of life on the Earthcan bring to a standstill the aerial traffic over an entire continent is a reminder of how, with all its power to transform nature, humankind remains just another species on the planet Earth.
item.author: Slavoj iek

item.quote: Rules for happiness: something to do, someone to love, something to hope for.
item.author: Immanuel Kant

item.quote: Be yourself. Don't worry about what other people are thinking of you, because they're probably feeling the same kind of scared, horrible feelings that everyone does.
item.author: Phil Lester

item.quote: I wanted to cry because I needed you there with me so bad. I knew in that moment that I was in love with you. I was in love with the way you loved me. When you wrapped your arms around me and held me, I knew that no matter what happened with my life, you were my home. You stole the biggest piece of my heart that night.
item.author: Colleen Hoover

item.quote: Pray for the dead and fight like hell for the living.
item.author: Mother Jones

item.quote: I learned...that inspiration does not come like a bolt, nor is it kinetic, energetic striving, but it comes into us slowly and quietly and all the time, though we must regularly and every day give it a little chance to start flowing, prime it with a little solitude and idleness.
item.author: Brenda Ueland

item.quote: Unless you have great parents or some inspirational teacher from a movie that pushes you to follow your dreams, you can't expect a kid to be smart enough to realize they can do what they want with their life before they've been pushed through the school system into having an average life.
item.author: Dan Howell

item.quote: Learning the truth has become my life's love.
item.author: Dan Brown

item.quote: Clearly, America has no shortage of metaphorical opportunities for the poor.
item.author: Stephen Colbert

item.quote: Can you say why America is the greatest country in the world?
item.author: Aaron Sorkin

item.quote: You better start swimming, or you'll sink like a stone. Because the Time's they are a-changing.
item.author: Bob Dylan

item.quote: Hidup hanya ada erti pada yang bahagia.
item.author: Hlovate

item.quote: Women only cut their hair in times of crisis... It's somethin' a woman always has the power to do, even when she loses control over everything else. Cuttin' hair is a cry for help.
item.author: Bella Pollen

item.quote: Every night I used to pray that Id find my people, and finally I did on the open road.
item.author: Lana Del Rey

item.quote: When you live for many hundreds of years, you know that every opportunity will come again.
item.author: Philip Pullman

item.quote: My point is, that if I'm honest, my life is all about me.
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: Yet if I was asked to do this again - in fact, if I was ever asked to repeat any of my experiences - I'd have to say, fuck it, bring them on. I've no regrets.
item.author: John Barrowman

item.quote: There are always loose ends in real life.
item.author: Robert Galbraith

item.quote: The struggles we endure today will be the good old days we laugh about tomorrow.
item.author: Aaron Lauritsen

item.quote: In the end,
item.author: Laotzu

item.quote: My life will be the best illustration of all my work.
item.author: Hans Christian Andersen

item.quote: You get what you give. What you put into things is what you get out of them.
item.author: Jennifer Lopez

item.quote: I didnt know. I feel sometimes likethere are all these rules. Just to be a person. You know? Youre supposed to carry a shoulder bag, not a backpack. Youre supposed to wear headbands, or youre not supposed to wear headbands. Its okay to describe yourself as likeable, but its not okay to describe yourself as eloquent. You can sit in the front of the school bus, but you cant sit in the middle. Youre not supposed to be with a boy, even when he wants you to. I didnt know that. There are so many rules, and they dont make any sense, and I just cant learn them all
item.author: Leila Sales

item.quote: A heart has problems which mind cannot understand.
item.author: Santosh Kalwar

item.quote: But fate, as Merlin always taught us, is inexorable. Life is a jest of the Gods, Merlin liked to claim, and there is no justice. You must learn to laugh, he once told me, or else you'll just weep yourself to death.
item.author: Bernard Cornwell

item.quote: You can never know about about your own destiny: are the people you meet there to play a part on your oun destiny, or do you exist just to play a role in theirs?
item.author: Libba Bray

item.quote: Even as your body betrays you, your mind denies it.
item.author: Sara Gruen

item.quote: Dedicate yourself to what gives your life true meaning and purpose; make a positive difference in someone's life.
item.author: Roy T. Bennett

item.quote: The world is terrible, said Mark tonelessly. And some are drawn down into it and drown there, and some rise above and carry others with them.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Ah, Nothing is too late, till the tired heart shall cease to palpitate.
item.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.quote: Out, out brief candle, life is but a walking shadow...a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.
item.author: William Shakespeare

item.quote: Non-judgment quiets the internal dialogue, and this opens once again the doorway to creativity.
item.author: Deepak Chopra

item.quote: Wake up, Shake up, Make up and Break up; life is all about moving like ant in search of sugar not sand.
item.author: Santosh Kalwar

item.quote: Nalaman kong habang lumalaki ka, maraming beses kang madadapa. Bumangon ka man ulit o hindi, magpapatuloy ang buhay, iikot ang mundo, at mauubos ang oras.
item.author: Bob Ong

item.quote: I suppose [my life] has most resembled a blue chip stock: fairly stable, more ups than downs, and gradually trending upward over time. A good buy, a lucky buy, and I've learned that not everyone can say that about his life.
item.author: Nicholas Sparks

item.quote: What if it's the there
item.author: Tyler Knott Gregson

item.quote: Imagine no limitations; decide what's right and desirable before you decide
item.author: Brian Tracy

item.quote: if i'm going to fuck up my life, does it really matter which way i do it?.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: Life can take so many twists and turns. You cant ever count yourself out. Even if youre really afraid at some point, you cant think that theres no room for you to grow and do something good with your life.
item.author: Portia de Rossi

item.quote: I must talk, and you must listen, for we are engaged here in the most important pursuit in history: the search for meaning. What is the nature of being a person? What is the best way to go about being a person? How did we come to be, and what will become of us when we are no longer? In short: What are the rules of this game, and how might we best play it?
item.author: John Green

item.quote: How unhappy does one have to be before living seems worse than dying?
item.author: Deborah Curtis

item.quote: When we cannot bear to be alone, it means we do not properly value the only companion we will have from birth to death - ourselves.
item.author: Eda LeShan

item.quote: Life never gives us what we want at the moment that we consider appropriate. Adventures do occur, but not punctually.
item.author: E.M. Forster

item.quote: If you have nothing in life but a good friend, you're rich.
item.author: Michelle Kwan

item.quote: Whether it is good or evil, whether life in itself is pain or pleasure, whether it is uncertain-that it may perhaps be this is not important-but the unity of the world, the coherence of all events, the embracing of the big and the small from the same stream, from the same law of cause, of becoming and dying.
item.author: Hermann Hesse

item.quote: Embrace the void and have the courage to exist.
item.author: Dan Howell

item.quote: It would be perfect if everyone who makes love, is in love, but this is simply an unrealistic expectation. I'd say 75 percent of the population of people who make love, are not in love, this is simply the reality of the human race, and to be idealistic about this is to wait for the stars to aline and Jupiter to change color; for the Heavens to etch your names together in the sky before you make love to someone. But idealism is immaturity, and as a matter of fact, the stars may never aline, Jupiter may never change color, and the Heavens may never ever etch your names together in the sky for you to have the never-ending permission to make endless love to one another. And so the bottom line is, there really is no difference between doing something today, and doing something tomorrow, because today is what you have, and tomorrow may not turn out the way you expect it to. At the end of the day, sex is an animalistic, humanistic, passionate desire.
item.author: C. JoyBell C.

item.quote: Men acquire a particular quality by constantly acting a particular way... you become just by performing just actions, temperate by performing temperate actions, brave by performing brave actions.
item.author: Aristotle

item.quote: You cant control what others think. The only thing you can control is yourself. Some people will look down on you for your choices in life, no matter what they are. You cant do anything about that. The only thing you can do is decide how to live your own life. And to hell with everybody else
item.author: Marie Sexton

item.quote: No lake so still but it has its wave.
item.author: Confucius

item.quote: So, preferring death to capture, I accomplished the most astonishing deeds, and which, more then once, showed me that the too great care we take of our bodies is the only obstacle to the sucess of those projects which require rapid decision, and vigorous and determined execution.
item.author: Alexandre Dumas

item.quote: Thunderstorms are as much our friends as the sunshine.
item.author: Criss Jami

item.quote: Never show anger at slight,Tell nothing.Earn Respect from everyone by deeds,not Words.Respect the members of your Blood Family.Gambling was Recreation,Not a way to earn a Living.Love your Father,your Mother,
item.author: Mario Puzo

item.quote: I think this is when most people give up on their stories. They come out of college wanting to change the world, wanting to get married, wanting to have kids and change the way people buy office supplies. But they get into the middle and discover it was harder than they thought. They can't see the distant shore anymore, and they wonder if their paddling is moving them forward. None of the trees behind them are getting smaller and none of the trees ahead are getting bigger. They take it out on their spouses, and they go looking for an easier story.
item.author: Donald Miller

item.quote: It isn't good to hold on too hard to the past. You can't spend your whole life looking back. Not even when you can't see what lies ahead. All you can do is keep on keeping on, and try to believe that tomorrow will be what it should beeven if it isn't what you expected.
item.author: Jim Butcher

item.quote: Accept yourself, your strengths, your weaknesses, your truths, and know what tools you have to fulfill your purpose.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: What are you thinking? he asks.
item.author: Lisa Kleypas

item.quote: Mom always liked to say that we hardly ever know the decisions we make that change our lives, mostly because they are little ones. You took this bus instead of that one and ended up meeting your soul mate, that kind of thing. But there was no doubt in my mind that this was one of those life-changing moments.
item.author: Rachel Hawkins

item.quote: I define nothing. Not beauty, not patriotism. I take each thing as it is, without prior rules about what it should be.
item.author: Bob Dylan

item.quote: All I know is I make sense to me- it's other people who seem complicated.
item.author: Tara Kelly

item.quote: True life lies in laughter, love and work.
item.author: Elbert Hubbard

item.quote: At least one thing was consistent about her life: It just kept on getting more complicated.
item.author: Scott Westerfeld

item.quote: my friends don't seem to be friends at all but people whose phone numbers I haven't lost.
item.author: Nick Hornby

item.quote: There are two kinds of people, shed said. Those who coast through life like ducks in a row, following one after the other, and those who ride the waves. Tears spilled down my cheeks, and my voice cracked. Ride the waves, baby, and live. Live.
item.author: Gena Showalter

item.quote: The way you give your name to others is a measure of how much you like and
item.author: Brian Tracy

item.quote: Because if you take a risk, you just might find what you're looking for.
item.author: Susane Colasanti

item.quote: Some people think that a place can save them... Like if they could just be somewhere else, their lives would be totally different. They could finally be the people they always wanted to be. But to me, a place is just a place. If you really want things to change, you can make them change no matter where you are.
item.author: Hannah Harrington

item.quote: Know that the same spark of life that is within you, is within all of our animal friends, the desire to live is the same within all of us...
item.author: Rai Aren

item.quote: When your sad--like really sad--you only want to be with other people who are sad.
item.author: Nick Hornby

item.quote: ...people with nothing to declare carry the most.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: Even if it were possible to cast my horoscope in this one life, and to make an accurate prediction about my future, it would not be possible to 'show' it to me because as soon as I saw it my future would change by definition. This is why Werner Heisenberg's adaptation of the Hays Officethe so-called principle of uncertainty whereby the act of measuring something has the effect of altering the measurementis of such importance. In my case the difference is often made by publicity. For example, and to boast of one of my few virtues, I used to derive pleasure from giving my time to bright young people who showed promise as writers and who asked for my help. Then some profile of me quoted someone who disclosed that I liked to do this. Then it became something widely said of me, whereupon it became almost impossible for me to go on doing it, because I started to receive far more requests than I could respond to, let alone satisfy. Perception modifies reality: when I abandoned the smoking habit of more than three decades I was given a supposedly helpful pill called Wellbutrin. But as soon as I discovered that this was the brand name for an antidepressant, I tossed the bottle away. There may be successful methods for overcoming the blues but for me they cannot include a capsule that says: 'Fool yourself into happiness, while pretending not to do so.' I should actually
item.author: Christopher Hitchens

item.quote: Love is not a relationship, love is a state of being; it has nothing to do with anybody else. One is not in love, one is love. And of course when one is love, one is in love but that is an outcome, a by-product, that is not the source. The source is that one is love.
item.author: Osho

item.quote: Sometimes problems dont require a solution to solve them; instead they require maturity to outgrow them.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Never judge someone's character based on the words of another. Instead, study the motives behind the words of the person casting the bad judgment.
item.author: Suzy Kassem

item.quote: Its a strange myth that atheists have nothing to live for. Its the opposite. We have nothing to die for. We have everything to live for.
item.author: Ricky Gervais

item.quote: Ive never once thought about how I was going to die, she said. I cant think about it. I dont even know how Im going to live.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Make the choice to embrace this day. Do not let your TODAY be stolen by the ghost of yesterday or the To-Do list of tomorrow! Its inspiring to see all the wonderfully amazing things that can happen in a day in which you participate.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: He knew sometimes some fear can be good. When you are afraid things are going to get worse if you don't do something, it can prompt you into action. But it is not good when you are afraid that it keeps you from doing anything.
item.author: Spencer Johnson

item.quote: Those were strange days, now that I look back at them. In the midst of life, everything revolved around death.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: In this lifetime you're nothing more than you appear to be: a stupid, selfish, ignorant, spoiled little girl who thinks the world lives or dies on whether she gets to go out with some good-looking boy at school...I'd still relish this moment...killing you.
item.author: lauren kate

item.quote: Sometimes the course of our lives depends on what we do or don't do in a few seconds, a heartbeat, when we either seize the opportunity, or just miss it. Miss the moment and you never get a chance again.
item.author: Aidan Chambers

item.quote: I dont know what it means to live.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: I welcome questions. I hate assumptions.
item.author: Red Haircrow

item.quote: If you have a goal, write it down. If you do not write it down, you do not have a goal - you have a wish.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: The thing about being catapulted into a whole new life--or at least, shoved up so hard against someone else's life that you might as well have your face pressed against their window--is that it forces you to rethink your idea of who you are. Or how you might seem to other people.
item.author: Jojo Moyes

item.quote: Happiness is not the absence of problems; it's the ability to deal with them.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: when we were kids
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: You never really know what's coming. A small wave, or maybe a big one. All you can really do is hope that when it comes, you can surf over it, instead of drown in its monstrosity.
item.author: Alysha Speer

item.quote: Stop trying to be less of who you are. Let this time in your life cut you open and drain all of the things that are holding you back.
item.author: Jennifer Elisabeth

item.quote: No one escapes from life alive.
item.author: Michael Crichton

item.quote: I dont see myself being special; I just see myself having more responsibilities than the next man. People look to me to do things for them, to have answers.
item.author: Tupac Shakur

item.quote: Everything that had happened was shockingly beautiful, enough to make you crazy.
item.author: Banana Yoshimoto

item.quote: This is not the end, this is not even the beginning of the end, this is just perhaps the end of the beginning.
item.author: Winston S. Churchill

item.quote: I've come to know that what we want in life is the greatest indication of who we really are.
item.author: Richard Paul Evans

item.quote: Life is a train of moods like a string of beads; and as we pass through them they prove to be many colored lenses, which paint the world their own hue, and each shows us only what lies in its own focus.
item.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.quote: I am not my body. My body is nothing without me.
item.author: Tom Stoppard

item.quote: Be happy -- if you're not even happy, what's so good about surviving?
item.author: Tom Stoppard

item.quote: I thought about the days i had handed over to a bottle..the nights i can't remember..the mornings i slept thru..all the time spent running from myself.
item.author: Mitch Albom

item.quote: My name is Jimmy,
item.author: Tim Burton

item.quote: You are the grim, goal-oriented ones who will not believe that the joy is in the journey rather than the destination no matter how many times it has been proven to you.
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: If you were all alone in the universe with no one to talk to, no one with which to share the beauty of the stars, to laugh with, to touch, what would be your purpose in life? It is other life; it is love, which gives your life meaning. This is harmony. We must discover the joy of each other, the joy of challenge, the joy of growth.
item.author: Mitsugi Saotome

item.quote: I felt the taste of mortality in my mouth, and at that moment I understood that I was not going to live forever. It takes a long time to learn that, but when you finally do, everything changes inside you, you can never be the same again. I was seventeen years old, and all of a sudden, without the slightest flicker of a doubt, I understood that my life was my own, that it belonged to me and no one else.
item.author: Paul Auster

item.quote: I understood how a man who has nothing left in this world still may know bliss, be it only for a brief moment, in the contemplation of his beloved.
item.author: Viktor E. Frankl

item.quote: You must purge yourself before finding faults in others.
item.author: B.K.S. Iyengar

item.quote: There are two kinds of secrets. The ones we keep from others and the ones we keep from ourselves.
item.author: Frank Warren

item.quote: But then, life is a constant withering of possibilities. Some are stolen with the lives of people you love. Others are let go, with regret and reluctance and deep, deep sorrow. But there is compensation for lives unlived in the intoxicating joy of knowing that the life you have - right here, right now - if the one you have chosen. There is power in that, and hope.
item.author: Emily Maguire

item.quote: Life is painful and disappointing. It is useless, therefore, to write new realistic novels. We generally know where we stand in relation to reality and dont care to know any more.
item.author: Michel Houellebecq

item.quote: So the hours are pretty good then?' he resumed.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: Have you ever noticed how as an adult, all the bright colors go out of your life? Now that Im not a kid anymore, things always look gray, like a clothesline draped with laundry thats been washed too many times and left to stand in the wind. I guess thats what growing up is its a fading photograph.
item.author: Rebecca McNutt

item.quote: Fantasy is silver and scarlet, indigo and azure, obsidian veined with gold and lapis lazuli. Reality is plywood and plastic, done up in mud brown and olive drab. Fantasy tastes of habaneros and honey, cinnamon and cloves, rare red meat and wines as sweet as summer. Reality is beans and tofu, and ashes at the end.
item.author: George R.R. Martin

item.quote: Because no one needs to live for ever. I think that sometimes you can outstay your welcome.
item.author: Gemma Malley

item.quote: I cannot tell if what the world considers happiness is happiness or not. All I know is that when I consider the way they go about attaining it, I see them carried away headlong, grim and obsessed, in the general onrush of the human herd, unable to stop themselves or to change their direction. All the while they claim to be just on the point of attaining happiness.
item.author: Chuang-Tzu

item.quote: The great Sufi poet and philosopher Rumi once advised his students to write down the three things they most wanted in life. If any item on the list clashes with any other item, Rumi warned, you are destined for unhappiness. Better to live a life of single-pointed focus, he taught. But what about the benefits of living harmoniously among extremes? What if you could somehow create an expansive enough life that you could synchronize seemingly incongruous opposites into a worldview that excludes nothing?
item.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

item.quote: Things don't always work out the way we hope. You just have to pick yourself up and find a new direction to go in.
item.author: Joelle Charbonneau

item.quote: Life itself is the proper binge.
item.author: Julia Child

item.quote: Expect nothing. Live frugally
item.author: alice walker

item.quote: Stop giving your life away to other people.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: The soul is like an uninhabited world
item.author: St. Thomas Aquinas

item.quote: People who fit dont seek. The seekers are those that dont fit.
item.author: Shannon L. Alder

item.quote: I do not cling to life sufficiently to fear death.
item.author: Alexandre Dumas

item.quote: Work harder on yourself than you do on your job.
item.author: Jim Rohn

item.quote: If you say that you never lie in life,
item.author: Toba Beta

item.quote: Life is long, and sometimes cruel. Sometimes victims are needed. Someone has to take on that role. And human bodies are fragile, easily damaged. Cut them, and they bleed.
item.author: Haruki Murakami

item.quote: Some days you must learn a great deal. But you should also have days when you allow what is already in you to swell up and touch everything. If you never let that happen, then you just accumulate facts, and they begin to rattle around inside of you.
item.author: E. L. Konigsburg

item.quote: Most of us won't see one another after graduation, and even if we do it will be different.
item.author: Lauren Oliver

item.quote: Some of the most beautiful things we have in life comes from our mistakes.
item.author: Surgeo Bell

item.quote: I think there is a song out there to describe just about any situation.
item.author: Criss Jami

item.quote: Let us work without reasoning,' said Martin; 'it is the only way to make life endurable.
item.author: Voltaire

item.quote: I could just remember how my father used to say that the reason for living was to get ready to stay dead a long time.
item.author: William Faulkner

item.quote: Middle age has been defined as what happens when a person's broad mind and narrow waist change places.
item.author: A.C. Grayling

item.quote: The secret of the mountain is that the mountains simply exist, as I do myself: the mountains exist simply, which I do not. The mountains have no meaning, they are meaning; the mountains are. The sun is round. I ring with life, and the mountains ring, and when I can hear it, there is a ringing that we share. I understand all this, not in my mind but in my heart, knowing how meaningless it is to try to capture what cannot be expressed, knowing that mere words will remain when I read it all again, another day.
item.author: Peter Matthiessen

item.quote: Find a voice in a whisper.
item.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

item.quote: Simplify your life. You don't grow spiritual, you shrink spiritual.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: The world is a prison in which solitary confinement is preferable.
item.author: Karl Kraus

item.quote: Each book is a mind alive, a life revealed, a world awaiting exploration, but living people are all those things, as welland more, because their stories havent yet been completely told.
item.author: Dean Koontz

item.quote: The truth was, history repeated itself on a daily basis; mistakes were made over and over. People were haunted by what they had done, and by what they hadn't had time to do.
item.author: Jodi Picoult

item.quote: Sometimes I think there are only two instructions we need to follow to develop and deepen our spiritual life: slow down and let go.
item.author: Oriah Mountain Dreamer

item.quote: Regular maps have few surprises: their contour lines reveal where the Andes are, and are reasonably clear. More precious, though, are the unpublished maps we make ourselves, of our city, our place, our daily world, our life; those maps of our private world we use every day; here I was happy, in that place I left my coat behind after a party, that is where I met my love; I cried there once, I was heartsore; but felt better round the corner once I saw the hills of Fife across the Forth, things of that sort, our personal memories, that make the private tapestry of our lives.
item.author: Alexander McCall Smith

item.quote: Do you understand what I'm saying?
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: Later on in life, you expect a bit of rest, don't you? You think you deserve it. I did, anyway. But then you begin to understand that the reward of merit is not life's business.
item.author: Julian Barnes

item.quote: If you want something, you don't wait for the world to deal it out for you. You take it.
item.author: Poppy Z. Brite

item.quote: [O]ur honeymoon will shine our life long: its beams will only fade over your grave or mine.
item.author: Charlotte Bront

item.quote: having nothing to struggle
item.author: Charles Bukowski

item.quote: Our lives are so important to us that we tend to think the story of them begins with our birth. First there was nothing, then I was born...Yet that is not so. Human lives are not pieces of string that can be separated out from a knot of others and laid out straight. Families are webs. Impossible to touch one part of it without setting the rest vibrating. Impossible to understand one part without having a sense of the whole. - Vida Winter
item.author: Diane Setterfield

item.quote: There is a very fine line between loving life and being greedy for it.
item.author: Maya Angelou

item.quote: Its a lack of clarity that creates chaos and frustration. Those emotions are poison to any living goal.
item.author: Steve Maraboli

item.quote: Life is boring. People are vengeful. Good things always end. We do so many things and we dont know why, and if we do find out why, its decades later and knowing why doesnt matter any more.
item.author: Douglas Coupland

item.quote: The continuous narrative of existence is a lie. There is no continuous narrative, there are lit-up moments, and the rest is dark.
item.author: Jeanette Winterson

item.quote: Because you have to just go with the flow. Your life is not your own, with people coming in and out all the time. You get mellow because you have to.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: The thing is, you cant always have the best of everything. Because for a life to be real, you need it all: good and bad, beach and concrete, the familiar and the unknown, big talkers and small towns.
item.author: Sarah Dessen

item.quote: Everybody was sorry. Sorry was easy. Sorry was for suckers.
item.author: Gretchen McNeil

item.quote: at your weakest, you end up showing more strength; at your lowest, you are suddenly lifted higher than youve ever been. They all border one another, these opposites and show how quickly we can be altered.
item.author: Cecelia Ahern

item.quote: You know, considering your IQ, you're really socially retarded sometimes.
item.author: Shannon Delany

item.quote: All art is but dirtying the paper delicately.
item.author: John Ruskin
