item.quote: There are four simple ways for the observant to tell Mr. Croup and Mr. Vandemar apart: first, Mr. Vandemar is two and a half heads taller than Mr. Croup; second, Mr. Croup has eyes of a faded china blue, while Mr. Vandemar's eyes are brown; third, while Mr. Vandemar fashioned the rings he wears on his right hand out of the skulls of four ravens, Mr. Croup has no obvious jewelery; fourth, Mr. Croup likes words, while Mr. Vandemar is always hungry. Also, they look nothing at all alike.

item.quote: Grover wore his fake feet and his pants to pass as human. He wore a green rasta-style cap, because when it rained his curly hair flattened and you could just see the tips of his horns. His bright orange backpack was full of scrap metal and apples to snack on. In his pocket was a set of reed pipes his daddy goat had carved for him, even though he only knew two songs: Mozart's Piano Concerto no. 12 and Hilary Duff's So Yesterday, both of which sounded pretty bad on reed pipes.

item.quote: And then Jack chopped down what was the world's last beanstalk, adding murder and ecological terrorism to the theft, enticement, and trespass charges already mentioned, and all the giant's children didn't have a daddy anymore. But he got away with it and lived happily ever after, without so much as a guilty twinge about what he had done...which proves that you can be excused for just about anything if you are a hero, because no one asks inconvenient questions.

item.quote: I know this goes without saying, but Stonehenge really was the most incredible accomplishment. It took five hundred men just to pull each sarsen, plus a hundred more to dash around positioning the rollers. Just think about it for a minute. Can you imagine trying to talk six hundred people into helping you drag a fifty-ton stone eighteen miles across the countryside and muscle it into an upright position, and then saying, 'Right, lads! Another twenty like that, plus some lintels and maybe a couple of dozen nice bluestones from Wales, and we can party!' Whoever was the person behind Stonehenge was one dickens of a motivator, I'll tell you that.

item.quote: One of the major problems encountered in time travel is not that of becoming your own father or mother. There is no problem in becoming your own father or mother that a broad-minded and well-adjusted family can't cope with. There is no problem with changing the course of historythe course of history does not change because it all fits together like a jigsaw. All the important changes have happened before the things they were supposed to change and it all sorts itself out in the end.

You make me dance like a fool, forget how to breath, shine like the sun buzz like a bee, just the thought of you can drive me wild. Oh you make me smile. -Uncle Kracker-

Unfortunately, the average man is less adroit at fostering such rivalries, which is why most men remain average; males are better at hating things that can't hate them back (e.g., lawnmowers, cats, the Denver Broncos, et cetera). They don't see the big picture.

item.quote: I wish someone had just told me the truth right up front, as soon as I was old enough to understand it. I wish someone had just said: Heres the deal, Wade. Youre something called a human being. Thats a really smart kind of animal. Like every other animal on this planet, were descended from a single-celled organism that lived millions of years ago. This happened by a process called evolution, and youll learn more about it But trust me, thats really how we all got here. Theres proof of it everywhere, buried in the rocks. That story you heard? About how we were all created by a super-powerful dude named God who lives up in the sky? Total bullshit. The whole God thing is actually an ancient fairy tale that people have been telling one another for thousands of years. We made it all up. Like Santa Claus and the Easter Bunny. Oh, and by the way theres no Santa Claus or Easter Bunny. Also bullshit. Sorry, kid Deal with it.
item.author: Ernest Cline

item.quote: You see, wire telegraph is a kind of a very, very long cat. You pull his tail in New York and his head is meowing in Los Angeles. Do you understand this? And radio operates exactly the same way: you send signals here, they receive them there. The only difference is that there is no cat.

item.quote: Of course, it is quite possible to be in the dark in the dark, but there are so many secrets in the world that it is likely that you are always in the dark about one thing or another, whether you are in the dark in the dark or in the dark not in the dark, although the sun can go down so quickly that you may be in the in the dark about being in the dark, only to look around and find yourself no longer in the dark about being in the dark, but in the dark in the dark nontheless, not only because of the dark, but because of the ballerinas in the dark, who are not in the dark about the dark, but also not in the dark about the locked cabinet, and you may be in the dark about the ballerinas digging up the locked cabinet in the dark, even though you are no longer in the dark about being in the dark, and so you are in fact in the dark about being in the dark, even though you are not in the dark about being in the dark, and so you may fall into the hole that the ballerinas have dug, which is dark, in the dark, and in the park.
item.author: Lemony Snicket

item.quote: And besides... I dont want to leave you. Er, you guys.

item.quote: Lead me not into temptation; I can find the way myself.

While in this respect the English, and still more the gallant French, are burdened with a spirit of narrow-mindedness. Anybody who knows anything of history knows that great social changes are impossible without the feminine ferment. Social progress can be measured exactly by the social position of the fair sex (the ugly ones included).

I had kind of a this-is-your-brain-on-drugs moment, only mine was more like a this-is-your-brain-on-seeing-Ren-in-tight-leather moment. If theyd been smart, the Ducati Company should have used him in a commercial and given him the bike for free.

I ran to the door to our street, opened it, and called out into the night, I shan't marry the prince. I turned back into the hall and ran to Char and threw my arms about his neck. I shan't marry you. I kissed his cheek. He was safe from me.

item.quote: I'm a girl of extremes. When I love something, I'm like a puppy dog (without all the licking). When I'm cranky, I'm a wasp (like a whole hive of 'em). And when I'm angry, I'm a Mother Bear with a predator after her cubs: Dangerous.
item.author: James Patterson

item.quote: Music is crucial. Beyond no way can I overstress this fact. Let's say you're southbound on the interstate, cruising alone in the middle lane, listening to AM radio. Up alongside comes a tractor trailer of logs or concrete pipe, a tie-down strap breaks, and the load dumps on top of your little sheetmetal ride. Crushed under a world of concrete, you're sandwiched like so much meat salad between layers of steel and glass. In that last, fast flutter of your eyelids, you looking down that long tunnel toward the bright God Light and your dead grandma walking up to hug you--do you want to be hearing another radio commercial for a mega, clearance, closeout, blow-out liquidation car-stereo sale?
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: Men seldom make passes at girls who wear glasses.

He found a man who agreed to be his hired worrier for a salary of $200,000 per year. After the man accepted the job, his first question to his boss was, Where are you going to get $200,000 per year? To which the man responded, That's your worry.

item.quote: Every time you come in yelling that God damn

You could be in the Garden of Eden if you had just kept your fucking mouth shut and hadn't asked any questions.

item.author: Shel Silverstein

His father had seduced hundred of women without any problems whatsoever, and he was having trouble with just one. This was the real reason he never used the Casanova name. He could never live up to his father's reputation. The old man was probably laughing in his grave.

Tune in, every week, as Chloe Saunders runs screaming from yet another ghost looking for her help.

And, on his lapel was a button that said, If you can read this, thank a teacher.

To ignore that because of some stupid rule seemed selfish, cowardly, and... well, stupid. If you want to throw me in jail for trying to save someone's [Alby] life, then go ahead. Next time I promise I'll point at them and laugh, then go eat some of Frypan's dinner. -Thomas

item.quote: Why?' is always the most difficult question to answer. You know where you are when someone asks you 'What's the time?' or 'When was the battle of 1066?' or 'How do these seatbelts work that go tight when you slam the brakes on, Daddy?' The answers are easy and are, respectively, 'Seven-thirty in the evening,' 'Ten-fifteen in the morning,' and 'Don't ask stupid questions.

item.quote: You know your Lamborghini is on fire, right?

item.quote: If someone called me chubby, it would no longer be something that kept me up late at night. Being called fat is not like being called stupid or unfunny, which is the worst thing you could ever say to me. Do I envy Jennifer Hudson for being able to lose all that weight and look smokin hot? Of course, yes. Do I sometimes look at Gisele Bundchen and wonder how awesome life would be if I never had to wear Spanx? Duh, of course. Thats kind of the point of Gisele Bundchen. And maybe I will, once or twice, for a very short period of time. But on the list of things I want to do in my lifetime, thats not near the top. I mean, its not near the bottom either. Id say its right above Learn to drive a vespa, but several notches below film a chase scene for a movie.
item.author: Mindy Kaling

item.quote: Kools and Newports were for black people and lower-class whites. Camels were for procrastinators, those who wrote bad poetry, and those who put off writing bad poetry. Merits were for sex addicts, Salems were for alcoholics, and Mores were for people who considered themselves to be outrageous but really weren't.

I mean, it's like, religion, you really can't take it seriously, because it seems so mythological, it seems so arbitrary...but, on the other hand, science is just pure empiricism, and by virtue of its method, it excludes metaphysics. I guess I wouldn't believe in anything anymore if it weren't for my lucky astrology mood watch.

item.quote: There was a dragon who had a long-standing obsession with a queen's breasts, she said, growing breathless. The dragon knew the penalty to touch her would mean death, yet he revealed his secret desire to the king's chief doctor. This man promised he could arrange for the dragon to satisfy his desire, but it would cost him one thousand gold coins. She spread her soapy hands over his nipples, then down his arms. Though he didn't have the money, the dragon readily agreed to the scheme.

item.quote: My Head of House said I lacked certain necessary qualities...like the ability to behave myself.

Let me just throw something out there for you to consider while we're chasing the probe: I share Artemis's passion but not his boorishness. No pressure; just think about it.

The latest one was a lullaby.

item.quote: You are going to love the sports here. Snow skiing and water-skiing and rock climbing and all kinds of extreme sports. I give you full permission to hurl yourself off stuff.

item.quote: Yes, boys are a little like shoes. Why? Well...They can be useful. But mainly...They are nice to look at. Getting the right one can be a lovely accessory to an outfit. There are times when you couldn't do without them. And there are times when you'd rather do without them. Get the wrong ones and they can hurt. There are many types and often the ones that look the nicest are completely unpractical.

item.quote: Dearest creature in creation,

item.quote: You can have everything in the world, but if you don't have love, none of it means crap, he said promptly. Love is patient. Love is kind. Love always forgives, trusts, supports, and endures. Love never fails. When every star in the heavens grows cold, and when silence lies once more on the face of the deep, three things will endure: faith, hope, and love.

He removed his wife from the general category labeled Females and gave her a section of her own. He made a note that she didn't find him revolting, and proposed several explanations: (a) bad eyesight and faulty hearing, (b)a defect in a portion of her otherwise sound intellect, (c) an inherited Trent eccentricity, or (d) an act of God. Since the Almighty had not done him a single act of kindness in at least twenty-five years, Dain thought it was about bloody time, but he thanked his Heavenly Father all the same, and promised to be as good as he was capable of being.

item.quote: You couldn't be satisfied with being an amateur asshole, could you, Jimbo! You had to go and turn pro on me!
item.author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips

item.quote: Camping is nature's way of promoting the motel business.
item.author: Dave Barry

item.quote: Huging my pillow to my chest, I told myself, At least soon you won't have so much time to miss him. Soon school will start again, and then you'll be busier.
item.author: Claudia Gray

item.quote: I will describe my eyes and then begin the story. My eyes are blue and resplendent. Now I will begin the story.
item.author: Jonathan Safran Foer

item.quote: Doing business without advertising is like winking at a girl in the dark. You know what you are doing but nobody else does.
item.author: Steuart Henderson Britt

item.quote: Professors of literature collect books the way a ship collects barnacles, without seeming effort.
item.author: Amanda Cross

item.quote: For the record, I would like to point out that it is NOT being obsessive to memorize a boy's schedule so that you can accidentally bump into him. It is called being efficient.
item.author: Jess Rothenberg

item.quote: I have never met any really wicked person before. I feel rather frightened. I am so afraid he will look just like every one else.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: She fitted into my biggest arm-chair as if it had been built round her by someone who knew they were wearing arm-chairs tight about the hips that season
item.author: P.G. Wodehouse

item.quote: Humor is a spontaneous, wonderful bit of an outburst that just comes. It's unbridled, its unplanned, it's full of suprises.
item.author: Erma Bombeck

item.quote: Bite me, Goth princess, Shane called from the back. Not literally or anything.
item.author: Rachel Caine

item.quote: One of my professors once told me that the last official act of the British monarchy was when Queen Victoria refused to sign a law that made same-sex acts illegal. It would have made me think more highly of her, except the reason she objected was because she didnt believe women would do anything like that. Parliament rewrote the law so it was specific to men, and she signed it. A tribute to enlightenment, Queen Victoria was not. Neither, as I have observed before, are werewolf packs.
item.author: Patricia Briggs

item.quote: Sometimes the most remarkable things seem commonplace. I mean when you think about it jet travel is pretty freaking remarkable. You get in a plane it defies the gravity of a entire planet by exploiting a loophole with air pressure and it flies across distances that would take months or years to cross by any means of travel that has been significant for more than a century or three. You hurtle above the earth at enough speed to kill you instantly should you bump into something and you can only breathe because someone built you a really good tin can that seems tight enough to hold in a decent amount of air. Hundreds of millions of man-hours of work and struggle and research blood sweat tears and lives have gone into the history of air travel and it has totally revolutionized the face of our planet and societies.
item.author: Jim Butcher

item.quote: I had a polynomial once. My doctor removed it.
item.author: Michael Grant

item.quote: Marry me, he says. I got all my own teeth, I wash twice a year an I'll cut you in fer half the business here.
item.author: Moira Young

item.quote: Do you find this...distracting?
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: All persons, living and dead, are purely coincidental.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: I'm trying to make some sense out of the phrase Everything happens for a reason, and I think I've figured out what the reason is - to pissed me off.
item.author: Cecilia Ahern

item.quote: 'Tell Suzie she's a lucky cat.' Have sexier words ever been spoken?
item.author: Ally Carter

item.quote: But Grovers voice was already growing fainter. Sweet dreams. Dont let me die!
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: You can run from the grave, but you can't hide.
item.author: Jeaniene Frost

item.quote: Ransom really looked at the other man for the first time, shook his head, stared again. Holy hell, your eyes are like a fucking vipers.
item.author: Nalini Singh

item.quote: My relationship with my father had been on the proverbial fritz since the time I was fifteen and called the police to report him for child molesting. He had never molested me, but I wanted to have a party that weekend and needed him out of the house.
item.author: Chelsea Handler

item.quote: There are things that are so serious that you can only joke about them.
item.author: Werner Heisenberg

item.quote: I do not, I felt oddly appalled by her statement. I'm an excellent liar. Ask my dentist. He swears I floss regularly.
item.author: Darynda Jones

item.quote: Revenge is sweet and not fattening.
item.author: Alfred Hitchcock

item.quote: Housework won't kill you, but then again, why take the chance?
item.author: Phyllis Diller

item.quote: It's all bullshit, folks and it's bad for ya.
item.author: George Carlin

item.quote: Oh that looked painful, called another Puck, a little farther down. We really need to talk about your anger-management problems.
item.author: Julie Kagawa

item.quote: You can read minds, and you didn't tell me? Link stared at me like he just found out I was the Silver Surfer. He rubbed his head nervously. Hey, man, all that stuff about Lena? I was yankin your chain. He looked away. Are you doin it now? You're doin it, aren't you? Dude, get out of my head. He backed away from me and into the bookshelf.
item.author: Kami Garcia

item.quote: He specialized in the murder of dreams, Hazel Grace...
item.author: John Green

item.quote: If Marilyn Monroe was alive right now, what would she be doing?'
item.author: Chuck Palahniuk

item.quote: The inhabitants of the earth are of two sorts: those with brains, but no religion, and those with religion, but no brains.
item.author: Al-Maarri

item.quote: I love being in love, but I also love other things, like not being jealous, overly sensitive, or needy.
item.author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo

item.quote: To say I had some pent-up anger would be like saying Britney Spears had minor impulse-control issues.
item.author: Molly Harper

item.quote: She gave Samuel a stern look. Now, I don't know what's going on between you and my daughter and Adam Hauptman
item.author: Patricia Briggs

item.quote: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
item.author: Rick Cook

item.quote: This is the problem with forever friends. They know too much.
item.author: Kristin Hannah

item.quote: Why would you throw a ball in someone's face?...Huh. That's a pretty good reason. Well, I can't do much about your teacher being pissed, but me and you are good.
item.author: Justin Halpern

item.quote: God, if you ever loved me, open my eyes for me when I'm being this stupid! (Ron)
item.author: Kim Harrison

item.quote: I sheathed my blade and glared at him. And here I almost thought you weren't a complete bastard.
item.author: Julie Kagawa

item.quote: Compromise is a stalling between two fools.
item.author: Stephen Fry

item.quote: There's a meeting in Command. Disregard your current schedule,' he says.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: Pulling the chair out for me, he invited me to sit.
item.author: Colleen Houck

item.quote: Otrera stayed dead the second time, Kinzie said, batting her eyes. We have to thank you for that. If you ever need a new girlfriend...well, I think you'd look great in an iron collar and an orange jumpsuit.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: That's it, cupcake. You're going down.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: OK, Josh said evenly, I've seen men made of mud, I guess I can accept spying rats. Do they talk? he wondered aloud.
item.author: Michael Scott

item.quote: Bad kitty! he screeched, snarling and baring his fangs at Grimalkin, who yawned and turned away to groom his tail. Evil, evil, sneaky kitty! Bite your head off in your sleep, I will! Hang you by your toes and set you on fire! Burn, Burn!
item.author: Julie Kagawa

item.quote: I think we're too young to be dating. I mean I don't see what the rush is. Summer says.
item.author: R.J. Palacio

item.quote: I hate the vamp jobs. They think they're so suave. It's not enough for them to slaughter and eat you like a zombie would. No, they want to be all sexy, too. And trust me: vampires? Not. Sexy.
item.author: Kiersten White

item.quote: CUSTOMER: Do you have this children's book I've heard about? It's supposed to be very good. It's called Lionel Richie and the Wardrobe.
item.author: Jen Campbell

item.quote: I don't know where people got the idea that characters in books are supposed to be likable. Books are not in the business of creating merely likeable characters with whom you can have some simple identification with. Books are in the business of creating great stories that make you're brain go ahhbdgbdmerhbergurhbudgerbudbaaarr.
item.author: John Green

item.quote: You know, I can see more than just the future or the past.
item.author: Rachel Hawkins

item.quote: Heartache often drives us to consume things we wouldn't otherwise, such as an entire pint of Caramel Pecan Perfection high-fat ice cream, covered in ganache, the crack cocaine of frozed dairy. Twelve hundred calories per pint, six hundred and eighty of which are fat calories, but is only dulls the pain for the moment, there's that carb fog while you're standing at the sink shoving it in your face, and then it's over and you feel...used. Like a cheap pickup the Dove people seduced and abandoned in your kitchen, leaving you with sticky hands and an empty cup and a still-broken heart, except now you're mad at Dove, too.
item.author: Jennifer Crusie

item.quote: I'm amazing and studly, but I have limits.
item.author: Jim Butcher

item.quote: If there is anyone here whom I have not insulted, I beg his pardon.
item.author: Johannes Brahms

item.quote: All I really wanted to do was cuddle back under the blankets, maybe with a certain stuffed toy penguin I knew. Yeah, hiding sounded good.
item.author: Laurell K. Hamilton

item.quote: Stupidity is much the same all the world over. A stupid person's notions and feelings may confidently be inferred from those which prevail in the circle by which the person is surrounded. Not so with those whose opinions and feelings are an emanation from their own nature and faculties.
item.author: John Stuart Mill

item.quote: I alternate between feeling sympathetic toward humanity and being a misanthrope. When I'm sympathetic, it usually means I haven't been around people in awhile.
item.author: John R Lindensmith

item.quote: As for Gussie Finknottle, many an experienced undertaker would have been deceived by his appearance and started embalming on sight.
item.author: Wodehouse

item.quote: When I was One,
item.author: A.A. Milne

item.quote: If 50 million people say something foolish, it is still foolish.
item.author: W. Somerset Maugham

item.quote: This was very exciting. I'd never had two boys get into a fight over me before. The fact that one of the boys was my stepbrother, however, and held about as much romantic appeal for me as Max, the family dog, somewhat dampened my enthusiasm. And Michael wasn't much of a catch, either, when you actually thought about it, being a potential murderer and all. Oh, why did I have to have such a couple of losers fighting over me? Why couldn't Matt Damon and Ben Affleck fight over me? Now that would be truly excellent.
item.author: Meg Cabot

item.quote: He had about the same life expectancy as a three legged hedgehog on a six lane motorway.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: I don't mind foreigners. God save the queen! he squeaked and ran.
item.author: Jeaniene Frost

item.quote: He was a gentle and sensitive soul, and therefore had a short temper, which is why he went straight after everything with an ax...

item.quote: We made too many wrong mistakes.
item.author: Yogi Berra

item.quote: Rosie get off your desk, and please put your beard away.
item.author: Louise Rennison

item.quote: Life is All About How you Handle Plan B
item.author: Suzy Toronto

item.quote: How do you deal with it? Kami asked Jared. The laughing at nothing and occasionally stopping dead in your tracks.
item.author: Sarah Rees Brennan

item.quote: People think first love is sweet, and never sweeter than when that first bond snaps. You've heard a thousand pop and country songs that prove the point; some fool got his heart broke. Yet that first broken heart is always the most painful, the slowest to mend, and leaves the most visible scar. What's so sweet about that?
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: Youre not as sexy as I think you are. She squinted. Wait. That hadnt come out right.
item.author: Thea Harrison

item.quote: I don't mind if you forget me.
item.author: Morrissey

item.quote: But that was life: Nobody got a guided tour to their own theme park. You had to hop on the rides as they presented themselves, never knowing whether you would like the one you were in line for...or if the bastard was going to make you throw up your corn dog and your cotton candy all over the place.
item.author: J.R. Ward

item.quote: Most of the upper management of I.S. were undead. I always thought it was because the job was easier if you didn't have a soul.
item.author: Kim Harrison

item.quote: Hell's bells, irony blows.
item.author: Jim Butcher

item.quote: I'd rather be fried alive and eaten by Mexicans.
item.author: Roald Dahl

item.quote: Do you sleep naked?
item.author: Becca Fitzpatrick

item.quote: How can such scary looking parents create something so cute?

item.quote: I love the Olympics, because they enable people from all over the world to come together and--regardless of their political or cultural differences--accuse each other of cheating.

item.quote: Unusual financial activity: none, unless you count the fact that someone in the family is way too into Civil War biographies. (Can this be a possible indication of Confederate insurgents still living and working in Virginia? Must research further.)
item.author: Ally Carter

item.quote: Zoo-Wee Mama!
item.author: Jeff Kinney

item.quote: That's chess! snapped Ron. You've got to make some sacrifices!

item.quote: By the way, when you finish the bottle of Crown Royal, you can still use the pouch to hold your broken dreams.

item.quote: Good-humor is a philosophic state of mind; it seems to say to Nature that we take her no more seriously than she takes us. I maintain that one should always talk of philosophy with a smile.

item.quote: You told me I was the best sex you'd ever had in your life...You couldn't get enough...At one point you were so loud I thought sure hotel security was going to beat down the door.

item.quote: I like pancakes.
item.author: Brandon Mull

item.quote: If we would learn what the human race really is at bottom, we need only observe it in election times.

item.quote: He moved to sniff some white-and-yellow flowers.
item.author: Sarah J. Maas

item.quote: You are putting yourself in serious danger...'
item.author: Marjane Satrapi

item.quote: Why couldn't you turn into a fireball when we were on the same team!
item.author: Pittacus Lore

item.quote: Women are sneaky.
item.author: Patricia Briggs

item.quote: Sir Beldevere: What makes you think she's a witch?
item.author: Graham Chapman

item.quote: Well, thanks for not shooting anyone, I guess, said Marcus. My contribution was to somehow refrain from peeing myself. You can thank me later.
item.author: Dan Wells

item.quote: Who cares even if I didn't?! Conor shouted back. They're just stupid berries. Woo-hoo,
item.author: Patrick Ness

item.quote: I'd give my right arm to be ambidextrous.
item.author: Yogi Berra

item.quote: At a certain age almost all the questions a person asks him or herself are really just about one thing: how should you live your life?
item.author: Fredrik Backman

item.quote: The kiss originated when the first male reptile licked the first female reptile, implying in a subtle way that she was as succulent as the small reptile he had for dinner the night before.
item.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.quote: A guy walks up to me and asks, What's Punk?. So I kick over a garbage can and say. That's punk!. So he kicks over the garbage can and says, That's Punk?, and I say, No that's trendy!
item.author: Billie Joe Armstrong

item.quote: I had a dream about you last night... you were a giant slinky and I watched you fall down the stairs.
item.author: Amy Summers

item.quote: There must be a mistake, I said.
item.author: Chelsea M. Cameron

item.quote: Ambulances were cool. You just want to fondle my extraneous body parts, I said to the EMT as I picked up a silver gadget that looked disturbingly like an alien orifice probe, broke it, then promptly put it back, hoping it wouldnt leave someones life hanging in the balance because the EMT couldnt alien-probe his orifices.
item.author: Darynda Jones

item.quote: Who knew? I had no idea that someone could be such a thorn in your foot during a death march and still be irresistibly attractive in some magical, undeniable way.
item.author: Susan Ee

item.quote: You don't happen to have a thousand dollars I can borrow?
item.author: Becca Fitzpatrick

item.quote: BE QUIET!!...What do you want...? I was in the middle of saying something nice...
item.author: Tite Kubo

item.quote: Personally, I like it much better when someone else does the decision making. That way you have legitimate grounds to whine and complain. I tend to find both whining and complaining quite interesting and amusing, though sometimes--unfortunately--it's hard to choose which one of the two I want to do.
item.author: Brandon Sanderson

item.quote: How can I believe in God when just last week I got my tongue caught in the roller of an electric typewriter?
item.author: Woody Allen

item.quote: Tut, Tut, looks like rain
item.author: A.A. Milne

item.quote: I've tried to get the angel to watch MTV so I can learn the vocabulary of your music, but even with the gift of tongues, I'm having trouble learning to speak hip-hop. Why is it that one can busta rhyme or busta move anywhere but you must busta cap in someone's ass? Is ho always feminine, and muthafucka always masculine, while bitch can be either? How many peeps in a posse, how much booty before baby got back, do you have to be all that to get all up in that, and do I need to be dope and phat to be da bomb or can I just be stupid? I'll not be singing over any dead mothers until I understand.
item.author: Christopher Moore

item.quote: Do you know how helpless you feel if you have a full cup of coffee in your hand and you start to sneeze?
item.author: Jean Kerr

item.quote: I see you're a man with ideals. I better be going before you've still got them.
item.author: Mae West

item.quote: Maybe we should go on lots of double dates, Cath said, and then we can get married on the same day in a double ceremony, in matching dresses, and the four of us will light the unity candle all at the same time.
item.author: Rainbow Rowell

item.quote: A lot of people ask me if I were shipwrecked, and could have only one book, what would it be? I always say, How to Build a Boat.
item.author: Stephen Wright

item.quote: What a strange family you are! Is your name Lettie too?
item.author: Diana Wynne Jones

item.quote: You weren't afraid of me when I was Wolf, he said. Why are you afraid of Nathan?
item.author: Anne Bishop

item.quote: Don't be stupid, it's a flying house!
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: He was a writer and words were his weapons.
item.author: Christopher Moore

item.quote: Mr. McGregor's a nasty piece of work, isn't he? Quite the Darth Vader of children's literature.
item.author: Jasper Fforde

item.quote: It was beautiful in a harsh I'm-going-to-gut-you-like-a-fish kind of way.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: The problem with the designated driver program, it's not a desirable job, but if you ever get sucked into doing it, have fun with it. At the end of the night, drop them off at the wrong house.
item.author: Jeff Foxworthy

item.quote: Madame Bellwings, Memoir Elf Coordinator, was not at all pleased with this request, because elves who write the memoirs of teenage girls have the habit of returning to the magical realm with atrocious grammar. They can't seem to shake the phrases watever and no way, and they insert the word like into so many sentences that the other elves start slapping them...and for no apparent reason occasionally call out the name Edward Cullen.
item.author: Janette Rallison

item.quote: Don't explain computers to laymen. Simpler to explain sex to a virgin.
item.author: Robert A. Heinlein

item.quote: I'm not senile, I snapped. If I burn the house down it will be on purpose.
item.author: Margaret Atwood

item.quote: Heifer.
item.author: Shelly Laurenston

item.quote: Anthony looked down at his evil clutches -- hands, he reminded himself, hands -- and grinned anew.
item.author: Julia Quinn

item.quote: Whenever I get that sad, depressed feeling, I go out and kill a policeman.
item.author: P.G. Wodehouse

item.quote: Etiquette tip: If you're looking for the right time to leave a party, when the host yells, No one leaves here alive, that's your cue.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Do you always ask me the same questions you ask him?
item.author: Anne Bishop

item.quote: Let him treat you like a lady and open the car door for you. If he doesn't automatically open the door for you, stand by the darn thing and don't get into the vehicle until he realises he needs to get hid behind out of the driver's seat and come round and open the car door for you. That's his job!
item.author: Steve Harvey

item.quote: Who shall I shoot? You choose. Now, listen very carefully: where's your coffee? You've got coffee, haven't you? C'mon, everyone's got coffee! Spill the beans!
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: He started to touch the mechanism under the keyboard,
item.author: Rachel Caine

item.quote: I was never really certain why he scared the bejesus out of me. Nothing scared me growing up. Ive been playing with dead people since the day I was born, so its good thing, yet the Big Bad scared me. Which brings me to the reason I called.
item.author: Darynda Jones

item.quote: The lampshade on my head is for my bright ideas. I won't be able to convey them until Monday, when my curtain gets out of the dry cleaners.
item.author: Bauvard

item.quote: Men are all the same, they think that because they came out of the belly of a woman they know all there is to know about women.
item.author: Jos Saramago

item.quote: I think it's the duty of the comedian to find out where the line is drawn and cross it deliberately.
item.author: George Carlin

item.quote: I swear that woman had a previous career as a death-hunter selling tragic ballads down around the Seven Dials, said Will. And I do wish she wouldn't sing about poisoning just after we've eaten.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: There are women named Faith, Hope, Joy, and Prudence. Why not Despair, Guilt, Rage, and Grief? It seems only right. 'Tom, I'd like you to meet the girl of my dreams, Tragedy.' These days, Trajedi.
item.author: George Carlin

item.quote: She blew out a breath between gritted teeth. Sometimes I really want toa frustrated soundbite you!
item.author: Nalini Singh

item.quote: My
item.author: Gail Carriger

item.quote: If I feel the urge to burst into flames, I'll let you know, Simon was getting fed up. Look, did you actually ask me to come all the way uptown just so you could stare at me like I'm something in a petrie dish? Next time I'll send you a photo.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: You're such a cynic, Molly said.
item.author: Jim Butcher

item.quote: I hate patience. Slows everything down.
item.author: J.D. Robb

item.quote: Wizard Howl, said Wizard Suliman. I must apologize for trying to bite you so often. In the normal way, I wouldn't dream of setting teeth in a fellow countryman.
item.author: Diana Wynne Jones

item.quote: Excuse me? Tonight you represent every dateless woman in this city, every woman who's about to sit down to a lonely meal of Weight Watchers past primavera she's just nuked in the microwave. Every woman who will get into bed tonight with a book or reruns of Sex and the City as her only companion. You are our shining hope....But no pressure.
item.author: Nora Roberts

item.quote: Walking around nude in front of humans was not a good way to keep a low profile with the community. It was an excellent way to make new friends, though.
item.author: Rachel Vincent

item.quote: This was supposed to be yesterday. I was sitting on the Cardiff/London train, supposedly about to write this very column, and realising something quite terrible. My head was entirely empty. A vast echoing void. Bigger on the inside, but with nothing in it. You could drop a pebble in my brain and wait for an hour to hear it land. No actually, you couldn't - that would be aggressive and unhelpful, so keep your damn pebbles to yourself.
item.author: Steven Moffat

item.quote: However, because they have no actual interests of their own (or if they do, they squelch them in order to fit in) and merely pursue those that they think will look best on their college apps, they're zombies.
item.author: Meg Cabot

item.quote: If I owned Texas and Hell, I would rent out Texas and live in Hell
item.author: General Philip Henry Sheridan

item.quote: Man was made at the end of the week's work when God was tired.
item.author: Mark Twain

item.quote: Could you just call me Pigeon? he asked the teacher when she read his name.
item.author: Brandon Mull

item.quote: You called me at four thirty-four....I hate four thirty-four. I think four thirty-four should be banned and replaced with something more reasonable, like, say, nine twelve.
item.author: Darynda Jones

item.quote: When did you become a woman?-Hatori
item.author: Natsuki Takaya

item.quote: Eating rice cakes is like chewing on a foam coffee cup, only less filling.
item.author: Dave Barry

item.quote: Easy. Peasy
item.author: P.C. Cast

item.quote: Everything has its drawbacks, as the man said when his mother-in-law died, and they came down upon him for the funeral expenses.
item.author: Jerome K. Jerome

item.quote: You can't save everyone, though God knows you try.
item.author: Richelle Mead

item.quote: What kind of Christmas present would Jesus ask Santa for?
item.author: Salman Rushdie

item.quote: How good one feels when one is full -- how satisfied with ourselves and with the world! People who have tried it, tell me that a clear conscience makes you very happy and contented; but a full stomach does the business quite as well, and is cheaper, and more easily obtained.
item.author: Jerome K. Jerome

item.quote: I've got a black-belt in crazy, and I know where you live.
item.author: Marjorie M. Liu

item.quote: Statement: A girl and a boy jump into a river. The boy swims over to the girl and says, God, it's cold.
item.author: Jenny Downham

item.quote: On the whole, we're a murderous race. According to Genesis, it took as few as four people to make the planet too crowded to stand, and the first murder was a fratricide. Genesis says that in a fit of jealous rage, the very first child born to mortal parents, Cain, snapped and popped the first metaphorical cap in another human being. The attack was a bloody, brutal, violent, reprehensible killing. Cain's brother Abel probably never saw it coming. As I opened the door to my apartment, I was filled with a sense of empathic sympathy and intuitive understanding. For freaking Cain.
item.author: Jim Butcher

item.quote: Are there weapons in a bookstore?'
item.author: Anne Bishop

item.quote: Writing is like talking to yourself, just in a way that makes it look like you're not crazy!
item.author: Mary Kate

item.quote: If possible, try to avoid pushing each other over the edge, as that would cause me extra paperwork.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: No matter how much the cats fight, there always seem to be plenty of kittens.
item.author: Abraham Lincoln

item.quote: And Flock Rule Number Two is, Don't argue with Max or you'll live to regret it. I spun and stomped out to the clearing, turning back for one last jab at Dylan. And by the way, you clearly DON'T know me better than Fang does. Do you see Fang arguing with me? No, you do not.
item.author: James Patterson

item.quote: It's not reasonable to love people who are only going to die, she said.
item.author: Kristin Cashore

item.quote: Winston Gallagher! I said, recognizing the first ghost I'de met. Then my eyes narrowed & I covered my hand in front of my crotch as I saw Winstons gaze fasten there next. Don't even think about poltergeisting my panties again. This is the sod? Come here you scurvy little-- Bones don't! I interrupted. He stopped, giving a last glare to him while mouthing YOU. ME. EXORCIST. before returning to my side.
item.author: Jeaniene Frost

item.quote: Are You Ready for New Urban Fragrances?
item.author: Tom Robbins

item.quote: That's the coolest thing I've ever seen, Puck said.
item.author: Michael Buckley

item.quote: It is often argued that religion is valuable because it makes men good, but even if this were true it would not be a proof that religion is true. That would be an extension of pragmatism beyond endurance. Santa Claus makes children good in precisely the same way, and yet no one would argue seriously that the fact proves his existence. The defense of religion is full of such logical imbecilities. The theologians, taking one with another, are adept logicians, but every now and then they have to resort to sophistries so obvious that their whole case takes on an air of the ridiculous. Even the most logical religion starts out with patently false assumptions. It is often argued in support of this or that one that men are so devoted to it that they are willing to die for it. That, of course, is as silly as the Santa Claus proof. Other men are just as devoted to manifestly false religions, and just as willing to die for them. Every theologian spends a large part of his time and energy trying to prove that religions for which multitudes of honest men have fought and died are false, wicked, and against God.

item.quote: An open Facebook page is simply a psychiatric dry erase board that screams, Look at me. I am insecure. I need your reaction to what I am doing, but youre not cool enough to be my friend. Therefore, I will just pray you see this because the approval of God is not all I need.
item.author: Shannon L. Alder

item.quote: She had not made a decision to give up sex, only the clamor of romance, because it was exhausting her, doing her no good and too much harm...
item.author: Michelle Herman

item.quote: Listen, street punk. You're a guy, and you're a couple inches taller, and maybe forty pounds heavier, and ooh, you're in a gang. But I've survived ten years of Catholic school, and I will cut you off at your knees without a blink. Do you understand?
item.author: James Patterson

item.quote: That is the second time you have spoken out of turn, Miss Granger, said Snape coolly. Five more points from Gryffindor for being an insufferable know-it-all.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: It took teams of LEP warlocks to slow down time for a few hours; the magic required to open a door to the tunnel was stupendous. It would be easier to shoot down the moon.
item.author: Eoin Colfer

item.quote: We were just looking at maps...
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: How did you-
item.author: Maria V. Snyder

item.quote: Don't count your owls before they are delivered.
item.author: J.K. Rowling

item.quote: Why are we bringing him along, again? Will inquired, of the world in general as well as his sister.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Mr Lorry asks the witness questions:
item.author: Charles Dickens

item.quote: If he's getting married, he's not longer interesting.
item.author: Colette

item.quote: I totally carpe-d the snot out of this diem!
item.author: Jerry Scott

item.quote: I've won Satan's lottery.
item.author: Christopher Moore

item.quote: Laughter rises out of tragedy when you need it the most, and rewards you for your courage.
item.author: Erma Bombeck

item.quote: You have to watch your language. People will think you have no fucking class
item.author: Lani Diane Rich

item.quote: Leo. Jason said, you're wierd. Yeah, you tell me that a lot. Leo grinned. But if you don't remember me, that means I can reuse all my old jokes. Come on!
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Gussie, a glutton for punishment, stared at himself in the mirror.
item.author: P.G. Wodehouse

item.quote: Jocks usually aren't smart. Their muscles feast on their brains.
item.author: Katie McGarry

item.quote: Dear Asshole: Thank you for keeping your word and believing me. It was more than I expected. Also, I'm sorry you were inconvenienced by my gluing your locker shut at the beginning of this year. However, I am not sorry that I did it, because it was a lot of fun. Love, Alex.
item.author: Francesca Zappia

item.quote: You just put that sword away, sir, please, said the voice of Lance-Constable Vimes.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: Where are you going?
item.author: Derek Landy

item.quote: [Jem] looked from Will to Tessa and raised his silvery eyebrows. A miracle, he said. You got him to speak.
item.author: Cassandra Clare

item.quote: Last night somebody broke into my apartment and replaced everything with exact duplicates... When I pointed it out to my roommate, he said, Do I know you?
item.author: Steven Wright

item.quote: [On school uniforms] Don't these schools do enough damage making all these kids think alike, now they have to make them look alike too? It's not a new idea, either. I first saw it in old newsreels from the 1930s, but it was hard to understand because the narration was in German.
item.author: George Carlin

item.quote: I am no fan of books. And chances are, if you're reading this, you and I share a healthy skepticism about the printed word. Well, I want you to know that this is the first book I've ever written, and I hope it's the first book you've ever read. Don't make a habit of it.
item.author: Stephen Colbert

item.quote: Becky Renee Apple - can you believe her mom named her that and then had all of her sweaters monogramed with 'BRA'?
item.author: P.C. Cast

item.quote: Im not an idiot, Kenji. I have reasons for the things I say.
item.author: Tahereh Mafi

item.quote: See? This is why I'm not religious. I couldn't possibly keep my mouth shut long enough to get along with everyone else.
item.author: Jim Butcher

item.quote: My geekness is a-quivering.
item.author: Jack Thorne

item.quote: There must be something wrong with those people who think Audrey Hepburn doesnt perspire, hiccup or sneeze, because they know thats not true. I n fact, I hiccup more than most.
item.author: Audrey Hepburn

item.quote: Oh Blimey OReilly's pantyhose...what is the point of Shakespeare? I know he is a genius and so on, but he does rave on.
item.author: Louise Rennison

item.quote: Dear Teens at Starbucks wearing 'Abstain from Sex 2 Attain Ur Goals' t-shirts: Doesn't it depend on what my goals are?
item.author: John Green

item.quote: Sorry, did I say something wrong? said Marvin, dragging himself on regardless. Pardon me for breathing, which I never do anyway so I don't know why I bother to say it, oh God I'm so depressed. Here's another one of those self-satisfied doors.
item.author: Douglas Adams

item.quote: You can't make footprints in the sands of time if you're sitting on your butt. And who wants to make buttprints in the sands of time?
item.author: Bob Moawad

item.quote: We only came close to dying six or seven times, which I thought was pretty good. Once, I lost my grip and found myself dangling by one hand from a ledge fifty feet above the rocky surf. But I found another handhold and kept climbing. A minute later Annabeth hit a slippery patch of moss and her foot slipped. Fortunately, she found something else to put it against. Unfortunately, that something was mt face.
item.author: Rick Riordan

item.quote: Be you wise and never sad,
item.author: Dorothy Parker

item.quote: The lustful glances thrown his way made me wish he wasnt such a damned bowl of eye candy.
item.author: Jeaniene Frost

item.quote: He gave her a sly, sideways look. Did you
item.author: Julia Quinn

item.quote: And by golly, love sure was a battlefield. Benatar was right about that.
item.author: Charlaine Harris

item.quote: How did you kill the Ashman in the forest last year?
item.author: Chelsea Fine

item.quote: In my mind, I'm probably the biggest sex maniac you ever saw.
item.author: J.D. Salinger

item.quote: Well finish your story anyway.
item.author: Kurt Vonnegut

item.quote: The only way to behave to a woman is to make love to her if she is pretty, and to someone else if she is plain.
item.author: Oscar Wilde

item.quote: Not daring to flee since my general location has just been broadcast to any killer who cares. I mean, I know it's cold out here and not everybody has a sleeping bag.
item.author: Suzanne Collins

item.quote: Sorry, she said. I have a psychological disorder that prevents me from keeping thoughts inside my head where they belong.
item.author: Jeri Smith-Ready

item.quote: And Mega has a crush on Chester.
item.author: Karen Marie Moning

item.quote: Rich children are always blond, Jocelyn goes. It has to do with vitamins.
item.author: Jennifer Egan

item.quote: What's the point of being a grown-up if you don't get to be immature?
item.author: Steven Moffat

item.quote: The internet is just a world passing notes around a classroom.
item.author: Jon Stewart

item.quote: Now lemme get this straight, she said in a throaty, nasal voice. You put the lime in the cocanut and drink 'em both up--whoa, long faces. What am I interrupting?
item.author: Lauren Kate

item.quote: I'll take the cemetery, Kane said. He didn't sound excited. Rather, he sounded resigned. The club might collapse if I go.
item.author: Gena Showalter

item.quote: And...I think that's what life is all about, actually,
item.author: Audrey Hepburn

item.quote: Bethany blinked. Did you just hit me? she asked, disbelief coloring her every feature.
item.author: Jennifer Lynn Barnes

item.quote: Conner Lassiter. Scheduled to be unwound the 21st of November-until you went AWOL. You caused an accident that killed a bus driver, left dozens of others injured, and shut down an interstate highway for hours. Then, on top of it, you took a hostage AND shot a Juvey-cop with his own tranq gun.
item.author: Neal Shusterman

item.quote: The only reason there's such a thing as a morning in the first place is to keep night and afternoon from bumping into each other.
item.author: David Eddings

item.quote: Opinions are like onions. They spell similarly, usually have many layers, and tend to make people cry.
item.author: Caitlyn Paige

item.quote: Roger, he has a chain saw, I hissed. I am not going to die in Kentucky!
item.author: Morgan Matson

item.quote: Juliet's version of cleanliness was next to godliness, which was to say it was erratic, past all understanding and was seldom seen.
item.author: Terry Pratchett

item.quote: Your mum pounced on her and started sucking away. Wouldve been arousing if not for all the screaming.
item.author: Jeaniene Frost

item.quote: See, you think I give a shit. Wrong. In fact, while you talk, I'm thinking; How can I give less of shit? That's why I look interested.
item.author: Justin Halpern

item.quote: Genius is of small use to a woman who does not know how to do her hair.
item.author: Edith Wharton

item.quote: And if you say that's because you lot barged into her home like a herd of mentally deficient sheep, I'm disowning all three of you.
item.author: Julia Quinn

item.quote: But I was not in the band, because I suffer from the kind of tone deafness that is generally associated with actual deafness
item.author: John Green

item.quote: There is no question that there is an unseen world. The problem is, how far is it from midtown and how late is it open?
item.author: Woody Allen

item.quote: Whats next? The size of my cock?
item.author: J.R. Ward

item.quote: Not really hungry.
item.author: Karen Chance

item.quote: Hash, x. There is no definition for this word - nobody knows what hash is.
item.author: Ambrose Bierce

item.quote: My powers of persuasion are only as strong as the bullshit I have to back it up.
item.author: Darynda Jones

item.quote: I am too tired, I must try to rest and sleep, otherwise I am lost in every respect. What an effort to keep alive! Erecting a monument does not require an expenditure of so much strength.
item.author: Franz Kafka

item.quote: Whenever I think of something but can't think of what it was I was thinking of, I can't stop thinking until I think I'm thinking of it again. I think I think too much.
item.author: Criss Jami

item.quote: Oh shit, the mummy's after us, let's all walk a little faster
item.author: Stephen King

item.quote: Death doesn't care about personalities - he's more interested in meeting quotas.
item.author: Jasper Fforde

item.quote: I've missed you, Sebastian.
item.author: Lisa Kleypas

item.quote: All art is but dirtying the paper delicately.
item.author: John Ruskin

item.quote: In a moment of sheer terror, I realized I couldn't feel my brain. It was there just a minute ago. Maybe I really was dead. Do I look dead to you?
item.author: Darynda Jones

item.quote: God I loved Sammy. Id considered marrying him, but his wife got upset when I asked for his hand.
item.author: Darynda Jones

item.quote: Of all the consumer products, chewing gum is perhaps the most ridiculous: it literally has no nourishment you just chew it to give yourself something to do with your stupid idiot Western mouth.
item.author: Russell Brand

item.quote: He awoke at six, as usual. He needed no alarm clock. He was already comprehensively alarmed.
item.author: Martin Amis

item.quote: Hobbies of any kind are boring except to people who have the same hobby. This is also true of religion, although you will not find me saying so in print.
item.author: Dave Barry

item.quote: Why are there five syllables in the word monosyllabic?
item.author: Steven Wright

item.quote: No one messes around with a nerds computer and escapes unscathed.
item.author: E.A. Bucchianeri

item.quote: Come to think of it, she did not speak a word. Yet I could have sworn she had the most beautiful voice.
item.author: Julie Klassen

item.quote: Yeah, I get it; you're a vampire, she said. Creepy. And okay, a little hot, I admit.
item.author: Rachel Caine

item.quote: Whew! You two are blowing hotter air than a tornado circlin a volcano in Hades.
item.author: Colleen Houck

item.quote: Don't you see Blaynie. Mitch put his arm around her shoulders. You're like an illegitimate little sister that I never wanted.
item.author: Shelly Laurenston
